SAMPLE CHART 2: TONY ROBBINS (Revealed at End)
Lens: Family/Children
Starting with 5th House (Children)
5th House Occupants:
                              * Chiron: The wound, the psychological scar
                              * Other planets (details given during reading)
Instructor’s Approach:
“My first instinct, because I work with Chiron, Moon, and Pluto, is I wanna know… what’s going on with this Chiron.”
Why These Three?
“As an astrologer, I focus heavily on Pluto, the moon, and Chiron; those are my three points. I always hit them, or pretty much always hit them in almost every reading because I think that most answers lie there when there’s a roadblock or you can’t do something. Most questions revolve around why aren’t I this, why can’t I do this, why do I feel like this, which is a derivative of why do I, why can’t I? And it usually comes back to these three.”
Initial Analysis Chain:
Chiron in 5th House:
                              * Wound related to children/creativity/romance
                              * Sign: Aquarius (ruled by Uranus)
Uranus (Ruler of Aquarius):
                              * Location: 11th house
                              * “does bring some luck back into the situation”
Sun (Ruler of Leo/sign Uranus is in):
                              * Location: 6th house
                              * Health implications
                              * “this could be the death of a child, specifically speaking”
                              * OR “some sort of developmental issue within this child”
The Jupiter Factor:
                              * Jupiter expands everything it touches
                              * If Jupiter aspects this configuration, it expands the issue
Initial Interpretation (Later Corrected):
“I already know at this point that this is probably a heavy reading… this could be a heavy one… this could be, this could be… the death of a child, specifically speaking… If it is not the death of a child, then it is some sort of developmental issue within this child… or something that’s expanded out…”
Critical Revision After Aspect Re-Check:
Upon reviewing aspects more carefully:
“that’s not a loss. … So, this is an illusion; this is a loss, but it’s not a loss of life; this is a loss of connection.”
Explanation:
 If there was a direct trine (harmonious aspect) still connecting the relevant planets, this indicates survival and connection, just a difficult or distant one. The initial reading of “death” was corrected to “disconnection” or “developmental challenge.”
Multiple Children Analysis:
House System for Children:
                              * 5th house: First child
                              * 7th house: Second child (derived house: 3rd from 5th)
                              * 9th house: Third child (derived house: 3rd from 7th)
Instructor Notes:
“This is also the first child, this is the second child, and a third child would be up here. This is them as a father, this is them as a mother.”
Linking Houses for Child Analysis:
“Now, all of these houses mean something when it comes to the context of children when you link it in. … This is their health … This is their one-on-one relationships, which may have to do with children.”
Complexity Note:
 The instructor acknowledges this reading involves multiple layers of rulerships, aspects, and interconnections, requiring extensive jotting/note-taking during the analysis process.
________________


SAMPLE CHART 3: HALLE BERRY (Revealed at End)
Lens: Career
Birth Data: [Specific data provided]
Rising Sign: Taurus
Instructor’s Disclaimer:
“And I’m telling you for real, I have not looked at this prior to starting this class.”
Career Analysis Framework
Primary Career Houses:
“So 10th house, usually they say 10th, 6th, and 2nd. Well, 2nd is money, 6th is your work and your work environment, what you do on a daily basis, and then the 10th house is your career. It’s your public image; it’s what you know, what you are known for, and what you kind of do structurally.”
2nd House Analysis (Money):
                              * Sign: Gemini
                              * Ruler: Mercury
                              * Mercury location: 4th house
                              * Interpretation: Makes money through communication, potentially entertainment
                              * Connection to home and family
6th House Analysis (Daily Work):
                              * Daily work environment
                              * Routine activities
                              * Health considerations in work
10th House Analysis (Career/Public Image):
                              * Career structure
                              * What person is known for
                              * Public reputation
Venus Analysis (Critical for Taurus Rising):
Venus as Ascendant Ruler:
                              * Represents the person’s overall energy
                              * How they present to the world
                              * Core values and self-worth
Venus Position:
                              * Opposes Midheaven (MC)
                              * At 29 degrees (critical degree)
                              * Sextile to 10th house ruler
Key Interpretation:
“What actually makes them known and known for being private is the fact that Venus is opposite the midheaven, so their stuff from internally is put into their career. Their career and their outward projection is actually bringing energy from their private life, so this is how you know they’re private, but people know them.”
The Privacy Paradox:
“Their daily life ties back into how they make their money; their work ties directly back into their, again, this is opposing Midheaven. It’s at 29 degrees, and there’s a sextile with the ruler of the 10th house… and you have Jupiter here. Jupiter’s the ruler of the 8th house that keeps this person also very intimate, very secretive, right?”
Career Themes Identified:
                              1. Communication and entertainment (Gemini/Mercury)
                              2. Private yet publicly known (Venus opposite MC)
                              3. Work involves home, family, children (4th house connections)
                              4. Intimate yet famous (Jupiter/8th house involvement)
                              5. Career brings private life into public view paradoxically
Empty House Protocol Demonstrated:
When asked about reliance on others’ money:
“Empty houses don’t mean that these things don’t happen in your life; in fact, a lot of stuff can happen career-wise. If you have a 7th house and it’s empty, it doesn’t mean you’re not going to get married. It just means that your focus is not on the interaction, one-to-one relationships, and the energy; that energy is pulled somewhere else.”
Summary for Halle Berry:
 Career involves communication/entertainment, with strong private-yet-public dynamic. Work connects to home and family. Known for being private despite fame. Likely works with or about children given connections shown.
________________


ADVANCED TECHNIQUES TAUGHT
Lens Within a Lens
Definition:
 Analyzing a sub-topic within a broader topic lens.
Example Given:
“So now we’re a lens within a lens; we’re talking about the lens of her values within her father, within the lens of a relationship.”
Process:
                              1. Start with primary lens (e.g., Love)
                              2. Identify sub-question (e.g., “What role do father’s values play?”)
                              3. Apply secondary lens filter to same chart elements
                              4. Trace ruler chains specific to sub-question
                              5. Return to primary lens with enhanced understanding
Warning:
“Don’t get overwhelmed; pause, go back if you need to, take a look at everything that got us to this point. I promise you it gets easier over and over because it just becomes second nature as you’re going.”
The String Theory Approach
Instructor’s Description:
“When you have so many planets impacting each other, you have to do this like string theory. It feels like like this one links to this, then this happens to this, and then you’re doing the readings. You’re like, I gotta pull all this third house energy into this twelfth house energy, into the in the first house energy, with the fifth house, right? Or I’m sorry, with the fourth because we’re talking about Venus.”
Visualization:
 Imagine a detective’s evidence board with strings connecting different pieces of information—each planet, house, ruler, and aspect is a node, and you trace the connections relevant to your lens.
Decans and Further Subdivision
Reference:
“Everything in the world is broken down into further things that are broken down into further things. Your body is broken down into cells. Your cells are broken down into atoms. It keeps going down and down and down until you can’t break it down anymore. Once we get down to decans and dwads, there’s not much further we can go.”
Example Used:
 Mars at 23 degrees Virgo = Taurus decan
                              * Adds Taurus qualities (value, worth, sensuality) to the Mars placement
                              * Refines interpretation beyond just “Mars in Virgo”
Progressions for Timing
Mentioned for Career Changes:
 When doing career readings for specific individuals with actual ages, progressions must be checked:
                              * Have they moved? (Relocation charts)
                              * What’s their age? (Progression charts)
                              * Recent major life changes? (Check progressed Ascendant/Midheaven)
Progression Indicators:
 When progressed Ascendant or Midheaven flips signs, major life changes occur:
                              * Appearance changes
                              * Career shifts
                              * Identity transformations
                              * Public image alterations
________________


INSTRUCTOR’S PERSONAL READING PRIORITIES
The Big Three: Chiron, Moon, Pluto
Direct Quote:
“If someone’s asking for a love reading, and you’re reading these charts. You’re like, okay, let’s go to your romance. Honestly, what I always start with is Chiron, but I’m not gonna do that for this because we’re not really talking about Chiron too much in this, so I’m gonna skip that. As an astrologer, I focus heavily on Pluto, the moon, and Chiron; those are my three points.”
Why These Three?
“I always hit them, or pretty much always hit them in almost every reading because I think that most answers lie there when there’s a roadblock or you can’t do something. Most questions revolve around why aren’t I this, why can’t I do this, why do I feel like this, which is a derivative of why do I, why can’t I? And it usually comes back to these three.”
Functional Interpretation:
                              * Chiron: The wound, psychological scars, healing journey
                              * Moon: Emotional needs, mother, instinctive reactions
                              * Pluto: Transformation, power, what’s buried, intensity
Love Reading Priorities
Instructor’s Focus Houses:
“For love readings, I do five, seven, eight. I read the entire chart, but five, seven, eight, excuse me, that’s what I focus on, right? Because for me, love is romance, the actual relationship and connection, how they interact, and then the intimacy. From there, I jump around because everything else is important and included, but those are the main three aspects.”
Breakdown:
                              * 5th House: Romance (courtship, risk, fun, Leo energy)
                              * 7th House: The relationship (partnership, marriage, one-on-one)
                              * 8th House: Intimacy (deep bonds, sex, psychological merging)
________________


COGNITIVE PROCESSING NOTES
The Instructor’s Thinking Speed
Self-Awareness Statement:
“By the way, I think very fast. I’ve shown you guys my chart in previous classes. Uh, my mercury square, or a square, my mercury is trining my mars. My mercury is opposite uranus, so my brain moves very fast. So what ends up happening for me is I end up seeing these relationships before my brain processes it, or my brain processes it before I can put it into a thought. I don’t really know how to explain it, but it’s very quick.”
Teaching Adjustment:
“I want to make sure that you guys can do this as well.”
The instructor acknowledges processing information faster than they can verbalize it, and consciously slows down to ensure students can follow the linking process.
Building Neural Pathways
Encouragement:
“The more you do this, the more it’ll start clicking in your head because you won’t have to stop every five seconds to remind yourself of what each one of these planets means, even though I do hundreds of chart readings every month; I still have to stop for some of these, especially semi-sextiles, because they are more difficult to work with.”
Process Timeline:
                              * Initially: Must stop frequently, jot notes, look up meanings
                              * Intermediate: Recognize patterns faster, fewer lookups
                              * Advanced: See connections instantly, but still pause for complex configurations
________________


PRACTICAL IMPLEMENTATION GUIDELINES
For Beginners
Write Everything Down:
“If you need to write it down like jot notes, jot it. Um, and that, you know, I mean, when you’re doing a reading, like if you can’t memorize everything you’ve just connected, write it down as you’re going, especially in the beginning, because it may help you remember how you connected things.”
Start Simple:
                              1. Pick ONE lens
                              2. Follow ONE ruler chain completely
                              3. Check ONE set of aspects
                              4. Build the story incrementally
                              5. Stop when you have sufficient answer
Don’t Get Overwhelmed:
“This is the most important thing of what I’m saying: you have to break it down, or this will become extremely overwhelming, and that’s what we don’t want for anybody. You don’t have to go as far layered down as I’m going, but the further you go, the more details you’re going to get because energy that is linked to energy that is ruled by other energy that conflicts with other energy, all it’s doing is whittling away the possibilities.”
The Depth Trade-Off
More Layers = More Precision:
“You don’t have to go as far layered down as I’m going, but the further you go, the more details you’re going to get because energy that is linked to energy that is ruled by other energy that conflicts with other energy, all it’s doing is whittling away the possibilities.”
Choose Your Stopping Point:
“If you don’t pick a stopping point, this will consume you and you’ll never get the reading done.”
Balance Required:
                              * Deep enough for accuracy and satisfaction
                              * Not so deep you never finish
                              * Practical considerations (time limits, client needs)
Building Proficiency
The Language Learning Analogy:
“It’s kinda like when you’re in Spanish class if you if you learn the words and then kind of put together a phrase, and then… oh god, what are they called? Conjunctions, no, not conjunctions, what are they called, uh… I can’t remember the word right now, but it’s the tenses, past, present, future. I don’t know why I can’t remember the word right now, but yeah, I struggled with that. And then you have to learn the slang, and then you have to put it all together, and you have a sentence, and you’re speaking a language. It’s just like that.”
Stages:
                              1. Learn vocabulary (planets, signs, houses)
                              2. Learn grammar (aspects, rulers, orbs)
                              3. Learn phrases (common configurations)
                              4. Learn context (lenses, applications)
                              5. Speak fluently (instant pattern recognition)
________________


CRITICAL CORRECTIONS TO TRADITIONAL ASTROLOGY
1. Empty Houses Are NOT Empty
Traditional View: Empty house = nothing happens in that life area
Alchemistic View: Empty house = energy not focused there, but ruler still determines how it manifests
Example Given:
“Empty houses are not really empty houses; empty houses just mean that your energy is not focused in that area of life. It does not mean that nothing happens in that area of life. In fact, this imaginary person could have an extremely active romantic life if its ruler is also aspecting other things because the rulership is far more important than the placements there, in my opinion.”
2. Software Orbs Are Often Wrong
Problem: Most software uses 10-degree orbs for all aspects and all planets
Reality: Each planet has specific orb ranges, and some aspects need tighter orbs
Critical Planets with Tight Orbs:
                              * Moon: 2-3 degrees maximum
                              * Pluto: 2-3 degrees maximum
                              * Mercury: 2-3 degrees
                              * Venus: 5-6 degrees (slightly wider)
                              * Mars: 3-4 degrees
Wider Orbs:
                              * Sun: 8-10 degrees
                              * Jupiter: 7-8 degrees
                              * Saturn: 7-8 degrees
Action Required:
 Manually verify every aspect shown by software against these orb ranges. Ignore aspects outside legitimate orbs.
3. Stelliums Extend Across Cusps
Traditional Definition: Planets must be in same sign AND house, within orb
Alchemistic Expansion: If planets are within orb of each other, they form stellium energy even if crossing sign or house cusps
Reasoning:
 Energy doesn’t stop at arbitrary lines. If planets are close enough to aspect each other (within orbs), they function as a unit.
4. Love Is NOT Just 7th House
Traditional View: 7th house = love, end of story
Alchemistic View: All 12 houses relate to love in different ways when using the love lens
Revolutionary Impact:
 This single correction transforms how love readings are done, providing answers even for empty 7th houses.
5. Career Requires Multiple House Analysis
Traditional View: 10th house = career
Alchemistic View: 2nd (money) + 6th (daily work) + 10th (career structure) + MC (life purpose) + 7th (if self-employed) = complete career picture
________________


PREDICTIVE ASTROLOGY CONSIDERATIONS
The Manifestation Variable
Problem with Predictions:
“Until I teach you all how to do this and you’re actually manifesting with it, then it’s not as easy. I know it’ll stay within the scope because you can only use the energy that you have to use, but then you’ll be changing things. So I hope to get to that point; I hope it gets harder to read people.”
Current Reality:
 Most people don’t know astrology, so they live at the lowest vibration of their energy by default, making predictions easier and more accurate.
Future Vision:
 As more people learn to consciously work with their chart energies, they’ll manifest differently, making prediction harder but empowering individuals.
Lowest vs. Highest Vibration
Default State:
“Energy does resonate at its lowest vibration. This is why I can get so accurate with most people most of the time, is because energy will play out the way that it normally plays out at its lowest frequency setting 99% of the time, unless somebody is changing something.”
Examples from Sample 1:
Mars in 12th House Virgo (7th House Ruler):
                              * Lowest Vibration: Relationships on back burner, hypercritical, doesn’t serve partner
                              * Highest Vibration: Spiritual connection, private devotion, behind-the-scenes service with value
Reading Strategy:
 Start with lowest vibration assumption unless client demonstrates conscious work or higher-vibration manifestation.
The “Why” Questions
Most Common Client Questions:
                              * “Why aren’t I [achieving something]?”
                              * “Why can’t I [do something]?”
                              * “Why do I feel like [negative emotion]?”
The Pattern:
“Most questions revolve around why aren’t I this, why can’t I do this, why do I feel like this, which is a derivative of why do I, why can’t I? And it usually comes back to these three [Chiron, Moon, Pluto].”
Implication:
 Roadblocks typically trace back to:
                              * Chiron: Wounds that haven’t healed
                              * Moon: Emotional needs not met
                              * Pluto: Transformation resisted or power struggles
________________


ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS & READING LIMITATIONS
Binary Predictions Are Problematic
Example: “Will I Have Children?”
 The instructor explains this cannot be answered with simple yes/no because:
                              1. Energy is malleable
                              2. Free will exists
                              3. Transits change circumstances
                              4. Conscious manifestation alters outcomes
Better Question:
 “If I have children, what will that experience be like?”
OR
“What does my chart say about my relationship with children/creativity?”
Natal Chart Limitations
What Natal Charts DON’T Show:
                              * Exact timing (need progressions and transits)
                              * Whether person has moved (need relocated charts)
                              * Current age-specific manifestations (need progression charts)
                              * Conscious spiritual work done (transcending lower vibrations)
Example Given:
 When doing Sample 1’s reading, the instructor notes:
“If I’m actually doing a report reading for you and you’re, let’s say you’re 33 years old, you know, I’ve got to, I got to look at progressions. Have you moved? I got to look at your relocations. Like it gets very, very in depth.”
The Complexity Acknowledgment
On Human Beings:
“We are complex individuals, so it makes sense.”
On Complete Readings:
“I could spend 45 minutes on your first house and still not get done.”
Professional Advice:
 The instructor recommends:
                              1. Charge significantly more for full natal chart readings
                              2. Prefer lens-focused readings (more satisfying for clients)
                              3. Set clear boundaries on reading scope
                              4. Accept that even thorough readings will leave questions
________________


VALIDATION & VERIFICATION
The Plot Twist
At the end of the class, after completing all three readings without knowing the identities, the instructor reveals:
Sample 1: Britney Spears
Sample 2: Tony Robbins
Sample 3: Halle Berry
Verification Process
For Britney Spears:
 The instructor validates:
                              * Love life always on display ✓
                              * Lots of relationship issues ✓
                              * Romance problems ✓
                              * First child involved in public relationship drama ✓
                              * Intimacy issues ✓
For Tony Robbins:
 The instructor researches and corrects:
                              * Initial reading: potential child death
                              * Correction after aspect re-check: loss of connection, not loss of life
                              * Validation: Confirms developmental or relationship challenges with first child
                              * Updated interpretation aligns with biographical information
For Halle Berry:
 The instructor validates:
                              * Career in entertainment/communication ✓
                              * Known for being private despite fame ✓
                              * Private life tied to public career ✓
                              * Work involves family/children themes ✓
Teaching Point on Corrections
The Tony Robbins Correction:
 The instructor demonstrates professional integrity by:
                              1. Making initial interpretation based on first reading
                              2. Revisiting aspects when something doesn’t feel right
                              3. Correcting the interpretation when finding tighter harmonious aspects
                              4. Explaining the reasoning for the change
                              5. Researching to validate the corrected reading
Quote:
“that’s not a loss. … So, this is an illusion; this is a loss, but it’s not a loss of life; this is a loss of connection.”
Why This Matters:
 Shows students that:
                              * Readings require checking and re-checking
                              * Aspects can be initially missed
                              * Corrections are professional, not failures
                              * Accuracy improves with thoroughness
________________


TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS REINFORCED
Orb Values (Comprehensive)
Planet
	Orb Range
	Notes
	Sun
	8-10°
	Widest orb
	Moon
	2-3°
	Very tight; software often wrong
	Mercury
	2-3°
	Tight orb
	Venus
	5-6°
	Moderate orb
	Mars
	3-4°
	Tight to moderate
	Jupiter
	7-8°
	Wide orb
	Saturn
	7-8°
	Wide orb
	Uranus
	3-5°
	Moderate orb
	Neptune
	~4°
	Moderate orb
	Pluto
	2-3°
	Very tight; software often wrong
	Chiron
	Variable
	Context-dependent
	Angles (ASC/MC):
                              * No orb of their own
                              * Use approaching planet’s orb
                              * Many software programs incorrectly show 9-10° orbs
Aspect Types Mentioned
Major Aspects:
                              * Conjunction (0°): Fusion of energies
                              * Opposition (180°): Awareness, balance, tension
                              * Square (90°): Conflict, growth, action required
                              * Trine (120°): Harmony, ease, potential laziness
Minor Aspects:
                              * Sextile (60°): Opportunity, must be activated
                              * Semi-sextile (30°): Agitation, discord, compartmentalization
                              * Semi-square (45°): Frustration, external pressure
                              * Quintile (72°): Creative innovation
                              * Biquintile (144°): Hidden talent
Orbs by Aspect Type:
                              * Conjunctions: Full planetary orb
                              * Major aspects: Slightly narrower than conjunction
                              * Minor aspects: Very tight (1-2° typically)
Applying vs. Separating
Applying:
                              * Faster planet approaching slower planet
                              * Energy building, pressure increasing
                              * More intense manifestation
Separating:
                              * Faster planet moving away from slower planet
                              * Energy loosening, pressure decreasing
                              * Less intense, more integrated
Software Notation:
 Usually marked with an “a” (applying) or “s” (separating) in aspect lists.
________________


PEDAGOGICAL INSIGHTS
Learning Curve Acknowledgment
The Instructor’s Honesty:
“I’ve been doing astrology for like six or seven years now obsessively, and I’m still finding new things in my chart because it’s impossible to go through every single aspect in every area of life, in every situation that could occur based off of just one reading.”
Realistic Expectations:
                              * No one masters astrology quickly
                              * Even experienced astrologers discover new layers
                              * Continuous learning is part of the practice
                              * Depth is infinite; proficiency is gradual
Common Student Mindsets Addressed
Mindset 1: Not Enough Information
“The first mindset is there’s not a lot going on in this chart. Once I know what Chiron means, that’s all I need to know. Once I know what Jupiter means, that’s what I need to know. If you’re of that mindset, maybe you need to revisit classes one, two, and three again because it’s so much more complex and involved than just the simple placement here.”
Solution: Layer deeper with rulers and aspects.
Mindset 2: Too Much Information
“Or you’re of the other mentality of saying this is a lot of information. How do we possibly decipher this into any sort of question because there’s just always something going on in every area of the chart?”
Solution: Apply lenses to filter noise.
The Learning Language Analogy
Complete Comparison:
“It’s kinda like when you’re in Spanish class if you if you learn the words and then kind of put together a phrase, and then… you have to learn the tenses, past, present, future… And then you have to learn the slang, and then you have to put it all together, and you have a sentence, and you’re speaking a language. It’s just like that.”
Application to Astrology:
                              1. Vocabulary: Planet meanings, sign meanings, house meanings
                              2. Grammar: Rulerships, aspects, orbs
                              3. Phrases: Common configurations (stelliums, T-squares, grand trines)
                              4. Tenses: Progressions, transits, timing
                              5. Slang: Context-specific interpretations, lens applications
                              6. Fluency: Instant pattern recognition, narrative building
________________


PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE GUIDELINES
Pricing Strategy
Lens-Focused Readings:
                              * More satisfying for clients
                              * Clearer scope
                              * Easier to complete
                              * Higher success rate
                              * Standard pricing
Full Natal Readings:
                              * Extremely time-intensive
                              * Often leave clients unsatisfied
                              * Impossible to complete fully
                              * Should charge significantly more
                              * Consider avoiding entirely
Quote:
“I don’t do those like hardly ever. And when I do, I charge a lot more, and I would advise the same for everybody else because you are diving so deep into so many areas, and you’re still not giving enough information that people are going to be satisfied. There’s always going to be questions at the end.”
Setting Client Expectations
Scope Definition:
 Always clarify at the start:
                              * What specific question are we answering?
                              * What area of life are we focusing on?
                              * What time period (natal only, or with transits)?
                              * What level of detail is appropriate?
Boundary Setting:
“You have to take a look at all of this, plus if I’m actually doing a report reading for you and you’re, let’s say you’re 33 years old, you know, I’ve got to, I got to look at progressions. Have you moved? I got to look at your relocations. Like it gets very, very in depth.”
Managing Depth:
 Choose stopping points deliberately to avoid:
                              * Endless reading sessions
                              * Client overwhelm
                              * Astrologer burnout
                              * Incomplete analysis due to time constraints
Note-Taking During Readings
For Astrologer:
“If you need to write it down like jot notes, jot it. Um, and that, you know, I mean, when you’re doing a reading, like if you can’t memorize everything you’ve just connected, write it down as you’re going, especially in the beginning, because it may help you remember how you connected things.”
Benefits:
                              1. Tracks complex ruler chains
                              2. Documents aspect webs
                              3. Ensures nothing forgotten
                              4. Provides reference for later
                              5. Helps organize narrative
For Client:
 Consider providing written notes or recording sessions so clients can review complex information later.
________________


PHILOSOPHICAL UNDERPINNINGS
Free Will vs. Determinism
Alchemistic Position:
 Energy is malleable; people can consciously work with their chart to manifest higher vibrations.
Current Reality:
“Energy does resonate at its lowest vibration. This is why I can get so accurate with most people most of the time, is because energy will play out the way that it normally plays out at its lowest frequency setting 99% of the time, unless somebody is changing something.”
Future Vision:
“But most people don’t know anything about astrology, and that’s what makes predictions a bit easier these days. Until I teach you all how to do this and you’re actually manifesting with it, then it’s not as easy. I know it’ll stay within the scope because you can only use the energy that you have to use, but then you’ll be changing things. So I hope to get to that point; I hope it gets harder to read people.”
Implication:
 The goal is empowerment, not fatalism. Astrology should help people understand their energies and consciously work with them, not trap them in predetermined outcomes.
Complexity as Truth
Recognition of Human Depth:
“We are complex individuals, so it makes sense.”
Against Oversimplification:
 The entire lens system, layering methodology, and multi-house approach all reject simplistic “this planet = this trait” astrology in favor of nuanced, interconnected interpretation.
The Infinity Problem:
“I’ve been doing astrology for like six or seven years now obsessively, and I’m still finding new things in my chart because it’s impossible to go through every single aspect in every area of life, in every situation that could occur.”
Acceptance:
 Complete analysis is impossible; practical application requires boundaries and priorities.

Teaser:
“The fifth class, which is the next one, is the manifestation class. So hopefully you’ll watch this one as many times as you need. You’ll learn what you need from this class to take it forward and be able to actually manifest. That’s gonna be a fun class too, because we’ll be taking energies and talking about the polarities of those energies and how you can make things work for yourself, including a little bit with transits.”
Expected Topics:
                              1. Polarity work with planetary energies
                              2. Transmuting lower vibrations to higher ones
                              3. Using transits for manifestation timing
                              4. Conscious energy work
                              5. Practical manifestation techniques
Connection to Class 4:
 This class (4) provides the analytical foundation—understanding the chart deeply through lenses and layering. Class 5 will build on this foundation to teach active manifestation and energy transformation.

KEY TAKEAWAYS FOR IMPLEMENTATION
The Big Picture
                              1. Always Apply a Lens: Never read a chart without a specific question/focus
                              2. Layer Ruthlessly: Follow rulers multiple levels deep
                              3. Verify Orbs Manually: Software is often wrong about aspect legitimacy
                              4. Empty Houses Have Rulers: Never ignore a house just because it’s empty
                              5. Build Narratives: Add information incrementally like writing a novel
                              6. Choose Stopping Points: Depth is infinite; practicality requires boundaries
                              7. Write It Down: Especially as beginner, jot notes to track connections
                              8. All Houses Relate to All Topics: Context (lens) determines interpretation
Technical Mastery Checklist
✓ Know legitimate orb ranges for each planet
✓ Identify sign on house cusp relevant to lens
✓ Find ruler planet and its placement
✓ Follow ruler chain at least 2-3 levels deep
✓ Check aspects within legitimate orbs only
✓ Distinguish applying vs. separating aspects
✓ Recognize stelliums vs. satellitiums
✓ Interpret decans for additional nuance
✓ Apply bi-directional rulership
✓ Build narrative incrementally
Professional Practice Essentials
✓ Set clear scope with clients
✓ Charge appropriately for depth of work
✓ Manage client expectations about completeness
✓ Document complex chains during reading
✓ Focus on actionable insights, not fatalism
✓ Validate interpretations when possible
✓ Correct errors professionally when found
✓ Prioritize Chiron, Moon, Pluto for roadblocks
Philosophical Commitments
✓ Energy is malleable, not deterministic
✓ Humans are complex; simple answers insufficient
✓ Lowest vibration is default, but not only option
✓ Empowerment over prediction
✓ Continuous learning is inherent to practice
✓ Free will exists within energetic parameters

INSTRUCTOR’S CHART REFERENCES
Throughout the class, the instructor references their own chart to explain their thinking process:
Mercury Aspects:
                              * Mercury trine Mars: Fast action-oriented thinking
                              * Mercury opposite Uranus: Extremely rapid, revolutionary thought patterns
                              * Result: “My brain moves very fast. So what ends up happening for me is I end up seeing these relationships before my brain processes it, or my brain processes it before I can put it into a thought.”
Self-Awareness in Teaching:
 The instructor acknowledges their thinking speed might make it difficult for students to follow and consciously slows down, repeats connections, and encourages pausing/rewatching.

FINAL SYNTHESIS
This class represents the integration point in the Alchemistic Astrology curriculum. Students who have learned the mechanics (Classes 1-3) now see how to apply everything simultaneously through the lens system.
The Revolutionary Elements:
                              1. Lenses replace aimless chart reading with focused inquiry
                              2. Layered rulership provides depth traditional astrology lacks
                              3. Manual orb verification corrects widespread software errors
                              4. Empty house reinterpretation solves common reading roadblocks
                              5. Multi-house topic analysis (all houses for love, etc.) gives comprehensive answers
                              6. Lowest/highest vibration framework allows both prediction and empowerment
                              7. Narrative building transforms data into meaningful stories
The Practice Path:
Beginners → Intermediate → Advanced → Master
                              * Learn vocabulary → Build phrases → Speak sentences → Achieve fluency
                              * One ruler chain → Multiple chains → Interconnected webs → Instant recognition
                              * Single lens → Lens within lens → Multiple simultaneous lenses → Holistic synthesis
The Ultimate Goal:
Empower individuals to understand their energetic patterns so deeply that they consciously transmute lower vibrations into higher ones, making fatalistic prediction obsolete and conscious manifestation the norm.
Class Completion Marker:
Students completing this class should be able to:
                              1. Read any chart with a specific lens applied
                              2. Layer rulerships at least 2-3 levels deep
                              3. Verify aspect legitimacy independently
                              4. Build coherent narrative from fragmented data
                              5. Interpret empty houses effectively
                              6. Choose appropriate stopping points
                              7. Prepare for manifestation work (Class 5)

Excellent! Now I have the complete overview. Let me create the comprehensive Harvard-level extraction with EXTREME detail, maintaining the same exhaustive quality you’ve praised! This is the manifestation class - the practical application of everything learned in Classes 1-4!

ALCHEMISTIC ASTROLOGY - CLASS 5: TIME TO MANIFEST
Complete Knowledge Extraction - Harvard-Level Documentation
________________


CLASS OVERVIEW & COURSE POSITION
Series Culmination
Direct Quote:
“Welcome to the Rebel Academy Astrology Manifestation Crash Course. Class number five, which wraps it up, is basically a zero to 100; if you got to this class, you already know this, but zero to 100 from nothing to everything.”
This is the final class of the foundational series (Classes 1-5), designed to transform theoretical knowledge into practical manifestation power.
Course Journey:
                              * Classes 1-3: Technical foundations (chart mechanics, interpretation, aspects/transits)
                              * Class 4: Integration (“Tying It All Together”)
                              * Class 5 (THIS CLASS): Practical manifestation and conscious energy manipulation
The Revolutionary Premise
The Fundamental Disagreement with Traditional Astrology:
Direct Quote:
“The average person who gets into astrology, professional astrologers, they believe that energy is energy. It plays out, it’s like fate, destiny, like it’s a roadmap that you can guide, but you can’t actually change, and I strongly disagree with that. I don’t think there’s a point in learning this aside from knowledge if that were the case.”
The Alchemistic Position:
“I think, and I know because I’ve used it, I’ve manifested so many things for myself, both with and without astrology, and I’ll tell you, it’s a hell of a lot easier when you have astrology to do so. And just knowing that you can take energies that may not feel so great for you and turn them into something that is magnificent for you, there’s nothing like it.”
The Observable Problem:
“And you’re watching other people who don’t believe in astrology, even the ones who do, who don’t believe that you can manifest with astrology, which I think might be worse, sit there and kind of fall behind.”
Class Structure
Three Main Components:
                              1. MINDSET: The psychological and environmental foundation
                              2. TRANSMUTATION: The technical process of energy manipulation
                              3. DIVINE TIMING: Using transits and progressions for optimal manifestation
No Physical Materials:
“I don’t have any materials for this class other than my little splash here, so there’s nothing for you to like review and go over. It’s just gonna be showing you how to do this and a little bit of a conversation here.”
This is pure application - demonstrating live chart work with a fictitious person named “Dolores.”
________________


COMPONENT 1: MINDSET - THE FOUNDATION
The Belief System Requirement
Core Philosophy:
Direct Quote:
“Mindset is so important because it’s kind of like what I just talked about, where a lot of astrologers don’t believe that you can transmute with these energies, that you can actually do something with them. They believe that they are static, fated points, and that’s all they are, and I do think that some of them are. I think that some of those energies are a little too intense for us mortal human beings to be able to do much with, but I think the rest of them are completely malleable, and we can live the type of life that we want to.”
The Manifestation Law:
“And if you manifestation-wise, what you believe is what you achieve, meaning if you believe that this cannot work, it won’t. If you believe that astrology is a roadmap to your fate and destiny, and you’re just along for the ride like a side seat passenger, then that’s what you will be. But if you believe that you can harness this energy and transmute it and turn it, then you can. I promise you, you can because I’ve done it.”
The Non-Negotiable Prerequisite
Toxic Elimination:
Direct Quote (Critical):
“None of this matters if you vibe with toxic people or toxic situations; I cannot help you if that’s the type of life you continue to lead. So if you really wanna manifest things in your life, you’re going to have to set yourself a mindset that allows you a clear path forward.”
The “Vibe Higher” Philosophy
Origin & Meaning:
Direct Quote:
“And in my podcast, in a lot of my videos on social media, I talk about what I’ve kind of coined as my catchphrase, which is vibe higher. And when I say vibe higher, I’m talking about there is a natural resonating frequency that all energy plays out. And I talk about this in the fourth class a little bit, but astrology is predictable, and the reason it’s predictable is because there’s a low frequency and then there is a spectrum going all the way up to the highest frequency.”
Personal Responsibility:
“And I am not the person to tell you what the highest frequency is, but you know, as different situations come across, and that’s what you have to figure out and what you wanna harness and embrace and manifest with.”
Categories of Toxic Situations to Remove
1. Toxic People:
Family Example:
“And sometimes a family, right? You might have a mom who’s just super toxic, who tells you all the time, like criticizes you all the time and kind of gets in your head. And I’m not saying don’t ever talk to your mom again, but maybe if you talk to her every day, maybe you should limit that to two to three times a week or something along that, that you can kind of manage that stress and whatnot.”
Romantic Relationships:
“If it’s a toxic relationship, maybe you’re at a precipice where you have to make a choice whether it’s right for you to move forward or if there’s something you can work on within the relationship so you can both move forward or if it’s time for you to exit and do things for yourself and harness that Aries energy.”
Friends:
“This includes friends; it includes a work situation.”
2. Toxic Work Situations:
“It’s not always people; sometimes, at work, it’s not the people, it’s the job itself that you just don’t like. There’s a component of it that just doesn’t feel fulfilling.”
3. Toxic Relationship with Money:
“Sometimes it’s your relationship with money. Sometimes you chase things that you shouldn’t chase, and you need to bring it back a little bit and say, you know, it’s okay to want money; it’s okay to do things to achieve money. But if your relationship with money is poor, then that is a toxic situation where money comes in and you spend it right away. That is something that you have to address.”
Warning Against Extremism:
“And that’s not to say go the other way and become an extremist, because that’s opposite your energy most likely, and that’s a drastic change that’s really unnecessary. Just having a better relationship within your energies to understand yourself will help immensely.”
The Cycle Recognition
Understanding Repeating Patterns:
Direct Quote:
“And more importantly, something that’s maybe a little more abstract, toxic cycles. When things happen, they run their course; we hit an ending, we come back to the beginning, we do it all over again. You notice in your lifetime, you have cycles because if you look at your chart, planets sit in a certain place and they sit in a certain order. And as events come and transits come, they always go this way. In perpetual motion, they move forward.”
Breaking the Cycle:
“And yeah, we get a chance through some retrogrades, but it has to hit that planet in order for us to snap out of it if we’re not cognizant of the fact that astrology exists. And you’re in this class, which means you know it exists.”
________________


THE FIVE CRITICAL PLANETS FOR MANIFESTATION
Introduction to the Framework
Expanding the Big Three:
Direct Quote:
“When you’re looking at your chart, Chiron, understanding your wounds, understanding your insecurities, and the things that hold you back within your own psyche is extremely important. I always talk about this. I’m adding two planets to this; there are five planets that I think you need to pay attention to in order to manifest properly. Three of them I always talk about; Chiron, again, is one.”
The Five:
                              1. Chiron
                              2. Moon
                              3. Neptune
                              4. Pluto
                              5. Sun
PLANET 1: CHIRON - The Wound
Definition & Astronomical Note:
Direct Quote:
“And in astrology, I understand Chiron, which has been back and forth, demoted, promoted to a dwarf planet, a small planet, whatever it was, an asteroid, a comet, whatever it is, it’s out there. And in astrology, we call it a planet.”
Purpose for Manifestation:
Direct Quote:
“So Chiron is huge, huge because if you’re looking for your limitations and you want to go beyond those limitations, then you need to understand what’s holding you back in the first place.”
Key Function:
                              * Identifies psychological wounds
                              * Shows insecurities
                              * Reveals what holds you back
                              * Indicates where healing is needed before manifestation can occur
Manifestation Application:
 You cannot manifest beyond your wounds until you acknowledge and work with them. Chiron shows WHERE the block is and WHAT type of healing is required.
PLANET 2 & 3: MOON & NEPTUNE - The Fears
Why Grouped Together:
Direct Quote:
“The next two I’m going to group together because they do have similarities in the context of what I’m speaking, and that is the moon, which I talk about constantly, and Neptune. Both of these planets revolve around fear.”
The Two Types of Fear:
Moon Fears (Conditioned):
“You have to know what your limitations are, which include what you are afraid of, your intuition, and your family and your soul level fears, the ones that come from your family, your upbringing, your conditioning, your emotions versus the things you don’t know…”
Neptune Fears (Abstract):
“…and the things you’re afraid of because you feel like either you’re going to lose it or you don’t know enough about it to achieve it.”
The Critical Distinction:
“And you have to address both of those fears because one of them comes from conditioning and the other one comes from abstractness. And both of them are based off of fear…”
Overlapping Planetary Functions - Advanced Concept
The Actor/Actress Example:
Direct Quote:
“And this is why a lot of times we talk about in the energies of different planets that different planets mean different things. And some of them have a little bit of overlap to the other one. Like if I’m looking at the chart of an actor or an actress, oftentimes I will see both Neptune and Jupiter have a prominent role, and it’s not because they’re co-rulers or anything like that. It’s because in different ways they have certain traits that overlap within the theatrical experience.”
Neptune’s Contribution:
“One of them has to do with fantasy, the media, and film, and things of that nature with the creativity that’s expressed.”
Jupiter’s Contribution:
“And the other one has to do with storytelling, experiences, and philosophy that can create a good storyteller who creates believable stories in a fantasy, fictitious, you know, liberally speaking way.”
Result:
“Both of those go hand in hand when it comes to creative people who are in the film industry.”
Implication for Manifestation:
 Multiple planets can contribute to the same goal through different energetic channels. Understanding which energies overlap helps you activate multiple chart areas toward one manifestation target.
Moon vs. Neptune - The Subconscious Distinction
Neptune as Subconscious:
“The Neptune is also your subconscious, and you do have to be aware of your subconscious traits and behaviors, patterns and habits.”
Function:
 Addresses fears about:
                              * What you don’t know
                              * What you might lose
                              * Abstract uncertainties
                              * Creative blocks
                              * Illusions and delusions
Manifestation Application:
 Neptune shows where you need to develop faith, creativity, and overcome fear of the unknown. Moon shows emotional patterns inherited from family that need reprogramming.
PLANET 4: PLUTO - The Power
Deep Psychology vs. Subconscious:
Direct Quote:
“But Pluto is deep down; it’s things you bottled up. It’s things that kind of stir inside, and you do not want these things coming out. You have to address Pluto and really get in tune with your inner self, the deep hidden parts of you that you don’t share with everybody else, the secrets.”
The Inner Work Required:
“And you have to come to terms with all this because Pluto is also personal power. It is inner power. It is regenerative, I can’t say that word, regenerative properties that you have. It is the Phoenix…”
The Failure Requirement
Critical Manifestation Truth:
Direct Quote:
“…and anytime you’re talking about manifestation, you have to realize that you have to also be okay with failure, because anytime you’re achieving something, I guarantee you, you didn’t get it on the first try. If you did, nice stroke of luck, but every single time is not gonna happen that way.”
Redefining Failure:
“Failure, true failure, means you fell down and you never got back up; that’s the mindset. Anyone who is successful has failed numerous times.”
The Smart Failure Process:
“The smart failures are the people who look at how they failed, why they failed. They take the stuff that did not cause them to fail and they keep it, they take the stuff that did cause that failure and change it, so they’re not starting from scratch, they’re not abandoning, they’re moving forward by tweaking the things that did not work so that they can achieve the success that they’re looking for.”
Pluto as Core Manifestation Energy
The Phoenix Principle:
“But Pluto is that inner power; it is that regeneration, it is that strive, that obsession, and that manifestation requires obsession, because it’s the thing you want.”
Reality Check:
“It’s not a genie; it’s not three wishes in a lamp. You don’t just wake up one day and say, there it is, that’s what I wanted, I got it.”
Scale Acknowledgment:
“Now, there are little things that you can manifest; you can really spend time thinking about something, driving something really small, but a lot of the things we wanna manifest are huge, especially if any of us are dreamers. I know I’m a dreamer; I know everything that I wanna do is grand scale.”
Working with Your Energy Type
Different Approaches for Different Charts:
Capricorn Energy:
“And some people will tell you you have to take a step at a time, do it little by little and whatnot, and I’m just like no that doesn’t vibe with me I don’t do things little at a time. I take huge leaps, and that is part of Leo. I’m a Leo rising, that’s part of my energy. Your energy may be Capricorn; you may have to set milestones, you may have to go slow and steady.”
Virgo Energy:
“If you have Virgo, you have to go service to others; it has to be a daily thing, a routine, and you have to be careful that you’re not overly criticizing yourself.”
Leo Energy (Instructor’s Example):
“Every single, and then back to Leo, Leo is about risk-taking; risk is a Leo trait. And the inner child and the things you want, and almost that innocence, but that untested worldly ambition that you can have that fire that literally lights inside you, say I’m not happy unless I have this, that’s Leo.”
Universal Principle:
“Every single sign in the zodiac has something that will help you grab onto and move forward with, and then the aspects and everything else, so that’s extremely important.”
Pluto as Magnetism
The Power Dynamics:
Direct Quote:
“Pluto is your power. If you wanna know where you’ll be powerful, if you wanna know where your magnetism is, that’s Pluto.”
Life as a Popularity Contest
The Controversial Truth:
Direct Quote:
“If you’re looking for success, life is a popularity contest, and people hate when I say that, but prove me wrong. Life is a popularity contest. People have to like you if you’re selling something; people have to like you if you wanna be seen.”
Examples:
                              * Actor: “If you’re an actor, if people don’t like you, they don’t wanna watch your movies.”
                              * Sales: “If you’re selling a product, if you’re selling a house and you’re the realtor and they don’t like you, they’re either not gonna buy the house or they’re gonna get rid of you and replace you in the process of buying whatever house it is.”
The Game Recognition:
“It’s a popularity contest, and you gotta figure out your way in there because that is also part of manifestation, is understanding the game. No one talks about that part: the game. You’re a chess piece on a chess board.”
Strategic Awareness:
“If you don’t understand the game or the ways that you can play it or the ways you can manipulate the system, then you’re gonna be that pawn that gets swiped off at the beginning, and you’re gonna have to play the game starting from scratch again, and it’s just gonna keep going; you’re gonna be in that cycle.”
The Power Choice
Critical Warning:
Direct Quote:
“Pluto is your power. If you do not harness Pluto, it’s everyone else’s power, and it becomes your chaos.”
This is arguably one of the most important statements in the entire class - Pluto energy WILL manifest. The question is whether YOU control it or it controls you.
PLANET 5: THE SUN - The Vitality
The Paradox:
Direct Quote:
“The final planet is what I would believe is the most obvious planet; it is in all social media, it’s in all pop culture astrology, everybody talks about this planet, but nobody uses it, and that is the sun.”
Core Functions:
Direct Quote:
“The sun is your vitality; the sun is your risk; the sun is what keeps you moving, keeps you alive and pushes you forward. It’s your creative expression in your inner child, right? We talk about this in the first or second class, or both of them.”
Why It’s Neglected:
Direct Quote:
“The sun is so important, but most people get hung up on all of the intricacies of the real world because the sun is not part of the real world. The sun is life; it’s why it rules children. You brought that into the world, but it’s also your happiness because it’s your vitality; it’s literally that fire inside you.”
Common Manifestation Mistakes
Looking in Wrong Places:
Direct Quote:
“So, wherever your sun is, wherever your Leo placements are, wherever you’re, what’s in your fifth house, all of that is extremely important; but people neglect it. They look for their midheaven when sometimes we don’t even use that, or they look for the 10th house or their second house, and they’re like, oh, I need to make money, my second house in Venus, and they start there.”
The Incomplete Manifestation:
“That’s great, but if you don’t incorporate the rest of it, you’re not gonna be happy. And you could be wealthy, but you won’t be happy. And we need the full package.”
The Nobody Said That Moment
Cultural Reference:
Direct Quote:
“Manifestation, nobody manifests to be rich and depressed; we don’t do that. I actually was listening to a song at the gym earlier today, and I sent the lyrics to my buddy because I vibe heavily with like a certain section of the song, and it’s a little crass. But there’s one part that ends the verse that says, yeah, I wanna be broke forever. Yeah, that’s that ish that no one ever said, right?”
The Balance Required:
“But we can wanna manifest money, we can wanna manifest abundance, happiness, a partner, the dream job, a place that we live. There’s anything. You can really manifest almost anything within the energy and the parameters of what you have. But if you only chase after that, Taylor got it. If you only chase after that, you are not gonna be happy because you are neglecting your sun sign…”
Sun’s Connections Matter
Integrated Analysis Required:
Direct Quote:
“…and your sun sign has connections, aspects. We talked about that in a previous class, and it has a position. It has a degree and a Deccan, and it has a house placement. You have to see where it is, and you have to look at your progressions because through time it changes.”
Natal vs. Progressed Sun
The Movement Principle:
Direct Quote:
“Your natal chart will always be there, but if you move or if you just get older, it moves. The progressions are based off of one degree per year on your sun, so you can move three to four signs within a lifetime, depending on what degree you started at.”
Application:
“It’s important that you pay attention to all that, and you align your current position Then we’re gonna get into this, and with divine timing, but you align your current position with what’s attainable at the time. And then you focus, and you hyper focus, and you make sure that this is the only thing. And anything that stops me from doing this is gone.”
Mindset Summary:
 Mindset = Clear belief system + toxic elimination + understanding your five key planets (Chiron, Moon, Neptune, Pluto, Sun) + strategic awareness + laser focus on aligned goals.

COMPONENT 2: TRANSMUTATION - THE TECHNICAL PROCESS
Definition & Purpose
Moving Beyond Mindset:
Direct Quote:
“The next stage is transmutation, right? And so now we have the mindset down. We know what we want and it has to be something that is A, attainable. It can be a big thing, but it has to be attainable, and it has to be something that we are willing to put in the workforce, something we really want, not something small, not something trivial.”
Scale Matters:
“You can get those things, sure, you can manifest them, but something you really want, and it can be things that some people don’t believe you could actually have any control over, but you can. So once you have your mindset down, that’s locked, right? So now we can move past mindset. Transmutation, that is the key.”
The Sample Chart: Dolores
Introduction:
Direct Quote:
“So I’m gonna move this on out of the way, and we have Dolores here. Now Dolores is some random woman; she was born in 1979. I don’t know why anyone’s still naming their child Dolores at this point, but she was born May 11th, 1979, in Memphis, Tennessee, at 11:16 a.m. And this is Dolores’ chart. So this is a fictitious person. I just chose some random dates and numbers and whatnot. I plugged it in, and this is Dolores, okay?”
Chart Selection Note:
“Actually, it’s the second attempt because I tried to do somebody from like 1930, and for the purpose of explaining this, there were too many stelliums, and it would take me too long to do. Whenever you see stelliums and satellitiums in a chart, you do have to allow a lot for more time because you have to break down all the energies that are feeding into one source. So, stelliums do add time and effort.”
Dolores’ Chart Basics:
                              * Rising Sign: Leo
                              * Notable Configurations: Multiple groupings of 2-3 planets (manageable)
                              * Purpose: Demonstrate transmutation techniques
TRANSMUTATION DEFINITION
The Core Concept:
Direct Quote:
“But the purpose of transmuting is to understand. Now, we talked about retrogrades in another class, which I will put out soon, which is utilizing retrogrades for positive action. And understanding that the observable backwards motion, which is not real, it is only in perspective of where we are on the planet, creates an influx; or, not influx, a flux in the way the energy hits us. And it works inwardly.”
How Retrogrades Work:
“You can call it backwards because that’s what the planet’s visually doing, but it’s really a flux; it’s an inward thing. So, as that planet, the transits, hit us, it’s causing that energy to go inward and for us to basically do reflection.”
TRANSMUTATION EXAMPLE: Mercury Retrograde
The Traditional Fear:
Direct Quote:
“Now, with transmutation, whether it is retrograde planets, actually, I’ll just stick on that; people talk about Mercury retrogrades all the time as a transit, right? In a previous class, we talked about whether what it would be like in your natal chart, but as transits is what we usually talk about. And people talk all the time about how it’s so bad: communication’s terrible, and contracts are bad, and you shouldn’t sign anything, and your electronics are gonna go crazy, and communication’s gonna get bad, and you’re gonna argue.”
The Reality:
“The first thing is all of that is all dependent on what sign it’s in, what house it’s transiting, what other planets are being aspected. So people generalize Mercury retrograde based off of perceived notions of what may have happened to them or someone they know in the past because of aspects that they were unaware of.”
The Truth About Retrogrades:
“Retrogrades are not bad; retrogrades are really good, actually, because they help re-steer you and change course when you could be hitting an iceberg. Helps you move around.”
TRANSMUTATION IN ACTION: Car Purchase Example
The Scenario:
Direct Quote:
“Transmuting the energy is to say, there’s a retrograde happening; I’m using it for this purpose, but there’s a retrograde happening over my third house. So contracts that have to do with communication, let’s say I’m buying a car; the third house has to do with buying a car.”
The Analysis Process:
“And I look to see how it’s aspecting Venus and whatnot, and I realize that there’s gonna be something wrong with the contract. There’s gonna be something I have to rethink or renegotiate that has to do with buying this car, and I shouldn’t sign the contract, but the difference is I shouldn’t sign that contract the way that it is. Not I shouldn’t sign any contract, right?”
The Transmutation:
“Because I now know that the retrograde is hitting, and this is transmutation. It’s because I know it’s there; I know what it means. And because I know what it means, I know what it could mean, and this is what transmutation is.”
What Does It Mean? The Core Question
Direct Quote:
“What does it mean? How will it play out? The way it plays out is always default. We know that it will play out in its lowest vibration unless you have a bunch of other people who also know astrology, who are changing the energies. It’s still within the confines of whatever that energy means, but it could play out in a higher vibration if somebody else knows.”
Current Reality:
“But at this point in time, not many people know how to transmute energy, so it plays out in its lowest vibrational setting. So you know what’s going to happen; you know there’s gonna be something wrong.”
The Detective Work:
“And if you look at all the aspects at the time of what’s going on, you can figure out exactly what it has to do with: is it something mechanical? Is it something with the car? Is it something to do with the salesperson? Is it something to do with the price? Is it, what is it? And you can figure that out.”
Armed with Knowledge:
“Now that I know. I’m armed; this is knowledge. I can go in there and, on my volition, renegotiate this contract, knowing it needs to be renegotiated anyway. I can’t move forward, so now I have to make the changes, and based off of all the transits and aspects that are happening at the moment, I know what I need to do.”
THE TRANSMUTATION FORMULA
Direct Quote:
“That is what transmutation is: to transmute the energies, meaning to take what was going to happen and make it be something I want to happen within the confines of those energies.”
This is the central technical definition of the entire manifestation system.
