DOLORES CHART ANALYSIS: PRACTICAL TRANSMUTATION
Starting Focus: Money
Why Money First:
Direct Quote:
“So how do the energies play out and why? Now, I’m going to hold off on transits, even though I use that in the example because that’s more about divine timing. I’m going to use natal energies, I’m going to see how does this stuff play out specifically here, right? I’m going to start with money because money, money, and love are the two main topics everyone wants to know, because they, they revolve their entire life around these two things…”
Reality Check:
“…even though they are not everything, they are literally two twelfths, one sixth of your life, those two things. And that’s only if you give one thing to each house, it’s so much. And people put so much stock in relationships and so much stock in money.”
Balanced Perspective:
“And yes, partnership is wonderful; your energies may actually support or promote that. Money is needed and necessary. Not everybody wants to be a billionaire; not everybody wants to be partnered. And we have to respect that when you’re doing readings as well by staying objective.”
The Analysis Process
Starting Point:
Direct Quote:
“But this is all about how do my energy sits in my chart; how does it normally play out? And I know that because of the lowest vibrational setting; how can it play out? What do all these energies mean and what are the different things based off of brainstorming? Because that’s basically what you’re doing when you’re transmuting energy.”
The Shift from Forcing to Working With:
“Instead of saying, I need to force the energy to do this, you say, here’s what’s going to happen; here’s the energies; here’s like a ballpark of what I would like to happen. And then you dive into the energy, into the glyphs, into the aspects, and everything that’s sitting here and say, how can I change this to do something different? How can I use it myself?”
How to Use Planetary Energies
Direct Application:
Direct Quote:
“Using the energies is not something you need to like teach yourself or focus on. You can literally just, if it’s Mars, you can literally act or react; or do, if it is Saturn, you can focus. If it is Neptune, you can dream or be creative. If it is the sun, you can harness that confidence. You can use those powers for yourself. If it is Pluto, you can have that inner understanding and that transmuting and fixation on something kind of like Uranus, where you can say, this is what it is; this is how I want to change it.”
Selective Transmutation
Don’t Fix What Isn’t Broken:
Direct Quote:
“And we want to use the energies differently. Some of them we don’t; some of them we’re like, you know what? Leave that alone because that’s great. But over here, there’s one thing, and that’s a big thing too: sometimes the energies all play out nicely except one or two things, and you’re like, I just need to change these two things so that they don’t play out poorly and they play out in my benefit.”
THE ONE-WAY ENERGY LAW
Critical Technical Principle:
Direct Quote:
“And I want to also to make this point here: energies cannot manifest two different ways at the same time, which means if you are using the energy, it can’t do something else because you are telling the energy at what vibration to resonate.”
This is one of the most important technical concepts in the system - energy exclusivity. If you consciously direct an energy, it cannot simultaneously manifest in its default/negative way.
Dolores Chart: Leo Rising Analysis
Physical Appearance Indicators:
Direct Quote:
“Now, I’m not going to do a natal chart here, but I know a couple of things. So I know that Dolores is a Leo rising, so I know kind of what she looks like. I know that the hair is something to look at, whether it’s poofy, curly, big, small, there, not there, or whatever; that’s something that I’ll have to look at.”
Transformation Pattern:
“I know that she goes through stark transformations when she is feeling a certain way or if she needs to present herself in public; that she transforms. How do I know that?”
The Chain of Reasoning:
“I know that because Leo rising, the ruler is the sun, and the sun is opposite Uranus in Scorpio. Now, a couple of things that you can do with this, right? One is I know that that’s kind of how it goes, but I also know that she can go through like huge transformations based off of this…”
Bringing in 12th House:
“…and bring in the 12th house ruler, which is Cancer, which is the moon over here, which is in here as well. So if this person knowing that, let’s just say because Leo is film and entertainment, it’s not film as much as it’s entertainment stage, you know, things that are fun, recreation, sports, and whatnot.”
Film Industry Application Example
The Hair Connection:
Direct Quote:
“I know that this person, if they were to go on film and kind of do that, that their hair would be a significant contributor to each character that they would play, right? So that’s the information of how it can play out.”
Subconscious Attachment:
“And I know that this person needs to have input. There’s a subconscious attachment to the changes here and they have to have input because the moon is attached here.”
Detailed Rulership Chain
Student Question & Response:
Question: “How did you get that from the 12th house?”
Answer:
“I have to backtrack a minute. First house was Leo, the rulers of the sun; that’s in the 10th house of public in Taurus, which is the arts. I’m ignoring Chiron for a second. The sun is opposite Uranus; Uranus is conjunct the moon. The moon is the ruler of the 12th house, and the 12th house rules film. The sun, Leo, which is the sun, also rules entertainment. So I’m just combining these with this opposition here, and this is an opposition.”
Natural State:
“So this person does not do this normally unless they need to bring in that 12th house energy. So what if, hair from one, film from 12, yes?”
The Stage Fright Problem
Scenario Without Transformation:
Direct Quote:
“So what if I need this person to be in their natural state to? Or what if, not me, let’s say it’s them; let’s say they want to take a role, but they can’t go through a transformation. The role actually calls for them as they look the way they normally look. How would they do that?”
The Chiron Issue:
“Well, theres an insecurity that has to do with their hair and their presence. Also, being in groups and wheres Virgo and the money thats attached or the value. And the value could be also attached to public image.”
Self-Worth Connection:
“So this person wants a strong public image; they want a strong appearance, and they are very self-conscious and insecure about it. They have their own self-worth issues that came from the father, and perhaps the father didnt have much money, and that resonated heavily; that drives this person forward.”
The Conflict:
“But now they’re taking a role, let’s say it’s entertainment film, and they want to use, like I said, their exact thing. Well, they have to use the energy that they have here. Now, Chiron here is insecurity, and if they do not use this transformation and they don’t use all of this energy here, Chiron will naturally show itself. That insecurity will come out.”
Default Outcome:
“They will either not take the role or push against the role, or they will show up, and when they do it, the insecurity will highlight, and they will likely not get the job unless that’s what the role calls for; it’s like an insecure person, right”
TRANSMUTATION SOLUTION: Commercial Example
Working with What You Have:
Direct Quote:
“So, in order to transmute the energies and not have it be here, you have to look at what each of these means. So, we know that we have the chart ruler, we know we have the sun. The sun is vitality, it’s children, it’s whatnot. So, this person can do a role that has to do with art, that has to do with money, it has to do with finance, maybe those things there, and how they can fix it.”
Capital One Commercial Example:
“So, that role, even if the role itself has nothing to do with, let’s say, it’s a Capital One commercial, right? And it’s like credit repair, right? So, this would make sense. She’d take this role and she would fixate; she would focus in on the fact that you’re fixing people’s money, you’re fixing people’s money, you’re fixing people’s money.”
Balancing the Opposition:
“And then for the time being, because it is in opposition, we’re gonna let go of this side of the opposition, or we’re going to balance in here. I’m going to make friends with the women that are there, and I’m going to use that to kind of hold on to it. Now that’s easy since we already have credit repair as a part of it.”
Food Commercial Example (Ragu)
Random But Perfect:
Direct Quote:
“But let’s say it’s a pasta commercial; it’s like a ragu or something like that. Well, that was random, but Taurus does rule food. So what do we have to do in order to do this?”
Mercury Analysis:
“Well, we have to realize that Mercury, I swear I picked this randomly, Mercury right here that’s sitting there rules communication. That’s good for talking, speaking, public, whatever. We have to realize that it rules siblings, cousins, coworkers, and that it also rules sales, right?”
The Mental Frame:
“So we may have to set up a scenario in our head that we have to help the 10th house, the company sell this through our performance and act like, you know, with a fake family.”
Using Scorpio 4th House:
“And maybe that’s an option, is that they can have a fake family, and then there they will make either, they’ll, you know, try to make deep bonds with them or try to find out something secret about the other person to kind of help their character.”
Pulling It Together:
“And that will help them here, kind of pull all this together because they’re using Taurus instead of money, instead of whatnot, they’re using it as food. They’ll probably be drawn to it anyway, but the Chiron, you don’t want the insecurity, so you have to use the healing. And that’s what all transmutation is about.”
The Mental Framework Process
Creating the Narrative:
Direct Quote:
“I know that if I go somewhere and I’m out in public, Chiron is going to impact me in a very negative way. I have, astrology is perception, it’s perspective. I have to use this and develop the scenario in my head and even tell myself, even speak it out loud, right? Because it’s public image.”
Using Sun’s Ego:
“I am selling Ragu because you can’t; maybe not too much ego, but the sun is ego. And if you use the sun’s positive traits, which are humor and joking and all the entertainment, you can come across as someone who is like, I am your sales rep. I am the one who’s going to fix your brand. I’m gonna make sure everybody buys this, blah, blah, blah.”
Focusing on Chiron:
“And you’re gonna focus on the Chiron here, so you’re using all of this energy here and pulling it all together as opposed to how it would have normally played out, which is I show up and my stage fright shows in. The stage fright cannot be a part of it if you want to nail this; if you want to get this audition; if you want to get this role, if it’s film-based.”
Family/Friends Energy Balance
Student Question: “How did you get, not fake, well, make friends even if they’re not?”
Answer:
“So, in the film industry, when you show up on set, there are people there; you can make friends. Uranus rules friendship, so since the sun is opposite, you want to bring this together; you want to balance this here. So, you want to balance; you want to bring in family and friends. You can bring these two energies here and be like the friends are extended family and it’s someone else’s family. And you can play that role and you can bring that in. That would be the best way to do it.”
Solo Scenario:
“If you’re solo, if you’re doing this role and you’re solo, there is no fake family here. Then what you’ll end up having to do is use this energy in a different way. So I would have to use a fourth house, Scorpio, either a very deep embedded memory or thought of your family that no one else knows, something very secret, deep in your psychology.”
Alternative Method:
“Or the easier way is to use someone else’s family because Scorpio is other people’s stuff. It’s the fourth house, which is family or homes. Use other people’s stuff in something that happened randomly and just think of that and use that. That would be the best way to do it. Or picture a future. Picture a future, like someone else’s family in the future because you’re using this.”
Acknowledgment of Method
Direct Quote:
“And I know some of this sounds like erratic and out of base or whatnot, but I promise you it works. It’s like a distorted affirmations, right? Affirmations are set things that you focus on so that you can achieve the things that you want.”
The Difference:
“With astrology, these energies are present, and these energies play out a certain way. You do not want this off and on again based off of your fears because this is stage fright. This could be stage fright, like deep stage fright. You don’t want this to play out. In order to overcome it, you have to use that energy in a different way.”

STUDENT-DIRECTED TRANSMUTATION: TRAVEL
Opening It Up
Direct Quote:
“So that’s one scenario. So I want to open it up to you guys real quick that are in the live class here, and you can pick any topic. Well, this is a real test for me, by the way, because this is a random person. You can pick any topic, and you can say, you know, this person, they want to do this with their life.”
Options Given:
“So, like I said, I’ll open it up to you guys; just choose something. It can be love, it can be money, it can be career, it can be anything. And then I will show you with this chart how they could attain the thing that you’re looking for, or if they can’t attain that, how they can attain something that does align with their energies.”
Student Request: “This person wants to travel.”
9th House Analysis
Starting Assessment:
Direct Quote:
“This person wants to travel. Perfect. Well, the beautiful thing with this is that their ninth house ruler is in the ninth house, so this is a good one. It’s not necessarily an easy one, but there’s a good start here.”
Natural Inclination:
“This person has the opportunity to travel, wants to travel, and enjoys traveling for the sake of doing so. Now, here’s the key: there is both Aries, Mars, which is the ruler here, and Venus and Juno here.”
Conflicting Energies Identified
The Problem:
Direct Quote:
“Now, if you think about what these energies actually signify, that means there’s a solo type of energy in here and a couple’s partners type of energy in here. So I’ve got conflicting energy. So this is actually a really good example because from the base, it’s like, okay, they travel, they wanna travel, and they travel for the sake of traveling, which is great.”
The Partnership Element:
“When they wanna travel, they do it. But then we have this partnership, and we have the Vesta that’s in there as well, which is that spark of life here.”
Default Manifestation
How It Normally Plays Out:
Direct Quote:
“The first thing we always do is we go in, we see what would normally happen here. Well, the first thing is they likely travel with partners, and they like to explore brand new places, right? Because we have two indications here, usually someone that they’re really, really close to or somebody that is a romantic partner of sorts, and they like to do it in luxury.”
Luxury Preference:
“So, they probably like to go first class, especially if they’ve never done first class before; they like to do first class. If they’ve never, there’s a sense of adventure here, so maybe it’s like they wanna travel and skydive with this Aries Mars energy here over Hawaii or something along those lines, right?”
Mercury Spillover
10th House Influence:
Direct Quote:
“We also have Mercury in the 10th house at one degree, which means that’s spilling over with the rest of this into the ninth house, so authority, public image; they like to be seen, they like to be out. They’re not trying to go to a hotel and to some hidden place.”
Nature Component:
“Nature is very important to where they go, so Hawaii, again, lines up with it, but they wanna be there. So Honolulu, as opposed to like one of the smaller islands. And again, nature as well.”
Chiron Note:
“Chiron’s there, I’m going to ignore Chiron for the sake of this; I’m just gonna keep it moving, keep it moving.”
Aspect Analysis
Mars at 26 Degrees:
Direct Quote:
“So we have the ruler of the ninth house here; we know that it’s at 26 degrees. Lilith, this is interesting, a trine with Lilith. Lilith is that raw sexual power; that raw, and Aries is also sex as well. So this person could enjoy getting a little freaky deaky out there when they go on vacation, like they like to do it as a romantic kind of gesture.”
Entertainment Focus:
“Adventure and romance would be a huge part of this, and they really wanna do something where they can have a lot of fun and have a lot of entertainment, and that entertainment, again, is out there. They like to eat good food…”
Health Warning:
“…but they do have to be careful with this Chiron, which I said I was gonna ignore, but they have to be careful with this Chiron that they do not eat the wrong things because they could have like structural issues when it comes to food and whatnot, and they could have reactions; they just have to make sure that they are good with that.”
The Financial Challenge
Square to Part of Fortune:
Direct Quote:
“29, so we have a square to the part of fortune; so they probably like to spend a lot of money, which means they, in order to vacation. Now this is actually really good to understand; so they like to vacation places and they like to live in luxury and kind of do things like that. But we have a square here between Mars and the part of fortune.”
Juno Involvement:
“And then we have a sextile. Here to Polis now, we also have Juno at 28 degrees, which means when you combine these two, it has to do with requiring both people to have money and work for it to be able to do that.”
TRANSMUTATION SOLUTION: Career Alignment
The Smart Path:
Direct Quote:
“Now, if they’re smart then they’ll take this energy, and they will know they’ll take it further into Saturn in their second house. We have the North Node there, so this won’t be easy at first, but they’ll take this energy, and that will tie back into their career, and they will position themselves in a in a place of in a place of power in a lead role or something along those lines where they are able to make the type of money they want.”
Business Options:
“Either they’re an entrepreneur or They are they work with their partner or they do something along those lines, and they build something, right? That’s the best way for this person to do it, and that’s part of the transmuting because there’s the conflict here between these two energies here and the part of fortune, which means it’s expensive. It’s a lot of money for them to go, and their work may not pay enough.”
The Solution:
“So, in order to change this career and that square, they either need to put in more hours, which some people do, or they need to develop a career that will support, you know, the different things that they want to do, that has some element of service involved. So, that’s how you handle that square.”
Speed Note:
“I did that really quickly, but that’s transmuting that energy. Use that square to build; realize that this doesn’t have to be a problem.”

COMPONENT 3: DIVINE TIMING - THE TEMPORAL DIMENSION
Introduction to Timing
Direct Quote:
“And that is the key to everything we’re doing here with the time to manifest, and then the whole transits part is the timing, the divine timing. We’re going to get to that towards the end.”
The Structure:
“I’m going to spend a little bit of time on transmutation, I’m going to let you guys ask some questions, and then we’re just going to kind of, you know, make our way through this.”
Father Time: Saturn
The Most Important Transit Planet:
Direct Quote:
“So we’ve talked about mindset, we’ve talked about transmutation, and now we need to talk about the divine timing portion, right? And the divine timing has to do with transits and using the transits. Now, there is a planet that is referred to as Father Time, and that is the planet Saturn. Saturn is the most important, in my opinion, planet outside of the moon, but the moon is on a daily level.”
Why Saturn Matters:
Direct Quote:
“To understand what the restrictions are, where your focus is gonna be, and the hardships, restrictions, or anything that is gonna come up that is going to be significant for your long-term goals and your future, Saturn. And then you align with these transits, you move it, you find the dates.”
Current Transit Example (Live Class)
Saturn in 8th House Transit:
Direct Quote:
“So, right now, if I go to this chart, this is actually if, this is an important one for this chart. We don’t have the exact time that this class is being, actually we do. Hold on a second. Let me go to extended chart selection. I can actually just pull up from when this broadcast started. So let me do that real quick.”
Setting Up the Chart:
“April 3rd, 2021, eastern time, so that was 5 p.m. Eastern, so that was like 4 p.m. Central, Memphis, Tennessee. Let’s see what’s actually going on here.”
The Analysis:
Direct Quote:
“Okay, so we see Saturn is going over the eighth house. The eighth house has to do with shared resources, other people’s money, intimacy, deep bonds, sex. It also, oh gosh, I keep forgetting it, it also has to do with, of course, death. Not in the sense that you’re gonna die, but endings, right? Cycles, things, and tax, taxes, and debt.”
Lowest Vibration Warning
How Saturn Naturally Manifests:
Direct Quote:
“So, if we’re talking about Dolores here, if Dolores is not aware of the fact that there is a Saturn transit happening over her eighth house for the next two and a half years, okay, if she’s not aware of that, then she can anticipate that there’s gonna be a lot of restriction on all of these things that I just mentioned.”
The Negative Possibilities:
“She could have issues with debt, she could have issues in the bedroom, she could have issues with intimacy with her partner because Saturn is like cold, it’s structured and orderly and business-like. So there’s that potential. Taxes could be a huge burden.”
Additional Concerns:
“And if she has any sort of, you know, her parents are getting up in age, you know, she could be looking at something happening with a parent or somebody close to her, a grandparent, or if there’s a divorce or anything along those lines, or a breakup, then there could be a separation of assets.”
Highest Vibration Opportunity
The Transmutation:
Direct Quote:
“So let’s take this and put it on the other side. Saturn’s all about goals, and using it in a higher vibration, its goals are in a lower vibration, it’s restriction. So it can be restriction on all these things, and naturally, it will play out.”
But…
“If you’re aware of it and you are transmuting it and you’re manifesting with it, you are saying, ‘Okay, my goal is to pay off my debt. My goal is to handle my taxes early.’ If you have a business, ‘My goal is to get a CPA,’ you know, ‘or get an accountant and structure my financials.’”
Intimacy Application:
“‘My goal is to have structured, regular intimacy with my partner where we sit down and we plan this out so that we’re not going through a drought,’ right? Because that’s what Saturn can do.”
Legacy Building:
“‘My goal is to build a legacy because the eighth house has legacy. My goal is to receive an inheritance.’ Maybe from a parent. ‘My goal is to set up my will or my trust fund or whatever I need to do.’ All of these things you can use because you’re using the Saturn energy. You’re not allowing it to control you.”
The Action Requirement
Critical Point:
Direct Quote:
“If you don’t do anything with it, it’s gonna play out in a lower vibration, and these are the things that are gonna happen because that’s how energy plays out. But if you harness it, if you use it, then it becomes what you want it to be, and it plays out in your favor.”
The Power of Knowledge:
“And now that you know it’s happening, you can get ahead of it. And instead of it feeling like you’re reacting to circumstance, you’re actually going and creating the circumstance. That’s transmutation, that’s manifestation, that’s divine timing, all three together.”

COMPREHENSIVE Q&A SECTION
Question 1: Communication and Stage Presence
Student Question:
“Does that mean this person can choose to communicate in a certain way to help with their stage presence?”
Instructor Answer:
“Yes, the answer to that question is yes. And if you need elaboration, just let me know. But yes, they can use the ruler of Mercury; Mercury is communication. So if they are using their… what house does it rule? What does Mercury rule? Mercury rules both the second house and the 11th house.”
Application:
“So they would have to use the energy of like, ‘I am representing my friends. I am out here with my squad.’ And then whenever you say things like that, like I said, it may sound silly, it may sound like, you know, childish or whatever, but it works because you’re pulling the energy and you’re making it resonate at a different frequency.”
Alternative Approach:
“Or ‘I need to make money from this; I need to sell this product; I need to bring value to this product.’ So you’re talking about your values and you’re using this energy here. So you pull all of this energy together by using the chart ruler opposite the moon, which rules 12, but the moon is in the fourth. So you’re also now pulling fourth house energy into that as well.”
The Result:
“So all of these energies, it’s like a web, are all pulling into this one moment to give you the outcome that you want, which is to use all this energy but not have the Chiron as the staple.”
Question 2: Relationship Interpretation
Student Observation:
“If we were to look at Dolores’s relationships, Dolores, her seventh house ruler is conjunct the moon, opposing the sun in the 10th house. Correct. I see that as the relationships may have the tendency to be public, but there may be some fears about it being public because it may change the emotional connection. This is my deepest shot at interpretation so far.”
Instructor Response:
“That’s really good. I would say that this is one of the things that would trigger these transformations that we talked about is romantic relationships because Venus and Juno are both there. And it has, this opposition here has to do with that. So, spot on. Yes.”
Additional Layer:
“Now the only thing I would add to that is because I, this is what I do. So when I look at this, the ruler is Aquarius, so Uranus here opposing the sun. So what happens is this is public; what happens is very erratic.”
The Pattern:
“It’s like very erratic, changes happen out of nowhere. They happen, there’s upheaval, like one day things are fine; next day, like, for no reason at all, things are not. And then it kind of adds some conflict within the house because the ruler isn’t just Venus in the ninth; the ruler is also Venus in the ninth square Neptune or semi-sextile Neptune in the third.”
The Publicity Angle:
“So there’s gossip happening, so people are talking, her relationships are public even though she doesn’t want them to be. This is like that fear or that loss of like, this isn’t what I wanted.”
Early Life Influence:
“And if we trace it back to the ruler, again, the moon in the fourth, that comes from childhood, right? So maybe she watched her parents have a very volatile, public relationship that she didn’t want. Or she watched her parents be very private, and it worked out, so she wanted that for herself.”
The Manifestation Problem:
“And now she’s in this position where she’s trying to be private because of the 12th energy, but it’s very difficult to be that way because of Mercury here, and she has no choice over the spontaneous nature of these relationships that, it’s like there’s always something. And the things that happen are, you know, kind of childlike and creative, but they’re also, they can sting a little bit, you know, because Uranus stings.”
Question 3: Empty 8th House
Student Question:
“What if someone has an empty eighth house?”
Instructor Answer:
“The ruler. So if you have an empty eighth house, what rules your eighth house? And then wherever that ruler is, you take that energy and you place it into the eighth house.”
Example:
“So let me just do this real quick. I’m gonna find, the eighth house is empty, but the eighth house is in Pisces. So Neptune rules it, Neptune’s in the third. So eighth house themes, deep bonds, intimacy, other people’s money, taxes, death, endings, cycles, all of that is very communicative.”
The Interpretation:
“It’s talked about. It’s, there could be legal, you know, when you’re dealing with other people’s money and divorce and separation, you have lawyers. That’s all third house. Communication, lawyers, documents, whatnot. And it’s in Sagittarius, so it’s also legal, justice, you know, truth. So you take those energies and you say, okay, this is how this plays out.”
Ruler Aspects:
“And then you go to look at Neptune itself, how is it aspected? And if Neptune is well aspected or if it’s ill aspected, you know, then you’ll know that the eighth house will actually play out pretty nicely, or it could be really rough.”
Question 4: Virgo & Pisces Manifestation
Student Question:
“I’m a Virgo rising, Pisces moon, and currently my Saturn is opposing my sun. How would you recommend I manifest right now?”
Instructor Answer - Part 1:
“Okay, so Saturn opposing the sun. So you’re probably either 14-15 or you’re closer to that 43-44, somewhere in there because I believe it’s a 28, 29 or 30-year cycle around there.”
The Opposition Meaning:
“So what this means is that you are being restricted from your own, what you want to do, your own vitality, your own energy. You’re, it’s like you are unable to push forward. You’re stuck, you feel stifled by what’s actually in front of you. And some of that is coming from either an authority figure or your own career or your own career path or something along those lines.”
The Transmutation:
“The reason, well, there’s a lot of reasons why we can go down a rabbit hole with this, but the fact that it’s an opposition, that’s balance. That’s trying to figure out how you can meet this energy in the middle so that you can figure out how to overcome it or use it for your benefit.”
Practical Application:
“So what I would do is I would say, ‘Okay, what is it that I really wanna do? What does my sun mean? Where’s my sun? What does my sun house placement tell me that I wanna do? What is it that I want to do?’ And then Saturn’s over here somewhere, so what does Saturn mean? Where’s Saturn? What house is Saturn in? Okay, that’s the structure or the restriction. How can I build on what I want that has to do with this thing over here?”
Example Scenario:
“So maybe your sun is in your ninth house and you wanna travel and Saturn is in your third and it’s like, I can’t afford to travel. Well, you go local. You do short trips. You do like traveling to like, you know, for me, I’m in Texas, so I would say like, I can’t go to, you know, Australia, but I can go to like San Antonio or Austin or Dallas or Houston or whatever and experience those things.”
The Build-Up:
“Or I can focus on making the money so that once this Saturn transit is over, I now have the money and I have my freedom to go do it. Do you see what I mean? Like you’re building on what you have and you’re using the energy that’s presenting itself to you to move forward once you’re out of the situation.”
Question 5: Spouse Prediction
Student Question:
“Can astrology tell how the spouse will be?”
Instructor Answer:
“Kind of. Not the way that you would think that you would want it to. So I’ll give you the answer to this.”
The Method:
“So the seventh house is the first marriage or first major relationship. And then you go to the opposite; so that’s the ninth house. So you would look at the ninth house to see what kind of partner they are in terms of that relationship.”
Limitations:
“Now, the part that you can’t really nail down is like you’re not gonna get hair color, eye color, how tall they are. Sometimes if there’s a lot of Jupiter and Sagittarius energy, I’ve noticed that they’re athletes. If there’s a lot of like entertainment, sun, Leo, they’re in entertainment.”
What You CAN Determine:
“You can get like what they do for a living sometimes. You can get their qualities and their traits because those energies are still energies that exist within the signs and the placements and everything else, but you can’t get specifics like you would if you were just like a fortune teller or a psychic.”
Why Not:
“That’s not the point of astrology; astrology just tells you the energy. And there are millions of people with the same chart. So if astrology said that you were gonna marry a six-foot-two blue-eyed brunette who’s amazing at basketball, and that there’s a million people who have your chart, you couldn’t all marry the same person. So it doesn’t work like that.”
What’s Realistic:
“But you can say, ‘Hey, I’m gonna, you know, my partner’s gonna be in sports, or they’re gonna be very athletic, or they’re gonna be very competitive, or they’re gonna be argumentative.’ You know, things like that, qualities.”
Question 6: Saturn Return Prep
Student Question:
“What do you do if you’re about to head into your Saturn return? Do you prep for it?”
Instructor Answer:
“Yes, you absolutely can prep for it. So a Saturn return is Saturn returning to where it was when you were born, right? So when the transit is coming back.”
Timing:
“Now it starts kind of with an orb. So if you have your Saturn at, let’s say, 15 degrees, I would start looking at it probably about 10 degrees before. So if it’s in the same sign, 10 degrees before; if it’s in a different sign, I would start watching for it about five degrees into the sign that it’s in, if that makes sense.”
What to Do:
“And what I would do is I would say, ‘What does my Saturn mean to me?’ So where’s Saturn? What does Saturn rule?’ Because that’s where it’s hitting. And then in my natal chart, ‘What house is it in? Okay, that’s hitting this house. So I’m being restricted, or my goals are supposed to be here. What happened the last time Saturn was here?’”
Pattern Recognition:
“So look back, the first Saturn return is at 28, 29, 30, somewhere in there. The second one is around 58, 59, 60. So if you’re at your first one, you look back to the year you were born.”
The Analysis:
“And you say, ‘What was going on? What was happening?’ And you look around, you do research on, you know, whether it’s your parents or your own records or whatever, and you see what was happening. And you’ll know exactly how that energy played out in the lower vibration.”
Transmuting for Higher Vibration:
“And that is you deciding, ‘I don’t want that to happen to me when I’m coming into my Saturn return.’ So now I know the house, I know the energies, I know my patterns, I know the themes, and I need to change them now.”
Early Action:
“So I would start doing it as soon as you know it’s coming. Don’t wait until it’s already happening. Because when it starts happening, usually that’s when you’re in reaction mode. And we’re all in reaction mode at that point.”
Proactive Strategy:
“But if you are doing it before and you’re in action mode, then you can set goals now and you can get a head start so that when Saturn comes, you’re already ahead of the curve and you’re already manifesting it at a higher vibration.”
Question 7: Debt and Saturn Transit
Student Question:
“For example, on the debt topic, should we pay off as much debt as possible with this Saturn in the eighth house?”
Instructor Answer:
“Absolutely, yes. If you, so okay, Dolores has Saturn in her second house natally. So she’s always going to have to pay attention to her money; she’s always gonna have to structure her money.”
The Transit Layer:
“When Saturn transits the eighth house, yes, you need to pay down your debt because Saturn’s gonna bring something up about it. Whether it’s you need a loan and you don’t qualify 'cause your debt’s too high, or somebody’s gonna come after you for that debt, or, you know, whatever, you’re gonna have to make monthly payments or something, I don’t know.”
The Outcome:
“But if you pay down your debt before Saturn gets there, then when Saturn is in your eighth house and it’s all about that, you’re debt-free, there’s no stress. Saturn’s like, ‘Cool, good job.’ And you move on with your life. You’re not, you didn’t react to Saturn; Saturn actually helped you because you saw it coming.”
Manifestation Example:
“And then what you can do is you can be like, ‘Alright, now that I’m not paying my debt, that money, I’m gonna put it here and I’m gonna save it, I’m gonna invest it,’ which is all eighth house. And now you’re manifesting money that is yours, but it was really other people’s money that you were paying down and now you don’t have to, so now it’s yours.”
Question 8: Finding the Chart
Student Question:
“So to see this on the astro.com website, what is the chart to choose?”
Instructor Answer:
“So on astro.com, when you want to do your transits, you go to the free horoscopes. Under free horoscopes, you can either go into the extended chart selection and change the type of chart; there’s a drop-down, and it says transits.”
Alternative Method:
“Or there’s another way to do it. You can go, I believe it’s under drawings, chart drawings and calculations, and then you can go down and there’s one that says transit chart. I think it’s like chart for now or, no, it says transits.”
What It Shows:
“And you can literally put in your natal information, and then you can put in the date that you want to know about, and it will show you exactly where everything is transiting over your natal chart.”
Question 9: Moving for Career
Student Question:
“This is intriguing! For instance, would you recommend someone move to LA for entertainment?”
Instructor Answer:
“You know what, I actually am so happy that was asked because I’m gonna use Dolores for this and I’m going to look at her relocated chart, her astrocartography. Give me one second.”
Setting Up Astrocartography:
“So I have the natal chart up right here. I’m gonna go back to chart selection because I don’t think I can go from here, and I’m gonna pull up, what’s it called? Astro click travel. That’s the name. Okay.”
Reading the Map:
“So this person is from Memphis, Tennessee. Okay. And I’m just gonna kind of scroll through and see if there’s anything interesting.”
Analysis Process:
“So right now we can see that red lines are typically malefic and blue lines are typically benefic, right? So they’re good. Saturn’s all about career; it’s really good for career. Let’s see where the Saturn is. Oh, actually the Saturn line goes straight through Memphis. That’s interesting.”
Neptune Line Discovery:
“But we also have a Neptune line that’s around LA. So this would be really good for like illusions, film, that kind of stuff. However, there is a Uranus line that goes right up the coast there too. So Uranus is really good for like groups, friends, all that fun stuff.”
The Recommendation:
“What I would do is I would say, based off of the quick analyzing, and I would always go deeper, but she could move from here, have something that is like Neptunian based for her job, so you know, like I said, film, dancing, music, whatever, and then that brings her money, so she should, from Memphis, go to Los Angeles and live out her career.”
Additional Considerations:
“Now, also we have the moon over here on the East Coast, and the moon is emotions and feelings and whatnot. And I would have to see what’s the other planet. The other planet doesn’t show me. But I would say that that’s something that she can’t ignore because the moon is the ruler of her 12th house.”
Location Strategy:
“So she could live on either coast and be fine, but she would probably be more happy and it would be more lucrative and successful if she was on the West Coast as opposed to the East Coast. But she’ll feel more comfortable in Memphis.”
The Reframe:
“But you’re not, you don’t move somewhere for comfort. You move somewhere because you want a different result. So I would say West Coast for sure.”
Question 10: When to Start Manifesting
Student Question:
“When does one start to manifest or transmute the energy? At the exact date the transit hits or as it’s approaching?”
Instructor Answer:
“As it’s approaching. And honestly, it actually depends because it goes based off of the planet.”
The Orb System:
“So if it’s Saturn, it’s got a seven to eight degree orb of influence. So seven to eight degrees before Saturn hits that planet in your natal chart, that’s when you start to feel it.”
Early Awareness:
“But if you’re looking at an ephemeris or your transits and you see that a year from now Saturn’s gonna hit your moon, I wouldn’t wait until 10 months or a year from now. I would start setting myself up and getting ready and transmuting and doing all the meditation or affirmations or really focusing and goal-setting and planning.”
The Manifestation Timeline:
“And then as you get closer, maybe about three months out from when it’s actually gonna happen, that’s when you take action and do whatever you need to do. But like I said with the debt thing, if you knew Saturn was coming into your eighth house, don’t wait until Saturn’s in your eighth house to deal with your debt.”
Proactive Strategy:
“Start when it’s in the seventh so that when it gets to your eighth house, you’re actually already ahead of it. Does that make sense?”

ELECTIONAL ASTROLOGY: PICKING DATES
The Wedding Date Example
Student Request:
“Can you show how to use transits to pick a wedding date? I have asked many astrologers about this for my wedding and they didn’t give a concrete answer.”
Instructor Response:
“Of course I can. I love picking dates; it’s actually one of my favorite things to do. So let me ask you this: what year are you getting married? Or do you have the year picked out yet?”
Student Answer: “2023”
Setting Parameters:
“Okay. So 2023, and I’m assuming you have some control over the months, not to like put you, you know, on the spot here. But do you know like are you a spring, summer, fall, winter kind of person?”
Student Answer: “October-November preferably”
The Analysis Process
Starting Point:
Direct Quote:
“Perfect, okay. Alright, so I’m gonna do a demonstration here, and I’m actually gonna use Dolores’ chart to do this because I can’t do it for you because you are a real person and this could take me like an hour and a half to actually do your chart.”
Date Range:
“But I’m going to show you what I do, and then maybe you can mimic this, or you can have somebody else who’s an astrologer do this, and you can kind of have them follow along with what I’m doing. So October to November of 2023, so I’m gonna do this.”
Step 1: Saturn Check
Direct Quote:
“Okay, so the first thing I do is I look at the transiting Saturn because Saturn is long-term goals, long-term restrictions. I always start there.”
Finding Saturn:
“Okay, so in 2023 in October, Saturn is at, I’m in October 1st right now, Saturn is at zero degrees and 42 minutes in Pisces. So it’s in Pisces. Okay. And then I’m gonna fast forward, and on November 30th, it is at one degree, so Saturn doesn’t move too much.”
The Interpretation:
“Okay, so Saturn is transiting Dolores’ eighth house. That’s pretty good, actually, for a wedding because Saturn is all about structure and you want structure in your marriage. And you want to overcome and achieve goals together.”
The Concern:
“The only thing that I would, you know, make sure of is that there’s nothing that’s gonna hit any of her planets natally that’s gonna cause any sort of conflict that has to do with shared resources.”
Why This Matters:
“Because you don’t wanna get married and then all of a sudden there’s some sort of financial thing, or somebody comes after you, or, you know, anything along those lines. Or you start your marriage off with debt that you didn’t expect or whatever, you know. So I wanna make sure there’s nothing there.”
Step 2: Checking Saturn Aspects
Direct Quote:
“So Saturn at zero to one degrees. I know that, let’s just double check. So on her natal chart, her moon is at 14, Uranus is at 19, Pluto at 15, Neptune at 18. So we’re not concerned with any of that. Nothing’s getting hit.”
Additional Check:
“What about Chiron at 10 and Jupiter at 22? Nope, we’re good. So Saturn itself is not hitting any planets natally. However, I wanna know what is Saturn doing? What is Saturn aspecting?”
October Analysis:
“So in October, Saturn is sextile Jupiter. That’s great. So Jupiter is expansion, luck, you know, doing things right, and a sextile is easy. That’s like a, it’s a minor aspect, but it’s good.”
The Assessment:
“So you can use, you can have Jupiter energy within your wedding, within your marriage, and within your marriage’s start, which is good. And then Saturn, what else is it doing? Trine Mars, okay. Well, Mars is sex and all that stuff, so that’s good.”
November Check:
“If I go to November, same thing. Saturn sextile Jupiter, trine Mars. Okay. So we’re not running into any issues there.”
Step 3: Checking Other Major Transits
Uranus:
“Let’s do Uranus. Uranus in October and November, 23 to 21 degrees in Taurus. So Uranus is in, it’s approaching retrograde, it’s retrograde, and it’s in her 10th house. That’s actually pretty interesting.”
The Interpretation:
“Uranus here could bring some changes as it’s going retrograde. It’s moving backwards, so it’s gonna bring like maybe some revisiting of themes or, you know, like if there was an ex that she had to like get closure with before she goes into this wedding or something.”
Aspect Check:
“But what I wanna know is what is Uranus doing? So, and I also wanna know what Uranus is actually hitting. So Uranus at 23 to 21. So it’s not hitting anything. Sun’s at 17, Mercury’s at one. So it’s not hitting that. Okay.”
More Planets:
“Let’s do Pluto. Pluto is, in October it’s at 27 Capricorn, and in November, oh it’s gonna move into Aquarius. Interesting. Okay. So in November, Pluto moves into Aquarius at zero degrees. So that is huge because Pluto takes 11 to 32 years to move through a sign.”
The Significance:
“So this would be like a generational shift that would be happening at her wedding. And the energy of that is like power and transformation that would be going on, and it’s happening right around the time that she’s getting married.”
Checking Pluto:
“Pluto at 27 Capricorn to zero Aquarius. What’s getting hit? Nothing’s in Capricorn. Nothing’s at 27, and she doesn’t have anything at zero Aquarius either. So we’re good there.”
Step 4: Mars and Venus
Mars Check:
“Okay, let’s do Mars. Mars moves pretty quickly. So I’m gonna have to kind of narrow it down a little bit. But in October, Mars starts at 11 degrees Libra and ends at 28 degrees Libra.”
The Problem:
“So in this month, if I’m not mistaken, because I see it at 28, Mars is gonna hit Pluto in Libra at 15 degrees in the first house. That’s not ideal.”
Why It’s Not Ideal:
“So Mars hitting Pluto is explosive. It is intensity, it is volatility, and it could bring up things. Now it’s a conjunction, so there could be something really powerful about it.”
The Transmutation:
“But I think that in terms of a wedding, which is supposed to be like more harmonious, even though people argue and things happen, I wouldn’t want that energy at a wedding. However, if you wanted like a really passionate, intense, powerful relationship that starts off with like this raw sexual energy and, you know, couple goals kind of vibe, I would use that.”
November Option:
“But I’m gonna move to November and see if that’s there. Okay, so in November, Mars is gonna be in Scorpio. That’s actually better.”
Mars in Scorpio:
“Okay, so Mars, let’s just double check that. At the end of November, Mars is at 14 degrees Scorpio. So I wanna check to see, is there anything getting hit here? Moon at 14, so yes, Mars is hitting the moon.”
Moon Conjunction:
“Now the moon is emotions. And so this could mean that the wedding itself, the day of the wedding, there could be a lot of emotions that are heightened, but it’s a conjunction, so it’s like you’re happy, you’re happy crying kind of vibe.”
Decision Point:
“But again, I’m gonna see what days specifically we can do where Mars isn’t over the moon because I just, for me, I don’t like that energy.”
Venus:
“Let’s do Venus. Venus in October starts at 11 Virgo, ends at nine Libra, and then in November, Venus is in Libra the entire time starting at nine and ending at 26.”
The Good News:
“So Venus is gonna be in the second and third house, so that’s money and communication. I actually really like that placement because Venus is good for a wedding. It’s love, it’s partnerships, but I don’t want it in the seventh because the seventh is also open enemies and conflict, legal stuff.”
The Preference:
“So I like it in the second because second house is values and, you know, you’re there, you’re committing to each other, you’re bringing that value to each other, and you’re, third house is communication and talking. So I think that that’s good.”
Step 5: The Moon (Final Activation)
The Critical Element:
Direct Quote:
“Okay. So now we have kind of like a baseline. The moon is the final step, guys. The moon is always the activator, so anytime any major event is that’s happening, anytime the moon is, you know doing something, you’ll feel agitation, or you feel focused, or you feel, you know, your attention emotionally drawn to something; it’s because of the moon placement.”
Warning:
“And as you saw, I moved it because I didn’t like the moon over the moon. That can create a depression; it can create heightened emotions. And when her moon is already aspected to too many things on a wedding, I don’t think that that’s a good thing. So I moved her moon over here.”
Picking the Specific Date
November Analysis:
Direct Quote:
“So I’m gonna go to November. I’m gonna say November 1st through 15th just to kind of give us a window here. And I’m gonna see where the moon is and where it’s going.”
Moon Movement:
“Okay, so the moon, oh, this is good. The moon on November 1st is at 13 Taurus and on November 15th, it’s at three Libra. Okay.”
The Decision Process:
“So I want the moon to be either away from her moon here, or I want the moon to be supporting Venus. Those would be the two best scenarios.”
Narrowing Down:
“So let me see. The moon natally is at 14 degrees Scorpio. So I want the moon to be nowhere near 14 degrees of anything if I can help it. Let me go day by day here.”
Checking Dates:
                              * “November 1st, the moon is at 13 Taurus. That’s good.”
                              * “November 2nd, it’s at 25 Taurus. That’s actually even better.”
                              * “November 3rd, seven Gemini. Okay.”
                              * “November 4th, 19 Gemini. That’s good.”
                              * “November 5th, one Cancer. Okay.”
The Chiron Consideration:
“So far, I’m liking one, two, three, four, and five. Let me check to make sure Chiron is where. Chiron is at 10 degrees Taurus. So on November 1st, I don’t like that the moon is conjunct Chiron. So I’m eliminating November 1st.”
Further Elimination:
“November 3rd, the moon is at seven Gemini. Gemini is Mercury, Mercury is at one degree. So the moon is not hitting Mercury natally. That’s fine.”
Aspects Matter:
“Let me see what aspects there are. Okay, so the moon is trine Pluto. That’s actually pretty good. So the moon trine Pluto is deep emotions, it’s powerful, but it’s in a harmonious way.”
More Checks:
“The moon is also sextile Mars. Okay, that’s good. So the moon’s making good aspects on November 3rd.”
Comparing Dates:
“Let me check November 2nd. Moon is at 25 Taurus. The moon is trine Mercury. Okay. And the moon is trine the sun. Okay. And the moon is sextile Neptune.”
The Concern:
“Actually, that’s, Neptune can be an illusion, right? So I don’t want illusions happening on a wedding day where you think something’s perfect and then you realize later it wasn’t. So I don’t like the sextile to Neptune.”
Between Two Dates:
“So I’m gonna say between November 2nd and November 3rd. And I would lean more towards November 3rd.”
Final Verification:
“November 3rd, 2023. Let me just double, triple check everything. So Saturn is sextile Jupiter, trine Mars. Good. Uranus is not hitting anything. Good. Pluto is in Capricorn at 27 degrees, not hitting anything. Good.”
Mars Clear:
“Mars is at zero degrees Scorpio. Is it hitting anything? No. Good. Venus is at 15 degrees Libra. Is it hitting anything? Pluto at 15. Okay, so Venus is conjunct Pluto.”
Venus-Pluto Analysis:
“That’s interesting. So Venus conjunct Pluto is very intense, it’s very passionate, it’s very like deep love. But it’s also, it can be obsessive. So if you want that energy, that’s great.”
Alternative Option:
“But let me see if we can find a day where Venus is not over Pluto. So Venus on November 4th is at 16 degrees. So it’s already passed. So if I wanted to avoid that, I would do November 4th, 5th, or 6th.”
The Winning Date
Final Analysis:
Direct Quote:
“Let me check November 4th. Okay, so the moon is at 19 Gemini. Moon is trine Saturn. That’s good. Moon is sextile Venus. That’s good. Moon is square Neptune.”
The Verdict:
“Ugh, I don’t like that. Okay, so between November 3rd and November 4th, I would pick November 3rd because I think the Venus-Pluto conjunction is powerful and passionate, whereas the moon square Neptune is confusing and illusions.”
Final Recommendation:
Direct Quote:
“So my recommendation for Dolores if she’s getting married in 2023 would be November 3rd, 2023.”
Time of Day:
“And then I would pick the time based off of, you know, whatever other transits are happening, what ascendant you want, what kind of energy you want for the day.”
The Teaching Point:
“But that’s basically how I do it. And I know that took me, you know, 20 minutes or so, but when I do it for clients, it takes me about an hour and a half to two hours because I’m going through every single thing and I’m checking all the aspects and I’m making sure everything is perfect.”

ASTROCARTOGRAPHY DEEP DIVE
The Memphis Question
Follow-Up Student Question:
“Why would she feel more comfortable in Memphis?”
Instructor Answer:
“Well, because that’s where she’s from. That’s where her roots are. That’s where she was born and raised, you know.”
The Chart Interpretation:
“And looking at the chart, she has a very big emphasis on family and home and traditions and things like that. And so Memphis is comfortable because that’s what she knows. She knows the culture, she knows the people, she knows her family’s there, her friends are probably there.”
The Growth Challenge:
“But if she wants to grow and if she wants to achieve the things that she wants in entertainment or whatever, she needs to be where the energy supports that. And that’s not in Memphis; that’s on the West Coast.”
The Comfort Trap:
“So staying in Memphis would be comfortable, but it would also be limiting. And she may end up resenting it later if she doesn’t take the chance to move and pursue her dreams.”
Saturn Line Significance
Additional Explanation:
“Now, the Saturn line going through Memphis is interesting because Saturn is career and structure. So she may have a very structured career path in Memphis, but it may not be in the field that she wants.”
The Neptune Difference:
“Whereas the Neptune line in LA is specifically about film, illusions, creativity, all the things that align with entertainment. So if entertainment is the goal, LA is the place to be.”

Student Note:
“Angie says, wow, my son is now in Taurus; I would not have known that it moves.”
Instructor Response:

What Changes:
“Understanding the new midheaven, for instance, if the midheaven shifted, understanding where your moon is. In progressions, your moon moves every two to two and a half years, moves into a new sign as well, so you’re constantly in a varying emotional state.”
Layering Transits:
“On top of the fact that the moon itself in transit, orbiting the earth, moves quite quickly as well and is two to two and a half days in every sign, so moon, the moon, I’m gonna be teaching a moon class.”
The Challenge:
“That moon is sometimes a little bee-ha, but if you understand what her purpose is, then you can utilize it. So the agitation can always be transmuted.”

RETROGRADE TRANSMUTATION
The Reflection Purpose
Core Teaching:
Direct Quote:
“And before I even get in here, let me talk real quick about the purpose of transmuting. We’ve already done classes one through four, so I’m not going back to teach you any of the basics, any of the energy, what the aspects are. I’ll highlight them as I teach and go, and I’m not even gonna talk about how I pull all this together. You’re just gonna watch as we do it.”
Retrograde Energy:
“But the purpose of transmuting is to understand. Now, we talked about retrogrades in another class, which I will put out soon, which is utilizing retrogrades for positive action. And understanding that the observable backwards motion, which is not real, it is only in perspective of where we are on the planet, creates an influx; or, not influx, a flux in the way the energy hits us.”
Inward Motion:
“And it works inwardly. You can call it backwards because that’s what the planet’s visually doing, but it’s really a flux; it’s an inward thing. So, as that planet, the transits, hit us, it’s causing that energy to go inward and for us to basically do reflection.”
Practical Retrograde Use
The Car Example Revisited:
When Mercury goes retrograde over 3rd house:
                              1. Recognize the transit and what it means
                              2. Identify the specific area of life affected (car purchase, contracts)
                              3. Determine what aspects indicate the specific problem area
                              4. Act proactively to renegotiate or revise before signing
                              5. Use the knowledge to get ahead of the default outcome
The Power Shift:
“That is what transmutation is: to transmute the energies, meaning to take what was going to happen and make it be something I want to happen within the confines of those energies.”

FINAL SYNTHESIS: PUTTING IT ALL TOGETHER
The Three Pillars Integrated
MINDSET:
                              * Clear belief system that energy is malleable
                              * Elimination of all toxic situations/people/cycles
                              * Understanding of five key planets (Chiron, Moon, Neptune, Pluto, Sun)
                              * Recognition of life as a strategic game
                              * Acceptance of failure as learning opportunity
TRANSMUTATION:
                              * Using planetary energies actively (Mars = action, Saturn = structure, etc.)
                              * One-way energy law: conscious direction prevents default manifestation
                              * Selective transmutation (only change what needs changing)
                              * Mental framing and narrative creation
                              * Aspect and rulership web analysis
                              * Applying higher vibration consciously
DIVINE TIMING:
                              * Saturn transits for long-term goal alignment
                              * Moon transits for event activation
                              * Progressed chart for current life phase
                              * Retrograde periods for reflection and revision
                              * Electional astrology for optimal date selection
                              * Astrocartography for location-based manifestation
The Formula
Step 1: KNOW
                              * Know your natal chart inside and out
                              * Know your progressions and current life phase
                              * Know upcoming transits (especially Saturn)
                              * Know your five key planets intimately
Step 2: DECIDE
                              * Decide what you want to manifest
                              * Decide it must be attainable within your energies
                              * Decide it must align with your Sun (happiness)
                              * Decide you will eliminate obstacles
Step 3: ANALYZE
                              * Analyze how energy currently manifests (lowest vibration)
                              * Analyze what aspects/rulers are involved
                              * Analyze what would constitute higher vibration
                              * Analyze upcoming transits for timing
Step 4: FRAME
                              * Frame the mental narrative
                              * Frame the aspects positively
                              * Frame the action steps clearly
                              * Frame your identity around the manifestation
Step 5: ACT
                              * Act when transits support
                              * Act before restrictive transits arrive
                              * Act with the planetary energy (not against)
                              * Act consistently until manifestation
Step 6: ADJUST
                              * Adjust when retrogrades offer reflection
                              * Adjust when progressions shift your life phase
                              * Adjust when feedback shows misalignment
                              * Adjust without abandoning core goal
The Non-Negotiables
From the Class:
                              1. Toxic Elimination:
“None of this matters if you vibe with toxic people or toxic situations; I cannot help you if that’s the type of life you continue to lead.”
                              2. Energy Exclusivity:
“Energies cannot manifest two different ways at the same time, which means if you are using the energy, it can’t do something else because you are telling the energy at what vibration to resonate.”
                              3. Proactive vs. Reactive:
“And instead of it feeling like you’re reacting to circumstance, you’re actually going and creating the circumstance. That’s transmutation, that’s manifestation, that’s divine timing, all three together.”
                              4. Personal Responsibility:
“Pluto is your power. If you do not harness Pluto, it’s everyone else’s power, and it becomes your chaos.”
                              5. Happiness Integration:
“You could be wealthy, but you won’t be happy. And we need the full package. Manifestation, nobody manifests to be rich and depressed; we don’t do that.”

TECHNICAL IMPLEMENTATION FOR APP DEVELOPMENT
Required Calculations
1. Natal Analysis Module:
                              * Five key planet positions (Chiron, Moon, Neptune, Pluto, Sun)
                              * All aspects with legitimate orbs
                              * Complete rulership chains (forward and reverse)
                              * House cusps and rulers
                              * Decan and dwad positions
2. Transit Analysis Module:
                              * Real-time transit positions
                              * Aspect calculations between transits and natal
                              * Orb-based triggering (7-8° for Saturn, 2-3° for Moon/Pluto, etc.)
                              * Transit-to-house overlays
                              * Retrograde detection and timing
3. Progression Module:
                              * Progressed Sun (1° per year)
                              * Progressed Moon (2-2.5 years per sign)
                              * Progressed Ascendant/Midheaven
                              * Progressed aspects
4. Electional Astrology Module:
                              * Date range scanning
                              * Multi-planet aspect checking
                              * Moon phase and position optimization
                              * Conflict detection (squares, oppositions to natal sensitive points)
                              * Benefic aspect maximization
5. Astrocartography Module:
                              * Planetary lines on world map
                              * Relocated chart calculations
                              * Line interpretations by planet
                              * Distance-from-line calculations
User Interface Requirements
Manifestation Dashboard:
                              * Current Saturn transit with countdown
                              * Upcoming major transits (within orb)
                              * Progressed chart overlay toggle
                              * Five key planet status indicators
                              * “Vibe higher” score (toxic situation assessment)
Transmutation Planner:
                              * Select area of life (money, love, career, etc.)
                              * Natal energy analysis (how it defaults)
                              * Aspect web visualization
                              * Higher vibration suggestions
                              * Mental frame templates
Timing Calculator:
                              * Date range selector
                              * Event type dropdown (wedding, business launch, move, etc.)
                              * Automatic optimal date suggestions
                              * Aspect calendar view
                              * Moon phase integration
Learning Modules:
                              * Five key planets deep dive
                              * How to read aspects for manifestation
                              * Retrograde utilization guides
                              * Case studies (like Dolores examples)
Algorithm Priorities
For Manifestation Timing:
                              1. Saturn position and aspects (highest weight)
                              2. Major hard aspects to natal chart (eliminate)
                              3. Moon position and aspects (medium weight)
                              4. Benefic aspects (Venus trine, Jupiter sextile, etc.)
                              5. Avoid Moon-Neptune squares/oppositions
                              6. Avoid Mars-Pluto harsh aspects for partnerships
                              7. Prioritize Moon trines/sextiles to natal planets
For Transmutation Suggestions:
                              1. Identify lowest vibration interpretation
                              2. Map aspect web involved
                              3. Identify planetary energies available
                              4. Suggest mental frames based on houses/signs
                              5. Provide action steps aligned with planets
                              6. Create affirmation templates
For Transit Alerts:
                              1. Saturn entering new house (2.5 year cycle)
                              2. Outer planets (Uranus, Neptune, Pluto) aspects to personal planets
                              3. Eclipses hitting natal points
                              4. Saturn returns (approaching within 10°)
                              5. Progressed Sun/Moon sign changes
                              6. Transits to five key planets

SCOPE LIMITATIONS - WHAT THIS CLASS DOES NOT COVER
1. Progressions

Why Progressions Matter:
“In your progressions as we go through life, what you do when you’re 20 to make money is not going to be the same as 30, 40, 50, 60, 70. It’s always going to change. It’s always going to be different. Progressing. You are evolving. Different transits are happening. Different events in your life are going to unfold.”
The Warning:
“You need to make sure that you’re not staying static. It’s very good to understand your natal chart, but realize that as you progress and get older, a lot of these things are going to add nuances and layers onto what you’re doing.”
Course Correction:
“So you may start something, you might be successful for three years. You might hit a wall. That wall can be overcome if you understand the energies at play. But if you keep trying to do the same thing you’ve always been doing, you may be trying to work against a transit or some sort of aspect in your progressions. And that is the warning to say, hey, you got to make some changes in course correct.”
2. Relocations / Astrocartography
Direct Quote:
“If you have moved, you have to factor in the new area and how, if you were born there, that’s the area. The energy’s influence of that area impacting you. And it does make changes to a lot of things, namely how you make money usually is greatly impacted because your midheaven is usually altered in some way.”
3. Transits
Direct Quote:
“Again, this is your relationship with money, and your entire chart is a factor. We have your ascendant here, which is how you approach life in general… I’m only going to be talking about the natal chart in this class, I’ll be talking about transits in a separate class because it’s just a lot of information and I wanna make sure that you get this down.”

HOUSE SYSTEM FRAMEWORK
The Money-Related Houses Defined
ASCENDANT:
Direct Quote:
“We have your ascendant here, which is how you approach life in general, which means whether we’re talking about love, career, children, your friends, spirituality, it all comes back to the ascendant because that point right there is the hot wire of who you are in the first house of self. So that is always going to be a factor.”
Application:
“So the ascendant has everything to do with your actions in this world. And that includes how you make money and why.”
SECOND HOUSE:
Direct Quote:
“Your second house, we’ve already talked about that. It is the relationship with money and how you align with value. It is your values and how you believe in your values. So it is not just money for like the static generalized term but more how you and your relationships, you and money have this bond or lack thereof.”
Additional Themes:
“This also rules the earth, mother nature, childbirth, womanhood. It’s all the second house. But again, we are focusing through the lens of money and finances…”
SIXTH HOUSE:
Direct Quote:
“The sixth house has to do with your work environment and your daily routine.”
Distinction from 10th:
“The sixth house and the 10th house do differ. The sixth house is where you have the authority. It’s where… you’re seeing in the workplace and how those themes apply. Whereas the sixth house has to do with the service, the type of job that you do in terms of services and the daily routine and the work environment. When you go there, what’s around you? What type of environment are you in?”
TENTH HOUSE:
Direct Quote:
“The 10th house is your reputation and public image. We talk about this being your career house because it themes the type of work that we do.”
Why It’s Career:
“Your 10th house does rule everything that Capricorn would rule.”
MIDHEAVEN (MC):
Critical Distinction:
Direct Quote:
“The midheaven, often aligned with the 10th house, right? They’re used synonymously, but they’re not actually synonymous.”
The Floating Point:
“Your 10th house does rule everything that Capricorn would rule. But the midheaven is a point that can actually float anywhere from the 8th to the 11th house. Oftentimes, it’s in the 9th or 11th. Eighth is actually very rare, but I’ve seen it.”
What It Represents:
“And then often I obviously see it in the 10th house, but this is really the opposition of your IC, the opposition of your nadir. The energy that you keep private, it’s everything that you don’t keep private and you want to put out in the world. It’s the trajectory, the opposition of what you seek and how you want to be seen.”
Life Purpose:
“And this ends up being… We call it your life purpose again because it opposes our private world, but it is a very personal angle point. It is public, yet it’s very personal to us just because it opposes the extremely personal IC.”
EIGHTH HOUSE (Business - Not Covered):
Direct Quote:
“Another thing that I don’t talk about much in this is because this is more on your personal level is business finance is the eighth house and Scorpio and Pluto. So those are a different class for when I do the business class.”
VENUS & SECOND HOUSE RULER:
Direct Quote:
“And then, of course, Venus and your second house ruler. Remember, rulerships are extremely important. Bidirectionality of rulerships, if you have any planets in the second house, also very important. And then, of course, aspects. This will all add additional information to color and theme, everything to do with money.”
Complexity Acknowledged:
“So it is a very complex topic. But once you get into it, you’ll start seeing the themes and how they play out in your life and then you can start aligning with them.”

VENUS & LIBRA: THE UNIVERSAL MONEY FACTORS
The Overlooked Connection
Direct Quote (from Aries Rising section):
“Now, the money ruler is Venus. That’s natural, right? Because Taurus rules money. So… for an Aries rising, they’re looking to Taurus anyway. I also want to point out that anytime that you’re looking at Venus and Taurus for money, you’re always looking at Libra. This is something that’s often overlooked people don’t do not look at their Libra house to understand that it’s also a factor for making money now.”
Why Libra Matters:
“I’m not going to talk about Libra much throughout the entire thing. I’m making the statement now. Aries rising also have to consider how their seventh house is situated because they will also make money through others. They do it themselves, but they need somebody else to buy. So this is how they interact and this is how it works for their Libra placement to be involved. Aries rising needs that Libra to be involved.”
Partnership Energy:
“So there’s often some aspect of either partnership, one-on-one dealings, dealing directly with the public and public as a whole, not public as in like one-on-one as a group rather. It’s the public as one. So this is extremely important. Remember, Libra is very important when you’re talking about money as well.”
Universal Application:
Direct Quote (from Taurus Rising section):
“To be fair, every single… every single planet, every single, oh my God, I can’t think. Every single sign has Venus to look to because Venus also rules this.”

COMPLETE 12 RISING SIGN ANALYSIS
Methodology Note
Direct Quote:
“Now we go on. I’m just going to go through each of your rising signs from Aries all the way to Pisces. And we’re going to just talk a little bit about your relationship and the ways to kind of use that energy and generate.”
Assumptions:
“I’m going to assume that there are no planets in any of these houses. I’m not going to talk about the rulership right now other than what it is. I’m not going to talk about where it is.”
Generalization Warning:
“This is Probably the most important thing… I’m going to go through all this, and it is not going to be 100% applicable to every single person because this is very generic, however, it’s a foundation to work off of. And each placement, rulership, and aspect is going to change this per person. But this is the basis. Assuming no planets, not talking about the rulership.”

ARIES RISING
Second House: Taurus
Money Ruler: Venus
Relationship with Money
Direct Quote:
“The relationship for most Aries risings is that they enjoy comfortable things. They enjoy having things that are valuable. Value is extremely important. If they buy something, if they spend money on something, they want the value out of it. And it needs to be equal to the amount that they’re putting out.”
Spending Patterns:
“They don’t mind spending money, and they will spend on luxury, but it’s usually because they’re in Aries rising, something that they want, right? The rising sign always colors the second house.”
Money Compartmentalization:
“But money is money. This is kind of a compartmentalized thing for Aries rising in general. Work is work. Communication is communication. Home is home. Blah, blah, blah. But money is money. They make money to make money. They see the value in money.”
The Separation:
“But until you get into the rulership, the actual topic of money doesn’t really span around into the rest of their chart. They understand it for what it is. And that’s just a generalized natural Aries rising thing.”
Ways to Generate Money
Direct Quote:
“Now, in order for them to generate money, they can do anything that involves food, they can you sell tangible, physical items, they can do anything that’s art-related, and they can do anything that’s directly related to finance.”
Specific Careers:
“They could be bankers, they could be investors, they could be in investments, investment banking, obviously, if you tie it all together. Anything that they handle money, depending on how other things are situated in the chart, they could even be into cryptocurrency.”
Value-Based Work:
“But it’s all about the value of something. This could even be somebody who’s into like auctions and things like that if they have certain placements that say, ‘I want that value to be, I want to get more value than I put out,’ right? So if there’s another Virgo placement or Mercury placement that’s involved with Taurus, it could be somebody who does something like that. But value is value for them.”
The Libra Connection
Critical Addition:
“I also want to point out that anytime that you’re looking at Venus and Taurus for money, you’re always looking at Libra… Aries rising also have to consider how their seventh house is situated because they will also make money through others.”
How It Works:
“They do it themselves, but they need somebody else to buy. So this is how they interact and this is how it works for their Libra placement to be involved. Aries rising needs that Libra to be involved.”
Public Dealing:
“So there’s often some aspect of either partnership, one-on-one dealings, dealing directly with the public and public as a whole…”
