TAURUS RISING
Second House: Gemini
Money Ruler: Mercury
Relationship with Money
The Knowledge Paradox:
Direct Quote:
“Well, Taurus Rising is automatically about value anyway. Their second house is Gemini, but they themselves, they enjoy to be comfortable. They enjoy luxury. They enjoy the finer things. They enjoy… like I think I already said it, luxury, finer things, things that are handmade. These are very important to them. Things that have value, things that have even a little bit of sentimentism.”
But:
“The money ruler is Mercury, though. So while you will look at Venus for every single rising sign, you will always look at the second house ruler in this case, Gemini’s ruler is Mercury. So you’re going to look at Mercury’s placement. So now you’re looking at Libra. You’re looking at Mercury. And because Mercury is also co-ruled, you will also be looking at Virgo.”
The Core Issue:
Direct Quote:
“So the relationship with money because they have a Gemini in the second house for Taurus rising is that they always think they know how much money they have. but they don’t typically know. It’s always like this average.”
The Mental Process:
“They think, logically speaking, based off of everything that’s happened, I think I know how much money I have, but they almost never know the exact amount.”
Exception:
“If they do know the exact amount, it’s because Mercury is in a very specific position and then they are more factual. Like if they have the… uh if they have mercury in the third house for instance or in the 10th house or something like that they may always have like knowledge of their quick access to their online bank statements so they have that total at hand…”
Spending Patterns:
Direct Quote:
“They’re extremely impulsive for new things. Shiny objects. Ooh, that looks nice. I want to buy something. I see that on TV, infomercials, all that kind of stuff. They’re the first ones to jump on that.”
The Duality:
“They tend to have two of everything. It’s like, I get this. I see it. But, you know, it came in blue and it came in purple. And I really liked both. It was like a like a teal and this and they justify it. They rationalize it, which is the other part of this. It’s logical, even if they have to rationalize it. So it’s not always logical to other people. It’s logical to them.”
Physical Connection:
“And this is kind of things. And they like trinkets, you know, little knickknacks and stuff like that that they could play with their hands as well. And that fit in their hands.”
The Cerebral Nature:
Direct Quote:
“Now, this is the relationship with them with this. And when I’m talking about the relationship here, guys, sometimes it’s how they accumulate money. Sometimes it’s the reason why they feel like they don’t have money. But either way, it’s just how they interact, how they think, how they feel. It’s not always about thinking that’s more Gemini, but how they associate with value and money. It’s very cerebral. It’s very hands-on. It’s very like ‘do-do-do-do-do-do-do’ for Taurus rising when there’s Gemini there.”
Ways to Generate Money
Direct Quote:
“The ways to generate money are through communication, some sort of communication, which could be writing, could be… could be online, could be social media. Obviously, the rulership is all going to be a part of this in Virgo’s placement.”
Hand Work:
“Working with their hands, like writing and coding and things of that nature where hand-eye coordination is one way to do that.”
Data & Numbers:
“Logistics, anything that deals with data, numbers. You see a lot of accountants who are Taurus rising because, remember, finance is very important already. And then the actual data is how they make their money through it.”
Multiple Streams:
Direct Quote:
“And then multiple streams of income. This is very common for Taurus rising. Anybody who has Mercury or Gemini, either in the 10th or the 6th, the second house or a midheaven there in gemini multiple streams of income always or if they don’t have more than one stream of income they have a job that requires them to wear multiple hats do at least two things…”
The Gemini Need:
Critical Point:
Direct Quote:
“…and to be honest if a gemini does not have somebody with gemini prominent tendencies, does not have more than one thing to do. They tend to fizzle out, kind of hit their own roadblocks. Everybody else in the world will tell them, you know, you need to pick one thing, you need to focus on it. And that’s actually their problem is that they only have one thing and they’re focusing on the one thing and they’re losing their minds either out of boredom or it’s just not aligning with their energies.”


The Solution:
“The second side of Gemini is like, hey, what do I do? So remember, Gemini energy is all about duality.”

GEMINI RISING
Second House: Cancer
Money Ruler: Moon
Relationship with Money
The Emotional Core:
Direct Quote:
“Gemini rising, the second house is Cancer. Cancer is obviously ruled by the moon. Here, and… wherever the moon placement is and Venus placement. The relationship with money for Gemini Rising, having a Cancer second house, is that they choose to use their money or not have their money based off of their mood and their emotion.”
The Intuitive Connection:
“I felt like buying this. I had a connection to this. I don’t know why, but I really just want to get this. They also have their mood and their emotions fluctuate to the amount of money they feel they should have. Because we’re talking about cancer energy in the moon. It’s more about intuition and feeling.”
The Positive Potential:
“Now, they obviously can use their intuition as well to make good money decisions. If they have that blocked or closed off, they can have issues there.”
Privacy Issues:
Direct Quote:
“They don’t like to tell people how much something costs. They don’t like to tell how much it was, especially anything that’s in their home. It’s very private to them. Their money is very private to them. This is my money. You don’t need to know, and that’s just how it is.”
Family Connection:
“Money is definitely tied in with home and family. Often that’s where the money goes. Either they’re helping family with something, they are tying that money back into their own home, they’re investing in homes or doing something like that that is tied in with home and family.”
The Emotional Need:
Direct Quote:
“And money is more of a need. There’s an emotional security that is tied with the need for money. And although cancer tends to be related to jobs that can produce a lot of money, it’s more about the emotional security. It’s not the cancer itself is a money sign it’s that it’s the first one that has again that emotional connection to it…”
Moon Placement Effect:
“…and depending on how your emotions are placed meaning your moon placement in your chart will determine how important money is as a gemini rising”
Personal Example: The Instructor’s Mother
Direct Quote:
“A good for instance, my mother is a Gemini rising. She has cancer in the second house. Her moon is in Capricorn. So working that corporate job, making more money, having stability, that’s all tied in.”
The Structure Need:
“If she doesn’t have that 401k and those investments and that portfolio and everything and have all that structure, it will affect her mood. It does, did… you know, affect her emotional status, all based off of how much she did or didn’t have based off of what she felt she should have.”
The Volatility:
“If the money went up and down, as a Gemini, she’s seen the numbers, she gets it, but if she felt like it should have been more, the mood will be affected by it. And conversely, if it ends up being more than she thought, the mood is affected positively by that.”
Ways to Generate Money
The Public Connection:
Direct Quote:
“Ways to generate. I see this all the time. Cancer placements have… unique opportunities to really connect with the public and their personal. Cancer is like a bridge between the because of it’s so intuitive between what is very private and what is very public.”
Why Cancer Works:
“It is obviously in direct opposition to Capricorn. but it just tends to be the pulse of everything. So these cancer placements in your chart are a really good indication of where you connect well with the public because it is your intuition.”
Real Estate:
“But these people can make money doing real estate or domestic efforts.”
Domestic Work Defined:
“Domestic efforts mean anything from like knitting, to sewing, to cooking, to agriculture, farming. These are all part of this. But real estate, which can be any facet of real estate, anything that has to do with physical homes, would be a good place to make money.”
Ruler Matters:
“And obviously, you would take the ruler and see where that is. All aspects. Some people who have this are not going to be into real estate. Obviously, this applies to everything I’m talking about because rulerships, aspects, progressions all those matter in relocations as well.”
Nurturing Professions:
Direct Quote:
“Nurturing, caring professions, anything like nursing, even things like dental hygienist or babysitting, anything like that is very indicative of a… of a moon in the second house, anything where they can…”
The Gemini Layer:
“…they tend to gravitate towards the Gemini. So there’s some sort of logical component to this. Often if they are in some sort of nurturing profession, there’s some sort of logistics to it where they’re dealing with numbers or scheduling or anything like that.”
Following Intuition:
“Doing what feels good or at peace. This goes back to not only the intuition side, but the fact that cancer naturally rules the fourth house. This is all about home, family, and things that are private.”
Family Business:
“And then, of course, through family. Family businesses, working with family, creating something as a legacy for family, trying to set something up so that they can pass it down. This is all cancer type of energy.”

Why It’s Different:
“Because all the other ones really have not much to do with it. The sun is vitality, happiness, you know, feeling like a kid, childhood risk and everything like that.”
Risk Factor:
“Now, risk obviously can factor in if it is implemented. Cancer risings tend to make a lot of money because of risk. Leo rules risk. And I don’t have that on here, but I wanted to mention it. That risk is associated with cancer rising due to Leo, and then the sun placement adds flavor to it.”
Relationship with Money

They’ll definitely put a lot into that.”

They let that kind of lead with their intuition.”

It’s the other side of the brain here.”

Direct Quote:
“If they can do that and do that their way and have fun with it and enjoy it, you will see that they will make a lot of money doing that as well. Creative pursuits are perfect for cancer risings. Doing what makes them happiest. It’s because the sun rules the second house. It’s all about creativity, feeling like that kid and feeling like you have that life, that spark of life.”
The Critical Point:
“So the happier you are, the more money you will make. This is kind of common through most of them, but for Cancer Risings, it really has to align.”
Leadership:
“And then anything that has to do with a leadership role and doing something that they, again, they want to do, but they need to be able to have some sort of control over that and do things their way. They’re not the type that enjoys having for the most part, and enjoys having a boss.”

So you’re gonna see a lot of Leo risings make a lot of money by being in the spotlight. They are known, they’re online, they’re influencers.”

So you’ll see these guys.”
The Generosity Explanation
Why Leos Are Generous:

The Connection:
“So when you pull in the ruler, Mercury, into what a Leo rising chart is, this is why Leos are so generous. It’s because of where the houses actually sit, not because Leo itself is inherently generous. It’s not. But Leo rising is.”
Relationship with Money
The Critical Nature:
Direct Quote:
“You see sale shoppers because Virgo is all about analyzing, being meticulous. In the house of value, they’re constantly being critical. So they’re always trying to figure out how much money they have, how much they can spend.”
Personal Exception:
“And obviously, there are plenty of Leo risings like myself who don’t keep any track of this kind of stuff. And that is because I have all that rulership in the sun, you know, my chart ruler, which is also important up here in Gemini. And it is opposite. The ruler here is opposite. Neptune and my Mercury, which rules my second house, Virgo. Yeah, Money House is opposite Uranus. So it’s like, yeah, I don’t really care that much how much money I have. I always know I can make it, but that’s because of other things in my placement.”
The Default:
“If you strip away all my chart signs as a Leo rising, which I am, then it is about this. And they’re kind of like Taurus risings in that they feel like they always know how much money they have. Again, it’s because Mercury is the ruler. So they have a good beat on how much they have.”
Personal Strategy:
Direct Quote:
“I actually use this. It’s also about strategy and detail and planning, right? I don’t necessarily plan my money, but I do do something that’s interesting. I said do. I actually use this Virgo here by I take, if I have an expense, if I’m paying out, I always round it up. So in my mind, in my bank account, I’ve paid more. If I have money coming in, I always round it down. So I always feel like I’m receiving less money. And it always keeps me having more money than I think I have, which obviously keeps me happy. But that’s something that’s actually this Virgo placement that I use there.”
The Work Requirement:
Direct Quote:
“And Virgo, I’m sorry, Leo rising because Virgo’s in the second house always feels like they have to work for their money. Now with Mercury being ruled there, it also means that stress, and this goes for Taurus rising as well, I guess, stress around finances is heavy. And maybe even more so for Taurus rising, if I’m completely honest, but Leo rising as well. Stresses around money.”
The Biggest Stressor:
“This is the biggest stressor for Taurus and Leo rising is money, finances, because they always feel like they need to work. You know, hard for them and they need to do what they do. Leo feels like they need to work hard. Taurus feels like they need to just know how to make money. And when they don’t just know how to make money, it really bothers them and stresses them out. Whereas Leo rising, it’s like, ‘I got to work hard. I know I got to work hard.’”
Exception Note:
“Obviously, if you’re Leo rising and you don’t like to work hard, you have to look at the rest of the planets. But this is, again, the basis.”
Ways to Generate Money

Direct Quote:
“To generate money for Leo rising services. It’s literally what it is work services. Those are the main things: finding routine, finding things that work on their own.”

“Now, this is automation as well for Leo risings because Mercury ruled Gemini is in the 11th house. So it brings in technology, it brings in networks, groups, teams. brings in automation.”

Direct Quote:
“So there are actually two different ways for both Taurus and Taurus and Leo rising. Sorry, I’m staring right at it. Leo risings to make money here. And that is through the second end, the 11th house. So this is more like groups, multiple groups and multiple teams and all of that. And the actual workings of automation. And Virgo is all about the services. It’s all about creating a strategy.”

Direct Quote:

If you have Virgo here, if you are in medicine or any type of healthcare or any type of service related industry, you may start there, but your goal is to work your way up to the top because your value is with Taurus in the 10th house, your value is in the management. Relationship with Money
The Partner Dynamic:

“It tends to fluctuate, but they tend to be able to skate by if they’re in a lower class. If they’re in the middle class, they kind of stay like this, upper class like this.”

“That’s really what a secretary is in a lot of these places: they end up doing the Gemini work up here where they’re doing all the communication, answering the emails, doing all that, all the stuff on the phone. And then they’re mediating. So, this between themselves or the customer and the CEO, the person who wants to get a hold of the person that they’re working for, they end up being mediator. And that’s another way that this tends to play up. It’s not listed on here.”
Partnership:
Direct Quote:
“But fashion and beauty is definitely one. Through partnership. Partnership is amazing for Virgos.”
The Libra Challenge:
“And a lot of Virgos feel because they feel like they need to be of service to others that they don’t end up getting this equality thing. And that’s kind of a thing with Libra that some people don’t realize that Libra is about balance and fairness. but never is. And that’s the unfortunate thing is that it should be, and they strive towards it, but it’s very difficult to attain.”
Finding Balance:
“However, they need to find and strike balance with other people to be able to utilize assets and kind of pull all that together so that they can find their fairness and their level of money that comes through partnership, but gives them a comfortable lifestyle because they also want that. With a Venus ruled second house, they also want comfort. They want to be comfortable. They want to have what they want. They want to make sure that they’re not, that they feel balanced.”
The Comfort Zone:
Direct Quote:
“A lot of Virgo risings actually feel comfortable when they’re not rich. You know, obviously the planetary placements will all change this, but they like to just be level. That’s what they’re seeking is balance and harmony.”
Legal Work:
Direct Quote:
“Legal work is huge for Virgo risings. I also see them in law firms and whatnot. Being able to step it up and be the service to the client rather than service to the firm. That’s the key for a lot of them.”
Career Progression:
“Not everybody wants to do that. Some people like their nine to five. Some people want to stay at that certain role. But a lot of these Virgo risings do, especially because in a lot of the charts that I do, the time frame tends to be A. Chiron and Taurus things where they don’t value their contributions, they have lower self-worth, insecurities with money and things like that. So a lot of these Virgo rising should be taking the step and elevating themselves a bit.”
Multitasking Strength:
“And they’re so good at multitasking. And being able to balance all of that out if they’re able to create a career with this Gemini energy in the 10th house so that they are multitasking and doing different things, whether that’s in one job or juggling a couple of businesses that maybe they have.”
Business Reluctance:
Direct Quote:
“And they tend not to start their own businesses with this Pisces in seventh house. If they do, it’s usually something that inspires creativity. So you end up seeing Virgo Risings being like organizers, professional organizers, something like that, where they get to be creative. And it’s not really a job that has much structure.”
Exception:
“Obviously, that can change if, for example, Neptune is in Capricorn or if you have certain other placements. But that tends to be kind of it.”
Music Example:
“A lot of Virgo Risings that get into music, if they start their own business, they kind of do their own thing where they’re either musicians or with that 10th house in Gemini. Do like the technical side of it where they’re producing or something along those lines.”
Legal Redux:
“But legal work is huge because labor rules and legal stuff.”
The Core Need:
Direct Quote:
“And, like I said before, finding stability, finding that balance between what you put out and what you get back. That is the main key for Virgo Risings when it comes to money: making sure that you are not doing, doing, doing being of service all the time and not being compensated for it. Making sure you find that stability. Make sure you are receiving the money.”
Chiron Warning:
“If you couple this with a Chiron and Taurus, it makes it very difficult. You’re going to have to work on both your Chiron and Taurus and your Libra in the second house to rectify this and remedy this.”
________________


LIBRA RISING
Second House: Scorpio
Money Ruler: Pluto
Relationship with Money
The Disappearing Act:
Direct Quote:
“Libra rising. So that means the second house is in Scorpio. The money ruler is wherever Pluto sits in the chart, which will add context to all of this. The relationship is that money disappears. I hear a lot of people with Pluto in the second house or, you know, Scorpio as a second house ruler because there are Libra risings. That’s like money just. There’s always a reason why I can’t hold on to it.”
Debt Pattern:
“Or they end up, here it is, usually easily in debt. So they have a really hard time not going after the lavish things, not going after they can obsess over luxury with that Taurus in the eighth house here and end up getting themselves quite in debt.”
Dependency:
Direct Quote:
“The money tends to come from other people. A lot of Libra rising charts, it’s always they end up partnering because that’s natural for Libra. They find themselves through partnerships and they end up partnering and their money comes through shared resources, mostly from their partner.”
The Core Problem:
“Unsure how to make money on their own is a side effect of that. They tend to like Pluto, it’s hidden, it’s mysterious. They’re not really sure where it comes from or how to get it. It just feels unattainable.”
The Irony:
Direct Quote:
“And this is a hard one for Libra rising, I think, because Pluto in and of itself is a difficult placement, a difficult… planet to harbor because it is chaos and mayhem and the ruler of the underworld and things that go awry and all that. And it does involve other people. And Libra should be really aware that the other people are significant in there.”
The Paradox:
“They have this feeling like they’re so used to partnership and dealing with other people, but they want to make their own money. And it’s ironic that because Scorpio is there, that money actually has to come from other people as well. It’s just a matter of how you do that. You can still make your own money by using other people’s resources.”
Ways to Generate Money
Insurance & Debt:
Direct Quote:
“Insurance and debt, especially large ones. People who do like life insurance and all kinds of insurance policies. Libra risings can do a really good job with this because they understand the investment strategy if they learn it, obviously, and it aligns their energies with being able to accumulate this through shared possessions.”
Wealth Management:
Direct Quote:
“Also, wealth management. I hardly ever see Libra risings in wealth management, yet they should be.”
The Perfect Setup:
“You literally have cancer in your 10th house, which has to do with families and home and the authority there. You have your… Taurus, which is your money house in other people’s money. You have Libra, which is you being able to associate with other people. You have Mars, which is you doing something for someone else.”
The Alignment:
“For example, finding yourself within them. It’s like it all aligns, but I don’t see it as much. It’s something that some people should consider if you’re, especially if you’re looking to start your own business, if you have a Mars placement because the seventh house is about starting your own business.”
Family Office Potential:
“If you have a Mars placement that supports it, you could be that type of person that doesn’t, especially if you’re already doing insurance and debt and stuff like that. You could start your own family office and become a wealth manager. And you know how much they make? A lot of money.”
Business:
“So they have that through businesses. Libra risings should be starting their own business. Most Libra Risings, because Aries, again, it depends on how your Mars is placed, but because Aries is in the seventh house, this is entrepreneurship energy going off on your own.”
Home Business:
“And doing your own thing. Being able to work from home is something that most Libra Risings love. Anyway, and being able to start that business finance is the eighth house. I mentioned that earlier in the class here. So you already are set up for that so that you would make money through that.”
Pooling Resources:
“Bringing people together to pool resources, kind of summarizing what I’ve already said here…”
Deep Expertise:
"…and …diving deeper into their chosen field. The more you dive and place value and pull value from something that you’re doing as a Libra rising, the more that you are going to be able to make money from it because you’ll be able to share deeper and dive deeper that other people can’t do.
So a Libra rising’s best option, most Libra rising, is to dive deeper and be able to do more in their chosen field, than anybody else, it makes them stand out, it makes them a household figure, a household name, because they are able to accomplish things that other people in their field are not able to accomplish, and this is where they find your uniqueness and their individuality."
Critical Implementation Note:
 This is the resolution to Libra Rising’s paradox—while money comes through others and shared resources (Scorpio/Pluto), their personal value proposition comes from becoming irreplaceably expert. The instructor emphasizes that depth of expertise compensates for Pluto’s chaotic energy by creating demand that pulls opportunities toward them rather than requiring them to chase opportunities.
Application Specification:
                              * App should track progression of expertise development over time
                              * Flag when transits support deep study vs surface-level work
                              * Identify house placement of Pluto to show WHERE expertise should be developed
                              * Cross-reference with 9th house (higher education) and 3rd house (communication of expertise)
________________


VII. SCORPIO RISING: The Philosophical Opportunist
A. Natal Chart Configuration
Direct Quote:
“Scorpio rising, our second house is in Sagittarius. Sagittarius is ruled by Jupiter. So take a look at your Jupiter placement. A lot of people who are Scorpio risings get lucky unless they have a Jupiter retrograde or adversely aspected Jupiter. They tend to find luck and come across opportunities. Whether they take them or not is a completely different thing.”
Structural Analysis:
                              * Second House: Sagittarius (mutable fire)
                              * Money Ruler: Jupiter (expansion, philosophy, international)
                              * Rising Ruler: Pluto (transformation, intensity, obsession)
                              * Career House (10th): Leo (Sun-ruled—creative authority, leadership)
                              * Work House (6th): Aries (Mars-ruled—pioneering, energetic)
Technical Note: The instructor identifies a critical modifier—“unless they have a Jupiter retrograde or adversely aspected Jupiter.” App must check:
                              1. Jupiter retrograde status (YES/NO)
                              2. Hard aspects to Jupiter (squares, oppositions with orbs)
                              3. Jupiter’s house placement (colors WHERE luck manifests)
________________


B. Relationship with Money: The Jupiter Expansion Paradox
Direct Quote:
"The relationship with money: high highs and lows, low lows. That’s because Jupiter expands. If you’re having a bad streak, Jupiter will expand your bad streak and make it worse. Obviously, if you’re conversely on a high streak, then you will have a high high.
So Jupiter, although seen often as the malefic [NOTE: instructor likely meant ‘benefic’], the great, lucky, abundant planet that it is, there is a downside. It’s also the, especially in the first house or related to your health houses, the planet that can make you gain a lot of weight. Jupiter transits to the first house can do the same thing. So remember that Jupiter just expands a lot.
Oftentimes when something’s going well and Jupiter comes along, then that’s great. If something’s going bad and Jupiter comes along, it makes it exponentially worse."
Critical Warning Implementation:
 Unlike other rising signs where money patterns are more stable (Taurus) or consistently challenging (Libra), Scorpio Rising experiences amplification of current conditions. This requires:
                              1. Momentum Detection Algorithm:

                                 * Track financial trend over last 3-6 months
                                 * When Jupiter transit approaches 2nd house or aspects natal Jupiter:
                                 * IF trend = positive → Flag as “expansion opportunity”
                                 * IF trend = negative → WARNING: “Course correct before Jupiter transit amplifies losses”
                                 2. Jupiter Cycle Tracking:

                                    * 12-year Jupiter return cycle
                                    * Annual Jupiter ingress into money-related houses
                                    * Jupiter-Saturn conjunctions (20-year wealth restructuring)
________________


C. Philosophical Relationship with Money
Direct Quote:
"You tend to have, as a Scorpio rising, your own philosophy about money and life. You think you can dive, as a Scorpio rising, you have dove, dived, whatever, deeper into it, and you have come up with your own philosophy.
Some Scorpio risings have kind of separated themselves from the material world, and they believe money is just a construct, and you don’t need money, and this is why. Other people have developed their own system around how they believe money works. It’s very interesting, but this can lead to a lot of money or no money, and whether or not you’re happy with that or not."
Psychological Profile:
 Scorpio Rising creates personal belief systems about money that may diverge dramatically from mainstream financial advice. This manifests as:
Spectrum of Philosophies:
                                    1. Anti-materialist extreme: “Money is a construct, I reject capitalism, abundance comes from simplicity”
                                    2. Middle ground: “I’ve studied how money works and developed my own investment/earning strategy”
                                    3. Systemization extreme: “I’ve decoded the financial system and created algorithms/methods others don’t know”


App Implementation:
                                    * During onboarding, Scorpio Risings should be asked about their money philosophy
                                    * Chart reading should note: “Your unique philosophy is VALID but must be examined—does it serve your highest vibration or limit you?”
                                    * Reference Jupiter placement to see if philosophy is expansive (well-aspected) or limiting (retrograde/afflicted)
________________


D. Spending Patterns
Direct Quote:
“They tend to spend money on experience. They value experience. They value higher education and learning a bit more than some other people. A lot of Scorpio risings will value education especially one that is going to be family approved, but something that is going to make them stand out and shine in whatever chosen field that they have.”
Spending Priority Hierarchy:
                                    1. Education: Formal degrees, certifications, courses (9th house Sagittarius themes)
                                    2. Experiences: Travel, cultural immersion, transformative events
                                    3. Learning resources: Books, workshops, mentorship programs
                                    4. Things that create distinction: Specialized tools/equipment for their field
Anti-pattern: Scorpio Rising devalues spending on:
                                    * Pure status items (unless education-related)
                                    * Surface-level entertainment
                                    * Things that don’t contribute to expertise development
________________


E. Ways to Generate Money
1. Teaching & Coaching
Direct Quote:
“Now, ways to generate income, teaching and coaching. This has to do with anything that’s online, anything that’s in person. Sometimes it’s fitness related. Remember the other planets all play into it. Sometimes it’s doing the stuff that I do, which is life coaching and mentoring. Anything that’s kind of consultancy-based, that would also be their school teachers, university teachers, anything like that.”
Career Examples:
                                    * School teachers (K-12)
                                    * University professors
                                    * Life coaches
                                    * Business consultants
                                    * Fitness coaches (if Mars/6th house supports)
                                    * Online course creators
                                    * Workshop facilitators
2. Foreign Languages & Cultural Work
Direct Quote:
“Also teaching foreign languages because of the cultural part of this. Foreign lands, something cultural… Foreign lands also says you’re likely to make your money outside of where you were born. Either you’re going to make your money across the country, more than 400 miles away, or literally overseas.”
Geographic Money Pattern:
 Scorpio Rising has a displacement factor for wealth generation:
                                    * Minimum distance: 400+ miles from birthplace
                                    * Optimal: International work or clients
                                    * Why: Sagittarius 2nd house = foreign/distant lands rule money
App Feature Specification:
                                    * Calculate distance between birthplace and current residence
                                    * IF < 400 miles → Suggest: “Your chart indicates financial expansion through relocation or remote work with distant clients”
                                    * Check 9th house planets for additional international indicators
3. Deep Expertise & Obsessive Mastery
Direct Quote:
“The more Scorpio rising dives deeper into their chosen field… The more money they will make because they know more. They learn more. They obsess over what they want. They find their own beliefs. They discard different things and they put it all together.”
The Obsession Advantage:
 Scorpio’s ruling planet Pluto gives capacity for obsessive focus that others can’t match. Combined with Sagittarius 2nd house (learning), this creates:
Mastery Formula:
                                    1. Dive deep into chosen field (Pluto intensity)
                                    2. Learn everything available (Jupiter expansion)
                                    3. Develop personal theories when existing knowledge insufficient (Jupiter philosophy + Pluto transformation)
                                    4. Monetize unique synthesis (know more than anyone else)
________________


F. Instructor’s Personal Example
Direct Quote:
"Now, what’s interesting is I have a Jupiter in Scorpio. So it’s kind of this energy when it comes to how it’s placed and that’s on my IC. So this is all placed like this for me in astrology.
I actually dove so deep into astrology, so deep into film, so deep into art, so deep into even when I sold cell phones for all the major carriers when I went to each one, I knew more than everybody else.
And it’s… You know, you can be called names all day long. You’re a know-it-all, you’re this, you’re that. It doesn’t matter. I did know. I obsessed over it. And what didn’t work, I developed my own theories and philosophies, literally that Jupiter slash Sagittarian energy.
And I pulled that together for astrology. People with Scorpio rising do that same thing for money."
Case Study Analysis:
 The instructor demonstrates the Scorpio Rising / Jupiter-Sagittarius money pattern even without being Scorpio Rising (he has Jupiter in Scorpio):
Evidence of Pattern:
                                    1. Deep obsessive study: Astrology, film, art, cell phone industry
                                    2. Exceeded standard knowledge: “knew more than everybody else”
                                    3. Social criticism for intensity: Called “know-it-all”
                                    4. Developed personal theories: When existing systems insufficient
                                    5. Synthesized unique approach: Created his own astrology teaching method
Application: Scorpio Risings should expect and embrace this pattern, not resist it due to social pressure.
________________


G. Unique Money-Making Systems
Direct Quote:
"They can use this in conjunction with Jupiter, which is their money ruler, to develop their own theories on how money is to be made. So you’ll see a lot of Scorpio risings making money in really weird ways, in taboo ways because that’s what Scorpio rules.
It’s not accepted by the mainstream, but they make their money and you’re just like, ‘I don’t know how you did that.’ They tell you and you’re like, ‘That doesn’t sound right,’ but it is right because they figured it out. It doesn’t sound right because no one else has done it. It’s new and unique."
Taboo/Unconventional Income Streams:
                                    * Methods others haven’t thought of (Sagittarius expansion into unexplored territory)
                                    * Approaches that seem illogical but work (personal philosophy overrides conventional wisdom)
                                    * “Taboo” industries or methods (Scorpio themes: death, sex, occult, transformation, power dynamics)
Examples:
                                    * Tarot/astrology for corporate executives
                                    * Death doula / end-of-life coaching
                                    * Tantric coaching
                                    * Underground/alternative healing modalities
                                    * Crypto trading with personal algorithms
                                    * Teaching “forbidden” or fringe knowledge
________________


H. Opportunity Creation (Especially for Jupiter Retrograde)
Direct Quote:
"Opportunity will show itself often… but especially if they have a Jupiter in retrograde, that Sagittarian ruler in retrograde, they have to create their own opportunities.
And if you have that in your chart, remember I talk about retrograde planets in one of those in the masterclass. It’s all about finding your own luck, finding your own theories, beliefs, and creating your own opportunities. And that will actually bring you wealth as a Scorpio rising."
Jupiter Retrograde Modification:
                                    * Direct Jupiter: Opportunities come naturally, must be recognized and seized
                                    * Retrograde Jupiter: Must generate opportunities through:
                                    * Creating content that attracts opportunities
                                    * Building systems that generate leads/clients
                                    * Developing expertise so rare that opportunities seek them
                                    * Networking in unconventional spaces
App Alert for Jupiter Retrograde Scorpio Rising:
 “Your Jupiter retrograde means you won’t stumble into opportunities—you must CREATE them through deep expertise, unique systems, and proactive positioning. This is not a limitation but a gift: the opportunities you create will be more aligned than random luck.”
________________

VIII. SAGITTARIUS RISING: The Late-Blooming Authority
A. Natal Chart Configuration
Direct Quote:
"Sagittarius rising. The second house is Capricorn. Capricorn is ruled by Saturn. So the money ruler is Saturn, wherever Saturn sits there.
Now, what’s interesting about Sag rising is that because Saturn rules your second house, Saturn also rules your career. So literally your career will bring you money as a Sagittarius rising, whatever that is."
Structural Advantage:
 This is one of the most aligned rising signs for money-career connection because:
                                    * Second House: Capricorn (Saturn)
                                    * Tenth House: Libra (Venus) - but Saturn is exalted in Libra
                                    * Saturn rules BOTH money (2nd) and career (10th by traditional ruler)
Result: Career success directly translates to financial success without the disconnect some signs experience (e.g., Libra Rising whose career may not generate personal wealth).
Technical Implementation:
 App should highlight this alignment: “Your career and money are unified—focusing on career advancement directly increases wealth. No need to separate ‘passion project’ from ‘money job.’”
________________


B. Saturn Retrograde Modification
Direct Quote:
“And if your Saturn is in retrograde, you have to figure out what that is for yourself, often developing your own goals, your own ambitions, your own sense of discipline and authority and create your own world, basically.”
Saturn Retrograde Pattern:
                                    * Direct Saturn: Traditional career ladder, established goals work well
                                    * Retrograde Saturn: Must define success personally:
                                    * Standard corporate path feels misaligned
                                    * Need to build own structure/business
                                    * Authority comes from self-discipline, not external validation
                                    * Late blooming intensifies (see below)
________________


C. The Late Bloomer Pattern
Direct Quote:
"Sometimes these are late bloomers. Saturn tends to be a late bloomer, especially if it’s in retrograde, but even when it’s not. So Sagittarius rising people tend to, at the beginning of life, seem like they don’t know how to make money.
They almost act like they don’t need money because as long as they have enough to get by… They need the basics. They have enough to get by and that often is enough for them."
Three-Phase Money Evolution:
Phase 1: Youth/Early Adulthood (Pre-Saturn Maturity)
                                    * Appearance of not knowing how to make money
                                    * Contentment with minimal income (“just enough to get by”)
                                    * Low material ambition
                                    * Exploratory period
Direct Quote:
“Capricorn energy doesn’t start out this way… But standard speaking, they grow into slow and steady, gets into working hard. So later in life, they’re very hard workers, but they need to find their way. They need to explore. They need to find their place in the world. And then they start putting in the hard work.”
Phase 2: Saturn Maturation (Late 20s - Saturn Return)
                                    * Discovery of “their place in the world”
                                    * Commitment to specific path
                                    * Development of work ethic
                                    * Slow, steady approach solidifies
Phase 3: Post-Saturn Return (30+)
                                    * “Very hard workers”
                                    * Financial success through discipline
                                    * Authority in chosen field
                                    * Long-term stability
App Feature - Age-Based Messaging:
                                    * Ages 18-28 (Sag Rising): “You’re in the exploration phase. Don’t stress about low income—this is your time to find your path. Financial success comes after age 29.”
                                    * Ages 29-35: “Saturn maturation phase—commit to your path now. Hard work during this period sets up lifelong wealth.”
                                    * Ages 36+: “Reaping rewards of Saturn discipline. Focus on long-term stability and authority building.”
________________


D. Relationship with Money: Stability-Oriented
Direct Quote:
"Working hard, slow and steady. These are all, again, if there’s no adverse traits or anything like that. But again, it’s also like they kind of have to grow into this.
They come a lot of their money comes through older systems and traditions, so they end up kind of aligning with their own beliefs. Then they go back and find what like systems and jobs in play are going to allow them to do the thing that they do."
Money Philosophy:
 Unlike Scorpio Rising (which creates new systems), Sagittarius Rising:
                                    1. Explores various philosophies/approaches (Sagittarius Rising nature)
                                    2. Identifies personal beliefs about what matters
                                    3. Finds existing systems that align with those beliefs
                                    4. Works within those structures long-term
Example:
                                    * Believes in environmental sustainability (personal philosophy)
                                    * Finds career in established environmental organization (existing system)
                                    * Climbs ladder within that system (Capricorn 2nd house discipline)
                                    * Doesn’t need to start own eco-company (unlike Aquarius or Aries Rising might)
________________


E. Alignment with Tradition vs. Innovation
Direct Quote:
"Sagittarius rising, unless they have certain traits and whatnot, they’re not usually the ones who go out and like reinvent the wheel and, you know, do like entrepreneur stuff that no one else has done. They tend to do things that are services that come from some sort of history, some sort of authority, some sort of, they bring all that in there.
Second, sixth, and tenth houses are all earth houses. It’s very much rooted in stability and security. But they will find their own spin on it. And that’s what Sagittarius is all about. Finding their own experience and what they feel like they want to do to have stories to tell to be able to kind of expand on that."
Innovation Pattern:
                                    * NOT: Create entirely new industry/method (Aquarius Rising)
                                    * BUT: Take established method and expand/improve it
Direct Quote:
“They may take something that is already out there and, while they’re not reinventing on it, they are expanding upon it and they are adding what they can bring to the table to it to make that thing a better thing.”
Example Applications:
                                    * Traditional teacher who develops innovative curriculum
                                    * Lawyer who creates new legal strategies within existing law
                                    * Doctor who expands standard protocols with holistic additions
                                    * Financial advisor who combines traditional investing with ethical screening
________________


F. Ways to Generate Money
1. Climbing the Ladder
Direct Quote:
"Ways to generate income are climbing the ladder. These are the type of people that will literally, once they find what they’re looking for and they found their place in the world, they’re looking for that experience. They will take all the experience and all the steps to climb up to the top.
And you may see them as either CEOs or just under. I see a lot of Sag rising is like vice presidents and stuff like that."
Career Trajectory:
                                    1. Find right organization/field
                                    2. Start at appropriate entry level
                                    3. Methodically gain experience at each level
                                    4. Accept promotions/advancement
                                    5. Reach senior leadership (CEO, VP, Senior Partner, etc.)
Why “Just Under” CEO?
 The instructor notes many Sag Risings are VPs rather than CEOs—this may be because:
                                    * 10th house in Libra (partnership-oriented, not solo authority)
                                    * Saturn prefers structure over spotlight
                                    * VP role offers authority without total exposure
________________


2. Structure in Utilizing Systems
Direct Quote:
"We see structure in utilizing systems. A lot of them are smart enough to understand that if I want to make an abundance of money using my Jupiter, that I need to use the systems in play, the financial systems.
This is where finance actually plays in with Capricorn and Saturn, is when it’s sitting in the second house and relating to Venus in any way. So financial systems—these are stock market players, these are portfolio, you know, people who hold portfolios, these are gamblers and risk takers."
Financial System Mastery:
                                    * Stock market investing/trading
                                    * Portfolio management
                                    * Systematic gambling (poker, sports betting with models)
                                    * Any field with learnable rules/patterns
Key Distinction:
                                    * Sagittarius Rising: Learns THE SYSTEM, then plays within it masterfully
                                    * Aquarius Rising: Tries to disrupt/replace the system
                                    * Scorpio Rising: Creates personal system that ignores mainstream
Direct Quote:
“They play the stock market. They know the systems and it doesn’t have to be just stocks. It can be anything that has a system. They will learn it and they will try to find a way to use it in their benefit too, to give themselves more. Sagittarius wants more.”
________________


3. Finding Authority in Money Streams
Direct Quote:
"Finding authority in money streams. This is where they find something that not only gives them stability, because that’s extremely important, and structure and foundation, but something that other people appreciate them for and they get respect for. And that’s what they’re seeking with money.
So that’s what they tend to align with when it’s on the positive here."
Money + Respect = Sagittarius Rising Fulfillment
Must have BOTH:
                                    * Financial stability (Saturn need)
                                    * Social respect/authority (Sagittarius need for reputation, Jupiter desire for expansion of influence)
Career Red Flags:
                                    * High-paying but socially devalued work (feels empty)
                                    * Respected but low-paying work (financial stress)
                                    * Need intersection of both factors
________________


4. Setting Up Long-Term Goals
Direct Quote:
"And setting up long-term goals. So they end up, sometimes they’ll play the short game, but a lot of these people, especially if they’re in a stock market or whatever, they’re not looking to be day traders as much as they are looking for patterns and how things play out through international.
They’re looking at the big picture. They tend to see things as they play out the long way. So if you’re getting into financing of any way, then you should be, as a Sagittarius rising, you should be looking at the long game. And that would bring you the most income is not playing the short game unless your energy favors it."
Investment Strategy:
                                    * NOT: Day trading (Gemini/Virgo approach)
                                    * YES: Long-term holds, pattern recognition, international diversification
                                    * Time Horizon: Years to decades, not days to weeks
App Investment Guidance:
 “As Sagittarius Rising, your wealth builds through patient, long-term strategies. Avoid get-rich-quick schemes. Your Saturn-ruled money house rewards discipline over decades.”
________________


G. Summary Table: Sagittarius Rising Money Profile
Category
	Details
	2nd House
	Capricorn (Saturn-ruled)
	Key Advantage
	Career = Money (Saturn rules both 2nd and 10th)
	Pattern
	Late bloomer, slow and steady, discipline-based
	Phase 1 (Youth)
	Low ambition, content with basics, exploring
	Phase 2 (Saturn Return)
	Finding path, committing, developing work ethic
	Phase 3 (Post-30)
	Hard work pays off, authority, stability
	Approach
	Work within existing systems, expand them (not reinvent)
	Careers
	CEOs, VPs, senior management, finance, portfolio management
	Investment Style
	Long-term, systematic, international, pattern-based
	Key Need
	Stability + Respect (money alone isn’t enough)
	Warning
	Avoid short-term strategies, don’t rush early career exploration
	Saturn Retrograde
	Must create own definition of success and authority
	________________


IX. CAPRICORN RISING: The Tech Innovator
A. Natal Chart Configuration
Direct Quote:
“Capricorn rising, second house is Aquarius. Aquarius is ruled by Uranus, so obviously wherever Uranus is in your chart, we’ll add more along with Venus.”
Structural Analysis:
                                    * Second House: Aquarius (Uranus-ruled, fixed air)
                                    * Sixth House: Gemini (Mercury-ruled, mutable air)
                                    * Tenth House: Libra (Venus-ruled, cardinal air)
                                    * ALL money-related houses are AIR signs
Implication: Capricorn Rising’s money comes through ideas, innovation, communication, networking, technology—not physical labor or traditional business.
________________


B. Relationship with Money: Come and Go Pattern
Direct Quote:
"The relationship for Capricorn rising with Aquarius is that money seems to come and go. It’s like no matter how hard they work for it, money just kind of like, either they spend it or they go through periods of time where they have work, they don’t have work.
And that’s because the air signs in the second, sixth, and tenth house are like, they’re ready, they want to work, assuming that their Saturn is well-aspected. But finding the thing that doesn’t make them bored and where they feel at peace and balanced and accepted can be very difficult for them. So they tend to jump jobs and try different things."
Income Instability Causes:
1. Uranus Volatility:
                                    * Sudden income influxes
                                    * Unexpected losses or expenses
                                    * Freelance/project-based income (not salary)
                                    * Cryptocurrency-type volatility
2. Boredom Factor:
                                    * Air signs need mental stimulation
                                    * Repetitive work = quitting
                                    * Constant job-hopping damages income continuity
3. Saturn Strength Modifier:
Direct Quote:
“If they have a stronger Saturn, they will not have the downtime as much, but if they have a weaker or retrograde or whatever Saturn in there, then you may see people with the Aquarius in the second house having a lot of downtime between jobs.”
App Implementation:
 Check Saturn condition:
                                    * Strong Saturn (exalted in Libra, in Capricorn, well-aspected): Income gaps are shorter, more discipline during transitions
                                    * Weak Saturn (fall in Aries, retrograde, afflicted): WARNING: “Expect significant downtime between jobs—build 6-12 month emergency fund”
________________


C. Spending Patterns: The Authority Figure
Direct Quote:
"They tend to spend on their friends. It’s very important. They have the authority. They feel like they’re the man. Sometimes they play that role a little bit too much. They’ll get their little posse together, their team, their groups. They’ll buy everybody shots at the bar. They’ll, you know, buy gifts. They’ll do different things, and they tend to have less money as a result of this.
Obviously, if their chart is the other way around, they try to mooch off their friends, but that’s a whole different thing."
Spending Psychology:
 Capricorn Rising seeks authority and leadership (Saturn/Capricorn nature) but in Aquarius 2nd house, this manifests as:
Two Extremes:
1. The Benefactor (Well-aspected):
                                    * Pays for group activities
                                    * Buys rounds of drinks
                                    * Gifts for friend group
                                    * Financially supports their “team”
                                    * Problem: Overspending leaves them broke
2. The Moocher (Afflicted):
                                    * Expects friends to cover expenses
                                    * Leverages group connections for free resources
                                    * Still sees self as “leader” but financially dependent
App Financial Planning Note:
 “Your chart shows tendency to overspend on social groups. Set ‘friend budget’ limit to maintain financial stability while honoring your generous nature.”
________________


D. Innovation-Seeking & Change
Direct Quote:
"They’re looking for new ways to make money. That’s the thing about Capricorns. And a lot of people associate Capricorns with money. It’s not directly, but a Capricorn rising is always looking for the next thing. They’re the ones who are like, ‘Oh, cryptocurrency. It’s like, it’s a system I identify with, but this is the new way to do it.’
That’s kind of how it is with Aquarius in the second house as a Capricorn rising. And constant change in jobs and sources is because the Gemini in the sixth house, because you have Uranus as the planet ruler, you’re always looking for change. Each one of those changes is really trying to find yourself and figure out your uniqueness."
The New System Seeker:
Capricorn (Saturn) provides ability to understand systems
+
Aquarius (Uranus) provides drive to find NEWER systems
Early adopter of innovative money-making methods
Examples:
                                    * First in friend group to trade crypto
                                    * Early NFT adopter
                                    * Beta tester for new platforms
                                    * Tries new gig economy apps before mainstream
WHY the Constant Change?
 Not flakiness—it’s a search for authentic uniqueness:
Direct Quote:
“Because you have Uranus as the planet ruler, you’re always looking for change. Each one of those changes is really trying to find yourself and figure out your uniqueness.”
________________


E. The Capricorn Work Trap
Direct Quote:
"If you end up as a Capricorn Rising doing Capricorn type stuff, just standard CEO stuff, standard hard work, labor work, anything like that, you’re going to find as a Capricorn rising, that you’re just not going to be happy. You’re going to constantly want to quit, do another job, find another way to transfer, try this over here, do that, because you’re seeking how you can have value in your uniqueness and what you bring individually to the table.
If it’s a type of job where you were hired for your skills that no one else has, you’re gonna be a lot happier."
Critical Career Guidance:
AVOID (Despite being Capricorn Rising):
                                    * Traditional corporate ladder climbing
                                    * Standard CEO roles
                                    * Labor-intensive work
                                    * Jobs where you’re replaceable
SEEK:
                                    * Roles requiring unique skillset
                                    * Positions where YOU specifically were needed
                                    * Work that highlights individual contribution
                                    * Jobs others can’t easily do
This is paradoxical because Capricorn is associated with traditional career success, BUT Aquarius 2nd house overrides this—must be unique even within structure.
________________


F. Ways to Generate Money
1. Tech and Online
Direct Quote:
“Ways to generate money: tech, tech and online. So cryptocurrency, anything that is technology-based, anything that’s like online, social media, you know, diving deep with that kind of stuff and finding a way to transmute that into something that is what you want.”
Career Examples:
                                    * Cryptocurrency trading/investing
                                    * Blockchain development
                                    * Online businesses (e-commerce, SaaS, apps)
                                    * Social media management/strategy
                                    * Tech startups
                                    * Digital products
                                    * Software development
2. Social Media (With Caveats)
Direct Quote:
"Because Scorpio in the 11th house with social media for a Capricorn rising is not traditionally the thing they want to do. But if they find a way to kind of like see the hidden value in it and find a way to use that, then they will do it as well.
Capricorn rising tends to not do it depends on where the sun is, and all these things. But just blanket statement doesn’t want to show their face on camera anyway. On social media, they tend to do things where they can promote whatever they’re doing in a new, inventive, and creative way where they are not necessarily putting themselves on camera like everybody else."
Social Media Strategy for Capricorn Rising:
NOT:
                                    * Influencer showing their face constantly
                                    * Personal brand centered on personality
                                    * Daily vlogs/lifestyle content
YES:
                                    * Behind-the-scenes business promotion
                                    * Innovative marketing that doesn’t require face
                                    * Anonymous/pseudonymous accounts
                                    * Faceless YouTube channels
                                    * Brand accounts (not personal)
                                    * Creative content that stands apart from typical influencer style
Why? Scorpio in 11th house (social media/networking house):
                                    * Privacy-oriented
                                    * Doesn’t want public exposure
                                    * Prefers mysterious/hidden approach
________________


3. Sources That Fluctuate
Direct Quote:
“Sources that fluctuate. This, again, could be cryptocurrency. It could be anything that has to do with digital currency. It could have to do with anything that’s tech-related. Anything that has a value that’s not constant the entire time. There’s a lot of Capricorn in the stock market as well.”
Income Sources:
                                    * Volatile investments (crypto, stocks, options)
                                    * Freelance/contract work (income varies monthly)
                                    * Project-based consulting
                                    * Commission-based sales
                                    * Anything with non-fixed income
Financial Planning Requirement:
 MUST have substantial emergency fund due to income volatility.
________________


4. Automation and Future-Proofing
Direct Quote:
"Automation and future-proofing. This is all about, again, diving deep into how we can utilize technology within the way that we make money, how we can bring in networking groups, teams. Small businesses, all of that, into here.
Anything, again, future-proofing, anything this technology is going to bring it in that’s going to create security is another way."
Future-Proof Career Strategy:
                                    * Build automated income systems (passive income through tech)
                                    * Develop skills that won’t be easily replaced by AI
                                    * Network with tech-forward groups
                                    * Create small businesses using latest technology
                                    * Position in industries that will grow (not decline)
App Career Guidance:
 “As Capricorn Rising, focus on automation and future-proof skills. Learn: AI, blockchain, no-code tools, digital marketing systems. Build: automated revenue streams, scalable digital products.”
________________

	Job Stability

	________________


X. AQUARIUS RISING: The Creative Dreamer
A. Natal Chart Configuration
Direct Quote:
“Aquarius rising. Second house is Pisces. Pisces is ruled by Neptune. So look for Neptune in the chart for further information.”
Structural Analysis:
                                    * Second House: Pisces (Neptune-ruled, mutable water)
                                    * Sixth House: Cancer (Moon-ruled, cardinal water)
                                    * Tenth House: Scorpio (Pluto-ruled, fixed water)
                                    * ALL money/work houses are WATER signs
Implication: Money comes through intuition, creativity, spirituality, emotion, behind-the-scenes work—the most “non-material” configuration for material resources.
________________


B. Relationship with Money: The Illusion Problem
Direct Quote:
"The relationship, some Aquarius rising people, because they are future-oriented, they’re all about society, humanitarianism, and how they kind of are the future in some ways, and in some ways they are. Because that Pisces in the second house, when it comes to values, possessions, and money, oftentimes they feel like they don’t need money.
You know, it’s the future. It’s unnecessary. I’m unconventional. I don’t go with the norm. And they can see money as a more Capricorn thing. Whereas Uranus, yeah, Uranus, which rules Aquarius, Aquarius is trying to be different, trying to rebel. I don’t need money."
The Future-Oriented Rejection:
Aquarius Rising identity = future, humanitarian, unconventional
+
Pisces 2nd house = transcendence of material
“Money is unnecessary/old paradigm thinking”
The Practical Consequence:
Direct Quote:
"Oftentimes they end up having a hard time keeping money and having a hard time materializing money. Because Pisces is in that second house. I can almost feel like money’s never there and I don’t know how to get it.
It’s like every time it’s like right out of my grasp or every time I think I have it, it’s an illusion. It just disappears. It’s a disappearance in a different way than when Scorpio was in this house, but it can feel like it’s very hard to attain."
Neptune’s Money Illusions:
1. The Vanishing Act:
                                    * Think you have $X in account
                                    * Check balance: significantly less
                                    * Can’t remember where it went
                                    * Genuinely confused about spending
2. The Mirage:
                                    * Opportunity seems real and promising
                                    * Upon closer inspection, it doesn’t materialize
                                    * Income you thought was coming doesn’t arrive
                                    * “Right out of grasp” feeling
3. The Dissociation:
                                    * Lose track of what they have
                                    * Assume more money than actual
                                    * Suddenly realize they’re broke
                                    * “Should have had more money” confusion
Direct Quote:
“If they do have it, it’s almost like they lose track of what they have. And then all of a sudden it feels like they should have had more money, but now they’re out of money.”
________________


C. Spiritual Connection to Material World
Direct Quote:
"And then there’s a spiritual connection to the material world. When they go too far into the Pisces, they end up losing the connection to the material world.
If they have a spiritual connection to the material world, sometimes it can be a little bit too much where they over-idolize money. So it can be not only that they don’t unless they do or they want badly. Sometimes they can see that money is a like an idealistic thing, like perfection. That’s the one thing that everybody needs, right?"
The Spiritual-Material Spectrum:
Extreme 1: Material Rejection
                                    * “Money is ego/illusion/maya”
                                    * Spiritual bypassing of financial responsibility
                                    * Result: Poverty, financial chaos
Extreme 2: Material Over-Idealization
                                    * Money becomes spiritual goal
                                    * “Abundance mindset” taken to extreme
                                    * Money = worthiness, enlightenment, perfection
                                    * Result: Disappointment when money doesn’t solve spiritual emptiness
Healthy Middle Ground:
                                    * Money is a tool in material reality
                                    * Spiritual connection helps intuition guide finances
                                    * Neither rejection nor worship
________________


D. Ways to Generate Money
Direct Quote:
"Now, to be able to use this energy and generate money: creativity. Aquarius Rising is all about using your individuality and making money through creative endeavors, spiritual work, anything that’s behind the scenes and anything that’s medically related. All that Pisces energy.
This includes dance. It includes a lot of people who have this are set up especially with the way that the generational planets have been lately for video games. This literally right here could be video games depending on where Uranus and Neptune are both situated in chart and how they’re aspected. This could be one way that they do it."
Career Categories:
1. Creative Arts
                                    * Dance, music, visual arts
                                    * Film, photography, video production
                                    * Creative writing, poetry
                                    * Fashion design
                                    * Interior design
2. Spiritual/Healing Work
                                    * Astrology, tarot, energy healing
                                    * Meditation instruction
                                    * Yoga teaching
                                    * Reiki, alternative medicine
                                    * Spiritual counseling
3. Behind-the-Scenes
                                    * Production (film, theater, events)
                                    * Ghostwriting
                                    * Research
                                    * Backend tech work
                                    * Anonymous creative work
4. Medical/Healthcare
                                    * Nursing, caregiving
                                    * Holistic medicine
                                    * Therapy, psychology
                                    * Hospital administration
                                    * Healthcare technology
5. Video Games (Generational Emphasis)
                                    * Game design, development
                                    * Gaming content creation
                                    * Esports
                                    * VR/AR development
                                    * Game streaming (if Neptune/Uranus support)
Generational Note: The instructor mentions “especially with the way that the generational planets have been lately”—referring to Neptune in Pisces (2011-2026) and Uranus in Taurus (2018-2026), which support digital creativity and gaming industry growth.
________________


E. Film and Entertainment
Direct Quote:
“A lot of Aquarius rising in film and entertainment as well, especially if they’re kind of like doing their own thing, especially with that seventh house Leo here and then looking at their sun placement for further.”
Why Film/Entertainment?
                                    * 7th house in Leo (creativity, performance, entertainment)
                                    * Need for creative self-expression (Aquarius)
                                    * Behind-the-scenes comfort (Pisces 2nd)
                                    * “Doing their own thing” (not corporate entertainment)
Examples:
                                    * Independent filmmakers
                                    * Indie musicians
                                    * Underground artists
                                    * Alternative entertainment
                                    * Experimental media

F. The Mysterious/Taboo Element
Direct Quote:
“It is water so using intuition, using, um, you know, their gut feelings and doing things differently that are having that mysterious, like, taboo element of it that… not really sure what they’re doing or how they’re doing it, but they’re making it work. Those types of people generate a lot of money doing that.”
The Mystique Advantage:
 People can’t quite figure out:
                                    * What exactly they do
                                    * How they make money
                                    * What their process is
                                    * Why it works
BUT it does work, and the mystery enhances value.
Examples:
                                    * Artist with unique process no one can replicate
                                    * Healer whose methods seem inexplicable but effective
                                    * Creator whose content is indefinable yet popular
                                    * Consultant whose insights seem to come from nowhere
________________


G. The Intuition Imperative
Direct Quote:
"But again, using creativity is huge for them. And also taking a look, obviously, at the sixth and 10th house placements. But Aquarius Rising is all about using your intuition to guide you as well into what is a good investment, what is a bad investment.
If I buy something, is it worth it? Use your intuition. Your intuition will tell you, ‘I shouldn’t buy this.’ I don’t know why, but I feel like I could either get a better deal or there’s something wrong with this or whatever.
Listen to that because that’s all part of your Earth houses are water ruled. So it’s all about intuition and using that for guidance."
Intuition as Financial Guidance System:
Money Houses (2nd, 6th, 10th) = Water Signs:
                                    * 2nd house: Pisces (Neptune intuition)
                                    * 6th house: Cancer (Moon emotional knowing)
                                    * 10th house: Scorpio (Pluto gut instinct)
Application:
                                    * Before purchase: “Does this feel right?”
                                    * Investment decisions: Trust gut over spreadsheet
                                    * Career choices: “Does this align with my knowing?”
                                    * Money opportunities: “Something feels off” = don’t proceed
App Feature:
 “Before financial decisions, your chart indicates checking in with intuition. Pause, feel into the decision, trust your gut—it’s your most accurate financial tool.”
________________
