TRANSCRIPT 8: UBER NEWBIE BASICS WEBINAR
Complete Harvard-Level Extraction
Alchemystic Astrology Introduction Class
________________


I. INTRODUCTION & CONTEXT
A. Welcome & Purpose
Direct Quote:
“Hey everybody, welcome to the Uber Newbie Basics. Basically, it’s a tutorial and a walkthrough of everything you need to know to get into astrology, especially alchemistic astrology, because we view astrology differently than other systems.”
Class Positioning:
 This is explicitly framed as “the class before the class”—a prerequisite introduction designed to prevent newcomers from feeling “completely lost” when jumping into the main curriculum.
________________


B. The Martial Arts School Analogy
Direct Quote:
“When you join a martial arts school, usually, at least in my school, before you get your white belt, before you take that first class, there’s an intro class. It’s kind of like where we, the instructor, take you ahead of time onto the mat. We show you the flags. We show you the mat. We show you the mirrors. We show you your space. We teach you how to bow, to enter, ready position, all of that. And we basically get you clued in so that, as you jump into class, you don’t feel completely lost.”
Purpose of Analogy:
 Establishes this webinar as foundational orientation—not substantive training but essential prep work so students can engage with actual courses effectively.
________________


C. Mystic Circle Context
Direct Quote:
“Now, we are doing this— not kind of, in four days, it’ll be the one-year anniversary of Mystic Circle, which is an exciting time for us. All of our classes, all of our replays, all of our information, it’s all good stuff. But if you’re brand new to astrology and— A lot of people are— We can’t do courses where we’re teaching people or talking to people as if they know all this stuff because they don’t.”
Problem Statement:
 Students joining the established Mystic Circle community mid-stream lack foundational vocabulary and concepts. “It’s very easy to get lost in the sauce and try to learn all this when you don’t have the very, very basic, basic, basics down.”
________________


D. Target Audience
Direct Quote:
“If you already know how to read a glyph, you already know that alchemistic astrology is all about energy, you already know these things, then this isn’t necessarily for you. But if you’re getting in and you’ve either come from a different system of astrology or you’re trying to unlearn to learn or this is brand new to you to begin with, this is going to be great for you.”
Three Audience Segments:
                                                                                                            1. Brand new to astrology (complete beginners)
                                                                                                            2. Coming from different systems (need paradigm shift)
                                                                                                            3. “Unlearning to relearn” (deprogramming from traditional astrology)
Resource Note:
“This PDF is going to be available to you. When this video goes into the replay realm, if you’re already watching it from the replay realm, check below the video for the PDF. You can download it and you can refer to it as many times you want as a resource.”
________________


II. CORE PHILOSOPHY: ENERGY AS FOUNDATION
A. Energy, Not Placements
Direct Quote:
“First thing that you need to know is energy. Everything in alchemistic astrology is energy. We do not look at placements in a chart and say, ‘Oh, this planet is sitting in this house or this planet is sitting in this sign. Therefore, it means XYZ.’ We don’t do that. You should not be doing that because that’s not what you’re actually looking at.”
PDF Slide 2 - Energy Definition:
"In Alchemystic Astrology, you are not reading zodiac signs or planets. You’re not memorizing definitions or analyzing placements.
You’re working with energy—just like light, color, and sound. Everything is frequency. None of it acts alone—it must be read together in the context of the entire chart. Energies are not static, nor are they fixed. They bend and meld. They pulsate and permeate. Energy is the ability to do work.
Unlike other systems, it’s not: ‘what does it mean?’ For us, it’s ‘how does it manifest?’
Why? Because we alchemize."
Critical Distinction:
                                                                                                            * Traditional Astrology: “Mars in 7th house = this definition”
                                                                                                            * Alchemystic Astrology: “Mars energy expresses through this field, in this tone, governed by this ruler—how does THIS manifest?”
________________


B. The Musical Instrument Analogy
Direct Quote:
"It’s kind of like if I… go ‘dong.’ Well, the actual striking of the instrument, the instrument is what creates the reverberation and the frequency, the shape of it, the material of it, so on and so forth. But the lingering ‘dong’ that happens, that is not the planet itself. That is not a thing. That is a frequency. That is a sound. That is an energy that comes out and it permeates until it fades. It has a gradient roll-off, if you will.
That’s the same thing with when you’re talking about planets."
Application:
                                                                                                            * Planet = Instrument being struck
                                                                                                            * Energy/Frequency = The sound that reverberates
                                                                                                            * What affects you = The frequency, not the physical planet
________________


C. Mars Affects Earth, Earth Affects You
Direct Quote:
“Mars does not actually affect you. Mars affects the Earth. And through the Earth, you are extended energies, and then it affects you through the Earth.”
Cascade of Influence:
                                                                                                            1. Mars generates energetic frequency
                                                                                                            2. Frequency reaches Earth
                                                                                                            3. Earth absorbs/transmutes energy
                                                                                                            4. You, as extension of Earth, experience that energy
Where Is Earth in the Chart?
Direct Quote:
“A lot of people will ask me, where’s the earth in a natal chart? I’m going to show you that, but it’s everywhere. It’s everything. The earth is you. You are the earth. You are an extension of the earth, and that’s where your energies come from.”
________________


D. How Does It Manifest? (Not What Does It Mean?)
Direct Quote:
"In alchemistic astrology, you’re not reading those zodiac signs or planets. You’re not memorizing definitions or analyzing placements. Again, you’re not looking at the moon in the ninth house, ‘What does it mean?’ You’re looking at the moon and saying, ‘These are the themes in my life. How are they expressed?’
And because you’re working with energy like light, color, and sound, everything is frequency. None of it acts alone. They all blend and meld. Energy, by definition, is the ability to do work."
Operational Question:
 Not “What does Mars in Scorpio mean?” but “How does action/assertion energy manifest through depth/intensity/transformation?”
________________


III. ALCHEMY + MYSTIC = ALCHEMYSTIC
A. Etymology & Definition
PDF Slide 3:
"The name of the system is Alchemystic Astrology. That’s Alchemy + Mystic.
Alchemy: A seemingly magical process of transformation, creation, or combination. In Alchemystic Astrology, alchemy is the practice of using energetic awareness to shift, harmonize, or redirect energy within your chart or transit experience to manifest favorable outcomes.
You are not a prisoner to your chart; the Universe does not dictate your life. You have Free Will."
Instructor Elaboration:
“Alchemistic is alchemy plus mysticism, as in mystic rebels. That’s why it’s called alchemistic.”
________________


B. Alchemy in Practice
Direct Quote:
"If you’re looking at definitions, you can’t alchemize a definition. You have to be working with energy to understand what alchemy is.
A lot of systems of astrology are fatalistic. They are deterministic. They basically say you have fate, you have destiny, you have karma. You have all of this that says, ‘Boop. This is what’s going to happen. Tough noogies.’
In alchemical astrology, we say this is what’s likely to happen. If you don’t want that to happen, let’s talk about it."
Example of Transmutation:
"‘Oh, I want Mars to act like this. Not different than Mars, but Mars has a whole spectrum of the ways that it can play out.’ You say, ‘I don’t want Mars to be aggression. I want Mars to be something blunt. I want Mars to be assertive. I don’t want Mars to come off too direct. I want Mars to come off in an actionable way.’
You can turn that around. So it’s not about aggression. It’s just about action. You’re still using Mars. You’re just changing how it’s being used."
________________


###C. Free Will is Central
Direct Quote:
“You are not a prisoner to your chart. The universe does not dictate your life. You have free will. Free will is extremely important in this system.”
Philosophical Stance:
 Chart shows energetic potentials and likely manifestations, NOT fixed fate. Conscious awareness allows transmutation from lower to higher vibrational expressions of same energy.
________________


D. Alchemy vs. Manifesting
Direct Quote:
“Alchemy doesn’t mean manifesting. Alchemy is the tool you’re going to use to manifest. Manifesting is this entire thing that includes intention, action, and alignment.”
Clarification:
                                                                                                            * Alchemy = The technique of energy transmutation
                                                                                                            * Manifesting = The complete process (intention + action + alignment)
                                                                                                            * Alchemy is within manifesting but not synonymous
________________


E. Astronomy-Based Accuracy
Direct Quote:
“Alchemistic astrology uses astronomy. It is one of the only systems of astrology that actually cares about the actual astronomy. This is why it’s so accurate.”
Distinguishing Factor:
 Most astrology systems ignore actual astronomical mechanics. Alchemystic astrology grounds interpretations in real celestial mechanics, orbital patterns, and spatial relationships.
________________


IV. THE NATAL CHART STRUCTURE
A. The Snapshot
Direct Quote:
“A natal chart, or any chart, is a snapshot of the sky. Everything—not just the sun, not just the moon, not just the ascendant—everything comprises your chart.”
PDF Slide 4:
“A [natal] chart is a snapshot of the sky the exact time and place you were born. Those energies imprint and become you. At the basic level, you will see this 360º model (the Universe all around you) shown with Planets, Signs, and Houses.”
________________


B. You ARE the Amalgam
Direct Quote:
“Everything about the energetic imprint becomes you. It is you. Not one thing. You’re not your sun sign. You’re not any sign. You are an amalgam of everything that is in your chart.”
Anti-Pattern:
 Rejecting “I’m a Scorpio” reductionism. The entire chart = you.
________________


V. THE TEN PLANETS + EARTH
A. Grand Design Order
PDF Slide 5:
"There are ten of them. One is technically a star (the Sun). One is a satellite (the Moon). For our purposes, we refer to them all as planets.
There is a specific order that you should memorize—this is the Grand Design of the solar system. We use this in our understanding when determining how energy works on an astronomical level."
The Order:
 Sun → Mercury → Venus → (Earth) → Moon → Mars → Jupiter → Saturn → Uranus → Neptune → Pluto
Instructor Note:
“The order of planets matters, and you’re going to see that when I get to the next parts in the next sections.”
________________


B. Astronomical Doctrine of Signatures
Direct Quote:
“The reason why this matters, astronomically speaking, is Mercury comes first from the Sun. That tells you, through what’s called the Astronomical Doctrine of Signatures, its traits, its velocity, its speed, its proximity, its size, its atmosphere, all of that stuff goes into its interpretation of its energetic frequency. Why it is the way it is and why it can’t be something else.”
Principle:
 A planet’s physical characteristics (size, distance from sun, orbital speed, composition, atmosphere, rings, moons, etc.) directly inform its energetic signature.
Examples:
                                                                                                            * Mercury: Closest to Sun, fastest orbit → mental quickness, communication
                                                                                                            * Saturn: Rings, slow orbit → structure, boundaries, time
                                                                                                            * Pluto: Binary system with Charon → intimacy, bonds, shared resources
Direct Quote:
“Pluto is a binary system. It is one planet, but it’s technically two. It, with its moon, creates a binary system, which is why it has to do with intimacy and bonds.”
________________


C. Planetary Glyphs - Must Memorize
Direct Quote:
"Each planet’s going to have a symbol, an icon, or a glyph. Doesn’t matter which word you use, it’s the same thing. It’s that thing on the natal chart that you’re going to be like, ‘What is that?’ ‘What is that?’ And at first, it’s all going to look Greek to you. And if you do speak Greek, it’s going to look Japanese to you.
You need to remember these. There’s not a lot that you have to remember. You have to understand the core. You have to understand the basics. And the glyphs are something you have to memorize so that you can identify them."
________________


D. The Five-Tier Planetary Classification System
This is the unique framework of Alchemystic Astrology that differs from all other systems.
________________


TIER 1: ULTRAPERSONAL PLANETS (Sun & Moon)
Direct Quote:
“These are the first two planets you need to know about, and I’m grouping them intentionally because these are called ultra-personal planets. These are the ones that are going to be the most personal to you and the closest to heart.”
The “Big Three” Clarification:
“Now, when you hear about the Ascendant, the Sun, and the Moon, and they call it your big three, the big three concept is terrible. However, the Ascendant, the Sun, and the Moon are the most important. You do have to know these. You have to know why.”
Why They’re Most Important:
“They are not everything. They don’t take over everything else, but they’re going to be the things that you make the most decisions in life based off of. They have to do with your sense of happiness and purpose and your sense of emotional security, safety, and needs.”
Energy Multiplier Principle:
“Your greatest achievements are all going to come from understanding your sun placement and the other energies. Now, we aren’t going to get into related energies, but just know that the sun shows up—the sun glyph shows up once in your chart, but the sun’s energy shows up four times in your chart. Your Leo house, your fifth house, your sun in terms of the house it’s in, and then the sun in terms of the sign that it’s in. Those are four times that it’s going to show up. Same thing with the moon. Same thing with Venus, which is actually a little bit more. Same thing with Mars.”
Glyph Origins (PDF Slide 6):
☉ SUN:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Greek and Egyptian solar symbolism
                                                                                                            * “The circle with a dot represents the solar disk (Ra or Helios) and the central point of divine consciousness. Used in ancient Egyptian cosmology as the Sun God’s eye.”
☽ MOON:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Lunar phases
                                                                                                            * “The crescent shape directly mimics the visible crescent Moon. Appears in Babylonian and Greek calendars to mark lunar time.”
________________


TIER 2: PERSONAL PLANETS - INTRA/INTERPERSONAL (Mercury & Venus)
The Ecliptic Principle:
Direct Quote:
"Mercury and Venus have a very special place in the chart because of their position in the solar system. When we looked up here, we saw the sun and we have the earth. Between the sun and the earth is something called the ecliptic.
The ecliptic is an imaginary tether that says, ‘Here’s the sun and the thing that gives us life, the thing that we orbit around. Here’s the earth, the planet of existence and reality that we sit on. And these two are anchored.’ Everything in astrology is based on the ecliptic. It’s extremely important to learn that word."
Inferior vs. Superior Positions:
Direct Quote:
"The only two planets that sit between it are Mercury and Venus. This is why they’re inter-and intrapersonal. However, Mercury can also be on the other side of the Sun. Venus can be on the other side of the Sun because they orbit the Sun as well. You can have Earth over here and Mercury or Venus over here, and that creates a difference.
So when we get to them, we see two positions. We see inferior positions, which is when they are between the Earth and the Sun. And then we see superior, which is when it’s on the other side. You look at it as the Sun is between those planets and Earth."
Inferior = Intrapersonal (Inward):
                                                                                                            * Mercury Inferior: Gemini (mind within self)
                                                                                                            * Venus Inferior: Taurus (self-value)
Superior = Interpersonal (Outward):
                                                                                                            * Mercury Superior: Virgo (mind in relation to world/others)
                                                                                                            * Venus Superior: Libra (value in relationships/with others)
Direct Quote:
"Mercury rules Gemini. It also rules Virgo. You have Venus that rules Taurus and also rules Libra. So Taurus is the inward version, it’s the inferior position. Libra is the external, it is the superior position. With Mercury, Gemini is the interior or the inferior position inward. And then Virgo is the outward, is how you relate to other people in the world.
It still has to do with the same keywords. Mercury means the mind. It means mental faculty, basically. And it means mental faculty when it’s Gemini, and it means it when it’s Virgo. Venus rules value. When it is Taurus, it is self-value. When it is Venus [Libra], it is outward value or value in relation to others.
So both of those retain certain themes and keywords, but it’s whether or not that’s inward or outward."
PDF Slide 7 - Glyphs:
☿ MERCURY:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Hermes’ caduceus
                                                                                                            * “Combines: circle (spirit), cross (matter/body), pair of horns or wings (Hermes’ winged helmet or caduceus). Rooted in Hermetic and alchemical texts, Mercury being the messenger and symbol of duality and motion.”
♀ VENUS:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Hand mirror of Aphrodite
                                                                                                            * “Depicts a mirror—associated with beauty and reflection. Ancient Roman representation of Venus/Aphrodite’s femininity and form.”
________________


TIER 3: EXTRAPERSONAL PLANET - THE CONNECTOR (Mars)
Revolutionary Classification:
Direct Quote:
"Now, this is a tricky one because Mars is considered a personal planet in literally every system of astrology except alchemistic. And that is because, again, I use the astronomy and I have documented how these planets actually play a role.
Mars is not a personal planet; it does not ever sit between the Earth and the Sun at any point in its orbit. It will never be personal. So it is actually a connector and an extra personal planet. It is what connects the Earth, you, reality to the outside world."
Mars = Physical Body:
Direct Quote:
“Mars rules the physical body. Is that your soul? Is that you? No. It’s that outer layer that enables you to do things in the world. Without your body, you would just be a floating set of energy that couldn’t connect. The body gives you that ability. It is the action. It is the go.”
Why Not Personal:
 Never sits between Earth-Sun axis → Cannot be “personal”
Always outside Earth’s orbit → Connector to external world
PDF Slide 8 - Glyph:
♂ MARS:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Spear and shield of Ares
                                                                                                            * “Circle = shield, Arrow = spear. Roman and Greek depictions of Mars/Ares as the god of war used this to show masculine strength and outward action.”
War Clarification:
“It doesn’t really represent war. War is a complicated word. Scorpio is very much needed for war. You need that conflict. You need that brewing. That leads in, but there is a quincunx—you’ll learn about these later—from Scorpio to Aries. Aries is the action of war. It is all this stuff that festered is now coming out in competition, aggression, and assertion.”
________________


TIER 4: TRANSPERSONAL PLANETS (Jupiter & Saturn)
Direct Quote:
“Next, we have our transpersonal planets. This is where society, the world, the general public, this is the next stage in energetic frequency happens with Jupiter, which was based on Zeus, and then Saturn, which is based on Kronos.”
PDF Slide 9 - Glyphs:
♃ JUPITER:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Zeta or abbreviation of Zeus
                                                                                                            * “Possibly a stylized ‘Z’ for Zeus or Greek letter zeta (ζ). Sometimes interpreted as an eagle’s beak or lightning bolt, Zeus’ weapon.”
♄ SATURN:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Sickle of Kronos
                                                                                                            * “Cross over a curved shape represents the sickle or scythe used by Saturn/Kronos to harvest or cut time. Seen in Roman mythology and agrarian symbolism.”
Function:
 Beyond personal action (Mars), these planets govern interface with society, public world, collective structures.
________________


TIER 5: METAPERSONAL PLANETS (Uranus, Neptune, Pluto)
Rejecting “Generational” Label:
Direct Quote:
“When you get beyond the public, then you’re hitting the meta-personal planets. Meta-personal planets is not generational. I’ve always, from day one, I’ve always hated the term generational planets. They say Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto are generational. I understand why they say it. It’s because it literally can cross generations. But when you hear ‘generational,’ you think, ‘Pluto for me was here. Pluto for my kids is here.’ And you think that the generations are marked by these planets. They are not.”
What Actually Creates Ages/Epochs:
“There’s something separate called astrological epochs. And that is the sidereally based incremental time splices, so to speak. When there’s an era, when there’s an age, when there are phases, when there’s certain time frames where something happens, that is not based on Uranus, it is not based on Neptune, it is not based on Pluto. It’s actually based on the planet itself in its own cycles. Because the axial tilt, the axis itself, where we rotate upon, wobbles. And that creates your astrological ages and such.”
Metapersonal Definition:
“So these are meta-personal planets. What they are is they set the stage beyond. So it’s not about the world. It’s what’s beyond the world. So, for instance, Uranus is not about time. It’s what’s beyond time. Neptune is not about reality. It’s what’s beyond reality. Pluto is not about value. It’s what’s beyond value or immersing yourself into depths of value. It’s anything that is not in the static, in the now. These are your metapersonal planets.”
Every Planet is Personal:
Direct Quote:
"You have your ultrapersonal. You have your personal, which includes intra and interpersonal. You have your extra-personal planet, you have your transpersonal planets, and you have your meta-personal planets. So they’re all personal. Do you see that? All personal. They all connect to you.
So when we call them generational planets, the other problem is that you are not connecting it to yourself. You assume that Pluto is only other people, when in reality it’s connecting you to others, connecting you to others’ resources, connecting you to trauma. You are still a part of it. Every planet is personal."
PDF Slide 10 - Glyphs:
♅ URANUS:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Modern invention (18th century)
                                                                                                            * “Not ancient—created by astronomer Johann Bode. Combines: H for Herschel (discoverer), Circle to represent spirit. Alternate version (⛢): antennas flanking solar circle for receptivity.”
♆ NEPTUNE:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Trident of Poseidon
                                                                                                            * “Based directly on Poseidon’s trident (Greek) or Neptune (Roman). Chosen upon discovery in 1846 to reflect its association with the sea.”
♇ PLUTO:
                                                                                                            * Origin: Alchemical transformation symbolism
                                                                                                            * “Circle = spirit, Crescent = soul, Cross = matter. Meaning: Spirit (divine will) rising above the subconscious (crescent), which in turn sits above the physical/material world (cross). Alternate version (♇): Combines P & L, as Percival Lowell’s initials (who theorized its existence), or an abbreviation for Pluto itself.”
________________


VI. THE TWELVE ZODIAC SIGNS
A. Grand Design, Not Archetypes
Direct Quote:
“Zodiac signs. This is where everybody gets hung up. Everybody thinks that all astrology is zodiac signs. They’re very important. They are the foundational base of astrology. The 12, they call them archetypes, but they are not. They’re just 12 ordered energies of grand design.”
The Eternal Order:
"**The zodiac signs are based off of these 10 planets. Mercury and Venus rule two because they can be inward and they can be outward, and they position themselves in a 360-degree wheel around us… **
This order will always be the order: Aries, Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, Pisces, and back.**
Unless you’re talking about astrological ages, which go backwards, you’ll read that in my book."
________________


B. Modality - Secondary Descriptor, Not Primary
Direct Quote:
"When we get to zodiac signs, instead of putting them in order, you see them in order in your chart, I’ve grouped them by modality. Modality is not the primary influence. Some people say all fixed signs, all cardinal signs, all mutable signs. Yes, those are the three—cardinal, fixed, mutable. And in a future class, I’m going to break down what cardinal means, fixed means, mutable means.
It does not mean that they’re connected and they’re together. It doesn’t mean that you’re supposed to look at a mutable sign as something that can’t be stagnant. Mutable signs can be stagnant. Even though mutable means change, you can get stuck. A fixed sign is not always about what stays. It’s about what is sustainable. A cardinal sign is not always about what begins, although we represent the initiators. It is about what we’re setting in motion."
Key Insight:
 Modality is functional descriptor, not identity. Don’t group signs by modality and assume they operate the same way.
________________


C. Cardinal Signs - The Initiators (Aries, Cancer, Libra, Capricorn)
Astronomical Basis:
Direct Quote:
"These represent the solstices and the equinoxes. Aries is the sign that when the sun… Because of the axial tilt of the Earth, and the Earth goes like this around the Sun, the Sun, in an illusion, goes up and down in the sky.
At zero degrees, when it’s completely even, at the median point, or the middle ground, going north is Aries. When it hits the top, it’s Cancer. When it comes back and hits the middle, it’s Libra. When it hits the bottom, it’s Capricorn. When it comes back, it’s Aries again. Those are how we mark the changes."
What You’re Crossing:
“You’re crossing barriers. You’re crossing markers. You’re crossing the zero degree. You’re crossing the height, which is 23.44 degrees. Middle again, bottom 23.44 degrees.”
________________


♈ ARIES (PDF Slide 11)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: Ram’s horns (ancient symbol of spring and initiation). Represents boldness, ignition, instinct. Stylized ram horns show direct, forward energy.”
Instructor Commentary:
“Now, Aries looks like this because it’s the ram. It’s stylized ram horns. It’s talking about forward, concentrated, directed energy. That is why it’s not the face of a ram. It is a V shape. It points at the bottom because it emulates Aries energy with the arrow.”
________________


♋ CANCER (PDF Slide 11)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: Crab claws or lunar breast curves. Symbol of protection, motherhood, and cyclical emotion. The curved shapes mimic holding, nurturing, or tides.”
Instructor Commentary:
“When you get to Cancer, a lot of people don’t realize that these are boobies. Everyone thinks that they’re just crab claws. They’re actually boobies because Cancer has to do with nurturing and motherhood. It can be the claws as well. It kind of envelops both. But like Sharon said in all caps, boobies.”
Duality Note:
“I want to point out every one of these zodiac glyphs that has two lines or two sections that are separated, every one of them has a duality. I always hear people say duality is Gemini. And yes, Gemini has to do with a literally two-duality. It is not the only one.”
Cancer & Libra Both Have Separated Duality:
“In this PDF slide alone, Cancer and Libra both have a separated and nuanced duality to them. This is something that we’ll discuss further in Mystic Circle in future classes, but realize that Gemini is not the only one that has a dual nature to it.”
________________


♎ LIBRA (PDF Slide 11)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: Balance scales or equinox horizon. Represents fairness, judgment, and harmony. Straight line + curve = measured balance, symmetry.”
Instructor Commentary:
"Libra. A lot of people say it’s the scales, and yes, it is the scales. However, what it really is is the horizon line. Libra is sunset.
In alchemistic astrology, when you read my book, this is all going to make sense. But there is sunrise and there is sunset. Sunrise sits here with Aries. Sunset sits with Libra. Sunset is arguably more important than sunrise in astrology because what it does is it’s a point that says, ‘This is what’s public, this is what’s personal, this is the transition of where things public come back to me.’"
The Descendant Function:
"It transitions back into my personal life. Your descendant is a point that we’ll talk about in a minute, sits in that seventh house, sits in that Libra energy. And it is a point that you have to realize that the people that you connect with and the people that you attract are going to come in and fuck up your sense of emotional security in your foundations because you are bringing that in.
This is why it’s very important to protect yourself because that sun-setted energy is no longer public, it’s private. So whatever you’re connecting to on that level is coming back inward."
________________


♑ CAPRICORN (PDF Slide 11)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: Sea-goat (Babylonian god Enki’s hybrid creature). Mastery through endurance, climb from depth to height. Goat horn + fish tail = spiritual/earthly integration.”
Water-Earth Paradox:
Direct Quote:
"Then we have Capricorn, which is the sea goat. It is a Babylonian god, a hybrid creature… What’s interesting is Capricorn and sea, Capricorn and water. It is an earth element. I didn’t put the elements on here intentionally, but we have fire, water, air, earth. You have to know that, yes, Capricorn is an earth energy. But it is a water-based earth energy.
Why? It sextiles back to Scorpio. It sextiles forward back to Pisces. It represents ice. Like the planet that rules it is Saturn. What is Saturn made of? What are the rings made of? Water, ice."
Element Caution:
“So understanding that… You can’t look at modality, which is cardinal in this case, and say, ‘Oh, it’s only about starting.’ You can’t look at element and say it’s only Earth stuff. Earth is a very loose term. It doesn’t actually mean rock, although Capricorn does rule rock. It has to do with structure, which we contribute or attribute to earthly things. Even though it’s earth, it rules water when it’s hardened, right? So this is why we have to be very careful how we learn this and why a lot of people unlearn to relearn here.”
Cardinal Energy Clarification:
“Fixed energies. These are the sustainers. Something that’s already started, brought anew, initiated. This is where we sustain it. Sustenance and sustaining is another thing. Sustaining something literally is a Capricorn trait, but it’s a cardinal energy. The reason why it’s a cardinal energy is because we are changing directions. We are not preparing ourselves for the change that’s mutable. We are changing directions. It is a pivot point. That’s one thing that’s not talked about in Cardinal. The reason it’s a start is because it’s a pivot.”
Capricorn & Past:
“Saturn and Capricorn represent the past because of where it sits. It’s at the bottom of the sun’s declination. That’s also why it’s sustaining. You’re taking something that already is and pulling it until you end up hitting Aquarius energy, which is next, which is saying, ‘This is what we have. How do we move this forward?’”
________________

♏ SCORPIO (PDF Slide 12)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: ‘M’ for maiden with outward stinger. Depth, protection, transformation. Tail points outward = readiness to strike or protect (scorpion).”
Instructor Commentary:
"Scorpio, this one’s an interesting one because when you get to Virgo later, the M is for maiden. That is why it’s an M. Now, Scorpio represents a couple of things. One, yes, it’s still based off of the maiden. It sextiles back to Virgo, which means there’s an inclusion.
But that M is also the back of a scorpion, and it has the Scorpio’s tail, the stinger. And it has to do with protection and transformation. Protection is coming from the trine from Cancer. The tail points outward. It’s a readiness to strike, which is why it feeds directly into Aries. It’s a readiness to strike. It does not strike. Scorpio doesn’t strike. Aries strikes."
________________

________________


♊ GEMINI (PDF Slide 13)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: Roman numeral II (the twins Castor & Pollux). Duality, mirroring, mental agility. Represents interaction between two poles of thought.”
Instructor Commentary:
"Like I said before, Gemini is the Roman numeral two. It represents the twins Castor and Pollux, which are stars that are in that zodiac constellation. But it is not disconnected. They work together.
So your duality in Gemini is not two different things. It’s two things you can do that connect together. It’s why it’s options. Gemini rules options because you’re not saying, ‘I could do this’ or ‘I could do that’ and they’re completely unrelated. It’s like I’m going to the restaurant. I can go get Chinese. I can go get Mediterranean. I’m still looking for food. These are just options within the same paradigm. Gemini is a connected duality.
And this is, again, why it’s so misinterpreted in other systems as they just say, ‘Oh, it’s two different things.’ Eh, not usually. It is not usually two different things. It’s two options within the same thing. So of the duality, it’s the least dual."
________________


♍ VIRGO (PDF Slide 13)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: ‘M’ for maiden with inward tail (modesty or crossed legs). Service, refinement, systems of purity. Tail curling inward = the harvest, discernment, and purity.”
Instructor Commentary:
“Virgo, there’s the M, and its tail comes back in, does not have a stinger, comes back in, wraps in. The legs are closed. She’s a prude. This is the maiden. Modesty also signifies the harvest, so holding the wheat.”
________________


♐ SAGITTARIUS (PDF Slide 13)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: Arrow of the centaur (archer aiming skyward). Vision, truth-seeking, momentum. Diagonal arrow = pursuit of something higher.”
Instructor Commentary:
“When we get into Sagittarius, this one’s pretty obvious. It’s the arrow of the centaur. It is aiming up. We’re looking for a heightened visibility. We’re looking to go outward. We’re rising. It’s about vision, truth-seeking, looking for something bigger, better, higher. It is not better. We haven’t achieved it. We’re looking for it. That’s why it’s search. It’s seek. We’re aiming.”
________________


♓ PISCES (PDF Slide 13)
Glyph Origin:
 “Origin: Two fish swimming in opposite directions, tied by a cord. Surrender, dualism, transcendence. Curves with a bridge = linked inner and outer realms.”
Instructor Commentary:
“Pisces, this one is two fish swimming in two different oppositions, and they are tethered by a cord. So this one is another duality that is trying to pull against itself but is stuck. This is about surrendering. This is about you can’t fight your other half. You can’t fight your duality. They are stuck together. You’re going to have to learn how to integrate them. Curves with a bridge, inner and outer realms, transcendence, dualism, all of that is together. That is what Pisces represents.”

F. Summary Instruction

VII. THE DUAL WHEEL NATAL CHART
A. Scientific Basis Requirement
Direct Quote:
“The natal chart. You saw the chart before. This is the dual wheel natal chart. This is the only system of astrology that teaches it like this. Alchemystic astrology recognizes that there are mechanics that create how things work and how things manifest in this world. It has to be scientifically based or it is garbage.”
Rejection of Placidus:
“When you look at a natal chart and people just look at the houses and they say, ‘Oh, Placidus, we’re going to cut the lines like this.’ And say that, you know, the planet or the sun itself goes a certain distance over a certain amount of time. And we’re going to mark that as a house cusp. No, that doesn’t mean anything. There’s no reason to do that because the mechanics are…”
________________


B. Inner Wheel vs. Outer Wheel
PDF Slide 14:
INNER WHEEL:
 “The center of a Natal Chart comprises the core of your zodiac energies as imbued to you through Earth. We call the 12 inner sections within this wheel the Houses. Natural Rulership will replace the numbers 1 through 12 to give you True Placements. These 12 sections become the lens in which energy travels and dictates Planetary Rulership.”
OUTER WHEEL:
 “The outer ring / outer wheel of a Natal Chart comprises the zodiac energies extended beyond Earth, relationally and spatially. This is the membrane in which all energy transfers.”
________________


C. Astronomical Mechanics
Direct Quote:
“What do you have? You have the Earth that spins on its axis. One rotation, or one revolution. One rotation. Sorry, I had the right word the first time. One rotation is called a sidereal rotation. It is going from here, spinning 360 degrees, and getting back to the same point. One circular orbit of the Earth going around the Sun, that is a revolution. That’s the sidereal revolution.”
Zodiac Sign Creation:
"Now, the position of the sun, the ecliptic we talked about before, wherever that sun is, designates the zodiac signs because of its declination. So when we look over there, based on how high or low the sun goes, based on our axial tilt, the Earth doesn’t sit like this—it sits tilted. It’s also called obliquity, for those of you who like technical terms.
When the sun looks like this, we are at the peak, we’re in Cancer. When it’s all the way at the bottom, we’re at the lowest point, we are in Capricorn. And then there’s a variance in between. That creates the zodiac signs."
NOT Constellations:
“They are not based on constellations. We don’t care where the constellations are. Those are only relevant as marker points in a sidereal structure. This becomes a tropical structure because we’re talking about the seasons, essentially, and the mechanism that creates those seasons.”
________________


D. How Houses Form
Direct Quote:
"So as the Earth spins, its ascendant point, its horizon marker, so wherever the horizon is and where that meets the ecliptic, that point is going to keep moving as I rotate. And that is the Earth spinning, and that is how we get the houses and the ascendant point itself.
The universe doesn’t spin. The universe is static."
________________


E. Earth IS the Center
PDF Slide 15:
THE CENTER:
 “At the very center of the entire thing is Earth. All energies are based on this locational X. Your cosmic blueprint is hyper-dependent on the exact location of your birth. This is a marker in time-space. Not just when, but where. All coordinates based on this point become YOU.”
Direct Quote:
“The center of the natal chart comprises your core of your energy. And this is why, when we get to true placements, if you’ve ever caught me on TikTok and I’ve done true placements for people, and I say, ‘People will be like, oh, I’m a Sagittarius,’ and, you know, they go, ‘They’re a Sagittarius rising.’ I say, ‘No, you’re not a Sagittarius. You’re an Aries.’”
True Placements Explanation:
"The reason why I say that, and if you go into the replay realm, you’ll see a webinar for true placements. The reason why that matters so much is because you are based on the Earth’s energies. You and everything that exists upon you is an extension of the Earth, and the Earth spinning is the inner wheel.
So therefore, no—you are not a Sagittarius. If you have a Sagittarius ascendant, you are in Aries because the ascendant sits in your first house. The first house is naturally ruled by Aries. Therefore, you, in terms of the position of that placement—your sun—technically you’re not in Aries because you’re not a sign, but your sun placement is in Aries. And then secondly, expresses through Sagittarius energy.
So the way you express yourself is going to be direct. That direction is going to go through something expansive. You do not express yourself expansively without the direct part of it."
________________


F. Houses = Fields (More Important Than Signs)
Direct Quote:
"So the inner wheel is the core of your energies. Those houses that we call fields in alchemistic astrology are arguably more important, at least initially pertinent, over the zodiac signs themselves.
Other systems of astrology prioritize the zodiac signs, and that is incorrect. That’s why nobody can read a chart. And they certainly can’t align with it because their information is wrong."
________________


G. Natural Rulership = True Placements
Direct Quote:
“We call the 12 intersections of this wheel the houses. Natural rulership will replace the numbers 1 through 12 to give you true placements. 1 is Aries, 2 is Taurus, 3 is Gemini, 4 is Cancer. If I am looking at my eighth house, the eighth house is the eighth zodiac. The eighth zodiac is Scorpio. So therefore, if I have any planets in the eighth house, they are Scorpio planets. They are Scorpio placements.”
Example:
 8th House = 8th Zodiac = Scorpio
Any planet in 8th house = Scorpio planet (by natural rulership)
________________


H. The Outer Membrane - Tone
Direct Quote:
“The outer ring is the universe outside. It becomes the stained glass window that we peer through. That comprises the zodiac energies that extend beyond Earth, relationally and spatially. Not the Earth itself, but everything outside the Earth. These sections become the lens. We call these the tone. This is what dictates planetary rulership.”
Rulership Determination:
"So if you have those eighth house placements, because we’re talking about the house, you do not look at the ruler of the house. You’re not looking for Pluto in a chart to know what your eighth house placements are. If your eighth house is in Scorpio because you’re a Capricorn rising, then the ruler is still going to be the sun.
Because you have to get to that outer membrane. Like I said here, this is the membrane in which all energy transfers."
________________


I. Transit Interaction Through Membrane
Direct Quote:
"When transits sit out here, they go through the membrane to get to you. So when you have, for that same example, when you have Venus in, well, right now we have a Mercury retrograde in Leo. It is permeating Leo themes to get to your Scorpio themes. It is not in your Scorpio themes. It is permeating through Leo. It is going through.
You have to think of this as a two-way window. It has to get through Leo to get to that. So it has to get through confidence. It has to get through presence. It has to get through ego, personality, character to be able to get to your debt, to be able to get to your shared resources, to get to your trauma. It is the barrier between you and the outside world and the universe and also the outside world and you, also within synastry."
________________


J. House Overlay Requires Sign Context
Direct Quote:
"You can’t just look at house overlays. You hear that all the time. ‘Oh, their second house overlays my first house, so their value overlays my sense of self.’ Yeah, through what? What’s the zodiac sign? Yes, the house overlay is important, but through what is it doing that? Everyone ignores that.
It only applies to that theme. So if the house overlay is Gemini, then this only happens through communication, siblings, how you think, ideas, local environment, so on and so forth. It doesn’t happen with everything else. It only happens within that energy."
________________


K. Where’s Earth? Everywhere.
Direct Quote:
"The center, the earth, that’s the earth. So people say, ‘Where’s the earth in a chart?’ Everywhere. The whole damn chart is the earth. You as an extension, every point is sensitive. So if my body was the earth, and I tap my hand, that’s different than if I tap my elbow.
That’s the same thing with where you live. You live in California, that’s different than if you lived in Slovenia. It’s going to have a different effect, different energies. Anytime you move, the relocated chart shifts. So this is your static natal chart. You have your relocated chart. You’re gonna see that it’s gonna do this. It’s gonna shift. This stays the same [inner wheel]. This changes the pinpoint of how you interact with that area of the planet because you are pre-mapped to the entire globe."
________________


L. Transits = Universe’s Synastry With You
PDF Slide 15:
TRANSITS:
 “These are the planets in the Universe that are not a part of your personal chart. Each one will pass through an energy shown in the Outer Wheel. This becomes your interaction with everything outside of your own Ecosystem, including Synastry with events, entities, & other people.”
Direct Quote:
"Now here, you’ll see that a bunch of different planets will be here. These are called transits. They are the universe’s synastry with us. And the synastry is kind of a one-way street. The universe is huge. It is massive. It is like you and a corporation. You can’t fight a corporation because the corporation is just too damn big.
Or you can fight another person because you’re on more of an equal playing field. You are not only an equal playing field of the universe, you’re minuscule, universe huge. So you can’t fight these things, and you have to understand you have to work with them."
________________


M. Ecosystems Impress Upon Each Other
Direct Quote:
"Anything that’s a separate ecosystem, meaning everything that’s my energy is one ecosystem. The universe and its energy is an ecosystem. You and your energy is a different ecosystem. My business is its own ecosystem. That means it has its own natal chart, its own way that its energies interact within itself.
And when we get into synastry, which is the comparison of those energies and how that affects me and how I affect it, I have my ecosystem. It has its ecosystem. Never is it working with me. It is always working upon me. Can I work with it? Yes. But it is not natural for it to do so. It’s always impressing its energies on me and me on it.
If you and I sit in a room and we’re interacting, you are not talking with me. You’re talking upon me even if you’re having a conversation with me. How you speak is impressing my energy. And I don’t mean impressing like, ‘Yay, wee, that’s so great.’ I mean impressing in terms of pressuring me.
How you speak is going to trigger my energies to have a certain type of reaction. Is it a square? Do I feel like it’s in conflict? Is it a trine? Do I feel like it’s a natural flow, whether I like it or not? Like every single time you’re around me, I get annoyed. Not because you’re doing anything, just something about you. That’s a trine. Trines are not always good."
________________


VIII. THE PHSR METHOD - INTERPRETATION FRAMEWORK
A. The Only Proper Order
PDF Slide 16:
PHSR:
                                                                                                            1. PLANET - Address the FOCUS—this is the “what” (are we talking about).
                                                                                                            2. HOUSE - Where is the planet? What area of life or FIELD are we talking about? This will be a zodiacal energy.
                                                                                                            3. SIGN - We extend what we know into how that energy will express itself. This is the TONE.
                                                                                                            4. RULER - We are back at the Planet, but are addressing the one that governs the zodiac sign we are expressing through.
Direct Quote:
"P-H-S-R. Very important. And this is exactly what it means. You have your inner wheel and you have your outer wheel. Planet, house, sign, ruler. P-H-S-R. You must, must, must read in this order. Alchemystic astrology is the only system of astrology that has a very specific order of how you read energy.
Again, you’re not reading planets, you’re reading energies. And you need all of this."
________________


B. Why You Can’t Use Definitions
Direct Quote:
“This is why you can’t say, ‘Oh, Mars is in my seventh house. That means this.’ No, it doesn’t. You have the planet and you have the house. You didn’t talk about the sign. You didn’t talk about the ruler. And when you expand P-H-S-R, you’re going to insert decans, degrees, aspects, and things of that nature. You don’t have any of that context. You can’t say Mars in the seventh house means anything.”
________________


C. The Interior Designer vs. Abuser Example
Direct Quote:
"You can have one person where Mars in the seventh house makes them an amazing designer and they do interior design for work. You have another person that beats their wife. And that’s very extreme. And I’m sorry if I trigger somebody by saying it that way, but they’re very aggressive towards their partner.
That doesn’t always play out that way, but somebody might say it does. ‘Oh, Mars and Libra, Mars and the seventh house, you’re aggressive towards your partner.’ No. No, it doesn’t mean that. Your energy is directed into partnership, for sure. It doesn’t mean that you’re angry or you’re abusive. Drawing that conclusion is very dangerous, and 99.999%, let’s just say almost everyone, does that. That’s why astrology has been so wrong for so long. You can’t do that."
________________


D. Rising Sign Changes Everything
Example 1: Scorpio Rising
“All we know is Aries energy directs into that. Now, if you have Mars directed into the seventh house, which is Libra energy, and that is going through, let’s say, Taurus. That means you’re Scorpio rising and Aries energy is coming from the sixth house. So that means you’re pulling sense of service, duty, and criticism into your partners.”
Example 2: Sagittarius Rising
“But if you are a Sagittarius rising with Mars in the seventh house, then you are pulling fifth house energy. You’re pulling sense of purpose, happiness, you’re pulling childhood, children in general, which means your children contribute greatly to your partner. That has nothing to do with Mars in the seventh in terms of you’re abusive to your partner.”
Conclusion:
“All we did was change one thing, which was the rising sign, and we have a completely different context of what Mars in the seventh house means. Again, why you cannot have definitions. You’re reading energies.”
________________


E. The Rulership Chain
Direct Quote:
"So this is the order that you have to read. What is the focus? What is the field? What is the tone? And what is it all wrapped up in? And then where is that ruler?
When you go chase that ruler, what house is it in? So the ruler becomes the planet again. So you’re back here. What house is it in? What sign’s it in? Where’s that ruler? That’s the planet again. What house is it? What sign? Just keep this going.
Now, you don’t keep it going without understanding each step of the way. So you just start with the first one. Where’s the planet? Where’s the house? Where’s the sign? Where’s the ruler? This is the order you do for every reading, everything you do."
Recursive Nature:
 Following the ruler creates a chain:
Planet 1 → House → Sign → Ruler (becomes Planet 2) → House → Sign → Ruler (becomes Planet 3) → etc.
Continue until you’ve traced the full energetic pathway.
________________


IX. ASPECTS - ENERGETIC INTERACTIONS
A. Definition
PDF Slide 17:
 “Each energy will make a geometric angle to another energy—no energy is standalone (this is why definitions for placements do not apply). Each relationship is different, creating interactions.”
Direct Quote:
"Aspects. These are the words that you’re going to hear the most, especially in alchemistic astrology. Outside of alchemistic, you will never hear PHSR because it doesn’t exist. It’s a technique exclusive to what we do. Aspects you hear all the time.
This, all it is, is an energy that makes a geometric angle to another. That is all—an aspect is. No energy ever stands alone, which is why definitions of placements don’t apply. Each relationship is different, creating what we call interactions. That is what an aspect is.
How does this planet relate to this planet? How do they interact? How do they feed into each other? Do they repel? Do they hate each other? And I would actually refrain from making them personalized, like adding human characteristics to them. Is there a companion energy? Do they work together? Are they sitting in opposition? So on and so forth—that’s what you need to know about the aspects."
________________


B. Seven Major Aspects (Not Five)
Direct Quote:
"The aspect glyphs in alchemistic astrology, there are seven major aspects. In every other system of astrology, there are five. The reason why there are seven is because aspects have to be broken down mathematically and scientifically.
When you take the astrology wheel, it is 360 degrees. When you take 360 degrees and mark out 12, there are 12 zodiac signs. You are left with the number 30. 30 is 30 degrees, 30 degrees for each house. That means that every 30-degree relationship must be a major aspect, otherwise there wouldn’t be a house associated with it.
To get there from the conjunction to the opposite point—that’s 180 degrees—that’s half of the chart, you’ll have all the major aspects."
________________


C. The Seven Aspects (PDF Slide 18)
1. Conjunction (☌) - Together (0°)
Direct Quote:
"The first one is the conjunction. The keyword for conjunction is ‘together.’ When you see them, they are within the orb of influence of zero degrees. Every planet has a different orb of influence, which is how far that planet reaches. The moon reaches out three degrees. The sun reaches out 10 degrees.
That’s for a future class, but you’ll need to know that when they are at zero degrees or within the orb of that—meaning from zero, if it’s the moon from zero to three and from zero back to 27 degrees, forward and backward three degrees, or the sun from 0 degrees to 10 degrees, 0 degrees back to 20 degrees, which is 10 degrees ago—that entire span would be a conjunction. Planets would be conjunct if they sit within that range.
So a conjunction is together. You’ll see the planets near each other. As long as they’re within each other’s orb of influence, they will be conjunct."
________________


2. Semi-Sextile (⚺) - Hard Stop (30°)
Direct Quote:
"So, you know, in terms of houses, Aries conjuncts Aries. Aries is in a semi-sextile with Taurus. It is 30 degrees, is the next sign over. That keyword is hard stop. This is what ends up creating an issue. When we take action on something, most of the time we haven’t considered its value and a lot of what we do has no value. It literally has no worth to it. You maximize the abilities of Aries, the first planet, when you put it into something that is of value.
So this is what that glyph will look like. It’s showing two different directions. That’s exactly what it feels like. A convergence. You need to pull those two things into one spot."
________________


3. Sextile (⚹) - Companion (60°)
Direct Quote:
“When you get to the sextile, this is what’s called a companion energy. It’s 60 degrees apart. A lot of times in other systems you’ll hear a 60-degree aspect known as a mini trine. It is not a mini trine. This is the trine over here at 120 degrees. It is half of that. It is not half of the effect. It has nothing to do with the trine. It is a companion partnership energy. It means you have to consider the other energy and they have to be used together to either resolve what you’re trying to do or just realize that it’s there.”
________________


4. Square (□) - Conflict (90°)
Direct Quote:
“A square is conflict. It’s 90 degrees. It’s also growth, by the way. Squares are very important, can be very positive. This is what that’s going to look like.”
Key Insight: Squares = growth through conflict (not inherently negative)
________________


5. Trine (△) - Direct Effect (120°)
Direct Quote:
“The trine, the triangle, is going to be the direct effect. No matter what happens from the first, it is going to affect the second. Trines are not always easy. In fact, usually they’re not easy. It’s 120 degrees apart within the orbits of influence.”
Key Insight: Trines create unavoidable flow between energies—NOT always pleasant or helpful.
________________


6. Quincunx (⚻) - Toggle (150°)
Direct Quote:
"The next one is a quincunx. It is a toggle. It’s 150 degrees. A toggle means I can do this or I can do that, but I cannot do both at the same time. You take any house that’s 150 degrees apart. For instance, you can’t have rage and anger at the same time.
You cannot hold something in and do something about it at the same time. It’s one or the other. Scorpio Aries. Either it’s repressed and it’s within and I’m holding on to it and just within me, or I’m pushing all of that out and doing something with it.
And there is an order. It has to go from the 8th to the 1st. It does not go from the 1st to the 8th. Action and anger does not contribute to trauma. You being angry doesn’t make you rageful. Being rageful makes you angry. 8th to 1st."
________________


7. Opposition (☍) - Counterbalance (180°)
Direct Quote:
"Opposition, first and seventh, for a good example, is about counterbalancing. Counterbalancing does not mean combining. So you’ll read a lot of people, a lot of things for astrology that’ll say 180 degrees apart, something that’s in opposition is about finding the middle ground.
And technically there is a compromise there, but the compromise is not to lose either. It is to say, ‘How do we make both of these work without losing the essence of either?’ And this is where people get really stuck."
Aries-Libra Opposition Example:
"Aries is in opposition to Libra, not because you are—Libra is the compromise. Libra is the balancing. The opposition to Aries is not. So I’ve seen it taught that the opposition carries Libra energy because you have to balance the energies. That is very, very wrong.
Whenever you’re talking about Aries energy and Libra energy, and they’re in opposition of each other, yes, Libra has to do with those things, but it does not relate to the association with Aries."
The Correct Understanding:
"Aries says, ‘How do I maintain myself, the things that I want to do, and my autonomy while also being in a relationship?’ Most people lose that. They side one way or the other. It becomes a seesaw. You need to find the middle ground of the seesaw where it’s not teetering on one end.
That doesn’t mean coming to the middle. It means balancing both of them equally at the same time from their respective points. Maintain this, maintain this. This will feel like it’s detracting from this. This will feel like it’s detracting from this.
When you’re in a relationship, you feel like you can’t do your own stuff. When you’re doing your own stuff, you feel like you can’t be partnering with somebody else or you won’t be able to do your own stuff because you won’t be autonomous.
There is a natural opposition of those energies. It’s about this [maintaining both ends], not meeting in the middle. In fact, if you meet in the middle of a seesaw, what happens? It doesn’t stay like this. It does this crap. It’s way out of balance because you’re trying to meet in the middle of something when Libra means that and opposition does not."
________________


D. Aspect Summary
Direct Quote:
“So these are the glyphs that you’ll be looking for to understand how these energies associate with each other.”
________________


X. THE FOUR VITALITY ANCHORS (ANGLES)
A. Alchemystic Terminology
Direct Quote:
“Vitality anchors. This is an alchemical astrology term. These are the four main things. You see them all the time. The ascendant, the descendant, the midheaven, and the subheaven.”
________________


B. Subheaven vs. IC/Nadir Distinction
Direct Quote:
"The subheaven is also alchemical. It is not the nadir. The nadir is a different point. If you draw a line straight through the earth at the very bottom, that is the nadir. If you look straight up, that is not the midheaven. That is the zenith.
So it’s very important that you do not call the Midheaven the Zenith. You do not call the IC the Nadir. When I first started learning, that’s how I learned them. That’s wrong."
Correct Terms:
                                                                                                            * Zenith = straight up (NOT Midheaven)
                                                                                                            * Nadir = straight down through Earth (NOT IC/Subheaven)
                                                                                                            * Midheaven = ecliptic peak
                                                                                                            * Subheaven = ecliptic anchor
________________


C. Mathematical Points, Not Bodies
Direct Quote:
"The ascendant is a point. The descendant’s a point. These are all mathematical points. They don’t have an orb of influence. They are always in a forced aspect, meaning any planet that is touching any of these points is not being pushed by these points. It is being enveloped by them.
So if you have your sun conjunct the midheaven, the midheaven is not acting upon the sun. The sun is forcing the midheaven to be a part of it.
When we get into forced and true aspects, this will make much more sense. Again, that’s also in my book. They’re not visible celestial bodies. They are rooted in the astronomical trigonometry that involves the ecliptic. Again, there’s that word again. So all of these are rooted in where the plane of reality sits."
________________


D. Ascendant - Emergence
PDF Slide 19:
 ASCENDANT - EMERGENCE (1ST HOUSE)
Direct Quote:
"The ascendant, the key word for the ascendant, is emergence. This is where you come out into the world and through your actions. It only sits in the first house. Every time you come up and you say, ‘This is my motivation,’ ‘This is how I’m going to do it,’ ‘This is why I’m doing it,’ and ‘This is the way that I’m going to do it,’ it’s always through your action. That is the key word of ascendant.
It is not the mask you wear. It is not how you show up. The first house is how you show up. The ascendant is why you showed up."
________________


E. Descendant - Submergence
PDF Slide 19:
 DESCENDANT - SUBMERGENCE (7TH HOUSE)
Direct Quote:
"The descendant is submergence. It is not my partner. My partner is Libra. That’s the seventh house itself. The descendant is what you want to bring from the physical realm back into your private realm, from the public to your personal.
Your descendant is you need to oblige by those energies and say, ‘I’m connecting to you because I want you a part of my personal world.’ That is the sunset point. The sun is disappearing. Descendant. Only connect to people that are going to be the people you want to bring into your personal life. Descendant. Seventh house only."
________________


F. Midheaven - Peak Aspiration
PDF Slide 19:
 MIDHEAVEN - PEAK ASPIRATION (1ST-7TH HOUSE RANGE)
Direct Quote:
“Midheaven. Peak aspiration. Highest public visibility. The midheaven can show up in the first house. The midheaven can show up in the seventh house, and it can appear in any house as long as it’s above the ascendant-descendant axis. So you can have your midheaven and your ascendant in the first house.”
Geographic Variation:
 Midheaven location varies depending on birth location on Earth. Can fall anywhere above the horizon axis.
________________


G. Subheaven - Core Anchor
PDF Slide 19:
 SUBHEAVEN - CORE ANCHOR (1ST-7TH HOUSE RANGE)
Direct Quote:
"The subheaven, which is what lies before it, is your core anchor. This is your deepest emotional truths. This is what keeps you tethered to this world. It can show up in the first house, it can show up in the seventh house, and anywhere below the ascendant-descendant axis, depending on where you are on this planet. It is what pulls you and roots you to reality.
It has nothing to do with Cancer. It has nothing to do with where you came from. It has nothing to do with your emotional stability. It is not Cancer. It has nothing to do with the fourth house whatsoever. Can you have it in the fourth house? Absolutely. And in that case, it will show up through your ancestry. It’ll show up through what makes you emotionally secure. But this is not that.
It is an anchor of what pulls you to this earth and makes you feel grounded on a very personal level. I don’t—nobody sees this way. I dive further into these topics in my book, obviously."
________________


XI. FOUR SELF-GROWTH GLYPHS
A. Introduction
PDF Slide 20:
 “You should always be aware of these 4 additional objects and points. They are crucial to your self-understanding and potential blockages.”




Direct Quote:
"Self-growth. And this is the last one that you need to be able to identify. These four are key. And this is at the very beginning when I showed you which ones to highlight, which ones to activate in your chart.
I told you North Node, South Node, Chiron, Black Moon Lilith. And Black Moon Lilith has two versions. Actually, Chiron’s the only one on this list that does not have two versions because Chiron is an asteroid. Black Moon Lilith is a mathematical point off of the Moon, and so are the North and South Node."
________________


B. Orbs of Influence
Direct Quote:
“The North and South Node and Black Moon Lilith have an orb of influence of three degrees because they are moon-derived. Chiron has an orb of influence of a degree to a degree and a half. We’re still whittling that one down. A half max degree is where we’re sitting at so far.”
________________


C. North Node ☊ - Future Trajectory
PDF Slide 20:
 NORTH NODE:
 “Calculation of the Moon heading South to North across the Ecliptic. It carries a forward momentum, future trajectory, and unease due to being unfamiliar or beyond needs.”
Direct Quote:
"These are calculations of the moon, which means they’re all based on the moon, which means the North Node cannot be your soul’s destiny unless the moon is the soul.
Now, the problem with that is if the moon is the soul and it represents Cancer and it represents your ancestry, that means your grandmother is your soul. So this is why we have to be very cautious on how we word things. The soul is the entire chart. It is all you. The soul is everything. So we can’t call the North Node the soul’s destiny because it isn’t."


Astronomical Definition:
“The truth is that the calculation of the North Node is when the moon is heading south to north across the ecliptic in its orbital cycle the moment you were born. That is the point where it’s crossing between the anchor between the sun and the earth, that line. And we have the moon in its orbit. This is the point from down here to up here where it crosses the ecliptic. That is your North Node.”
North = Future Principle:
"Everything in astrology, especially alchemistic astrology, but everything, is North is future, South is past. Ecliptic is now. Think about the civilizations on this planet. Think about how they form. Think about which ones are more primitive or more historically stuck in the past in their traditions, and which ones are always progressive and forward-thinking.
The forward-thinking, progressive ones are in the Northern Hemisphere. The more attached to how things have always been are in the Southern Hemisphere, and the ones that are living in the moment, in the now, are sitting on the equator. You apply the same thing when you get into the astrology."
What North Node Actually Means:
"The North Node is the moon. It is your emotional needs, your emotional security, your family and sense of family, the things that are going to make you feel comfortable on an emotional level in the future.
Therefore, you can never actually reach your north node. You can never embody or embrace your north node because it is always in the future. It hasn’t happened yet, and it never will. All you can do is align a trajectory towards your north node to say, ‘That’s where I’m going to emotionally grow. That is where it is my out of comfort zone that I need to start acquiring comfort with. I will never be fully comfortable with this energy, but I’m always going to try to align with it.’"
Mother Relationship:
“The north node is a relationship you never had with your mother, but you wish you had. That’s why it’s uncomfortable.”
________________


D. South Node ☋ - Default Settings
PDF Slide 20:
 SOUTH NODE:
 “Calculation of the Moon heading North to South across the Ecliptic. Shows default settings, relationship with family, and comfort zones based off familiarity & routine emotional focus.”
Direct Quote:
"When it comes all the way back around and it’s coming down, that is your South Node.
The South Node is the opposite. It says, this is the relationship I had with my mother. The south node—the relationship with the mother and the family that you always had. It’s the things that became habit, instinct. It’s the things that are rooted in the core of you. It can make you feel stuck, but also gives you great strength and skill. It’s based off of familiarity and routine emotional focus. ‘This has always been the way it’s been for me with my family, with my home, with my sense of security, with my needs. I’ve always needed this. I’ve always been good at this.’ It’s because the South Node is rooted in what always has been.
It doesn’t allow for emotional growth. However, because of the opposition, you use one to fuel the other."
________________


E. Chiron ⚷ - The Authenticity Asteroid
PDF Slide 20:
 CHIRON:
 “Asteroid orbiting the Saturn-Uranus realm. Highlights insecurities, breakdowns in structure, wounds, and where things aren’t normal as you seek what works for you.”
Direct Quote:
"Chiron is an asteroid. It sits for most of its orbit between Saturn and Uranus, so it embodies both themes, but it’s anchored twice to Saturn. We have a webinar that you can watch in the replay realm for Chiron.
This one is about insecurities, breakdowns, and structures, wounds, and where you’re just not normal. This is an authenticity asteroid. This is where things don’t work well for you because you’re trying to do it like other people."
Examples by House:
4th House Chiron:
“If you have it in the fourth house, you expect emotion to process the normal way for you. You’re looking for how you can have typical family normalcy, and you never will.”
6th House Chiron:
“If you’re looking for Chiron in the sixth house, you’re trying to work. You’re trying to have normal routines. You’re trying to have a sense of mental health that is just the norm. You never will.”
7th House Chiron:
“If you have it in the seventh house, you think that relationships are supposed to be a certain way, but for you, they never are. You think that the way that you see design, balance, and interaction with others, your wounds and insecurities, you expect something out of the other person, or you think that they expect something out of you, and then you feel insecure about it when it doesn’t happen. Because it’s not supposed to. You’re supposed to find a way that works for you.”
The Gift of Chiron:
“That’s what Chiron is all about. And once you do, it becomes something that other people look at and say, ‘Holy shit, how did you do that?’ Because it’s not normal.”
________________


F. Michael Jackson Chiron Example
Direct Quote:
"Michael Jackson has his Chiron in Aquarius in the 12th house. So basically, Chiron’s in Pisces, expressing through Aquarius, with its ruler in the 6th house through Leo. His insecurity is about judgment rather than his music, dance, or work ethic. Imagine the biggest pop star in the world having insecurity about music. It’s always that way. And that’s where the wound will be.
And because he’s weird behind closed doors, because he did things differently, it’s also his vulnerability point. It’s where people attacked him. This is where the world will attack you because it’s your weak spot. And you have to stand strong in that authenticity.
That’s why he got accused of what he did behind closed doors, especially around bedtime. Literally, kids sleeping in his bed. That ruler in the sixth house routine, Leo. Kids sleeping in his bed. That’s why he was attacked for that. In his chart, I can tell he never did anything. You can believe what you want, but they attacked him for that because they didn’t know."
11th House Chiron Example:
"In the 11th house, it has to do with your intelligence, depending on what sign it goes through. So if you have Chiron in the 11th house, your weak spot is groups. It is ‘I don’t function well in groups. I’m very concerned that I don’t have a future plan. I don’t know how to change things. I don’t know how to be an individual.’
Taurus just associates value with that. ‘I don’t have value in groups. When I’m in a group, it doesn’t seem to work right and I don’t feel valuable within it. My intelligence and the things that I—the way that my mind works, through the resources that I have, I have to use those resources a different way. If I try to do it normally it doesn’t work and therefore I feel insecure about those things. I don’t feel smart.’ And then we have to attach it to the rest of the chart."
________________


G. Black Moon Lilith ⚸ - Raw Emotional Truth
PDF Slide 20:
 BLACK MOON LILITH:
 “Calculation at the apogee of the Moon. Untethered, liberation-seeking, raw emotional needs and truth which disconnect from reality, thus creating deep guilt and shame.”
Apogee vs. Perigee:
Direct Quote:
"Black moon Lilith is another calculation of the moon. The opposite is something called… In other systems of astrology, it’s called Priapus. We do not use Priapus because Priapus is a male fertility god with an erect penis that won’t go away. That has nothing to do with the moon. It has nothing to do with femininity or motherhood.
So you’ll see in my book that I’ve replaced Priapus with White Moon Sophia. White Moon Sophia makes a lot more sense, and that’s what we’re going to use. White Moon Sophia is the direct oppositional point to Black Moon Lilith. It has a completely different meaning. You’ll learn about that later.
Black Moon Lilith is the apogee of the moon, whereas White Moon Sophia is the perigee. Perigee means it’s the closest to the Earth in orbit. Apogee means it’s the furthest away in orbit. So the moment you were born, wherever that furthest point was becomes your Black Moon Lilith."
Mean vs. True:
"There is a webinar in the replay realm about taming and embracing your Black Moon Lilith. There are two versions. There is a mean version and there is a true version. Same thing goes with the North and South Node. There’s one that has to do with the averages that sits very much internally. And then there’s one that adjusts for orbital variances and fluctuations, gravity paths, things of that nature. That is your true. One’s inward, one’s outward.
The one I want you to focus on now is the inward one, Black Moon Lilith. It’s mean Black Moon Lilith. It looks like this. It has the shape of the moon above a cross."
What It Represents:
“This is the calculation at the apogee. It is an untethered, liberation-seeking, raw emotional needs and truth—something that disconnects from reality, thus creating deep guilt and shame. You need to know why you feel guilt and shame around things. You need to understand what’s stopping you from doing things because you feel like it’s not okay for you to do it because the general world won’t understand, your family won’t understand. That point is extremely important.”
________________
