🎓 VERBATIM QUOTES COLLECTION
On the Core Concept:
“Vantage is your point of view, your perspective. In chart reading, we traditionally read aspects in one direction: Planet 1 feeds energy into Planet 2. But Reverse Vantage means reading it backwards. You have to talk about the receipt of it.”
“You have to ask: Did Planet 2 WANT this energy? Is it prepared to receive it? How does it receive it? Planet 1 thinks Planet 2 is the problem, but Planet 2 becomes the solution.”
“Planet 1 is sending energy whether Planet 2 wants it or not. But Planet 2’s entire experience—its foundational reality—is built on what it’s receiving. You can’t understand Planet 2 without understanding what’s being poured into it.”
On Trines (Critical Correction):
“Trines are NOT about things being easy or positive. Trines are about DIRECT EFFECT. Whatever Planet 1 is, it flows directly into Planet 2’s foundation. If Planet 1 is absence, then Planet 2 is built on absence—smoothly, seamlessly, without resistance.”
“The trine makes it seamless. The Moon doesn’t fight this; it doesn’t even question it. The Moon’s entire emotional structure is built on ‘I don’t have a mother, so THIS is what safety looks like instead.’ It’s not a problem to solve—it’s the FOUNDATION.”
On Forced Aspects:
“When it’s a forced aspect, the planet doing the forcing is trying to pull that energy in. But the other planet? It didn’t necessarily sign up for this. That’s when Reverse Vantage becomes CRITICAL because you need to see how the forced planet experiences being dragged into this relationship.”
“The Moon is PULLING that Chiron energy in. The Moon NEEDS to reference the wound to understand itself. This isn’t Chiron imposing on the Moon—this is the Moon requiring the wound to build its sense of safety.”
On Structure vs. Content:
“The biggest mistake people make is assuming what a planet ‘should’ be. They see Moon and think ‘nurturing mother.’ They see Sun and think ‘confident identity.’ But you have to read what’s ACTUALLY THERE in the chart. Reverse Vantage forces you to read structure, not assumption.”
“You can’t assume. You have to read what’s actually there. My Moon’s experience is disconnection, so my Sun is built from disconnection. The trine doesn’t make it positive—it makes it FOUNDATIONAL.”
On Application:
“This works for every aspect. Conjunction, semi-sextile, sextile, square, trine, quincunx, opposition—all of them. You always need to check: how is Planet 2 receiving this?”
“You need both. Forward tells you what’s being sent. Reverse tells you what it’s like to receive it. You don’t do one OR the other—you do BOTH, and the complete picture emerges from combining them.”
“When someone asks WHY they feel a certain way, WHY they struggle with something, WHY they experience life as they do—Reverse Vantage gives you the answer. It shows you what their reality is BUILT ON.”
On Integration:
“Traditional astrology reads aspects as one planet acting on another. We read aspects as energy exchanges where BOTH perspectives matter. If you only read forward, you’re only seeing half the circuit. Reverse Vantage completes it.”

TRANSCRIPT 19: ZODIAC ENERGY WALKTHROUGH WEBINAR
Complete Harvard-Level Extraction & Documentation

________________


🎯 WEBINAR PURPOSE & INTRODUCTION
Why This Webinar Exists
Direct Quote:
“Hey, everybody. Welcome to the Zodiac Energy’s walkthrough webinar. This is just kind of a long time coming. For people who have already been learning, this is kind of a refresher course for people who are new and are jumping in. And my foundation’s masterclass, the legacy one that most people are jumping into, is a very dense course, and we already go through a lot of this material in there. We want to kind of go back and just refresh, make sure that what you’re learning is everything that you’re going to need. And look at the lens of Zodiac themes in a different way, so that we’re going to go through so that it’s very basic, very beginners-oriented.”
Target Audience:
                                                                                                                        * Beginners: Complete newcomers to Alchemistic Astrology
                                                                                                                        * Refreshers: Students from the Foundation Masterclass reviewing material
                                                                                                                        * New theory students: Those learning FREE theory for the first time
What Makes This Different:
Direct Quote:
“But I’m introducing free theory, which is something I didn’t introduce in my courses before, which is the foundational relationship of energetic expression.”
This webinar introduces a NEW framework (FREE theory) not covered in previous courses, making it essential even for advanced students.
________________


📖 FREE THEORY: FOUNDATIONAL RELATIONSHIP OF ENERGETIC EXPRESSION
What Is FREE Theory?
Direct Quote:
“It’s something that is a major chapter in my book, I Fixed Astrology, and its purpose is to understand how to concisely pinpoint what an energy means based on its natural relationship to every other relationship. So if you’re talking about Aries, what does it mean to Taurus? What does it mean to Gemini? What does it mean to Cancer? And by understanding those relationships, you know definitively that a certain sign cannot mean something other than what it actually means.”
Core Concept:
FREE theory uses the aspectual relationships between zodiac signs to PROVE what each sign must mean. By examining how each sign relates to every other sign through major aspects (semi-sextile, sextile, square, trine, quincunx, opposition), we can definitively determine:
                                                                                                                        * What a sign MUST include
                                                                                                                        * What a sign CANNOT mean
                                                                                                                        * How signs support, conflict with, or depend on each other
________________


The Saturn/Father Example: How FREE Theory Corrects Astrology
The Problem:
Direct Quote:
“A good, for instance, example of that is Saturn. There are a lot of people in the astrology community who believe that Saturn rules the father. And when you look at how it’s positioned in the chart, Saturn being a square to Aries, which Aries is you and your actions, how you show up in the physical world, would mean that your father would always be challenging you as an undercurrent, always.”
Why This Is Wrong (FREE Theory Proof):
Direct Quote:
“Thematically, across the board, your father would be an issue in your life. Now, obviously, some of you, that might be true, but that’s because of the placements. That’s because of the rulerships. That is your individual expression of energy. But an undercurrent of everyone, it doesn’t apply that way. So the undercurrent is that it does not— the father, if it were Capricorn, does not challenge us in terms of just existence. Also, it would mean that the mother at the fourth house and the father at the tenth house would be an always opposites. They would never work together; they would always be the mother’s over here, the father’s over here. There’s no real unity allowed. We know that that’s not true. The mother tends to support the father; the mother has themes; the father has themes.”
The Correct Answer (Via FREE Theory):
Direct Quote:
“We know that Saturn cannot rule the father for those reasons. It’s the reason why we know that Leo rules the father. The fifth house rules the father. The sun rules the father because a semi-sextile, although creates a hard stop in your life in terms of the energies of Cancer into the energies of Leo. Once you understand what Leo needs and the purpose of Leo, the fourth house funnels directly into a direct cohesive integration with the fifth house. And that is when you would see your parents in unison. You would see your emotional security and your desire for purpose to have that cohesion, which would make you feel fulfillment.”
The FREE Theory Logic:
                                                                                                                        1. Cancer (4th house) = Mother, emotional security
                                                                                                                        2. Leo (5th house) = Father, purpose, vitality
                                                                                                                        3. Cancer and Leo are in semi-sextile (30°)
                                                                                                                        4. Semi-sextile = needs understanding to flow, or feels blocked
                                                                                                                        5. Mother and father MUST work together cohesively for fulfillment
                                                                                                                        6. Therefore: Leo = Father (NOT Saturn/Capricorn)
This is FREE theory in action: aspectual relationships prove rulerships.
________________


How FREE Theory Works: The 180° Rule
The Vantage Shift at Opposition:
Direct Quote:
“Once we pass that, we are now past 180 degree mark. Now what ends up happening is 180 degrees, anything beyond that becomes zero again; zero becomes 180 degrees, we flip it upside down because we have to complete the second half of the travel when we’re doing this journey through the aspects.”
Practical Application:
From 0°-180° (Aries through Libra):
                                                                                                                        * Aries is Planet 1 (the giver/sender)
                                                                                                                        * Energy flows FROM Aries TO other signs
From 180°-360° (Scorpio through Pisces):
                                                                                                                        * Aries becomes Planet 2 (the receiver)
                                                                                                                        * Energy flows FROM other signs TO Aries
Direct Quote:
“Now Aries is actually the end point, so what we’re gonna do here is now, once we get to Scorpio, Aries is the energy that’s being fed into because there’s a quincunx; the quincunx does not go from Aries to the Scorpio energy; it does not go from the first house to the eighth because that breaks the 180-degree rule. It goes from the eighth to the first; Aries becomes planet two. Up until this point, from Aries to Libra, Aries was always planet one. From its vantage, now from its vantage, it is the receiving planet; it is planet two or sign two or energy two.”
Why This Matters:
This creates directional energy flow that is unique to Alchemistic Astrology. Energy doesn’t flow randomly—it follows specific, provable paths based on the 180° Rule.
Direct Quote:
“This energy flow is specific to alchemistic astrology; it doesn’t exist outside of the system.”
________________


Application Beyond Ascendants: Vantage Theory
Direct Quote:
“In reality, it doesn’t have to be the ascendant because of vantage. So even if you were, let’s say, a Virgo rising, you would have Scorpio in your third house. So would it be Gemini’s energy expressing through Scorpio? And from the vantage of you putting yourself in the energy of Scorpio in that third house, that Gemini energy expressing through Scorpio, you would know your mental relationship in the themes it plays in relationship to the first house, in relationship to the eighth house, in relationship to the 10th house because you’re doing that.”
Vantage Principle:
FREE theory applies to any house/sign combination, not just the Ascendant. You can use any sign as your “vantage point” and analyze its relationships to all other energies in the chart.
Example:
                                                                                                                        * Virgo Rising with Scorpio in 3rd house
                                                                                                                        * Put yourself in Scorpio’s vantage (3rd house)
                                                                                                                        * Analyze: How does Scorpio (8th house energy) express Gemini (3rd house) themes?
                                                                                                                        * Map relationships to 1st, 8th, 10th houses from that vantage
Direct Quote:
“So whether that’s the first house or it’s your sixth house, if it’s Scorpio energy, you’ll see the themes; you’ll see how it plays out and its relationship within the chart.”
________________


♈ ARIES: THE COMPLETE FREE THEORY BREAKDOWN
Core Identity
Ruler: Mars
House: 1st House
Element: Fire
Modality: Cardinal
Main Keyword: ACTION
Direct Quote:
“Aries is the first; it is ruled by Mars. It is the same exact energies as the first house… In alchemistic astrology, signs are planets, are houses. They are synonymous; they are the same… So, Aries is the sign, the ruler is Mars, the house is always that first house, all the same exact energy.”
________________


Aries Themes & Keywords
Direct Quote:
“The main keyword in alchemistic astrology for Aries is every single thematic expression of Aries is always gonna come down to some sort of action, and you can see a lot of these words; all these words are going to have some sort of, even if it feels loose, synonymous association with the word action.”
Complete Keyword List:
                                                                                                                        * Drive, passion, movement (physical body movement, travel movement)
                                                                                                                        * Travel (Aries rules travel: “it’s literally talking about go, do— that’s travel”)
                                                                                                                        * Speed, assertion, competition, aggression, conflict
                                                                                                                        * NOT anger (anger is emotion = Cancer; aggression is Aries)
                                                                                                                        * New beginnings, starting something
                                                                                                                        * Youth, being first, pioneering
                                                                                                                        * Impact, force, impulse (how quick something is)
                                                                                                                        * Sharp objects (piercing nature, directness)
                                                                                                                        * Stabbing, impaling (cutting into, not severing)
                                                                                                                        * Blood (related to piercing/wounding)
                                                                                                                        * Physical body, head, forehead (anatomical rulerships)
                                                                                                                        * Impulsive, reactionary (immediate response)
                                                                                                                        * Motivation through action
                                                                                                                        * Emergence (ascendant: physical emergence from subconscious to conscious)
Direct Quote:
“Anytime you do something first, anytime you do anything impulsive, reactionary; reactionary is kind of a combination of Aries and Cancer as well, because it has to do with our emotional point. But when we get into it, it is always in conflict of safety, right? When your passions and drive need, they themselves don’t need any sort of feelings of safety, but your security within what you’re doing, that passion comes from, this is who I feel like I am. Otherwise, there is no passion.”

Aries FREE Theory: Aspectual Relationships
Aries to Aries (0° Conjunction)
Direct Quote:
“In free theory, Aries has no, it says NA, but we don’t have to worry about Aries’ association with itself, other than saying it obviously works with itself, right?”
Interpretation: Aries naturally aligns with itself; no conflict or complexity in self-reference.
________________


Aries to Taurus (30° Semi-Sextile)
Relationship: Supportive, Simultaneous Collaboration Required
Direct Quote:
“Aries, in its position to Taurus, which is the second house, the next house over, is in a semi-sextile; it’s a 30 degrees. Remember, all of these are sitting in major aspects to each other. The 30 degree aspect, the semi-sextile, is where Taurus, and from the vantage of Aries, it needs to understand Taurus to be able to support it; otherwise, it feels blocked by Taurus.”
What This Means:
Direct Quote:
“When it’s Aries to Taurus, your actions and the value of your actions are not inherently obvious. So you can do whatever you want. Whether or not it has value could be a waste of energy until you figure out something valuable to put your energy in. Making money is very difficult because we don’t have, that’s the first house to the second to the third; we don’t know how to make money, and then we don’t know the actions it takes to make money. What are we gonna do that’s actually gonna bring those resources and value?”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Action without value = wasted energy
                                                                                                                        * Taurus (value/resources) must be understood for Aries (action) to be productive
                                                                                                                        * If Aries doesn’t understand Taurus, it “acts a fool”—exerts energy without worth
Direct Quote:
“So, until we understand Taurus, Aries is going to act a fool; it’s just gonna go astray, it’s gonna exert energy, which is also a keyword of Aries that we’ll get to, in an area that does not support actual value. Human beings do this all the time. We exert our energy into things that literally have no value and then we wonder why we have no value, and it makes us feel like we’re not worthy, we don’t have self-worth, we don’t have that value because what we’re putting our energy into is not identified as value.”
Practical Application:
                                                                                                                        * Without understanding what has value (2nd house), action (1st house) is directionless
                                                                                                                        * This explains why people work hard but don’t make money
                                                                                                                        * This explains why effort doesn’t always equal results
________________


Aries to Gemini (60° Sextile)
Relationship: Consideration for Inclusion (Not Required, But Helpful)
Direct Quote:
“When we get to the sextile, the 60 degree, it’s Aries to Gemini, first house to third house. The Gemini energy needs to be considered, so in order to take action, there’s always an element of our environment. There’s something that we can see, there’s something we’ve thought of Now, have we thought it through? Can we see everything? No, but there is an element of that that we have to consider. So, in order to take action, there has to be some sort of thought; there has to be some sort of perception.”
The Sextile Rule (First Half of Chart):
Direct Quote:
“But the thing with sextiles in this direction, you’re going to see when I get to Aquarius, it doesn’t work that way. But sextiles in this direction is that you do not have to use the sextile that is ahead, but you do have to consider it. Aries must consider Gemini, but does not have to use Gemini. I can take action; I can act without thinking; people do it all the time, but the saying is what? Look before you leap. That is that sextile because it’s not a requirement, but it is something that would help Aries along.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Gemini (thought/perception) SHOULD be considered before action
                                                                                                                        * But it’s NOT required (you CAN act without thinking)
                                                                                                                        * The saying “Look before you leap” = Aries-Gemini sextile
                                                                                                                        * Considering Gemini improves Aries outcomes, but Aries can function without it
________________


Aries to Cancer (90° Square)
Relationship: Conflict Point Requiring Symbiosis Through Agreement
Direct Quote:
“Once we get to Cancer, we’re at the square, we’re at the 90 degree angle, so Aries at the first house, Cancer at the fourth house. This is a conflict point; this needs symbiosis through agreement, and this is the part that people don’t understand. Anytime you’re talking about any aspect, planet one is always the problem; it causes the conflict because there’s something going on with planet two. Planet two is the solution; it’s where the energy is being directed, so it has to be understood so that we have a symbiotic relationship, and we can have positive outcome from it.”
The 90° Turning Point:
Direct Quote:
“But in a square aspect at the 90 degrees, we’re in the aspect spectrum from zero to 180; we’re at the halfway point. And everything from zero to 90 is for the purposes of the first planet to utilize those first energies to be able to achieve whatever it’s trying to achieve. Once we pass that 90 degree angle, we’re coming over to the opposition; it’s in favor of the second planet.”
What This Means for Aries-Cancer:
Direct Quote:
“When you do things and you don’t feel safe doing them, you get in trouble, or you don’t do them, or you end up doing something that you get hurt. When you do something and you understand what the foundation is and there’s an element of safety and security within it, or you feel good about it, then you can actually take what you’re doing and what you feel good about doing and do something better.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Action (Aries) requires emotional safety (Cancer)
                                                                                                                        * Without feeling safe, action leads to trouble/harm
                                                                                                                        * Cancer is the SOLUTION, not the problem
                                                                                                                        * Symbiosis = understanding that action needs emotional foundation
Practical Application:
                                                                                                                        * People who don’t feel safe don’t take action (or take reckless action)
                                                                                                                        * Emotional security enables productive action
                                                                                                                        * This is why therapy/healing enables life changes
________________


Aries to Leo (120° Trine)
Relationship: Direct Support, Autofocus (Floodgate Effect)
Direct Quote:
“When you get beyond that, now we’re starting to get into the oppositional energy. We’re talking about Leo’s energy. Aries is a direct support into Leo, which means it’s an autofocus. From Aries, the energy is going to open up like a floodgate into Leo, first house into fifth house; nothing you can do about it. This is the trine aspect… Now this could be good, this could be bad, but no matter what, it’s going to go there now.”
Critical Correction: Trines Are NOT Always “Easy”
Direct Quote:
“Again, planet one, planet two, we always say, oh, this is harmonious. It’s not true; the harmony is the fact that there’s nothing stopping it. If planet two does it, if planet one is trying to feed energy to planet two but planet two is not readily aligned to accept it, then what you’re doing is forcing energy and creating a conflict, because planet two feels overwhelmed, which is also part of the trine. You can feel very overwhelmed in these areas; it’s too much, like too much of a good thing type of energy.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Trine = DIRECT EFFECT, not necessarily “good”
                                                                                                                        * Energy flows unimpeded from Aries to Leo
                                                                                                                        * If Leo isn’t aligned to receive, this creates OVERWHELM
                                                                                                                        * “Too much of a good thing” = trine problem
                                                                                                                        * Aries action AUTOMATICALLY feeds Leo vitality/purpose
Practical Application:
                                                                                                                        * Action naturally creates purpose/vitality (whether wanted or not)
                                                                                                                        * Can lead to over-extension, burnout, too much activity
                                                                                                                        * Purpose/ego (Leo) is constantly fed by action (Aries) with no filter
________________


Aries to Virgo (150° Quincunx)
Relationship: True Opposite (Cannot Integrate, Must Toggle)
Direct Quote:
“Once we get to Virgo, we’re hitting a quincunx, which is 150 degrees. Aries is feeding naturally where to go, extends naturally into but does not integrate with the quincunx with the planet two, with Virgo. So Aries into Virgo or first house in the sixth house, these energies are true opposites. is interesting because we don’t call it the opposition, but this is your true opposite. You cannot have Aries and have Virgo at the same time.”
The Quincunx Rule:
Direct Quote:
“The function is to identify the first and the second, feed the first energy into the second, and then allow them to operate independently. So, a good for instance is you cannot have autonomy, meaning I do what I want, if you have routine because you are not doing what you want; you’re doing the same thing. You can’t take action while you’re overthinking, processing, and analyzing something. You have to bounce back and forth between these energies.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Aries (autonomy/action) and Virgo (routine/analysis) are INCOMPATIBLE
                                                                                                                        * You cannot act impulsively while analyzing
                                                                                                                        * You cannot have autonomy while following routine
                                                                                                                        * These must TOGGLE—one on, then the other, not both
Practical Application:
                                                                                                                        * Analysis paralysis = Virgo overtaking Aries
                                                                                                                        * Impulsive mistakes = Aries overtaking Virgo
                                                                                                                        * Healthy function = toggle between spontaneity and planning
________________


Aries to Libra (180° Opposition)
Relationship: Balance (NOT Compromise, But Equality/Symbiosis)
Direct Quote:
“Once we get to Libra, we’re hitting the oppositional energy. So now we’re saying Aries is in opposition to Libra; it requires balance, and I’m gonna help you understand balance because a lot of people think that means a midpoint when it doesn’t, and direction to rationalize. So balance is not about compromise; there is an element of compromise in there only so that these two energies can work together, but not because they’re both giving up something to meet in the middle. They’re not giving up what they are, and this is the problem with compromises, is we tend to think that that harmony, that balance means we have to give up something.”
What Balance Actually Means:
Direct Quote:
“It means we have to meet at a point where there is an equality, where there is a symbiosis, so we have to we have to say well what does Aries need, what does Libra need. Aries already knows but doesn’t understand Libra because it’s literally oppositional, but it’s going to feed its energy naturally into the opposition. So what we have to do is balance out what what we’re feeding in through Aries into what is mutually receptive for Libra, so that we can support it.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Balance = equality and symbiosis, NOT middle ground
                                                                                                                        * Aries (self/action) and Libra (other/relationship) must BOTH be honored
                                                                                                                        * Neither gives up what it is
                                                                                                                        * Energy flows from Aries to Libra naturally
                                                                                                                        * The work is making Aries energy RECEPTIVE to Libra’s needs
Practical Application:
                                                                                                                        * Self-care vs. relationship care: both needed, not 50/50 split
                                                                                                                        * Independence vs. partnership: honor both, don’t sacrifice either
                                                                                                                        * Action vs. collaboration: find equality, not compromise
________________


Aries After 180°: Becoming Planet 2 (The Receiver)
The Vantage Flip:
Direct Quote:
“Once we pass that, we are now past 180 degree mark… Now Aries is actually the end point… once we get to Scorpio, Aries is the energy that’s being fed into… Aries becomes planet two. Up until this point, from Aries to Libra, Aries was always planet one. From its vantage, now from its vantage, it is the receiving planet; it is planet two or sign two or energy two.”
From Scorpio through Pisces, energy flows TO Aries, not from it.

Scorpio to Aries (150° Quincunx, Reversed)
Relationship: True Opposite (No Integration, But Rage Fuels Action)
Direct Quote:
“Once we hit Scorpio’s energy, what’s gonna happen is, from the vantage of Aries, Scorpio is driven by meaning; Scorpio’s energy is naturally feeding into Aries. However, there is no integration which means you again, just like Aries and Virgo, with Aries and Scorpio, you can’t integrate these two. You can’t, you can’t be angry and rageful at the same time. However, your rage can fuel your anger, which happens all the time. You can’t, you can’t take action while transforming. You can’t do things while trying to like do things outwardly while diving deep inwardly. Those two things can’t happen, but while you’re doing them, then you dive deeper. It can, it can spawn why you take action on something.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Rage (Scorpio) and anger (Aries) are DIFFERENT
                                                                                                                        * Rage FUELS anger, but they don’t coexist
                                                                                                                        * Transformation (Scorpio) and action (Aries) toggle
                                                                                                                        * Deep inner work spawns reasons for action
                                                                                                                        * But you can’t go inward and outward simultaneously
________________


Sagittarius to Aries (120° Trine, Reversed)
Relationship: Direct Flow (Aries Must Align or Adjust)
Direct Quote:
“Scorpio and Sagittarius energy are another trine, but remember from the vantage of Aries, Sagittarius is flowing directly into Aries, which means Aries must either align to accept it or inform Sagittarian energy. Now, this is where it gets tricky because if it’s in your natal chart, you can do it either direction. You can say, Oh, my Sagittarius, this is what I want to take action on. Sagittarius needs to flow; I need to change Sagittarius to direct into Aries, or you say Sagittarius already flowing. I’m going to change what I’m doing and how I do it so that it aligns with the new beliefs, or the adventure, or the wisdom, or whatever.”
Natal vs Transit Difference:
Direct Quote:
“When it’s a transit, you don’t have that option; you can’t change the sky, you can’t change the universe. This is why aspects in your natal chart and aspects in transits are very different; they also operate differently. And sometimes you read them backwards intentionally because they have to be, because the order flow is different.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * In NATAL charts: Can work bidirectionally (adjust Aries OR Sagittarius)
                                                                                                                        * In TRANSITS: Can only adjust YOUR end (Aries), not the transit (Sagittarius)
                                                                                                                        * Sagittarius (beliefs/expansion) flows into Aries (action)
                                                                                                                        * Action must align with current beliefs/opportunities
________________


Capricorn to Aries (90° Square, Reversed)
Relationship: Friction Point for Growth (Aries in Control)
Direct Quote:
“Capricorn’s energy Now from the vantage of Aries, Capricorn’s energy, sitting at the top of the chart, squares off with Aries. This is a friction point for growth. It’s different than squaring off with Cancer because Cancer’s a conflict point, meaning from Aries’ viewpoint, from its vantage, Cancer feels like the obstacle, feels like the problem. But from Capricorn, from Aries’ viewpoint, Capricorn seems like there’s friction there, but Aries is the resolution.”
Cancer Square vs Capricorn Square:
Cancer Square Aries:
                                                                                                                        * Cancer = solution
                                                                                                                        * Aries = problem
                                                                                                                        * Aries must adjust to Cancer’s needs (safety)
Capricorn Square Aries:
                                                                                                                        * Aries = resolution
                                                                                                                        * Capricorn = friction provider
                                                                                                                        * Capricorn must feed through what it offers to Aries
Direct Quote:
“So it feels like it’s being acted upon as a friction point instead of a conflict point, but it’s allowing for growth through conflict clarity. It’s basically saying, why don’t you understand me? Let’s talk; you adjust to match me… So Capricorn squaring off with Ares is a friction point; Ares is in control. Capricorn still has to feed it through what Capricorn can offer.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Aries is IN CONTROL in this square
                                                                                                                        * Structure/career (Capricorn) must align with action/identity (Aries)
                                                                                                                        * Not the other way around
                                                                                                                        * Career serves self, not self serves career (in this aspect)
Direct Quote:
“Your career can literally be anything you want it to be as long as it aligns with all of your energies and the proper resolutions of them through your first house, through your Aries house, through your Mars placement, and those energies are going to be whatever you determine that they are.”
________________


Aquarius to Aries (60° Sextile, Reversed)
Relationship: Required Level (Not Optional, Not Consideration—Prerequisite)
Direct Quote:
“From Aquarius, now we’re on the other side of the sextile; remember the first sextile to Gemini, from Aries to Gemini, was there’s a certain level of Gemini that we need to consider. From the vantage point of the second planet, which is Aries from Aquarius, there’s already a level that is there, cooperatively speaking. We don’t choose anymore; it’s not about maybe, no.”
The Sextile Rule (Second Half of Chart):
Direct Quote:
“You’re already saying there’s an expectation that there is, from that sextile, an element, a level in a quantifiable and quantified level of Aquarian energy. So, being able to be autonomous requires a level of individuality; otherwise, you’re not going to be autonomous. To be able to have movement requires a level of being able to change directions; that is Aquarian energy. Without Aquarian energy, Ares cannot do what Ares needs to do.”
Energy vs Exerted Energy:
Direct Quote:
“The physical body and the energy exerted require energy to be able to do so. Now, you’re going to see energy. I didn’t put energy under Aquarius; I put it under Aries. But both of them are energy. One is energy exerted, like fuel burned, and Aquarius is the actual energy.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Aquarius (energy/individuality) is REQUIRED for Aries (action/autonomy)
                                                                                                                        * This is NOT optional (unlike Gemini sextile)
                                                                                                                        * You cannot act without energy
                                                                                                                        * You cannot be autonomous without individuality
                                                                                                                        * Aquarius = energy source; Aries = energy expenditure

Pisces to Aries (30° Semi-Sextile, Reversed)
Relationship: Supportive, Simultaneous Collaboration (Aries as Answer)
Direct Quote:
“Then, when we get to Pisces, instead of it being like Taurus, which is the other semi-sextile from Aries to Taurus, Taurus needs to be understood or feels like the blockage. Well, Aries is the answer to Pisces. All of your spirituality, all of your creativity, it all needs to be fed through supportive, simultaneous collaboration with Aries energy. If you don’t take action on your manifestation, it won’t happen. If you’ve got music and you don’t exert energy to produce the music, it stays in the ether.”
Inspiration Requires Action:
Direct Quote:
“You always need energy, you always need action, you always need direction. Even taking that for, oops, even taking that for passion and drive is all based off of hope and inspiration. Without inspiration, there is no motivation, so it’s a collaborative, supportive, and simultaneous energy usage.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Pisces (inspiration/creativity) NEEDS Aries (action) to manifest
                                                                                                                        * Without action, inspiration stays in the ether (unmanifest)
                                                                                                                        * Pisces provides motivation (hope/inspiration)
                                                                                                                        * Aries provides motion (action/execution)
                                                                                                                        * They must work SIMULTANEOUSLY

Aries Summary: What FREE Theory Proves
Core Function: ACTION is the foundation of all manifestation
Required Relationships:
                                                                                                                        * Value (Taurus): Action needs direction/worth or wastes energy
                                                                                                                        * Thought (Gemini): Should be considered, but action can proceed without it
                                                                                                                        * Safety (Cancer): Emotional security enables productive action
                                                                                                                        * Purpose (Leo): Action automatically feeds vitality/ego (can overwhelm)
                                                                                                                        * Routine (Virgo): Cannot coexist with spontaneity; must toggle
                                                                                                                        * Balance (Libra): Action and relationship need equality, not compromise
                                                                                                                        * Depth (Scorpio): Rage fuels action, but transformation and action toggle
                                                                                                                        * Expansion (Sagittarius): Action must align with beliefs/opportunities
                                                                                                                        * Structure (Capricorn): Career serves identity, not the reverse
                                                                                                                        * Individuality (Aquarius): Energy source required for all action
                                                                                                                        * Inspiration (Pisces): Must be actualized through action or remains unmanifest

♉ TAURUS: VALUE THROUGH THE SELF
Core Identity
Ruler: Venus (Inferior/Intrapersonal)
House: 2nd House
Element: Earth
Modality: Fixed
Main Keyword: VALUE THROUGH THE SELF
Direct Quote:
“So this is free theory for Taurus. It is ruled by Venus; it’s the same as the second house. Again, all of these are exactly the same. Venus’s energy inwardly, Taurus, and the second house energy are all the same energy.”
________________


Element & Modality Explained
Earth Element:
Direct Quote:
“The element is earth. Earth tells us that it is a physical material presence. It is something on the thread of reality, and its modality is fixed. This tells us that Taurian energy is in a stagnancy or a set pace, and it’s not looking for change. It is not looking for a reason to have to waver. It is not looking for a purpose to start something or change anything. It is saying we’ve already established it. This is what it is and let’s move on.”
Fixed Modality Meaning:
                                                                                                                        * Already established
                                                                                                                        * Not seeking change
                                                                                                                        * Set pace, stagnant (in a functional sense)
                                                                                                                        * Maintains what exists
                                                                                                                        * Material, physical, tangible
________________


Taurus Themes & Keywords
Direct Quote:
“So being the self-value, which means it’s the, again, when we talked about inferior versus superior, it’s the inferior position amplifies this, but Taurus’s energy is based off of that association of when Venus is between the earth and the sun. So it creates anything that is ours of value on a material level or a reality plane that is, I wouldn’t say immovable, but it’s not there to move.”
Complete Keyword List:
                                                                                                                        * Resources (anything you have access to)
                                                                                                                        * Items, belongings, possessions
                                                                                                                        * Luxury (levels of value)
                                                                                                                        * Money (how it ties to luxury/value)
                                                                                                                        * Jewelry (luxury + items)
                                                                                                                        * Art and talents (self-created value)
                                                                                                                        * Artwork (the physical item that is art)
                                                                                                                        * Plants and earthly things
                                                                                                                        * Food (plants as resources we eat)
                                                                                                                        * Values (what you deem important)
                                                                                                                        * Self-worth
                                                                                                                        * Senses and sensuality
                                                                                                                        * Physical comfort (NOT emotional comfort—that’s Cancer)
                                                                                                                        * Throat (anatomical rulership)
                                                                                                                        * Talents
                                                                                                                        * Fuel (resources used for energy)
Direct Quote:
“So we have resources, which can be literally anything that is, you have access to. You know, tarot cards, the cards themselves, are resources. So they are Taurus energy for the deck of cards. It also includes items in general, belongings, possessions, luxury, so value and the levels of value would be luxury, money, and how they can tie into luxury. Obviously, being when you take like luxury and items and you put those two together, you get jewelry, for example, art and talents themselves, because these are self-created art, artwork, because it’s an item that is art. So the actual artwork is art, is Taurus as well; plants and earthly things, values, especially because plants are here as resources.”

FREE Theory: Taurus Aspectual Relationships
Fuel as Semi-Sextile from Aries
Direct Quote:
“…senses, I already said the throat, your talents, and then fuel. So fuel is an interesting one because I’ve seen that kind of all over the place, but fuel is a resource; most often, it’s a natural resource actually, and whether you’re using food for fuel or you’re using gasoline for your vehicle, it is fuel. And that’s the semi-sextile from Aries to Taurus; without the appropriate fuel, you can’t exert the energy.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Fuel (Taurus) enables energy expenditure (Aries)
                                                                                                                        * Without resources, action cannot happen
                                                                                                                        * Food, gasoline, money = fuel for activity

Taurus Sextile to Cancer (Security Through Resources)
Direct Quote:
“…you can see this in every, I have a slide for each one of these because you’ll see that with Taurus, Taurus is now NA. Ares requires supportive, simultaneous collaboration to work with Taurus, and then it continues going on from Taurus to Cancer. That is the consideration for inclusion. Do I feel comfortable within having money? Do I feel safe based off of my materialism? I don’t have to feel safe there is an element of security, but how much security? Well, if I don’t have any money, I feel very insecure, or I feel comfortable with it. I don’t need all that money, right? That’s Taurus sextile to Cancer, but Cancer from sextiles, in order for there to be nurturing, I need resources, I need food, so to speak. Houses, you can just do it that way. If I have money, I could buy a house, but to buy a house, I would need money. That’s the same sextile from either direction.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Resources (Taurus) and emotional security (Cancer) are connected
                                                                                                                        * Money affects how safe you feel
                                                                                                                        * Nurturing requires resources (food, shelter, money)
                                                                                                                        * Bidirectional: resources enable security, security requires resources

“It’s also the square from Aquarius to Taurus.”

                                                                                                                        * Energy (Aquarius) requires fuel (Taurus)

Element & Modality Explained
Air Element:
Direct Quote:
“With Gemini. It is an air sign, so it is all about the flow of the intellect and it is mutable, so it’s ever changing.”
Mutable Modality:
                                                                                                                        * Ever-changing
                                                                                                                        * Flexible
                                                                                                                        * Adaptable mental flow
                                                                                                                        * Not fixed or initiating
________________


Gemini Themes & Keywords
Complete Keyword List:
                                                                                                                        * Facts and figures (numbers)
                                                                                                                        * Words in general
                                                                                                                        * Options, variety, assortment
                                                                                                                        * Curiosity
                                                                                                                        * Perception
                                                                                                                        * Eyes and hands (anatomical)
                                                                                                                        * Siblings, cousins, co-workers, neighbors, classmates
                                                                                                                        * Anything at arm’s reach
                                                                                                                        * Local environment
                                                                                                                        * Tools (hammers, screwdrivers, things used with hands)
                                                                                                                        * Communication and actual speech
                                                                                                                        * Thoughts and ideas
                                                                                                                        * Messages and documentation (includes texting)
                                                                                                                        * Early learning (fundamentals, basics)
                                                                                                                        * Information
                                                                                                                        * Stress, anxiety (mental racing)
Direct Quote:
“So we have facts and figures like numbers, words in general, options, or any time you have an assortment or a variety of anything: curiosity, perception, your eyes and your hands, siblings, cousins, co-workers, neighbors, also classmates, which attributes to early learning. Anything at arm’s reach, your local environment, tools like hammers and screwdrivers, or whatever, the different options to be able to use with your hands; those are all Gemini energy. Communication and actual speech, thoughts and ideas, messages and documentation that includes texting, and then early learning, learning in general, but early learning when we’re talking really about the fundamentals, the basics.”
________________


Gemini vs Sagittarius: The Learning Distinction
Direct Quote:
“And that is without any sort of philosophical approach or application So when you’re learning something, just kind of getting the information, information also another keyword that is Gemini, it doesn’t take over. We say it’s higher education but really what it is, is any time you add a philosophical or a wandering approach that you’re not saying this is what it is, that becomes Sagittarian energy on the other end of this.”
The Difference:
                                                                                                                        * Gemini: Facts, data, information gathering, learning basics
                                                                                                                        * Sagittarius: Philosophy, belief-based learning, “what if” exploration
                                                                                                                        * Gemini: “Here’s the data” (perception)
                                                                                                                        * Sagittarius: “What does this mean?” (expansion/belief)
________________


FREE Theory: Gemini Aspectual Relationships
Aries Sextile Gemini (Consideration, Not Requirement)
Already covered in Aries section:
                                                                                                                        * Aries SHOULD consider Gemini (perception/thought)
                                                                                                                        * But Aries CAN act without Gemini
                                                                                                                        * “Look before you leap” = this sextile
________________


Gemini Square Virgo (Mental Health and Stress)
Direct Quote:
“…free theory, we see here that Gemini is the friction point for growth, conflict, clarity. So we know that Virgo, the assessment is that stress, which is stress, anxiety, our perception, right? That is Gemini’s energy. It counters our mental health. It creates, if I go back here to Virgo, it’s the conflict point. It needs symbiosis through agreement.”
The Anxiety-Mental Health Connection:
Direct Quote:
“Now, we didn’t talk about Gemini ruling anxiety and Gemini ruling your options and what you’re doing and how your brain races and goes back and forth And the stress that comes from that, that contributes to, it quincunxes into Scorpio’s energy, which contributes to trauma. And that trauma contributes through a quincunx directly back into Aries, which feeds into a quincunx back into Virgo. We’re getting into quinconic flow here, but that’s how this all operates.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Gemini = stress, anxiety, mental racing, options
                                                                                                                        * Virgo = mental health, assessment, analysis
                                                                                                                        * Gemini’s stress challenges Virgo’s mental health
                                                                                                                        * Quinconic flow: Gemini (stress) → Scorpio (trauma) → Aries (reactive action) → Virgo (mental health impact)
________________


Gemini Summary
Core Function: MENTAL PERCEPTION and information processing
Key Themes:
                                                                                                                        * Curiosity, variety, options
                                                                                                                        * Local environment, immediate perception
                                                                                                                        * Communication of thoughts/ideas
                                                                                                                        * Early learning, fundamentals
                                                                                                                        * Stress and anxiety from mental overload
Key Relationships:
                                                                                                                        * Aries: Should be considered before action (but not required)
                                                                                                                        * Virgo: Stress from Gemini challenges Virgo’s mental health
                                                                                                                        * Sagittarius: Gemini gathers facts; Sagittarius creates beliefs from them

♋ CANCER: SAFETY
Core Identity
Ruler: Moon
House: 4th House
Element: Water
Modality: Cardinal
Main Keyword: SAFETY (also security)
Direct Quote:
“Free theory for Cancer, rule by the moon, same energy as the fourth house, the keyword is safety. We have water and cardinal, by the way, with Gemini.”
________________


Element & Modality Explained
Water Element:
Direct Quote:
“Cancer is a water, it is about the fluidity within the emotional realm, the undercurrents, and it is cardinal, so we’re establishing something that we are determining if we want before we agree to it or sustain it.”
Cardinal Water:
                                                                                                                        * Establishing emotional territory
                                                                                                                        * Determining what feels safe before committing
                                                                                                                        * Initiating emotional boundaries
                                                                                                                        * Fluid but selective (not passive)
________________


Cancer Themes & Keywords
Complete Keyword List:
                                                                                                                        * Safety, security (same concept)
                                                                                                                        * Security systems (literal Cancer energy)
                                                                                                                        * Protection
                                                                                                                        * Feelings and moods
                                                                                                                        * Subconscious (NOT unconscious—that’s Neptune/Pisces)
                                                                                                                        * Nurturing, care, self-care
                                                                                                                        * Empathy (connecting through emotions/moods)
                                                                                                                        * Privacy (all things private or personal)
                                                                                                                        * Response (emotional/reactive response, NOT action—that’s Aries)
                                                                                                                        * Ancestry, lineage
                                                                                                                        * Mother, motherhood, grandmothers, maternal figures, maternity
                                                                                                                        * Family (especially mother’s side)
                                                                                                                        * House and home (both physical structure and feeling)
                                                                                                                        * Hometown, country
                                                                                                                        * Domestication, agriculture
Direct Quote:
“Keyword is safety, which obviously is the same as security, so whenever you talk about like a security system, it literally is cancer energy, protection, which isn’t on this list, but that’s another one: feelings and moods, subconscious, as opposed to Neptune, which rules the unconscious, which I actually didn’t put in there; nurturing, care, self-care— those are all cancer energy. Empathy, which is connecting to somebody through mood, through feelings, through emotions; privacy and all things that are private or personal.”
________________


Response vs Aries (Clarification)
Direct Quote:
“Your response to something is an emotional response; it’s a reactive response. That is Cancer, so sometimes you’ll see response as an Aries thing, but that’s actually the action on response; the response itself is Cancer.”
The Distinction:
                                                                                                                        * Cancer: Emotional response, reaction (internal)
                                                                                                                        * Aries: Action ON the response (external)
Practical Example:
                                                                                                                        * Someone insults you
                                                                                                                        * Cancer = feeling hurt/angry (response)
                                                                                                                        * Aries = yelling back or walking away (action on response)
________________


Cancer and Ancestry/Home
Direct Quote:
“Ancestry, your lineage, just going back: mother, motherhood, mothers, grandmothers, maternal-like people, maternity, all of those things, and family— especially on the mother’s side— but it’s usually through a mother’s lineage. House and home, the physical and the feeling of it. Hometown, which includes country, domestication, agriculture— which obviously the tilling of the land, the land being here, and the actual what you do to care for the crops and be able to cycle that through— that is all Cancer’s energy.”
Practical Application:
                                                                                                                        * Cancer rules WHERE you’re from (hometown, country)
                                                                                                                        * Cancer rules WHO you’re from (maternal lineage)
                                                                                                                        * Cancer rules maternal ROLES (nurturing, caregiving)
                                                                                                                        * Cancer rules domestic ACTIVITIES (agriculture, homemaking)
________________


FREE Theory: Cancer Aspectual Relationships
Aries Square Cancer (Action Requires Safety)
Already covered in Aries section:
                                                                                                                        * Action without safety = trouble/harm
                                                                                                                        * Action with safety = productive growth
                                                                                                                        * Cancer is the SOLUTION to Aries’ conflict

Already covered in Taurus section:
                                                                                                                        * Nurturing requires resources (food, shelter, money)
                                                                                                                        * Security needs material foundation
                                                                                                                        * Bidirectional relationship

♌ LEO: VITALITY
Core Identity
Ruler: Sun
House: 5th House
Element: Fire
Modality: Fixed
Main Keyword: VITALITY
Direct Quote:
“Leo, fire. So remember, actionable flow; modality is fixed. So Leo’s energy is very much about sustenance, not sustenance, that’s a Taurus thing, sustaining; and the key word is vitality.”
________________


Vitality Explained
Direct Quote:
“Leo is about vitality, and vitality contributes to purpose, vitality meaning life, life force, the fire within, literally the fire element that is fixed.”
What Vitality Means:
                                                                                                                        * Life force
                                                                                                                        * The fire within
                                                                                                                        * Sustained energy (fixed fire)
                                                                                                                        * Existence itself
                                                                                                                        * Purpose foundation
________________


Leo Themes & Keywords
Complete Keyword List:
                                                                                                                        * Vitality, life force
                                                                                                                        * Ego
                                                                                                                        * Character (also characters—people as entities)
                                                                                                                        * Existence itself (“the existence of that person”)
                                                                                                                        * Happiness
                                                                                                                        * Validation, celebration
                                                                                                                        * Sense of alignment with core being
                                                                                                                        * Expression (personal, creative, character expression)
                                                                                                                        * Play, fun, recreation
                                                                                                                        * Romance
                                                                                                                        * Father, grandfather, father figures
                                                                                                                        * Children, youth, inner child
                                                                                                                        * Young age
                                                                                                                        * Leadership (through being, magnetizing, example)
                                                                                                                        * “Is” (the state of being)
                                                                                                                        * Lifestyle (“this is literally just how I am”)
                                                                                                                        * Color (expression of something)
Direct Quote:
“It is the ego, it is your character; it’s also characters. So if you’re talking about people, like a person, the existence of that person that you’re talking about is Leo, literally existence in itself. Happiness, a sense of, it’s that sense of not achievement, success, or fulfillment, because those are all Capricorn, but it’s the level that comes before that that contributes to those things. It’s that sense of validation, celebration, happiness, a sense of knowing that this is aligned with the core of your being.”
________________


Leo vs Capricorn (Happiness vs Achievement)
Critical Distinction:
Direct Quote:
“Happiness, a sense of, it’s that sense of not achievement, success, or fulfillment, because those are all Capricorn, but it’s the level that comes before that that contributes to those things.”
The Difference:
                                                                                                                        * Leo: Happiness, validation, alignment with core (comes FIRST)
                                                                                                                        * Capricorn: Achievement, success, fulfillment (comes AFTER, requires Leo)
                                                                                                                        * Leo enables Capricorn (can’t achieve without vitality/purpose)
________________


Creative Expression: Pisces Influence
Direct Quote:
“Your sense of expression, sometimes we say creative expression. Creative expression is because Pisces energy quincunxes into Leo, so you’re getting that creativity from Pisces, and it’s fueling your Leo energy. So it is creative expression, but it’s also character expression and personal expression.”
FREE Theory Insight:
                                                                                                                        * Leo = expression itself
                                                                                                                        * Pisces = creativity (the “creative” part)
                                                                                                                        * Quincunx from Pisces fuels Leo’s creative expression
                                                                                                                        * But Leo also expresses character and personality (not just creativity)
________________


Leadership Through Being
Direct Quote:
“Leadership through being, through magnetizing and doing by example, saying this is the way it is, which is also another keyword, is. And then lifestyle; this is literally just how I am. That is lifestyle. That is Leo. That is vitality.”
Leo Leadership:
                                                                                                                        * NOT through authority (that’s Capricorn)
                                                                                                                        * Through BEING an example
                                                                                                                        * Through magnetism (people drawn to vitality)
                                                                                                                        * “This is the way it is” = embodiment
