                                                                                                                                                      * “It’s naturally cooperative”
But this misses the point:
Planet One is supported (Sun), but it must consciously choose to include Planet Two (Moon). The cooperation is AVAILABLE, not AUTOMATIC.
The Car Ride Example:
Direct Quote:
“I hop in my car and I go drive… my wife is coming with me… she says we need to go to the store.”
Sextile dynamic:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun = driving somewhere (has a plan)
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon = coming along (cooperative presence)
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon mentions: “We need to go to the store”
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun must CHOOSE to include that need: “Okay, we’re bringing this along”
If Sun ignores Moon’s request:
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon feels unsupported
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun misses opportunity for productive cooperation
                                                                                                                                                      * Sextile potential wasted
Resolution Strategy:
                                                                                                                                                      1. Acknowledge Planet Two’s presence - Don’t dismiss as unimportant
                                                                                                                                                      2. Actively include it in your plans - Make conscious effort
                                                                                                                                                      3. Recognize it as SUPPORT, not interference - Planet Two wants to help
                                                                                                                                                      4. Bring it along for the ride - Integrate its needs into your journey
Example: Mercury Sextile Venus
Mercury at 15° Gemini, Venus at 15° Leo:
Perception:
                                                                                                                                                      * Mercury (communication/thinking) is doing its thing
                                                                                                                                                      * Vaguely aware Venus (values/relationships) is there
                                                                                                                                                      * “Do I need to consider relationships while communicating?”
Reality:
                                                                                                                                                      * Venus offers SUPPORT to Mercury’s communication
                                                                                                                                                      * Communication becomes MORE EFFECTIVE when charm/diplomacy included
                                                                                                                                                      * Must consciously say: “I’ll communicate (Mercury) in a way that honors relationships (Venus)”
Integration:
                                                                                                                                                      * Before speaking, ask: “How can I say this with grace/diplomacy?”
                                                                                                                                                      * Include Venus’s relational awareness in Mercury’s mental processes
                                                                                                                                                      * Result: Charming, effective, relationship-building communication
________________


6.4 Square (90°): The Forced Integration
Direct Quote:
“So the square is the one that most people are like, I understand that there’s friction. I understand that there is tension, conflict, but I don’t know why. … The perception, the way that it feels, is that the sun is in conflict with the moon and wants to challenge it to overtake it.’ … 'The reality is that the moon is at a cross point from the sun. And they’re at an angle that creates conflict when not properly managed equally. This is the key word, equally.”
Geometric Definition:
                                                                                                                                                      * 90° separation between two planets
                                                                                                                                                      * Three signs away from each other
                                                                                                                                                      * Creates 90° angle (L-shape) on chart wheel
PERCEPTION:
Direct Quote:
“The perception, the way that it feels, is that the sun is in conflict with the moon and wants to challenge it to overtake it.”
How the square feels:
                                                                                                                                                      * Direct conflict - “We’re fighting”
                                                                                                                                                      * Desire to overtake - “I want to WIN, not cooperate”
                                                                                                                                                      * Friction and tension - Obvious struggle
                                                                                                                                                      * One vs the other - “Either I succeed OR you do”
REALITY:
Direct Quote:
“The reality is that the moon is at a cross point from the sun. And they’re at an angle that creates conflict when not properly managed equally. This is the key word, equally. … with the square, both planets have to be used kind of like a conjunction, equally.”
What the square actually represents:
                                                                                                                                                      * Cross point - Perpendicular angles create forced meeting
                                                                                                                                                      * Equal use required - Like a conjunction, BOTH must be active
                                                                                                                                                      * Managed conflict - Tension is constructive when properly handled
                                                                                                                                                      * Building opportunity - “from there, we get to build things magically”
The Equal Support Requirement:
Direct Quote:
“They’re both coming at it from different angles, and instead of the first angle saying, I’m going to overtake the second one, it’s like, no, no, no, respect me. This is what I need. Just as much as you need this, I need this. We’re coming at it from different approaches. And from there, we get to build things magically. That’s what the square is all about.”
Both planets must be honored simultaneously:
                                                                                                                                                      * Not “Sun OR Moon”
                                                                                                                                                      * Not “Sun dominates Moon”
                                                                                                                                                      * Not “Compromise between Sun and Moon”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Sun AND Moon, coming from different angles, building together”
The Three Phases of Square:
Phase 1: Applying Toward 90°
Direct Quote:
“But applying towards 90. you’re still doing it for the purposes of the sun.”
                                                                                                                                                      * Planet One (Sun) is supported
                                                                                                                                                      * Friction builds as square approaches
                                                                                                                                                      * Purpose: Sun must learn to INCLUDE Moon equally
                                                                                                                                                      * Focus: “How can Sun’s goals incorporate Moon’s needs?”
Phase 2: Exact 90.000°
Direct Quote:
“Once the square hits the point of exactitude… both are in favor at the same exact time. … And the closer you are to exactitude, the more equal it has to be.”
                                                                                                                                                      * Both planets equally supported
                                                                                                                                                      * Maximum friction point
                                                                                                                                                      * Neither can dominate
                                                                                                                                                      * Requires perfect balance of both energies
Phase 3: Separating Beyond 90°
Direct Quote:
“Separating beyond 90 degrees—this is that. It’s not for the sun anymore. It is for the moon… The sun is lending its services… to support whatever the moon needs.”
                                                                                                                                                      * Favor shifts to Planet Two (Moon)
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun now SERVES Moon’s journey
                                                                                                                                                      * Purpose: Moon continues toward opposition with Sun’s support
                                                                                                                                                      * Focus: “How can Moon’s needs be supported by Sun’s vitality?”
The Turnover:
Direct Quote:
“The turnover point is where planet A will shift to planet B. The favor is going to switch.”
The square (90°) is the TURNOVER POINT:
                                                                                                                                                      * Before 90°: Planet One supported
                                                                                                                                                      * At 90°: Both equal
                                                                                                                                                      * After 90°: Planet Two favored (even though still Planet Two until opposition)
Resolution Strategy:
Direct Quote:
“That’s why the square is so damn challenging, but nobody brings this up. Because not only do I have to know what I’m sending, I have to understand how I’m receiving it and whether I’m ready to receive it.”
                                                                                                                                                      1. Stop trying to “win” - Neither planet should overtake the other
                                                                                                                                                      2. Use both equally - Like a conjunction, merge the energies
                                                                                                                                                      3. Come from different angles - Respect that they approach differently
                                                                                                                                                      4. Build together - Use the friction constructively
                                                                                                                                                      5. Adjust focus as square progresses - Support shifts from Planet One → Both → Planet Two
Example: Mars Square Saturn
Mars at 15° Aries, Saturn at 15° Capricorn:
Perception:
                                                                                                                                                      * Mars (action) feels BLOCKED by Saturn (structure/limitation)
                                                                                                                                                      * Wants to fight Saturn, overcome it, prove it wrong
                                                                                                                                                      * Frustration, anger, “I can’t do anything!”
Reality:
                                                                                                                                                      * Mars and Saturn are at cross point
                                                                                                                                                      * Both must be used EQUALLY
                                                                                                                                                      * Mars provides drive/energy; Saturn provides discipline/structure
                                                                                                                                                      * Together they build SUSTAINABLE ACHIEVEMENT
Integration (Applying):
                                                                                                                                                      * Mars (supported): “I will take action (Mars) but within structured parameters (Saturn)”
                                                                                                                                                      * Build disciplined action plans
                                                                                                                                                      * Channel raw energy into strategic effort
Integration (Separating):
                                                                                                                                                      * Saturn (favored): “I will maintain structure (Saturn) energized by drive (Mars)”
                                                                                                                                                      * Don’t let structures become rigid—keep them dynamic
                                                                                                                                                      * Use Mars’s energy to serve Saturn’s long-term goals
Result:
                                                                                                                                                      * Not Mars without Saturn (reckless action)
                                                                                                                                                      * Not Saturn without Mars (stagnant structure)
                                                                                                                                                      * Mars + Saturn together = Strategic, disciplined, effective achievement
________________


6.5 Trine (120°): The Unimpeded Flow
Direct Quote:
“When we get to the trine, this is the one that everybody thinks is so easy. … The perception is that the sun directly contributes to the moon. And this is a 120-degree angle, it seems to come very naturally and typically goes unnoticed because you’re not actively doing anything.”
Geometric Definition:
                                                                                                                                                      * 120° separation between two planets
                                                                                                                                                      * Four signs away from each other
                                                                                                                                                      * Same element (fire-fire, earth-earth, air-air, water-water)
PERCEPTION:
Direct Quote:
“The perception is that the sun directly contributes to the moon. And this is a 120-degree angle, it seems to come very naturally and typically goes unnoticed because you’re not actively doing anything.”
How the trine feels:
                                                                                                                                                      * Easy flow - “This just works”
                                                                                                                                                      * Natural contribution - “Energy transfers smoothly”
                                                                                                                                                      * Goes unnoticed - So natural you don’t think about it
                                                                                                                                                      * No active effort - “I’m not doing anything and it still works”
REALITY:
Direct Quote:
“The reality of a trine is much deeper. It’s that the moon is a receiver for the sun. Whatever energy comes from the sun, it does indeed affect the moon without interruption. However, without intentional alignment, the sun can distort or disrupt that flow. The moon can receive something it doesn’t want, or … gives it the feels of being insecure, unsafe, and feeling like there’s no emotional security foundation.”
What the trine actually represents:
                                                                                                                                                      * Unimpeded reception - Energy flows WITHOUT INTERRUPTION
                                                                                                                                                      * Not automatic harmony - Requires INTENTIONAL ALIGNMENT
                                                                                                                                                      * Can distort/disrupt - If Sun sends misaligned energy, Moon receives it fully (including the problem)
                                                                                                                                                      * Receiver vulnerability - Moon can’t block what Sun sends
The Trine Trap:
Direct Quote:
“That’s why trines are so damn challenging, but nobody brings this up. Because not only do I have to know what I’m sending, I have to understand how I’m receiving it and whether I’m ready to receive it.”
Traditional view: “Trines are lucky, easy, always positive”
Aspect Spectrum view: “Trines transmit EVERYTHING unfiltered—if Planet One sends poorly aimed energy, Planet Two receives the full force of it”
The Complacency Risk:
Because trines feel easy:
                                                                                                                                                      * People don’t pay attention to them
                                                                                                                                                      * Assume they’re “already working”
                                                                                                                                                      * Don’t consciously direct the energy
                                                                                                                                                      * Miss the fact that Planet Two might be overwhelmed
The Heart Connection:
Direct Quote:
“If there’s something wrong … it affects the heart.”
Trines often involve emotional vulnerability:
                                                                                                                                                      * Energy flows directly to core
                                                                                                                                                      * No friction to slow it down
                                                                                                                                                      * If misaligned, it hurts DEEPLY
                                                                                                                                                      * More painful than expected because there’s no defense
Resolution Strategy:
Direct Quote:
“The moon must be in a stable position to direct its focus into the sun, and it must know what the sun’s purposes are also so it’s supportive instead of detracting. The sun needs to be open to an understanding of the reception, the energy the moon is pushing in.”
                                                                                                                                                      1. Conscious direction required - Planet One must AIM intentionally
                                                                                                                                                      2. Check Planet Two’s readiness - Is it prepared to receive?
                                                                                                                                                      3. Ensure alignment - Is what’s being sent what’s needed?
                                                                                                                                                      4. Don’t assume it’s working - Just because it’s flowing doesn’t mean it’s helpful
                                                                                                                                                      5. Planet Two must communicate - Let Planet One know what’s being received
Example: Sun Trine Moon
Sun at 15° Leo, Moon at 15° Sagittarius:
Perception:
                                                                                                                                                      * “Sun and Moon naturally support each other”
                                                                                                                                                      * “This feels easy, no work needed”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Ego and emotions are in harmony”
Reality:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun sends vitality energy → Moon WITHOUT INTERRUPTION
                                                                                                                                                      * If Sun is sending grandiose/ego-driven energy, Moon receives FULL FORCE
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon might feel overwhelmed by Sun’s intensity
                                                                                                                                                      * OR Moon might inflate Sun’s ego without grounding
Misaligned Trine:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun (Planet One): “I’m amazing, I can do anything!” (sending inflated energy)
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon (Planet Two): Receives this, feels unsafe (“This is too much, where’s the security?”)
                                                                                                                                                      * Result: Emotional instability despite “easy” aspect
Aligned Trine:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun: “I will shine vitality in a way that SUPPORTS Moon’s emotional needs”
                                                                                                                                                      * Consciously sends grounded, nurturing vitality
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon receives stable, supportive energy
                                                                                                                                                      * Result: True harmony and mutual support
Key Insight:
Trines are NOT automatically beneficial—they’re POWERFUL CHANNELS that transmit whatever Planet One sends. If what’s being sent is good, it’s received fully (positive). If what’s being sent is misaligned, it’s ALSO received fully (problematic).
________________


6.6 Quincunx (150°): The Delegation
Direct Quote:
“Quincunx, one of my favorite aspects, just because… nobody wanted to figure this one out. And all they really know about is these two don’t really go together and there’s some sort of balancing. You’re not supposed to balance. That’s actually the key is you don’t try to balance these energies.”
Geometric Definition:
                                                                                                                                                      * 150° separation between two planets
                                                                                                                                                      * Five signs away from each other
                                                                                                                                                      * Also called “inconjunct”
PERCEPTION:
Direct Quote:
“So what ends up happening, … sun here at 150 degrees to the moon. The sun and the moon may feel like they’re at an impasse. My energy and your energy, we are just not combining. I don’t have anything for you. You don’t have anything for me.”
How the quincunx feels:
                                                                                                                                                      * Impasse - “We’re stuck, can’t bridge the gap”
                                                                                                                                                      * Incompatibility - “These energies don’t go together”
                                                                                                                                                      * Nothing for each other - “You can’t help me, I can’t help you”
                                                                                                                                                      * Adjustment needed - Traditional interpretation says “adjust to each other”
REALITY:
Direct Quote:
“But the reality is that the moon is a natural receiver for the sun, kind of like a trine. But the two are not meant to merge together. And that is key. So it’s not when people are like, ‘oh, you got to balance it out.’ You got to bring them together. No, that’s the worst thing you can do with the quincunx.”
What the quincunx actually represents:
                                                                                                                                                      * One-way transmission - Like trine, but NOT meant to merge
                                                                                                                                                      * Delegation, not integration - Hand off the task, don’t do it together
                                                                                                                                                      * Compartmentalization - Keep energies SEPARATE but communicate
                                                                                                                                                      * Directional aim - Point energy in right direction, then let go
The Email Metaphor:
Direct Quote:
“The sun just has to aim its influence in the direction of the moon. … it’s just direction. I’m talking to you. I’m not talking, we’re not having a conversation. I’m just talking to you. You’re going to take the information and go away. But what if it’s you I’m supposed to talk to? Well, I just direct it to you so that I’m talking to the right person…”
Quincunx is like sending an email:
                                                                                                                                                      * You write the message (Planet One)
                                                                                                                                                      * You send it to the right recipient (Planet Two)
                                                                                                                                                      * You DON’T need a conversation
                                                                                                                                                      * You DON’T need to merge with recipient
                                                                                                                                                      * Recipient takes the info and handles it independently
What NOT To Do:
Direct Quote:
“So it’s not when people are like, ‘oh, you got to balance it out.’ You got to bring them together. No, that’s the worst thing you can do with the quincunx.”
Wrong Approach:
                                                                                                                                                      * “Try to integrate these energies”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Balance them out”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Make them work together”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Adjust until they harmonize”
Right Approach:
                                                                                                                                                      * AIM the energy correctly
                                                                                                                                                      * Delegate the task
                                                                                                                                                      * Let them remain separate
                                                                                                                                                      * One-way communication
The Unidirectional Flow:
Direct Quote:
“It only goes in one direction, though. So it doesn’t go from moon back. It only reacts from moon back. So if the sun is there and it’s not delivering properly to the moon, the moon gets unsettled. And that’s where that reactive energy happens.”
Planet One (Sun):
                                                                                                                                                      * Sends energy/information TO Planet Two
                                                                                                                                                      * Must aim correctly
                                                                                                                                                      * Cannot force integration
Planet Two (Moon):
                                                                                                                                                      * Receives what Planet One sends
                                                                                                                                                      * Takes it and “goes away” (handles it independently)
                                                                                                                                                      * Cannot send back—can only REACT if it’s wrong
If Sun sends to wrong “person” (wrong direction):
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon gets unsettled (reactive energy)
                                                                                                                                                      * Signal that aim was off
Resolution Strategy:
                                                                                                                                                      1. Don’t try to merge them - Worst mistake with quincunx
                                                                                                                                                      2. Identify what needs delegating - What should Planet One hand off to Planet Two?
                                                                                                                                                      3. Aim correctly - Direct the energy/task to the right place
                                                                                                                                                      4. Let go - Don’t micromanage how Planet Two handles it
                                                                                                                                                      5. Separate domains - Accept that these energies operate independently
Example: Sun Quincunx Pluto
Sun at 15° Taurus, Pluto at 15° Libra:
Perception:
                                                                                                                                                      * “My ego/will (Sun) and transformation/power (Pluto) don’t work together”
                                                                                                                                                      * “I need to adjust one to fit the other”
                                                                                                                                                      * Feels like constant tension
Reality:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun must DELEGATE transformation work to Pluto
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun says: “Here’s what needs to be transformed” (sends the info)
                                                                                                                                                      * Pluto receives it and does the deep work INDEPENDENTLY
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun doesn’t participate in the transformation process
Integration:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun identifies: “This aspect of my life needs profound change”
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun aims that awareness toward Pluto
                                                                                                                                                      * Pluto receives it and does the shadow work/transformation
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun doesn’t try to CONTROL the transformation (that’s Pluto’s job)
                                                                                                                                                      * Result: Sun continues shining while Pluto handles the depth work separately
Key Insight:
Quincunx is about outsourcing, not integrating. Some energies work best when they operate in SEPARATE domains with one-way communication, not forced collaboration.
________________


6.7 Opposition (180°): The Balance Point
Direct Quote:
“Opposition. Now, this is not a direct opposition. This is applying towards 180 degrees… The perception is that the sun feels like the moon is the enemy. … The reality is that the moon is finalizing its arc journey through the spectrum. … both need to work concurrently. This is where most people mess up. They think that it’s all about compromise, when in reality it’s about balance and fairness, not compromise.”
Geometric Definition:
                                                                                                                                                      * 180° separation between two planets
                                                                                                                                                      * Directly across from each other on chart wheel
                                                                                                                                                      * Maximum separation possible


PERCEPTION:
Direct Quote:
“The perception is that the sun feels like the moon is the enemy.”
How the opposition feels (applying toward 180°):
                                                                                                                                                      * Enemy dynamic - “You’re against me”
                                                                                                                                                      * Polarization - “We’re on opposite sides”
                                                                                                                                                      * Need to compromise - Traditional advice
                                                                                                                                                      * One must win - Competitive feeling
REALITY:
Direct Quote:
“The reality is that the moon is finalizing its arc journey through the spectrum. … both need to work concurrently. This is where most people mess up. They think that it’s all about compromise, when in reality it’s about balance and fairness, not compromise.”
What the opposition actually represents:
                                                                                                                                                      * Journey completion - Planet Two has traveled full 180°
                                                                                                                                                      * Concurrent action - Both work AT THE SAME TIME
                                                                                                                                                      * Balance, not compromise - Don’t give up parts of each; honor both fully
                                                                                                                                                      * Fairness - Each gets their full expression
                                                                                                                                                      * Handoff point - Roles about to reverse
Compromise vs Balance:
COMPROMISE (Wrong):
                                                                                                                                                      * “Sun gives up some vitality, Moon gives up some emotion”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Meet in the middle”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Neither gets full expression”
                                                                                                                                                      * Both diminished
BALANCE (Correct):
                                                                                                                                                      * “Sun expresses FULL vitality, Moon expresses FULL emotion”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Both do their thing simultaneously”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Each focuses on their domain within the same situation”
                                                                                                                                                      * Both enhanced
The Concurrent Action Requirement:
Direct Quote:
“you can do both at the same exact time within the same exact thing, but the moon’s focusing on this part of it, the sun’s focusing on this part of it.”
Example Given:
Sun in work context, Moon in relationship context:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun focuses on PURPOSE/CAREER aspects
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon focuses on EMOTIONAL/SECURITY aspects
                                                                                                                                                      * Both operate in the SAME LIFE, SAME MOMENTS
                                                                                                                                                      * Don’t take turns—work CONCURRENTLY
At Exact Opposition (180.000°):
Direct Quote:
“then finally, in the aspect spectrum, we reach the opposition point of exactitude at 180 degrees. … This is the second handoff point switching leadership. So what’s going to happen is that planet one has been the sun. Planet two has been the moon. You’re going to see it flip in just a moment. because this is a handoff point.”
At exactitude:
                                                                                                                                                      * Both equally supported (like conjunction)
                                                                                                                                                      * Neither leads, both essential
                                                                                                                                                      * Perfect awareness of each other
                                                                                                                                                      * Maximum illumination (like Full Moon)
The Handoff:
As Moon continues past 180.000°:
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon becomes Planet One (new sender/leader)
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun becomes Planet Two (new receiver/solution)
                                                                                                                                                      * Return journey begins (180° → 360°/0°)
The Halfway Point:
Direct Quote:
“The aspect spectrum comprises seven major aspects across 12 aspect points, which are the 12 signs, the 12 houses, or, geometrically speaking, the 12 30-degree points. The conjunction begins the journey. The opposition ends it. But in traveling the zodiacal wheel, this leaves us at a midpoint. We’re not done our journey. We’re halfway. Much like a solar lunar opposition of the full moon, we’re only halfway. What are you doing? We got to come all the way back.”
Opposition is NOT the end:
                                                                                                                                                      * It’s the TURNING POINT
                                                                                                                                                      * Like Full Moon = midpoint of lunar cycle
                                                                                                                                                      * Must return to conjunction to complete cycle
                                                                                                                                                      * The awareness gained at opposition fuels the return journey
Resolution Strategy:
                                                                                                                                                      1. Don’t see as enemies - Not opposing forces, complementary ones
                                                                                                                                                      2. Don’t compromise - Don’t diminish either planet
                                                                                                                                                      3. Establish balance - Both get full expression
                                                                                                                                                      4. Work concurrently - Not taking turns, simultaneous action
                                                                                                                                                      5. Prepare for role reversal - After opposition, favor shifts
Example: Mercury Opposition Jupiter
Mercury at 15° Gemini, Jupiter at 15° Sagittarius:
Perception:
                                                                                                                                                      * Mercury (details/facts/analysis) vs Jupiter (big picture/beliefs/expansion)
                                                                                                                                                      * “These are opposites, they conflict”
                                                                                                                                                      * “Must choose: focus on details OR see big picture”
Reality:
                                                                                                                                                      * Both must work CONCURRENTLY
                                                                                                                                                      * Mercury focuses on gathering information, analyzing details
                                                                                                                                                      * Jupiter focuses on understanding meaning, seeing patterns
                                                                                                                                                      * SAME SITUATION, different focuses working together
Integration:
                                                                                                                                                      * Writing a research paper:
                                                                                                                                                      * Mercury: Gathers data, checks facts, analyzes sources (detail work)
                                                                                                                                                      * Jupiter: Sees overall argument, understands implications, expands context (big picture)
                                                                                                                                                      * Both happen SIMULTANEOUSLY in the same project
                                                                                                                                                      * Don’t compromise—use FULL detail orientation AND FULL expansion
Result:
                                                                                                                                                      * Not Mercury without Jupiter (lost in details, no meaning)
                                                                                                                                                      * Not Jupiter without Mercury (grand ideas with no support)
                                                                                                                                                      * Mercury + Jupiter together = Comprehensive understanding with both depth and breadth
________________


7. FORCED VS TRUE ASPECTS: ORB MECHANICS
7.1 True Aspects Defined
Direct Quote:
“We’re only using true aspects right now, which means the sun has a 10-degree orb of influence. The moon has a three-degree orb of influence. So we’re assuming zero to three orbs, three degrees orb right now.”
True Aspect Definition:
A true aspect occurs when both planets involved are within their respective orbs of influence for that aspect.
Orb of Influence:
Each planet has a specific “reach” or sphere of influence:








Planet
	Orb of Influence
	Sun
	10°
	Moon
	3°
	Mercury
	7°
	Venus
	7°
	Mars
	7°
	Jupiter
	9°
	Saturn
	9°
	Uranus
	5°
	Neptune
	5°
	Pluto
	5°


	True Aspect Requirement:
Both planets must be within their orbs for the aspect to be “true.”
Example 1: Sun-Moon Conjunction (True)
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun at 10° Aries
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon at 12° Aries
                                                                                                                                                      * Separation: 2°
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun’s orb: 10° ✓ (2° is within 10°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon’s orb: 3° ✓ (2° is within 3°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Result: TRUE CONJUNCTION
Example 2: Sun-Moon Conjunction (NOT True)
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun at 10° Aries
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon at 15° Aries
                                                                                                                                                      * Separation: 5°
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun’s orb: 10° ✓ (5° is within 10°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Moon’s orb: 3° ✗ (5° exceeds 3°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Result: NOT A TRUE ASPECT (would be “forced”—see below)
True Aspect Experience:
Direct Quote:
“In a true aspect, where, again, the moon’s three-degree orb of influence. This feels very normal. So it’s like, ‘Oh, okay.’”
True aspects feel:
                                                                                                                                                      * Natural - Energy flows as expected
                                                                                                                                                      * Normal - Not strained or awkward
                                                                                                                                                      * Coordinated - Both planets engaged appropriately
                                                                                                                                                      * Functional - Works as designed
________________


7.2 Forced Aspects Defined
Direct Quote:
“Beyond three-degree orbs, it’s a forced aspect. It’s a whole different thing, whole other webinar. But you’ll read about that in the book. … When it’s a forced aspect, you start realizing when you break it down, like, ‘Oh my God!’ It feeds it in, but the second planet didn’t want it or the first planet didn’t want to. Like, the second planet’s reaching back, ‘Hey, give that to me.’ That’s a forced aspect.”
Forced Aspect Definition:
A forced aspect occurs when the geometric relationship exists (e.g., 90° for square), but one or both planets are OUTSIDE their orbs of influence.
How Forced Aspects Happen:
Scenario 1: One Planet Outside Orb
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun at 10° Aries (square to) Saturn at 10° Cancer
                                                                                                                                                      * Separation: exactly 90° ✓
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun’s orb: 10° ✓
                                                                                                                                                      * Saturn’s orb: 9° ✓
                                                                                                                                                      * This is TRUE
BUT:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun at 10° Aries (square to) Neptune at 10° Cancer
                                                                                                                                                      * Separation: exactly 90° ✓
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun’s orb: 10° ✓
                                                                                                                                                      * Neptune’s orb: 5° ✓
                                                                                                                                                      * This is TRUE
NOW:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun at 10° Aries (square to) Neptune at 17° Cancer
                                                                                                                                                      * Separation: 97° (7° past exact square)
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun’s orb: 10° ✓ (7° is within 10°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Neptune’s orb: 5° ✗ (7° exceeds 5°)
                                                                                                                                                      * This is FORCED
Forced Aspect Experience:
Direct Quote:
“When it’s a forced aspect, you start realizing when you break it down, like, ‘Oh my God!’ It feeds it in, but the second planet didn’t want it or the first planet didn’t want to.”
Forced aspects feel:
                                                                                                                                                      * Uncoordinated - One planet engaged, the other isn’t ready
                                                                                                                                                      * Unwanted - “The second planet didn’t want it”
                                                                                                                                                      * Reaching - “The second planet’s reaching back, ‘Hey, give that to me’”
                                                                                                                                                      * Strained - Not natural flow
The Mechanism:
Unwanted Sending:
                                                                                                                                                      * Planet One sends energy through the aspect
                                                                                                                                                      * But Planet Two is outside orb—not ready/able to receive properly
                                                                                                                                                      * Energy arrives but isn’t integrated well
Forced Receiving:
                                                                                                                                                      * Planet Two reaches back to get energy
                                                                                                                                                      * But Planet One is outside orb—not prepared to send that way
                                                                                                                                                      * Creates strain and misalignment
________________


7.3 Minor Aspect Orbs
Direct Quote:
“as it becomes more minor, the orb of influence shrinks. So that 72, you get to a degree and a half, and it takes you to the 75 degree aspect. There is a 75. So if you take 72, a degree and a half, which is minor aspects. That’s the door of influence. You take the 75, a degree and a half, and that meets right there. So you literally go from one aspect to the next one.”
Minor Aspects:
Beyond the seven major aspects, there are minor aspects at smaller degree increments:
Major Aspects (30° increments):
                                                                                                                                                      * 0° (conjunction)
                                                                                                                                                      * 30° (semi-sextile)
                                                                                                                                                      * 60° (sextile)
                                                                                                                                                      * 90° (square)
                                                                                                                                                      * 120° (trine)
                                                                                                                                                      * 150° (quincunx)
                                                                                                                                                      * 180° (opposition)
Minor Aspects (15° increments between majors):
                                                                                                                                                      * 15° (adjunction—mentioned in Transcript 8 reference)
                                                                                                                                                      * 45° (semi-square)
                                                                                                                                                      * 75° (between sextile and square)
                                                                                                                                                      * 105° (between square and trine)
                                                                                                                                                      * 135° (sesquiquadrate)
                                                                                                                                                      * 165° (between quincunx and opposition)
Plus harmonic aspects:
                                                                                                                                                      * 72° (quintile - 360°/5)
                                                                                                                                                      * 144° (biquintile - 2×72°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Others based on different divisions
Orb for Minor Aspects:
Direct Quote:
“as it becomes more minor, the orb of influence shrinks. So that 72, you get to a degree and a half”
Minor aspects have much smaller orbs:
                                                                                                                                                      * Major aspects: Use planet’s full orb (3°-10°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Minor aspects: ~1.5° maximum
Why Smaller Orbs:
Direct Quote:
“So if you take 72, a degree and a half, which is minor aspects. That’s the door of influence. You take the 75, a degree and a half, and that meets right there. So you literally go from one aspect to the next one.”
Minor aspects are transitional stages between major aspects:
                                                                                                                                                      * They connect the major aspects
                                                                                                                                                      * If their orbs were large, they’d overlap with major aspects
                                                                                                                                                      * Smaller orbs keep them distinct
                                                                                                                                                      * You “go from one aspect to the next” through the minor aspects
The 72° Example:
Quintile (72°):
                                                                                                                                                      * Orb: ~1.5°
                                                                                                                                                      * Range: 70.5° to 73.5°
Next Minor Aspect (75°):
                                                                                                                                                      * Orb: ~1.5°
                                                                                                                                                      * Range: 73.5° to 76.5°
They meet at 73.5°, creating continuous coverage without overlap.
________________


7.4 Rolling Aspects
Direct Quote:
“Because when you read your chart, it’s like, ‘Oh, I have a conjunction. That’s not enough. There’s way more going on in your chart than just a conjunction.’ Which planets first? Is it applying? Is it separating? What planets are involved? All of that’s important. Is it a true aspect? Is it a forced aspect? Is it a rolling aspect? All these are different ways that this plays out.”
Rolling Aspect Mentioned:
The instructor references “rolling aspects” as a third category beyond true and forced, but doesn’t elaborate in this webinar.
Likely Definition (Synthesized from Context):
A rolling aspect probably refers to:
                                                                                                                                                      * Aspects that are applying (coming into exactitude)
                                                                                                                                                      * OR aspects that are separating (moving away from exactitude)
                                                                                                                                                      * The aspect is “rolling” toward or away from perfect degree alignment
Why It Matters:
Applying Aspect:
                                                                                                                                                      * Energy building toward exactitude
                                                                                                                                                      * Increasing intensity
                                                                                                                                                      * Future-oriented
Exact Aspect:
                                                                                                                                                      * Maximum intensity
                                                                                                                                                      * Perfect alignment
                                                                                                                                                      * Present moment
Separating Aspect:
                                                                                                                                                      * Energy releasing from exactitude
                                                                                                                                                      * Decreasing intensity
                                                                                                                                                      * Integrating the experience
The Movement Context:
Direct Quote:
“Which planets first? Is it applying? Is it separating?”
The direction of motion affects how the aspect is experienced:
                                                                                                                                                      * Same square, different experience if applying vs separating
                                                                                                                                                      * Applying square = building friction (problem emerging)
                                                                                                                                                      * Separating square = releasing friction (problem being integrated)
________________


7.5 Practical Orb Checking
Chart Reading Protocol:
When analyzing an aspect in a chart:
Step 1: Calculate Exact Degree Separation
                                                                                                                                                      * Planet A at 10° Aries = 10°
                                                                                                                                                      * Planet B at 15° Cancer = 105°
                                                                                                                                                      * Separation: 105° - 10° = 95°
Step 2: Identify Nearest Major Aspect
                                                                                                                                                      * 95° is closest to 90° (square)
                                                                                                                                                      * 95° - 90° = 5° past exact square
Step 3: Check Both Planets’ Orbs
                                                                                                                                                      * Planet A orb: [lookup table]
                                                                                                                                                      * Planet B orb: [lookup table]
                                                                                                                                                      * Is 5° within both orbs?
Step 4: Determine Aspect Type
                                                                                                                                                      * If within both orbs: TRUE ASPECT
                                                                                                                                                      * If outside one/both orbs: FORCED ASPECT
                                                                                                                                                      * If no major aspect within range: Not aspecting (though minor aspects might apply)
Example Calculation:
Sun at 12° Leo, Mars at 20° Scorpio:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun: 12° + 120° (Leo starts at 120°) = 132°
                                                                                                                                                      * Mars: 20° + 210° (Scorpio starts at 210°) = 230°
                                                                                                                                                      * Separation: 230° - 132° = 98°
                                                                                                                                                      * Nearest aspect: 90° (square)
                                                                                                                                                      * Distance from exact: 98° - 90° = 8°
Orb Check:
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun orb: 10° ✓ (8° is within 10°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Mars orb: 7° ✗ (8° exceeds 7°)
                                                                                                                                                      * Result: FORCED SQUARE (Sun wants to engage, Mars is outside orb)
________________


8. PRACTICAL APPLICATION: REAL CHART CASE STUDIES
8.1 Instructor’s Sun Opposite Neptune
Direct Quote:
“in my chart, there’s an opposition. I’m not going to worry about which planets first and second. We can talk about that elsewhere. But I have my sun opposite Neptune retrograde. My Sun inherently has Aries traits because it’s my Ascendant ruler as a Leo rising. My Neptune retrograde has Scorpio traits because it’s my 8th house ruler. And it’s in the 5th house. So we have the 11th, 5th house. So we have Aquarius energy and Leo energy there. And then I’m not going to go any further. But the sun is in opposition to Neptune.”
Chart Details:
Sun:
                                                                                                                                                      * Leo rising (Sun rules Ascendant)
                                                                                                                                                      * Inherent Aries traits (through rulership)
                                                                                                                                                      * 11th house position (Aquarius themes)
Neptune Retrograde:
                                                                                                                                                      * 5th house position (Leo themes)
                                                                                                                                                      * 8th house ruler (Scorpio themes)
                                                                                                                                                      * Retrograde (internalized/review energy)
Opposition Dynamics:
Direct Quote:
“And anything that has to do with like trauma and pain and sensitivity and, you know, even illusion over. the sun which is ego action things i’m doing uh you know purpose father there’s that that pulling away from it saying that neptune is not working with the sun.”
PERCEPTION:
                                                                                                                                                      * Neptune (trauma, pain, sensitivity, illusion) feels like it’s AGAINST Sun (ego, action, purpose, father)
                                                                                                                                                      * Pulling away from each other
                                                                                                                                                      * Neptune “not working with” Sun
                                                                                                                                                      * Experience of Neptune undermining ego/identity
Comparative Example:
Direct Quote:
“like my wife right so she has her sun um she has her sun in pisces My daughter, Isla, has her sun conjunct Neptune, also Venus, but in this case, in this example, sun conjunct Neptune in Pisces. So they have Pisces working together with the sun. I have an opposition to it.”
Wife & Daughter: Sun Conjunct Neptune (Pisces)
                                                                                                                                                      * Sun and Neptune MERGED
