What are the general traits of a window and what energy represents them? Windows are represented by Pisces energy for those exact reasons.”
Direct Quote: “The reflection that you can get from a mirror, which is also Neptune, but also windows, comes from the seventh house quincunx into the twelfth house…So, you’re looking here, and the 12th house is in Cancer. So, there would be some sort of personal ethereal connection with windows, with anything that has to do with things that you can see through or reflective surfaces like that.”
Real Manifestation:
Direct Quote: “One of the things that happened quite often is there would either be bullets, rocks, or glass bottles that were thrown through the window, and they would shatter…And that’s probably because Vesta is here and just kind of kept it intact. So that energy shows right here in my chart. I’ve always had these kinds of like things happen…The film studio that I got in up there in Silmar, my first film studio had a bullet hole that was like in the, in the window…And then there was another one from a BB gun that happened later, and it actually held it in attack and it didn’t fully break either, but it did start splitting the window there…The house in Florida also had one on the big bay window in the front, so those were, were pretty common.”
Mold Around Windows:
Direct Quote: “The eighth house has to do with mold…look around the windows. By the way, I don’t know if you guys caught this, but Ashley and I were talking about; we think there might be mold in the house…However, around the windows, there is mold forming in certain areas within the bedroom where our children sleep.”
This demonstrates the incredible specificity possible with lenses—not just “what’s my 4th house like?” but “Why do I keep having window problems?” and finding precise astrological indicators.
Lens #2: WORK AND CAREER
Primary Focus: 6th house (daily work, routine, service), 10th house (long-term goals, reputation, authority)
What This Lens Answers:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What type of work suits me?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What’s my daily work style and needs?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Where do I have conflicts with coworkers or authority?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What’s my relationship with routine and service?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * How do I function as an employee?
Technical Distinction:
Direct Quote: “For work and career, as you’re looking at a chart, remember, we would normally go to, oh, work is the sixth house, and we definitely start there. Like it’s important to realize that I’m not saying that’s not where we start. You absolutely do start there, so whenever you’re picking a lens, you’re always still starting to the general themes of that area…But then when we look at the lens in terms of the components of that, we have to reach out beyond that.”
The Ascendant Always Matters:
Direct Quote: “Every single lens, in terms of anything that’s going to be actionable…you’re always looking at the ascendant as well. Every single thing is always going to come back to the ascendant and then wherever the ascendant is and anything else in the first house. The ascendant for this chart is in the Jupiter decan of Leo, which goes into the 11th house.”
Example from Instructor’s Chart:
6th House Analysis:
 Direct Quote: “We have the sixth house, there’s the south node, there is an ascendant quincunx to the south node, which can be challenging, obviously, and you guys are crazy in the comments. The energy that’s sitting here with Lilith, and then Juno in retrograde, this has to do with commitment issues with work…”
No major planets in 6th, so look to ruler:
 Direct Quote: “We go to rulership; it leads us into the third house where we do not have a stellium…”
3rd House (Coworkers, Communication):
 Contains Saturn retrograde, Pluto retrograde, Mars—creating complexity around communication, authority, and workplace relationships.
Real-Life Work History:
Direct Quote: “I’ve done a lot of jobs, hundreds of jobs, but there are four companies that I worked for before I became a full-on entrepreneur…RadioShack, AT&T, Sprint, Verizon, they’re all cell phone companies, and what I did on a daily basis was communication through conversation.”
The Gemini/11th House Connection:
Direct Quote: “The ascendant for this chart is in the Jupiter decan of Leo, which goes into the 11th house. So, no matter what lens you’re talking about, there’s always going to be something different; it’s always going to be something tech-oriented.”
This explains why all jobs involved technology (11th house) and communication (3rd house), with teams and social dynamics (11th house groups).
Sales Technique Example:
Direct Quote: “Me and my friend, 11th house, his name is Devar…we would co-sign on each other’s sales…this is Gemini, this banter…I would jump in and be like, oh yeah, cause if you don’t have that, you need this, this, and this…he would do the same thing for me…And it was like we were finishing each other’s sentences and making you guys laugh or like building rapport while he was doing it. He kept you on the hook while I was doing it. And we just made these massive sales.”
Conflict with Authority:
Direct Quote: “For me, my ideas always conflicted with authority because the third house rulers up here with Chiron, and then it is in a quincunx to Saturn and retrograde…”
The Sales Walk Rebellion:
Direct Quote: “I was in this office in Columbia, Maryland, with my two assistant managers, my store manager, the regional manager, the district manager, and the tech manager…telling me that I’ve been a problem for a long time…And then I challenged the regional. I said, …you take the next customer; you show me that the sales walk works. And then I’ll take the customer after that…She got nothing…I took the next one and closed the 12-line business deal…they ended up ditching the sales walk because of that, and I ended up becoming a trainer that went from store to store.”
This perfectly illustrates 3rd house (communication, challenging systems) conflicting with 10th house authority (Chiron = the wound around achievement/authority).
Lens #3: BUSINESS AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP
Primary Focus: 10th house (authority, structure, goals), 6th house (reframed as employees, not self as employee), 7th house (business partners, legal contracts), 3rd house (communication, ideas)
Critical Distinction from Career Lens:
Direct Quote: “Is there a difference between a career lens and building a business…Yes, because your overall focus is, whether or not…they’re subtly different. Whether you’re working for yourself or you’re working for somebody else is gonna be very important.”
How Houses Shift Meaning:
Direct Quote: “Now, if you’re working for yourself, the likelihood for most entrepreneurs is that you don’t have any coworkers, so this house, you’re not gonna be looking for coworkers anymore; you’re just gonna be looking for communication…When you are running your own business, the Sixth House becomes your employees. Do you have employees? How does that work? Does it work?”
7th House Becomes Business Partners:
Direct Quote: “In the Seventh House…how your relationship is with your own business. That’s added now in the Seventh House when you’re talking about your own business.”
Instructor’s Business Experience:
Direct Quote: “When I try to be the manager of everything, it’s too much…I have to have a team; I always have to have a team because when I try to be the manager of everything, it’s too much…same thing happens with…TikTok…Mystic Rebels…when Ashley comes in and kind of shows the other side of it and takes over some of the responsibilities…Mystic Rebels is flourishing.”
This demonstrates that even with strong 10th house (Chiron demanding achievement), the chart shows need for team (11th house emphasis) rather than solo management.
Lens #4: MONEY AND FINANCE
Primary Focus: 2nd house (value, resources, earning), 11th house (income, variety), 8th house (shared resources, others’ money), 1st house (how you take action to earn)
What This Lens Answers:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * How do I make money?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What’s my relationship with resources and value?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Where do financial opportunities come from?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What are my spending patterns?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * How do I handle money management?
The Action Component:
Direct Quote: “So, for instance, if you’re looking at money overall and you’re looking at money as a lens, so basically you’re looking at money and finance. So you’re looking at the first house when you are going to, what are you going to do that is going to be the activity that’s going to bring you money? That’s the first house. How does money start? How does money happen?”
Example from Instructor’s Chart:
Direct Quote: “The value part of it is through, you know, details, through, you know, analyzing things, through, you know, getting to the numbers as they project out in the real world, and then the services. And then that leads into the 11th house of being different, of, you know, going above and beyond, of, again, technology…”
2nd House Ruler in Retrograde:
Direct Quote: “Because my second house ruler is up here in retrograde in the Gemini decan of Gemini, and in opposition to my seventh house…”
Multiple Income Streams:
Direct Quote: “The retrograde is, you know, you have to pull those things inward; you can’t just project them outward…when I had my film stuff, when I did the fetish film stuff, we had something called custom orders…then what I would do is to get more money out of the same thing, which is retrograde in increments, which is the 11th house energy. I would say, Hey, let’s offer partial customs…and then basically off of the same thing that I was making money off of, I would get this plus this plus this plus this and quadruple my income. This is why I was so successful doing it; it’s actually sitting there in my chart.”
Gemini = Dual Income:
 The instructor earned money through hourly wages + commission, perfectly reflecting Gemini energy (duality, two sources).
Financial Quirks:
Direct Quote: “I’m always rounding up. So if something is two dollars and 1 cents, I round up to $3. If something is 10 dollars and $0.01, I round up to eleven…And then whenever I take in income, I round down…That’s my Chiron in the 10th. Always undershooting my estimate of how much I’m going to make.”
This financial behavior is directly readable in the chart through the money lens—showing how specific and personalized lens work becomes.
Lens #5: MENTAL HEALTH
Primary Focus: 6th house (health, mind-body connection), 3rd house (neurology, mental processing), Mercury/Virgo (analytical mind)
Critical Correction of Common Misconception:
Direct Quote: “Mental health is one that you’re gonna get a lot of. First place you always look for mental health is where? A lot of people think it’s the 12th house in Neptune; it is not. What was that? Sixth, yes. The sixth house is where you’re gonna look. Why do we say the sixth house? For anybody that has taken all the classes, you know that the sixth house is naturally Virgo ruled. Virgo is ruled by Mercury. On the outward analytical side of it, the earth expression of it, the reality expression of it. And because it rules our health…”
The 3rd/6th Connection:
Direct Quote: “It goes along with the herbalism physiology that Ashley will be teaching pretty soon, that there are multiple brains in the body, the digestive system having one of them. So you have your head brain, and then you have your digestive brain, and that digestive brain is what contributes to the real world…your sixth house is also all the details.”
Stress and Squares:
Direct Quote: “So these two houses contribute to stress; stress contributes naturally through a square harshly…the third house, the sixth house, and the ninth house, with the 12th house all contributing in different levels to each other.”
Example from Instructor’s Chart:
Direct Quote: “In my South node being in the sixth house, I am naturally akin to that stress. So it gives me that, that superpower. It’s like, no matter how stressed I am, for the most part, I can handle more stress than most people, but I’m not supposed to, you’re not supposed to, we are not supposed to do that.”
Direct Quote: “My mental health always comes from overdoing stress from emotional trauma that’s trapped…All these retrogrades basically tell you that I put that stress on myself.”
Important Guidance:
Direct Quote: “Just because you CAN handle high stress doesn’t mean you SHOULD. The chart shows capacity but also warns of danger.”

The Intensity Factor (8th House):
Direct Quote: “The eighth house is other people’s resources, but it’s also intensity. So it’s going to be, how intense are your workouts? And what type of workouts are going to give you the most benefit that is going to lead into the transformation of your physical body?”
Example from Instructor’s Chart:
Direct Quote: “Leo Rising’s base for the intensity is not intense unless that eighth house ruler’s back in the eighth house or related to Pluto…What would work really well for you would be either like hit training or something that really gets your heart going to a point where it’s like pounding a little bit. We just have to make sure it doesn’t overdo it.”
Variety Matters:
Direct Quote: “My motivations behind doing into something different, it can’t be the same every single time. There has to be some sort of hands element in there, but also some sort of mental, um, involvement in what I’m doing.”
Lens #7: NUTRITION

But when we get into Ceres, this is literal nutrition, like physical nurturing in terms of nutrition and things you physically do for taking care of yourself and taking care of other people on a physical level, nurturing…The value that you’re gonna get, and the resources and the types of food, is gonna be here in the second house. And again, for this one, it points again into the 11th house, which is all about that variety. It’s all about like small foods. This person is going to be a snacker because the third house going into Gemini in the 11th, so you would have to utilize that energy and realize that this person needs to snack.”
Real-Life Pattern:
Direct Quote: “I would have my bigger meals around the time I was doing physical activity, but then we would always have smaller meals and supplemental snacks…I had to do it that way. I couldn’t do the like three or four meals a day. It just doesn’t work that way. There are people who can, and it will show that in their chart.”
Lens #8: SELF-LOVE AND SELF-WORTH

The Identity Connection:

Grand Trine Example:

Your mental health is gonna lead into your sense of stability and your long-term goals and sense of achievement and what you’ve done over time, which should lead directly back in. It should tell you what to do to lead back into your own sense of self-worth.”
Lens #9: SPIRITUALITY, FAITH, BELIEF, PHILOSOPHY, INTUITION

                                                                                                                                                                                             * What do I believe and why?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * How does intuition function for me?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What’s my philosophical framework?

Direct Quote: “When you’re looking at the entire chart, also says, like, within the lens of spirituality, how does my mindset have to be? You know what? What would I think about? What would be the way that I kind of communicate spirituality? The fifth house would be like, what’s the point in the spirituality? Like, why, why would I be spiritual? What would I need to gain out of it?..The philosophy, the mindset, the mythology, the storytelling of spirituality would be all in the ninth house.”
Example from Instructor’s Chart:
Direct Quote: “With my North Node in the 12th house, it’s also saying that spirituality is going to be uncomfortable, which you’ve heard me say over and over and over…”
The Logic/Intuition Balance:
Direct Quote: “When it comes to your spirituality and your intuition, this is how you take action on your intuition and whether or not you trust your intuition to lead into the things that you do. When we just do things without any sort of intuition, we can get lost very easily because this is conflicting with this. However, that intuition needs to lead into what we choose to do, and that’s why the 12th leads into the first and semi-sextile.”
Lens #10: HOBBIES AND RECREATION

You can start with the sun as well to see, you know, what type of energy that is…For me, having, you know, one to two friends around, you know, small groups, and being able to bring them in and, you know, play recreation. I love puzzle games, figuring things out, which is 11th house. I love word games, like, you know, word searches and crosswords…that’s all Gemini’s type of energy.”
Video Games (Technology + Media):
Direct Quote: “In the fifth house, would be the other side of it, video games, which would be technology and media…I’ll go buy it for myself. It’s that type of energy.”
Lens #11: LOVE AND RELATIONSHIPS
Primary Focus: 7th house (partnership, reciprocation), 5th house (vitality, purpose), 8th house (depth, intimacy, intensity), Venus (love, attraction)
What This Lens Answers:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * How do I love?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What do I need in partnership?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Where are my relationship patterns?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What creates depth and intimacy for me?
The Multi-House Necessity:
Direct Quote: “So one of the things people get hung up on is they’ll say, oh, love and relationships. If I want to know about love, I go to Venus or I go to the seventh house…And it’s like, yes, for certain parts of it, but love is not just how you relate to another person; it’s not just the conversation you have…so much more that goes into it.”
The 5th House Purpose Component:
Direct Quote: “Being able to look at everything under a lens. So, like I said, when I talked about love, understanding that the fifth house has to do with vitality. Well, why are you in the relationship? A lot of people forget that. So, they get into the relationship. They have this reciprocating nature. But the fifth house element is gone, which is the purpose. Why do we get into this relationship? And when you forget that fifth house in the relationship, you don’t have a relationship anymore. You just have you with somebody else, and you’re just kind of coexisting.”
The 8th House Depth Component:
Direct Quote: “Then, the eighth house is that intensity; it’s that deep bond; it’s that intimacy. It’s getting deeper into whatever is going on with the sixth house, which stems off of the purpose of it. So one thing that is true of all lenses is that the eighth house is, you know, why would we get closer? What are we looking for? What’s deeper? Because the fifth house and the purpose is going to conflict with whether or not we can go deeper. So once we’ve assessed the purpose, then we have to say, well, how do we dive deeper? So we’re adding more to the purpose of this, and we’re, you know, bringing something closer together. Into a level of depth that we don’t want to get lost in, but we want to bring to again to the purpose so that the purpose enhances intimacy and any sort of bond that we have with whatever we’re doing.”
The Complete Relationship Picture:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 7th House = How you relate, reciprocate, balance, partner
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 5th House = Why you’re in the relationship (purpose, vitality, fun)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 8th House = How deep you go (intimacy, transformation, shared vulnerability)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Venus = What you’re attracted to, how you love
                                                                                                                                                                                             * All must work together for a healthy relationship
Lens #12: COMMUNITY
Primary Focus: 11th house (groups, friendship networks, collective belonging), Aquarius/Uranus (innovation, equality, community values)
What This Lens Answers:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What community do I need?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * How do I connect with groups?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * What’s my role in collective settings?
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Where do I find my tribe?
Lens Combination Example:
Direct Quote: “So if somebody is asking you, like, I want more community and, you know, I want to be in a community, you know, I want to do hobbies, but I want to find a community within the hobbies, well, where the hobby itself is the lens. Then we need to look in the 11th house, and we have to also look at what a community needs. So there’s two lenses: one is community and how you would assess with community, but then the second one is community within the lens of recreation. So you can dive deeper and deeper and deeper, depending on the question on lenses, to get the type of insight that is going to be beneficial for you or the person that’s asking.”
This demonstrates nested lenses—you can apply a lens WITHIN another lens for highly specific questions.
________________


SECTION 4: COMPARING LENS PERSPECTIVES ON THE SAME CHART
The Power of Lens Switching
One of the most powerful demonstrations in this webinar is how the instructor repeatedly uses the same natal chart (their own) to show completely different stories emerging through different lenses.
The Chart Details (Instructor - Leo Rising):
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Rising: Leo (Jupiter decan → 11th house)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 4th House: Scorpio, ruled by Pluto in 3rd, Jupiter in 4th
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 6th House: South Node, Lilith, Juno retrograde
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 3rd House: Saturn retrograde, Pluto retrograde, Mars
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 10th House: Chiron
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 2nd House: Ruler in retrograde, Gemini decan, opposition to 7th
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 12th House: Cancer, North Node, Pluto decan
Same Chart, Different Stories
Through the HOME Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Childhood poverty, section 8 housing
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Repeated window breakages (bullets, rocks, bottles)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Mold around windows in children’s bedroom
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Always needing “entrance pizzazz” (Leo rising affecting home entrance)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Pluto in 3rd ruling 4th = trauma around home/siblings/early environment
Through the CAREER Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Technology sales jobs (RadioShack, AT&T, Sprint, Verizon)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Communication-based work (3rd house emphasis)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Team dynamics (11th house)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Conflict with authority (3rd house/Chiron square)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Success as trainer after challenging corporate structure
Through the MONEY Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Dual income streams (Gemini)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Commission + hourly (duality)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Multiple revenue sources (11th house variety)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Creative monetization (partial customs, clone apps)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Rounding up expenses, rounding down income (Chiron in 10th)
Through the MENTAL HEALTH Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * High stress tolerance (South Node in 6th)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * But shouldn’t push it (retrogrades warning)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Stress from trapped emotional trauma
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Self-imposed pressure (retrogrades = internalized)
Through the FITNESS Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Needs variety in workouts (11th house)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Can’t do same routine repeatedly
                                                                                                                                                                                             * HIT training suits chart
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Mental + physical combination needed
Through the NUTRITION Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Snacker (Gemini/3rd/11th)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Can’t do 3-4 meals per day
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Multiple small meals throughout day
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Timing meals around physical activity
Through the SELF-LOVE Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Self-worth tied to mental health
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Grand trine connecting worth → mental health → achievement → back to worth
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Identity (Leo rising) dependent on sense of value
Through the SPIRITUALITY Lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * North Node in 12th = spirituality is uncomfortable
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Growth requires engaging with unseen/unknown
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Logic/intuition must balance (3rd house conflicts with 12th)
The Key Insight:
Direct Quote: “You can do this for any theme…whatever that topic is that you want to do, that could be a larger topic, like a set house. And this works really well for people who are trying to, like, you want to understand what you need in a house and home.”
Without lenses, you’d just describe placements generically. With lenses, the same exact chart reveals:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Specific childhood trauma (home lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Optimal career path (career lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Money-making strategies (money lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Health vulnerabilities (mental health lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Exercise preferences (fitness lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Eating patterns (nutrition lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Self-worth patterns (self-love lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Spiritual challenges (spirituality lens)
Each lens extracts different information from the same data, making interpretation infinitely more precise and useful.
________________


SECTION 5: ADVANCED LENS TECHNIQUES
Nested Lenses (Lenses Within Lenses)
Direct Quote: “So if somebody is asking you, like, I want more community and, you know, I want to be in a community, you know, I want to do hobbies, but I want to find a community within the hobbies, well, where the hobby itself is the lens. Then we need to look in the 11th house, and we have to also look at what a community needs. So there’s two lenses: one is community and how you would assess with community, but then the second one is community within the lens of recreation.”
How Nested Lenses Work:
                                                                                                                                                                                             1. Start with the broader lens (e.g., Hobbies = 5th house)
                                                                                                                                                                                             2. Apply a secondary lens (e.g., Community = 11th house)
                                                                                                                                                                                             3. Look for overlap and interaction between the two themes
                                                                                                                                                                                             4. Synthesize: “Where do 5th house themes meet 11th house themes?”
Other Nested Lens Examples:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “How do I make money (2nd) through my career (10th)?” → Money lens within Career lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “What community (11th) supports my spirituality (12th)?” → Community lens within Spirituality lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “How does my home (4th) affect my mental health (6th)?” → Home lens within Mental Health lens
Component Lenses (Zooming Into Details)
The windows example demonstrates component lenses:
Direct Quote: “You start breaking down the different components of the house, and you start thinking, what are windows? What energy represents windows?..Windows are represented by Pisces energy for those exact reasons.”
How to Create Component Lenses:
                                                                                                                                                                                             1. Identify the larger lens (e.g., Home)
                                                                                                                                                                                             2. Break it into physical or conceptual components (rooms, windows, doors, foundation, etc.)
                                                                                                                                                                                             3. Assign archetypal energy to each component based on symbolic meaning
                                                                                                                                                                                             4. Track those specific placements in the chart
Examples of Components:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Home: Windows (Pisces/Neptune/12th), Doors (Aries/Mars/1st), Kitchen (Cancer/Moon/4th), Basement (Scorpio/Pluto/8th)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Body: Head (Aries/1st), Digestive system (Virgo/6th), Knees (Capricorn/10th), Nervous system (Gemini/3rd)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Career: Daily tasks (6th), Long-term goals (10th), Coworkers (3rd), Authority (Saturn/10th)
The Natural Rulership Warning
Direct Quote: “Don’t get hung up on the natural rulership, I’m going to have to go back to natural rulership, some people are getting hung up onto it. Natural rulership contributes to related energies, not to energy flow. So when you’re seeing like the natural of the first house is Aries, you’re not going to Mars to complete this. Where Leo is, you’re using Mars as an ad side, the plus sign…while that’s happening, I’m also, I take action in this way at the same time. So it’s a combination…don’t get stuck on ‘natural ruler’ for the flow of meaning.”
What This Means:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Natural rulership (Aries = 1st house, Taurus = 2nd house, etc.) provides background themes
                                                                                                                                                                                             * But energy flow comes from the actual chart placements
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Example: Leo rising person doesn’t follow Mars for 1st house energy—they follow Sun’s placement
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Mars adds flavor (the “plus sign”), but Sun shows the actual flow
Critical for App Implementation:
 The app must distinguish between:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chart-specific rulers (primary for energy flow)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Natural rulers (secondary for thematic context)
Fusion Cusps and Zero-Degree Placements
Student Question: “Do you merge ascendant with the 12th ascendant at zero degrees with the Twelfth House, same at 29 with the…?”
Direct Quote: “You don’t merge them. So you’re talking about a, you’re talking about ascendant that’s sitting at zero degrees, it’s still at zero degrees. But when it’s in the fusion cusp area…I’m gonna use my zero, for instance; it’s definitively a Fourth House placement. It’s definitively a Scorpio placement in the Pluto deck. And however, when I read it together, its influence is pushing Fourth House energy into the Third House…But you’re always taking that energy and you’re merging it in with this, and this becomes a secondary ruler. So that energy is fused in with the Third House, but it stems from the Fourth House.”
Fusion Cusp Rule:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Placement is factually in one house
                                                                                                                                                                                             * But influences the adjacent house when within ~5 degrees of cusp
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Read the primary house first
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Then add the influence/fusion of the adjacent house as secondary layer
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Both are active, but one is primary
________________


SECTION 6: INTEGRATION WITH OTHER ALCHEMISTIC CONCEPTS
Lenses + Delegates (Transcript 13)
Direct Quote: “A lot of the things you’ve learned recently, like PHSR, Planet House sign ruler, and then cycling it back, that’s obviously been something that, you know, we want to focus on as well.”
How They Work Together:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Delegates show WHERE house themes are expressed
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Lenses show WHY you’re looking at those houses
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Example: Money lens (2nd house) + delegates show where 2nd house themes flow through the chart
Process:
                                                                                                                                                                                             1. Apply lens (e.g., Career lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             2. Identify primary houses (6th, 10th)
                                                                                                                                                                                             3. Find delegates for those houses
                                                                                                                                                                                             4. Trace delegate networks through the chart
                                                                                                                                                                                             5. Interpret career themes through delegate locations
Lenses + Aspect Spectrum (Transcript 10)
Direct Quote: “And the grand trine, I didn’t talk about the grand trines before, but the grand trine from there is gonna lead into your mental health. Your mental health is gonna lead into your sense of stability and your long-term goals and sense of achievement and what you’ve done over time, which should lead directly back in.”
How They Work Together:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Lenses identify which aspects matter for the question
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Aspect Spectrum shows the journey/flow between planets
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Planet One/Planet Two dynamics operate within the lens context
Example:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Self-Love lens highlights 2nd house
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Grand trine between 2nd, 6th, 10th creates supportive flow
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Self-worth (2nd) → Mental health (6th) → Achievement (10th) → back to self-worth
Lenses + Progressions + Relocations
Direct Quote: “You always read the natal chart first; that is your baseline energies. And then, to understand the phases of life, you will go into the progressions. And then, if you’ve moved, you’re gonna add the relocations. I would, the order I would do it would actually be natal chart relocations. I would read those two together, and then I would go into the progressions to see where you are in life. Because if your energy is completely different, we have to add that in there.”
The Layered Reading Process:
Layer 1: Natal Chart Through Lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “What does my natal chart say about career?”
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Baseline blueprint, unchanging foundation
Layer 2: Relocation Chart Through Same Lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “How does living in this city affect my career?”
                                                                                                                                                                                             * House cusps shift, changing which houses are emphasized
Layer 3: Progressions Through Same Lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “Where am I in my career evolution right now?”
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Shows current phase, what’s being activated
All Three Combined:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Natal = potential
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Relocation = environmental modification
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Progression = current activation
Lenses + Electional Astrology
Direct Quote: “I’m not going to talk about electional charts. You read those differently; I’m going to do an electional webinar at some point.”
Brief Mention:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Electional charts require lens application for optimal timing
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Example: Starting a business → apply Business lens to find best date/time
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Different from natal lens application (future webinar will detail)
________________


SECTION 7: EXTENSIVE Q&A - STUDENT QUESTIONS
Q1: Order of Reading - Natal, Relocation, Progression
Student Question: “Would you read the lenses first with natal relocated progress chart?”
Direct Quote: “You always read the natal chart first; that is your baseline energies. And then, to understand the phases of life, you will go into the progressions. And then, if you’ve moved, you’re gonna add the relocations. I would, the order I would do it would actually be natal chart relocations. I would read those two together, and then I would go into the progressions to see where you are in life. Because if your energy is completely different, we have to add that in there.”
The Proper Order:
                                                                                                                                                                                             1. Natal chart (baseline)
                                                                                                                                                                                             2. Relocation chart (if person moved)
                                                                                                                                                                                             3. Read natal + relocation together
                                                                                                                                                                                             4. Then add progressions (current phase)
Q2: Career Lens vs. Business Lens - What’s the Difference?
Student Question: “Is there a difference between a career lens and building a business like the reading did for me based on my natal?”
Direct Quote: “Yes, because your overall focus is, whether or not, I mean, they’re subtly different. Whether you’re working for yourself or you’re working for somebody else is gonna be very important.”
Key Distinctions:
Career/Work Lens (Employee):
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 6th house = your daily work, service, routine
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 3rd house = coworkers
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 10th house = your boss, authority over you
                                                                                                                                                                                             * You serve someone else’s vision
Business/Entrepreneurship Lens (Self-Employed):
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 6th house = your employees (if you have them)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 3rd house = communication, not coworkers
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 10th house = your authority, your structure, your management
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 7th house = business partners, contracts
                                                                                                                                                                                             * You create the vision
Direct Quote: “When you are running your own business, the Sixth House becomes your employees. Do you have employees? How does that work? Does it work?”
Direct Quote: “In the Seventh House…how your relationship is with your own business. That’s added now in the Seventh House when you’re talking about your own business.”
Q3: Fusion Cusps and Zero-Degree Placements
Student Question: “Do you merge ascendant with the 12th ascendant at zero degrees with the Twelfth House, same at 29 with the…?”
Direct Quote: “You don’t merge them…when it’s in the fusion cusp area…I’m gonna use my zero, for instance; it’s definitively a Fourth House placement. It’s definitively a Scorpio placement in the Pluto deck. And however, when I read it together, its influence is pushing Fourth House energy into the Third House.”
The Answer:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Factually in one house (primary)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * But influences adjacent house (secondary)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Read primary house first
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Add fusion influence from adjacent house
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Both matter, but hierarchy exists
Q4: Saturn in 9th House and Anxiety
Student Question: “Saturn was in the ninth and Aries, how would anxiety present?”
Direct Quote: “So it would, it would not present. So, okay, so basically you’re saying if Saturn was up here, so basically, um, it’s not as much about stress in that case, as much as it is about overwhelm, and then that overwhelm leads into stress…this would be a much more outward level where I would over-exaggerate…taking on too much responsibility, feeling like I could do everything and, um, trying to be a perfectionist in every single thing I’m doing while also trying to do everything without allowing myself to get anything really done, especially since my Saturn’s in retrograde. And then that would contribute to probably more stress than I have now.”
The Distinction:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Saturn in 6th = stress directly
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Saturn in 9th = overwhelm → then stress
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Different pathway, different manifestation
Q5: 12th House Placements and Unconscious Awareness
Student Question: “If you have a lot of 12th house placements, can that mean that you have an awareness of the unconscious?”
Direct Quote: “You could have an awareness of the unconscious. Your energy is definitely directed into that realm, of the unconscious of the higher power, so to speak; you’re, you’re more in tune usually…but usually you’re more in tune with the fact that there is a higher power, um, and tied into that energy. And it becomes a lot of what dictates the things that happen in your life. And they all lead kind of into, well, it’s all leads into hope. This all leads into creativity or inspiration, all leads into things that are behind the scenes and unknown…but it is also, um, with a higher power. Yes, and more of an awareness of it.”
The Answer: Yes, but the type of awareness depends on specific placements and aspects within the 12th house.
Q6: Energy Cleaning and Spirituality
Student Question: “Energy cleaning, energy is Aquarian energy?”
Direct Quote: “So depending on how Aquarius, the 11th house ruler, Uranus, um, and whatever’s in the 11th house, however, that sits there is going to tell you what, you know, if energy is a big part of it…energy is Aquarian energy. And then spirituality is your 12th house ruler, or Neptune, or the 12th house itself—all that Pisces energy.”
The Distinction:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Energy work, energy awareness = 11th house/Aquarius/Uranus
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Spirituality, faith, connection to higher power = 12th house/Neptune/Pisces
Q7: Complex Water House Configuration
Student Question: “Because you have, I’m sorry, cancer in twelve, and you said before about the triangle. And what if it was Scorpio in twelve? Pisces in fourth. And can cancer in eighth house…”
Direct Quote: “So, yeah, you’re on. You have your unconscious plays out through intensity. OK, and through traumas…Now you have Pisces down here. Yes, yeah, Pisces. Yeah, so your emotional comfort, your emotional stability is within the unknown, is within the ability to go with the flow. There is a natural ebb and flow that you you emotionally have to kind of ride like this. And that it’s anything that has to do with your safety and security is within a greater power. You know, knowing that you’re going to feel safe, and then your eighth house is going to be in cancer. So your traumas are usually related to emotional wounds or the mother or the family, especially on the feminine side as well. And then your emotion, your trauma is also processed and held within your emotions and how you emotionally react to things. It’s also your level of intensity contributes to how you emotionally respond to things.”
This demonstrates:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * How to read interlocking house themes
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Water houses (4th, 8th, 12th) in water signs create emotional intensification
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Each house contributes its specific flavor to the overall emotional/intuitive landscape
Q8: Natural Rulership Confusion
Student Question (implied from instructor’s response): Confusion about whether to use natural rulers (Aries = 1st, Taurus = 2nd, etc.) or chart-specific rulers.
Direct Quote: “Don’t get hung up on the natural rulership, I’m going to have to go back to natural rulership, some people are getting hung up onto it. Natural rulership contributes to related energies, not to energy flow. So when you’re seeing like the natural of the first house is Aries, you’re not going to Mars to complete this. Where Leo is, you’re using Mars as an ad side, the plus sign.”
The Rule:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chart-specific rulers = energy flow (primary)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Natural rulers = thematic context (secondary, “ad side”)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Don’t trace natural rulers for delegate chains
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Use them to add flavor/theme, not structure
Q9: Age and Physical Limitations in Fitness
Student Question (paraphrased): “What about knees at my age?”
Direct Quote: “First thing I would tell you is, you said knees at my age, I would knock that off…age is just a marker…(motivational anecdote about 88-year-old martial arts master)…we have to have that resilience and that safe house energy as well.”
The Guidance:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Age beliefs create limitations
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chart shows capacity, not age restrictions
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Work with chart indicators, not cultural age expectations
________________


SECTION 8: COMMON MISTAKES AND CORRECTIONS
Mistake #1: Relying Only on One House/Planet Per Theme
Direct Quote: “So one of the things people get hung up on is they’ll say, oh, love and relationships. If I want to know about love, I go to Venus or I go to the seventh house…And it’s like, yes, for certain parts of it, but love is not just how you relate to another person…there’s so much more that goes into it.”
The Problem: Oversimplification leads to incomplete, generic readings.
The Solution: Use multiple houses, planets, and relationships for any theme. Love requires 5th (purpose), 7th (relating), 8th (depth), Venus (attraction).
Mistake #2: Treating Archetypes as Literal Definitions
Direct Quote: “In astrology, we tend to forget when we give the names of archetypes to planets and houses specifically, we start forgetting that everything has to work together…we’re not dealing with definitions and we’re not dealing with placements; those are building blocks for a bigger picture.”
The Problem: Keywords become rigid boxes that limit interpretation.
The Solution: Treat archetypes as flexible symbolic languages that blend and interact.
Mistake #3: Ignoring Natural Rulership vs. Chart-Specific Rulership
Direct Quote: “Don’t get hung up on the natural rulership…Natural rulership contributes to related energies, not to energy flow.”
The Problem: Tracing natural rulers instead of chart-specific rulers.
The Solution: Use chart placements for energy flow; natural rulers add thematic context only.
Mistake #4: Confirmation Bias When Reading Your Own Chart
Direct Quote: “When you guys get into reading your own charts, you want to do that as well. You wanna do your best to be like, I’m gonna pretend that this is not me because it can be very easy for you to get hung up on making it make sense and, you know, basically confirmation bias as opposed to actually reading the chart.”
The Problem: Forcing the chart to match what you already believe about yourself.
The Solution: Read your own chart as if it belongs to a stranger; let insights emerge objectively.
Mistake #5: Misassigning Mental Health to 12th House
Direct Quote: “Mental health is one that you’re gonna get a lot of. First place you always look for mental health is where? A lot of people think it’s the 12th house in Neptune; it is not…Sixth, yes. The sixth house is where you’re gonna look.”
The Problem: Cultural assumption that mental health = unconscious (12th).
The Solution:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 6th house = mental health, mind-body connection (primary)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * 12th house = escapism, spirituality, unconscious (secondary, for spiritual mental health only)
Mistake #6: Not Checking Degrees and Order
Implied throughout: Order of planets by degree matters for activation sequence, but this is often forgotten when applying lenses.
The Solution: Always note degree order of planets in houses, especially when multiple planets are present.
Mistake #7: Applying Wrong Lens for the Question
Direct Quote: “Each question is going to lead you to how you’re reading the lenses.”
The Problem: Using a generic “tell me about my chart” approach rather than question-specific lens.
The Solution: Always clarify the question first, then select the appropriate lens (or multiple lenses).
________________


SECTION 9: MASTERY GUIDANCE - BECOMING PROFICIENT WITH LENSES
How Long Does It Take to Learn?
No specific timeframe is given, but the instructor emphasizes:
Direct Quote: “What seems to be easy for me, it’s not always some people’s energies, some energies of the transits, even when I do those reports, they’re more difficult to to decipher.”
Implication: Mastery is individual and requires consistent practice. Some charts/questions are easier than others.
Recommended Practice Exercises
1. Single Chart, Multiple Lenses:
 Take your own chart and read it through:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Home lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Career lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Money lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Mental health lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Fitness lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Self-love lens
Notice how different insights emerge each time.
2. Objective Self-Reading:
Direct Quote: “When you guys get into reading your own charts, you want to do that as well. You wanna do your best to be like, I’m gonna pretend that this is not me because it can be very easy for you to get hung up on making it make sense and, you know, basically confirmation bias as opposed to actually reading the chart. So we wanna make sure that that’s what you’re doing, that you are pulling that energy in as though you’re giving somebody else advice and that’ll be super helpful for you.”
Practice reading your chart as if it’s a stranger’s.
3. PHSR (Planet House Sign Ruler) Cycling:
Direct Quote: “A lot of the things you’ve learned recently, like PHSR, Planet House sign ruler, and then cycling it back, that’s obviously been something that, you know, we want to focus on as well.”
For any lens:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Identify relevant planet
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Note its house
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Note its sign
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Find sign’s ruler
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Locate ruler’s house
                                                                                                                                                                                             * Cycle back to original question
4. Question-Driven Practice:
Direct Quote: “Each question is going to lead you to how you’re reading the lenses.”
Practice with specific questions:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “How do I find community within my hobbies?” (nested lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “What’s blocking my career progress?” (career lens)
                                                                                                                                                                                             * “Why do I struggle with self-worth?” (self-love lens)
5. Comparative Lens Practice:
Read the same chart event through different lenses:
                                                                                                                                                                                             * A job change through Career lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * The same job change through Money lens
                                                                                                                                                                                             * The same job change through Self-Love lens
See how perspectives shift.
How Do You Know You’re Using Lenses Correctly?
Signs of Proficiency:
                                                                                                                                                                                             1. Specificity - Your interpretations become highly specific rather than generic
                                                                                                                                                                                             2. Actionability - You can give practical, implementable advice
                                                                                                                                                                                             3. Context Awareness - You automatically ask “what lens does this question require?”
                                                                                                                                                                                             4. Synthesis - You can integrate multiple lenses for complex questions
                                                                                                                                                                                             5. Real-World Confirmation - Clients/friends confirm accuracy of lens-based insights
Direct Quote: “Being able to look at everything under a lens…each question is going to lead you to how you’re reading the lenses.”
When you instinctively know which lens to apply for any question, you’ve achieved proficiency.
________________


SECTION 10: APP DEVELOPMENT SPECIFICATIONS
Data Architecture for Lens-Based Interpretation
Required Data Points:
                                                                                                                                                                                             1. Full Natal Chart Data
