                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Student discoveries contribute to system growth
________________


SECTION 3: THE 10 MYTHS - COMPLETE BREAKDOWN
MYTH #1: “The Ascendant is the mask you wear”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “A lot of times, you’ll hear the ascendant is the mask you wear; that’s pretty common. That’s even in astrology books. It is not.”
Why It’s Wrong:
Direct Quote: “So when they say that the ascendant is not you, and it’s the mask you wear, it makes absolutely no sense because if it was the mask we wear, there would be some sort of hidden element to it. There would be some sort of secrecy, and there would be some sort of trickery in there, but Aries energy acts way too fast to be fake. It is our first natural reaction; when it’s in its highest vibration, it is our response. But it is always us; it is always how we do it.”
The Logical Breakdown:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * A “mask” implies concealment, something fake or put on
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * The Ascendant/1st house corresponds to Aries energy
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Aries is the fastest, most impulsive energy in the zodiac
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You cannot fake what happens instantly
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * The Ascendant is your immediate, authentic reaction
The Truth:
Direct Quote: “The ascendant is not your mask you wear; the ascendant is your motivations. Remember, the ascendant is bringing in the sun to reality as it aligns with your sense of self and who you are. You’re bringing purpose to your actions. What do we call that? Purpose to actions, motivations. This is your reason; this is your passion.”
The Ascendant IS:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Vitality Anchor (technical term in Alchemistic Astrology)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Motivations - why you do what you do
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Physical body and appearance
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * First reactions and immediate responses
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * How purpose (Sun) becomes action (physical reality)
Direct Quote: “It is not the mask. It really is you. It’s just what we do in the physical form.”
Nuances:
Direct Quote: “On the baseline, the ascendant is not your mask; it is your motivations.”
Complex aspects might make someone “more secretive,” but that’s a function of aspects, not the Ascendant itself.
Practical Implications:
If you believe the mask myth:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll dismiss clients’ Ascendant as “not the real them”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll miss understanding their core motivations
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll misinterpret immediate reactions as “false fronts”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll overlook the physical body connection
Corrective Guidance:
Always treat the Ascendant as:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. The authentic, immediate self
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Physical presence and body
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. Motivational force driving actions
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. The mechanism by which Sun’s purpose becomes real
Integration:
The Ascendant is the first Vitality Anchor, working with the Midheaven (second Vitality Anchor) to structure how life purpose manifests.
________________


MYTH #2: “The 8th house shows how you’re going to die”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “The second one is the eighth house, which shows you how you’re going to die, or how I said you’ll exit this life. Again, it doesn’t.”
Why It’s Wrong:
Direct Quote: “The idea that the eighth house is how you’re going to die is absolutely ridiculous.”
The Evidence - Real Charts:
Example 1: Instructor’s Wife’s Sister
Direct Quote: “We have my wife’s sister, and she gave me permission to be able to talk about this. So we have, these are the energies here. Now, what we wanted to look at is the idea in pop culture; astrology is that the eighth house shows us how we’re going to die. So, we go to her eighth house; she did die, she passed away.”
8th House Configuration:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Chiron in 8th house at 18 degrees
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Pop astrology would say: “Chiron = wound, 8th = death, therefore wounded death”
Actual Cause of Death:
 Direct Quote: “She died of an accidental drug overdose. That’s how she died, and she died at home.”
The 8th house revealed NOTHING about:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Manner of death (overdose)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Location of death (home)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Circumstances (accidental)
Direct Quote: “And as you can see, nothing happened in her eighth house, nothing because all death is based off of transits.”
Example 2: Robin Williams
Direct Quote: “So the question is, does the eighth house show how they died? So we know how Robin Williams passed. Most of us know that it was hanging and that this one was something specific. So Chiron here, and I haven’t even looked at Robin Williams in a long time, but his natal chart has nothing in the eighth house. So you would not be able to say, oh, the eighth house, that’s how you’re gonna go even if you look to the ruler.”
Robin Williams’ Chart:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * NOTHING in 8th house
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Yet he died by hanging
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * The 8th house was empty, provided no information
The Truth:
Direct Quote: “All death is based off of transits…death is not going to show in your natal chart; it is going to show in transits and transits to other people’s charts.”
Why This Makes Sense:
Direct Quote: “Because at that point, if it was sitting directly in your natal chart, how would you know when it was going to happen?”
Natal charts are STATIC - they show potential, not timing.
Transits are DYNAMIC - they show when events occur.
Who’s Chart Shows Death?
Direct Quote: “And in fact, if you pull up Ashley’s chart, let’s make sure that is the same day…Venus is going over Juno retrograde. This actually had to do with Ashley’s situation. I’m not going to get too deep into this, but Ashley not really connecting with her sister during this time.”
Death shows up in:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Transit charts (timing)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Other people’s charts (family members, close relationships)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Progressions (internal development)
Why: Because Pluto (death/transformation) and Neptune (dissolution) are other people’s energy, not self-energy.
Pisces/Neptune vs. Scorpio/Pluto:
Direct Quote: “Mercury rules siblings; yes, the eighth house is involved, but more than the eighth house is Pisces energy. Pisces rules anything that has to do with pharmaceuticals, has to do with isolation, depression, and also has to do more so with death than Pluto. Neptune is the end of cycles, end of life, and you can’t…you can’t get it back. When Neptune comes around and it’s dissolved and it’s gone, it’s gone. Pluto is a rebirth, and yes, death can happen because you can go too deep into things.”
Key Distinction:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Pluto/Scorpio = transformation, rebirth (death AND resurrection)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Neptune/Pisces = dissolution, endings (death as FINALITY)
The sister’s overdose involved:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Pharmaceuticals (Pisces)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Isolation and depression (Pisces/Neptune)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Going too deep into coping mechanisms (Scorpio/Pluto)
Practical Implications:
Believing this myth:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Creates fear and fatalism
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Leads to false predictions that scare clients
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Wastes interpretive focus on the wrong areas
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Can cause emotional harm
Corrective Guidance:
Direct Quote: “In order to understand them, you have to understand progressions, relocations, and transits.”
For death analysis:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Never use natal chart alone
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Look at transits (especially Neptune)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. Check charts of close family/friends
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. Understand 8th house is about transformation, intimacy, shared resources—not literal death
Integration:
This reinforces that Alchemistic Astrology is dynamic, not static. Natal charts are blueprints; transits are when blueprints activate.
________________


MYTH #3: “The Midheaven (MC) is your career”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “The third one is the midheaven is not your career, a huge one. Almost every astrology book, every astrology video, every website always tries to take the midheaven and correlate it to your career, and sometimes there is a correlation. But I’ll explain to you why it is not your career, not only directly, but even indirectly.”
Why It’s Wrong:
The MC Can Be in Different Houses:
Direct Quote: “But you can have a midheaven in the 8th house, 9th house, 10th house, 11th house, 12th house. It can be in any of those houses.”
The MC is a calculated point (where the meridian crosses the ecliptic), not a house. It floats and can land in:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 8th house
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 9th house
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 10th house (only sometimes!)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 11th house
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 12th house
If MC = career, then how can it be in the 12th house (isolation, spirituality) and still mean “career”? It doesn’t make sense.
What the 10th House Actually Means:
Direct Quote: “So when you’re talking about the midheaven, so these are all the, I’m going to erase this, but these are all the tenth house themes here. They’re all Capricorn, they’re all Saturn. When you realize that the sign is the house, is the planet, and that natural rulership usurps all of this, it makes things a lot easier.”
10th House = Saturn = Capricorn:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Structure
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Long-term goals
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Authority
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * What you do over time
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Public reputation (not because it’s career, but because what you do consistently becomes known)
The Truth About Career:
Direct Quote: “Your ascendant point, remember that? Is your motivations, it’s like this, right? It’s kind of a combination of this. It is your motivations for why you do what you do. And then it’s ruler…that’s all ascendant. And its ruler, let’s say this is sitting in the fourth house. It’s all going to be based off of things that are either domesticated, nurturing, literally house and home, family anything that has to do with nurturing, anything that has to do with things that are just deeply personal to you or have some sort of emotional connection to you. That’s because the ascendant of the first house and its motivations, its actions, are being led into this area. You will do a career that aligns with that.”
Career Comes From:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Ascendant (motivations, what drives you to act)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Ascendant ruler’s house (where those motivations lead)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. 6th house (daily work, service, routine)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. 2nd house (skills, values, what you earn from)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      5. 10th house (structure, long-term goals, what you build over time)
Career is a SYNTHESIS of multiple houses, not just MC.
The Truth About Midheaven:
Direct Quote: “Now what is the midheaven really?..The midheaven is taking the highest point in your chart, which aligns with the opposite of the IC and adds the sun to it…The IC is at the bottom of the chart, the darkest part, the personal side of the chart. The above stuff over here…is what I put out into the world; it’s not how I structure it, I don’t care how it structure, I care that I can do it. And it’s not about me actually physically doing the action, as much as me presenting it.”
MC = AMBITION
Direct Quote: “Ambition, literally a word that’s correlated to midheaven. Ambition, this is not my motivation; it is my ambition.”
Ambition vs. Motivation:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Motivation (Ascendant) = Why I do things, what drives me
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Ambition (Midheaven) = What I want to be known for, my aspirations
Real-Life Example:
Direct Quote: “When you have it in alignment here in the 10th house, and your midheaven’s in the 10th house, then the stuff you wanna do, your ambitions, and what you wanna put out in the world aligns with career, tradition, structure, authority, something you do for a long time. But when you don’t have it here, and you have it in one of these other four places, let’s say the ninth house, which is really popular, I have that; I had it in Tampa, I have it here in Los Angeles, it doesn’t align with authority at all.”
Instructor’s MC in 9th House:
Direct Quote: “It doesn’t mean that I don’t care about authority; it just means that my aspirations, I don’t care about the long-term goals and structure of it. It means I care more about the adventure, the journey, the philosophy, making it bigger, doing much more, teaching, coaching, consulting, all the ninth house stuff, the culture of it. I want the experience; I wanna share the experience. I want that to be what I leave in this world. My ambitions are bigger, big picture stuff, Jupiter.”
His career (what he DOES): Teaching, consulting, creating content
His ambition (what he wants to LEAVE): Big-picture philosophy, shared experiences, cultural impact
These are related but different.
Practical Implications:
If you treat MC as career:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll confuse ambition with daily work
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll miss actual career indicators (Ascendant ruler, 6th, 2nd houses)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll give vague, inaccurate career guidance
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll overlook what drives the person (Ascendant)
Corrective Guidance:
Direct Quote: “When someone asks you what your career is, they don’t say, hey, what do people know you for? What is the thing you wanna leave on this? No, they say, what do you do? That is why the ascendant, as we had here, that leads into your career more than anything else. But this is the way that you do it. These are your ambitions here with the midheaven.”
For career analysis:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Start with Ascendant and its ruler (motivation → action)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Check 2nd house (skills, earning, values)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. Check 6th house (daily work, service)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. Check 10th house (structure, long-term goals)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      5. Use MC to understand aspirations and what they want to be known for
Integration:
MC is a Vitality Anchor (like Ascendant), but serves a different function. Together, they structure purpose and ambition, but neither alone equals “career.”
________________


MYTH #4: “Saturn (or Jupiter) is the father”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “Number four is you’ll hear all the time that Saturn’s the father. Sometimes you’ll hear Jupiter’s the father; neither one of them is the father, and we’ll talk about why.”
Why It’s Wrong:
The Logic Behind the Myth:
Traditional astrology creates an opposition:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 4th house (IC) = mother
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 10th house (MC) = father
This creates a mom vs. dad dynamic, fighting across an opposition.
Direct Quote: “So when you hear the argument between the fourth house being the mother and the tenth house being the father, they create this natural opposition that they’re looking for between mom and dad. But are mom and dad always opposite? Do they always fight each other? Are they always in a tug of war? Not in a good household. In a good household, they’re working together.”
The problem: This opposition framework assumes conflict, but good parents cooperate.
The Truth:
Direct Quote: “When we’re talking about the sun, the sun is the father; the sun gives life. You do not have life without the father, just like you don’t have nurturing and think about the womb without the mother. That is it.”
The Father = Sun = Leo = 5th House
Why:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Sun gives LIFE (generative principle)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Father is the spark, the initiator
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Life cannot exist without the father’s contribution
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Sun = vitality, life force, purpose
Direct Quote: “What you really have here is the fourth house represents the mother, the fifth house represents the father. These two work in tandem; this one supports this one but doesn’t understand this one half of the time.”
4th House (Mother) + 5th House (Father):
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Adjacent, not opposite
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Mother (4th) supports father (5th)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Father doesn’t always understand mother (semi-sextile aspect = misunderstanding)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * But they work together, not against each other
What Saturn Actually Is:
Direct Quote: “Leo is the father, the sun is the father, the fifth house is the father; Saturn is not the father. Saturn is authority. The mother can be in an authority position. Teachers can be in authority positions, and teachers do not have to have a father-like, or even a mother-like influence.”
Saturn = AUTHORITY
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Structures
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Rules
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Long-term commitments
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Limitations
Authority is NOT the same as fatherhood:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Mothers can be authority figures
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Teachers are authorities but not parents
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Bosses, governments, institutions = authority, not fatherhood
Direct Quote: “The funny thing is they actually have more of a mother-like influence energetically than a father, with the opposition to the fourth house. Teachers who care teach better is what it is. People of authority who care are more respected; that’s the opposition between the fourth and the tenth house.”
Good authority figures care (4th house quality), creating the opposition’s complementary nature.
What the Father (Sun) Actually Represents:
Direct Quote: “Life, having fun, bringing purpose, a little bit of drama, personal expression, leadership. Those are all father things; those are all the sun. They are not Saturn.”
Father = Sun qualities:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Life-giving
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Fun, play, creativity
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Purpose and meaning
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Personal expression
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Leadership
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Drama (spotlight, attention)
These are 5th house themes, not 10th house.
Practical Implications:
If you treat Saturn as father:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll confuse authority issues with paternal relationships
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll miss the Sun’s role in vitality and life purpose
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll create false oppositions between parents
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll misread family dynamics
Corrective Guidance:
Always associate:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Father = Sun, Leo, 5th house
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Mother = Moon, Cancer, 4th house
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Authority = Saturn, Capricorn, 10th house
Integration:
This ties to the foundational relationships of energy (one of the Four Pillars): planets, signs, and houses have natural correspondences that cannot be arbitrarily reassigned.
________________


MYTH #5: “Mars is anger”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “Number five, Mars is usually attributed to anger; it is not anger.”
Why It’s Wrong:
The Logical Breakdown:
Direct Quote: “Mars, right? First house, Aries; they’re all the same energy. They are physical action and impulse. The fourth house, first house; the fourth house is Cancer moon, right? There is a square aspect between these two…This is emotion, or your relationship to emotion. Emotion itself is not defined. … But your relationship to emotion is Cancer. It does not mean that cancers are emotional, and that’s another problem with pop culture astrology.”
Key Distinctions:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Mars/Aries/1st house = physical action, impulse
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Moon/Cancer/4th house = relationship to emotion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * These are separate energies
Direct Quote: “Anger is an emotion; emotions are not ruled by Mars. It’s the relationship of these two that creates a personal emotional insecurity. And because this is so fast that it reacts with this and that you don’t focus on the emotion or the actual root of what’s being said, what’s being done, it becomes anger and aggression.”
How Anger Actually Forms:
Anger = Mars (action) + Moon (emotion) in challenging aspect
When:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Action is impulsive (Mars)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Emotion is not processed (Moon)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. These two energies conflict (square, semi-sextile, opposition)
Result: Anger and aggression
Direct Quote: “And anger is always, always accompanied by physical action. People don’t get angry and not punch something, not storm off, not wave their hands; they don’t do that.”
Anger requires BOTH:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Emotional trigger (Moon)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Physical expression (Mars)
Mars alone is just force, speed, energy—not anger.
The Truth:
Direct Quote: “So what is [Mars]? Well, this is aggression in terms of force, physical action, doing something, speed, adding energy into something…Mars is the physical body; the ascendant is the physical body; that’s your first house.”
Mars IS:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Physical action
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Force and speed
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Impulse
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Energy application
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * The physical body in motion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Aggression (force), not anger (emotion)
Aspect Order Matters:
Direct Quote: “If you see somebody who has Mars square the moon, then that person is going to not process their emotions before their actions; they’re going to be impulsive, and that person may be a bit more angry or come across that way. If you see moon square Mars, it’s a very different thing because the order of those planets matters.”
Mars Square Moon:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Action doesn’t understand emotion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Person acts before processing feelings
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Appears angry because they react physically before emotional awareness
Moon Square Mars:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Emotion doesn’t understand action
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Person feels intensely but action doesn’t match
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Different expression entirely
Even More Challenging:
Direct Quote: “Mars semi-sextile the moon…If Mars comes first, then it creates agitation. It means that’s even worse than a square because it doesn’t actually process emotions; it doesn’t understand emotions, and it makes things a Mars semi-square.”
Semi-sextile: The energies don’t see each other at all. If Mars comes first in the flow, action happens with zero emotional awareness.
Personal Example:
Direct Quote: “I have Mars conjunct the Moon…in a conjunction, those two energies are mixing together, which means you make decisions based on things that are personal to you. Your emotions are tied into your actions.”
In a conjunction, emotions and actions are integrated, not in conflict.
Practical Implications:
If you believe Mars = anger:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll stereotype Aries placements as “angry people”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll miss the actual source of anger (Mars-Moon conflicts)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll overlook healthy assertiveness and mistake it for aggression
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll fail to help clients understand emotional processing
Corrective Guidance:
Always interpret:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Mars alone = action, force, speed, physical energy
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Moon alone = emotional security, personal feelings
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. Mars-Moon aspects = where anger/agitation may arise (IF aspect is challenging)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. Aspect order = determines which is the problem (action or emotion)
Integration:
This demonstrates the critical importance of energy flow (Pillar 1 of Alchemistic Astrology). The order and relationship between planets matters more than individual planets.
________________


MYTH #6: “The 10th house is your physical appearance”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “Number six, your 10th house; they like to say that your 10th house has to do with your public image and therefore becomes your appearance; it is not your appearance.”
Why It’s Wrong:
Direct Quote: “They’re not seeing what you look like; they’re seeing the energy that you put out into the world in terms of Saturnian things in the 10th house.”
The Logic Error:
Pop astrology conflates:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Public image (how you’re perceived)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Physical appearance (what you look like)
These are NOT the same thing.
Public image = reputation, what you’re known for (10th house)
Physical appearance = body, face, presence (1st house/Ascendant)
The Truth:
Direct Quote: “So the ascendant is your physical appearance; that is your body. Now, when we talk about the 10th house…it’s goals, structure, authority, time for the record.”
Ascendant/1st House = Physical Body:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * What you look like
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Your immediate presence
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Physical characteristics
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * How you move and act
10th House = Saturnian Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Goals
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Structure
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Authority
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Long-term reputation
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Achievement over time
Direct Quote: “So when people say that…the tenth house is your appearance, right? The tenth house is not your appearance…it is impulsive, reactionary, the very first thing that we do, it is not the mask we wear. It is literally the thing we do.”
Nuances:
There might be a correlation if:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Your Ascendant ruler is in the 10th house
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * There’s a strong connection between 1st and 10th houses
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * But that’s a derived relationship, not direct meaning
Practical Implications:
If you treat 10th house as appearance:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll analyze the wrong area for physical traits
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll confuse reputation with presentation
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll miss the Ascendant’s crucial role
Corrective Guidance:
Always use:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Ascendant/1st house for physical appearance
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 10th house for reputation, achievement, long-term goals
Integration:
This reinforces that houses, signs, and planets have natural correspondences that cannot be arbitrarily swapped. 1st = body (Aries/Mars), 10th = structure (Capricorn/Saturn).
________________


MYTH #7: “Jupiter is money/financial abundance”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “Number seven, Jupiter is often attributed to money or financial abundance or gains; it is not; it has nothing to do with money.”
Why It’s Wrong:
Direct Quote: “In pop culture astrology, or PCA as we call it…they say it’s the husband, they say it’s God…they attribute everything to Jupiter; like they leave nothing out somehow.”
The Problem: Jupiter has become a catch-all for anything “good” or “abundant,” including money. But:
Jupiter = Expansion, NOT Money
Direct Quote: “Whenever you see a brain tumor that expands, Jupiter’s involved. Whenever you see somebody who’s struggling with weight, Jupiter’s involved. Whenever you see Jupiter come along…something expands.”
Jupiter expands WHATEVER is present:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Money? Jupiter expands it (MORE money)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Debt? Jupiter expands it (MORE debt)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Health issues? Jupiter expands them (WORSE health)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Knowledge? Jupiter expands it (MORE learning)
Jupiter is neutral—it amplifies, it doesn’t inherently create wealth.
The Truth About Money:
Direct Quote: “Money is ruled by Taurus. Venus is money. Taurus is money. Jupiter, by literal definition, one planet, two planets, doesn’t understand money.”
Money = Venus = Taurus = 2nd House
Why:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Venus = value, possession, material things
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Taurus = stability, resources, what you own
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * 2nd house = earned income, skills, possessions
The Philosophical/Cultural Confusion:
Direct Quote: “So when you’re talking about financial abundance, we’re talking about luck; we’re talking about money. But the problem is the perception of luck is the idea that opportunity, which is based off of a numbers game, is that that’s just gonna come to us…what actually rules numbers is Gemini.”
Pop astrology confuses:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Luck (opportunity) with money (resources)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Expansion (Jupiter) with wealth (Venus)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Philosophy with materialism
Real-Life Example:
Direct Quote: “This is also for the record why teachers don’t make much money, because Jupiter is not about that…When you start focusing on Jupiter, you will not get money…You will not get money by doing a lot.”
Teachers: Jupiter-ruled profession (teaching, philosophy, expansion of knowledge)
Teachers’ salary: Usually low
Why? Because teaching is Jupiter (expansion, education), but money is Venus (material value). The system (Saturn) values money more than education.
Direct Quote: “But when Jupiter for higher education links up with Saturn…then teaching makes a lot of money because it’s going through this filter. But the average person is subject as a teacher to the system, which they didn’t even want to be a part of anyway. The system makes money; the teacher does not.”
When CAN Jupiter relate to money?
Only when Jupiter aspects Venus or the 2nd house. Then Jupiter expands the money that Venus rules.
But Jupiter alone? No money connection.
Practical Implications:
If you believe Jupiter = money:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll tell people to “manifest abundance” through Jupiter (won’t work)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll miss the actual financial indicators (Venus, 2nd house)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll create false hope around Jupiter transits
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll overlook Venus’s crucial role
Corrective Guidance:
For financial analysis:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Venus = value, money, possessions
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. 2nd house = earned income, skills, resources
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. 11th house = income from groups, networks, multiple streams
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. 8th house = shared resources, others’ money
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      5. Jupiter = expansion of whatever’s already there (can amplify money if connected to Venus/2nd, but doesn’t create it)
Integration:
This demonstrates color theory: same planet (Jupiter) in different contexts creates different results. Jupiter isn’t inherently “good”—it’s context-dependent.
________________


MYTH #8: “Astrocartography lines show your best/worst places”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “Number eight is that astrocartography map lines somehow show you the exact place you’re supposed to use based on the line. So you’re supposed to go to a place, live there because that’s your good line. There are no good lines; there are no bad lines universally.”
Why It’s Wrong:
The Lines Are Limited:
Direct Quote: “These lines are not all the lines. Secondly, when you’re looking at these lines, each one of them has a marker…these are just conjunction points…”
Most astrocartography software only shows:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Conjunction lines (planet conjunct Ascendant, MC, Descendant, IC)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Ignores squares, oppositions, pairon lines
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Shows only a fraction of astrological influence
The Lines Mean Different Things for Different People:
Direct Quote: “These lines just mean that Jupiter in my chart…is going to be conjunct my IC…for you, Pluto might be terrible. But for me, Pluto could be amazing because Pluto, sitting in my chart versus Pluto sitting in your chart…”
Same line ≠ same effect
Why:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Your Jupiter might be well-placed in your natal chart (expansion of good things)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * My Jupiter might be challenging (expansion of problems)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Lines don’t account for natal context
Real-Life Examples:
Born on Jupiter IC Line:
Direct Quote: “I was born on my Jupiter line…I did not have a wonderful childhood; I did not have a big family…all the definitions are almost always wrong because it factors absolutely nothing in.”
Pop astrology: “Jupiter IC = abundant, happy home life”
Reality: Difficult childhood, poverty, small family
Mars IC Line Experience:
Direct Quote: “Mars IC line, but people will tell you, oh, don’t go to your Mars IC line…But I had the best experience.”
Pop astrology: “Mars IC = dangerous, aggressive home life”
Reality: One of instructor’s favorite places
The Truth:
Direct Quote: “When you’re looking at astrocartography…everybody’s like, oh, your Sun line, oh, your Jupiter line, oh, your Venus line, blah, blah, blah…Now, in my chart…Jupiter line’s abundance…We talked before that it is not abundance…”
Astrocartography shows:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Where a planetary conjunction occurs for your unique chart
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Must be interpreted through your natal context
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Requires analyzing the relocated chart (full chart calculated for new location)
Technical Issues:
Direct Quote: “These lines are not even completely accurate because you have to factor in a couple of things. One is that the software is gonna do what the software wants to do…”
Different software calculates differently:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Mundo (in mundo) vs. Zodiacal
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Different calculation methods = different line placements
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * No single “correct” map
Practical Implications:
If you believe universal good/bad lines:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll move to “good” lines and be disappointed
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll avoid “bad” lines and miss opportunities
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll give clients inaccurate relocation advice
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * You’ll oversimplify complex relocational astrology
Corrective Guidance:
Direct Quote: “For the record, that’s what astrocartography is about: aligning with goals, figuring out what goals you want to align with.”
For proper astrocartography:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Calculate relocated chart for each location
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Analyze entire relocated chart, not just lines
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. Consider natal context (is this planet well-placed in your natal chart?)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. Look at all aspects, not just conjunctions
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      5. Understand your goals for the relocation
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      6. Never use generic “Venus = love, Jupiter = luck” interpretations
Integration:
This demonstrates that astrology is contextual and relational. No single factor (like a line) can be understood in isolation from the whole chart.
________________


MYTH #9: “Pisces is an emotional sign”
The Myth Statement:
Direct Quote: “And number nine is that Pisces is not an emotional sign.”
Why It’s Wrong:
Direct Quote: “Pisces energy is a sensitive, is a fragile energy. It is a connection to the ether and the connection to nothing, so it’s not about emotion. The tears, water being represented by Pisces and Neptune energy, is a form of release.”
The Confusion:
People see:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Water element → emotion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Pisces = water sign → therefore emotional
But this conflates water element themes with specific water signs.
The Water Trine:
Cancer (4th house/Moon):
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Relationship to emotion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Personal feelings
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Emotional security
Scorpio (8th house/Pluto):
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Depth of emotion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Transformation through feeling
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Psychological intensity
Pisces (12th house/Neptune):
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * RELEASE of emotion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Sensitivity (not emotionality)
