So you’re constantly reworking things that are already done, which is why you’re not actually taking action because the action happened before you were born. Does that make sense? So when you have a retrograde in your chart and the action’s already been done for you, the universe, everybody else that came before you is already done, you’re in a position of reevaluating.”
The Inward Turn:
“And this is why people who have a Mars retrograde turn their energy inward, and they have a very difficult time asserting themselves. They have a very difficult time taking action, starting new projects because it already was started before they were born. The energy of their imprint, their natal chart happened already. The thing already started, but the but the challenge is that for you, it didn’t start. You’re imbued with energy post starting, but nothing’s there.”
The Missing Quality:
“So for you, there’s nothing there. That is why I say when you were first born, you’re lacking these energies or you feel like you’re lacking these energies. These themes are missing in your life, and they work erratic, and you don’t have any connection to them. You have no idea because you weren’t there for the start of it.”
________________


Saturn Retrograde Example (Further Illustration)
Verbatim:
“And this applies for all the planets. Take Saturn, jump the Saturn real quick; Saturn has to do with authority and structure in your life, and that authority and structure was already set before you were born. And then, once you were born with a retrograde Saturn, that imprint is on you; it already happened, but you didn’t start it.”
“So you, there’s an expectation of structure, but it’s not there for you. There’s no authority there for you. Authority you don’t make, it doesn’t make any sense, but at the same time you feel like you already have the authority. You feel like you’ve already done things, or you should already be able to do things with Mars.”
________________


1.3 The Four Planetary Motion States
Complete Framework:
Verbatim:
“When you want to understand pro grade, pre grade, post grade, retrograde, right? Those are the four movements of planets. Pro grade is just direct; okay? It’s just normal, it’s moving forward. It’s not in pre grade, it’s not retrograde, it’s not post grade, it is pro grade, and it just means it’s normally moving, and it’s it’s It’s whatever velocity speed that it’s going through. So we know that the direct is just acting out the way that we learn direct to be.”
1. Prograde (Direct)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Normal forward motion
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * “Acting out the way that we learn direct to be”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Standard planetary function and expression
2. Pre-grade (Pre-Retrograde Station)
Definition:
“When you dive deeper into retrograde, you also want to kind of take a look at the ephemeris at the time you were born to understand what your planet’s really doing because your planet might not be retrograde, but it could have been two days before retrograde, which means it’s more almost inertial, meaning it’s almost retrograde. It is slowed down; it is not prograde. Just because there’s no R on it does not mean that it’s not giving you some of those vibes as it slows down.”
Critical for App Development: Planets within 1-2 degrees or days of retrograde station should be flagged as exhibiting retrograde-like qualities even without the ‘R’ symbol.
3. Retrograde
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Apparent backward motion from Earth’s perspective
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Energy turned inward
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Themes of reworking, reevaluation, revisiting
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Imprinted with “already been done” energy
4. Post-grade (Post-Retrograde Station)
Verbatim:
“So we have the retrograde is coming here and anything once it reaches the second time around. So once Mars hits six degrees, it’s going to go retrograde. When it goes back, it’s going to go to 17 degrees of Cancer, and then it’s going to go forward; it’s going to hit six degrees again. And anything after that point is prograde; it’s going normal again. The period of time after a retrograde, so February 24th, when this planet goes all the way back to here, anything from 17 degrees Cancer back up to six degrees Leo, where it already was before, is called post-grade.”
Post-grade Significance: The planet is moving forward again but still traversing degrees it has already covered twice (once forward pre-retrograde, once backward during retrograde). This creates a “completion” or “integration” quality.
________________


1.4 Which Planets Can Be Retrograde
Complete List:
Cannot Be Retrograde:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Sun
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Moon
Verbatim:
“I want to make sure I can get through all eight signs, or eight planets rather, because two of them can’t be retrograde.”
Can Be Retrograde:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Mercury - Very common (3x per year for ~3 weeks each)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Venus - Rare (every ~18-24 months)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. Mars - Rare (every ~2 years)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. Jupiter - More common
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      5. Saturn - More common
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      6. Uranus - Very common (generational)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      7. Neptune - Very common (generational)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      8. Pluto - Very common (generational)
________________


Frequency and Rarity
Inner Planet Retrogrades:
Mercury:
“Mercury retrograde, I have a Mercury. Anyone else have a Mercury retrograde? I do. A lot of people would. Anita, is that what you? Yeah. All right, a lot of people do. This is a really common one, happens three times a year for usually about three weeks at a time. So while it’s cumulatively not that long, it’s still a decent amount of the population that has it.”
Venus and Mars:
“Mars are very rare; Silas, Mars and Venus only happen every two years, so both of those are rare retrogrades. I don’t have retrograde my station direct. Yeah, okay. … Venus is another rare one.”
Outer Planets:
 Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto retrograde for approximately 5-6 months each year, making natal retrogrades of these planets much more common. These are considered generational retrogrades because large cohorts share them.
________________


1.5 General Principles of Retrograde Interpretation
Inward vs. Outward Energy
Core Directional Framework:
“Because the natural flow of a retrograde planet is to go inward, is to go backwards, is to revisit because again, you’re imprinted with all the energy of a time where Mars had already been here, and it also means you have to do it different.”
Verbatim:
“Often, you’ll end up asserting yourself to yourself. So if there’s any anger with a partner, you could blame yourself, or you could like just communicate with yourself, and it doesn’t actually fix any of the issues or any of the trauma, … You just want to be careful because retrogrades compound.”
________________


Compounding Effect
Critical Warning:
“You just want to be careful because retrogrades compound. So as you rework things, you can get so hung up on this like snow pile of reworking and redoing that it stops you from moving forward.”
Positive Reframe:
“But you can see action within action. You can do things within what you’re doing. So … because you see opportunity for doing things within something you’re already doing.”
________________


Early Life Experience vs. Later Mastery
Initial Challenge:
“A lot of people look at retrogrades as like these huge burdening challenges, and they definitely feel that way coming up because in the first parts of your life, these are areas that don’t seem to work. Right, there are things that you’re you feel like you’re missing or you’re lacking. And those are things that you have to go inward to find. So that’s the first thing to realize, that the beginning of your life, wherever you have a retrograde, you can expect to not have that planet’s energy playing out in a normal way.”
Path to Empowerment:
“So each one of these retrogrades is sitting in your chart for a reason, right? It’s part of what makes you different from the next person, and honing in and harnessing them is extremely important.”
________________


Authenticity and Uniqueness
Verbatim:
“Your retrograde is one of those things that says, I’m not the same. It’s kind of like Chiron in in its way, and Chiron can obviously be retrograde. We won’t be talking about that today; we’ll do a different webinar for Chiron, which will include Chiron retrograde in that one.”
“But as that one represents you being authentic and unique and doing things for yourself, and that area of life not working, that’s a part of your authenticity. But so are your retrogrades.”
________________


Common Misconceptions Debunked
Misconception: Retrogrades Are Purely Negative
Verbatim:
“A lot of people look at retrogrades as like these huge burdening challenges, and they definitely feel that way coming up … but I want you to understand why they’re not direct and how they’re different from being direct and what that can mean negatively. Because if we understand how it can be bad or potentially negative or overwhelming, because that’s what happens with retrogrades, it gives you that inverse Jupiter vibe.”
“I want to balance out the good, and I want to make sure that the bad is subdued, right, as much as we can… I know I’m focusing kind of on the negative side of it, and I don’t want you to think that retrogrades are negative; they absolutely aren’t.”
________________


1.6 Instructor’s Personal Retrograde Chart
Instructor’s Natal Retrogrades:
Verbatim:
“I’m going to pull up mine because I’ve got a ton, and I’m going to use some of you guys as examples.”
Confirmed Retrogrades:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Mercury retrograde
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. Venus retrograde (via house rulership: 2nd and 7th house rulers)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. Jupiter retrograde
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4. Saturn retrograde
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      5. (Mars: NOT retrograde - “I don’t have retrograde my station direct”)
Personal Impact Statement:
“Most of my planets are retrograde, kind of licking my lips on this one because I’m kind of proud of it, but also kind of ashamed of it.”
________________


Venus Retrograde Personal Experience
Verbatim:
“Venus is another rare one. However, I’m going to go to me. Doesn’t look like it, not on this call. Anyway, it’s not common, but guess what? Second house is naturally Taurus; its ruler in my chart is retrograde. Seventh house, Libra ruled by Venus; its ruler retrograde. So for me, as Venus pertains to money and as Venus pertains to relationships, I have both retrograde. So when I talk about, I was born in the ghetto, and money was difficult for me, and life was challenging, and relationships were tough. It’s not just this, but this was a contributing factor to it.”
“I didn’t understand money, or value, or self-worth, or anything like that growing up because again, my second house ruler, and it would be the same for Venus.”
________________


Jupiter Retrograde Personal Experience
Verbatim:
“Jupiter retrograde, Jupiter is expansion and abundance and philosophy and culture, right? It’s all these things. Guess what I don’t have and didn’t have growing up? Any of those things, no abundance, not a big family.”
“But I’ll tell you what I did get is all of my friends. That I’ve had growing up through all of my recreation and activities and martial arts and all of that from my childhood. I went with their family, the ruler right there, boom with their family and their family and their culture. All of my friends were ethnic, every single one. …So, but that’s the retrograde, and I dove deep into it; I took all of their, their culture to me and said, why are you doing that?”
________________


Saturn Retrograde Personal Experience
Verbatim:
“Saturn’s a fun one. Saturn, to me, is this you? …I have this, most of my planets are retrograde, kind of licking my lips on this one because I’m kind of proud of it, but also kind of ashamed of it. But I have my Saturn retrograde as well. I have, uh, my 10th house with Chiron.”
“I also have a Saturn retrograde, so I don’t verbalize mine in the third house. I don’t talk about being successful. I don’t think I’m successful. Like I talk about it all the time. I’ve got my name up on a building, I got money, I got whatever. I’ve done a lot of really cool things, but in my mind, in my energy, in my brain, I don’t attribute that to being successful. I’m not successful yet. There’s always something else, and it’s because I haven’t really—I’m still 42 years old. I haven’t figured this out yet, what success means to me.”
________________


Personal Optimization Journey
Verbatim:
“I finally figured it out, at least partially, but it took, I’m 42 years old. Now it took me a long time to figure this out. I don’t want people to figure out 40 years later, or 30, or whatever age you want to take it from the vantage of. I don’t want you to, to wait that long to figure this out; I want you to figure it out now so that in 40, 30, 40 years from now, you’re just like living on a yacht or something. I don’t know, whatever you’re doing, whatever your goal is, just happy, whatever your form of happiness. I want that for you.”
________________


PART II: PLANET-BY-PLANET RETROGRADE BREAKDOWN
2.1 MERCURY RETROGRADE
Core Energy When Direct
Planetary Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Communication
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Thinking and logic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Learning and intellect
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Choices and options
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Analytical strength
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Immediate environment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Daily processes
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Details and facts
House Rulerships:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Gemini (3rd house naturally)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Virgo (6th house naturally)
Verbatim:
“So Mercury’s about communication, thinking, logic, learning, choices, options, and analytical strength.”
________________


How Retrograde Modifies Mercury Energy
The Skeptical Mind:
“With a Mercury retrograde or a third house ruler retrograde or a sixth house ruler retrograde is not to trust it, not to believe what we’re hearing, to criticize the details and the facts.”
“We don’t even know what it is yet, but we’re already in that stance that whatever that fact is, I don’t believe it; show it to me, prove it to me kind of energy.”
Internal Dialogue Before External Expression:
“Communication … starts in your head and then some point during your either sentence or paragraph or conversation, you start speaking.”
“With a Mercury retrograde, you take it upon yourself to discern, to find the facts, to pull it all together, to figure out what is true, what’s a fact, and what’s the, I’ve criticized it enough to know it’s real.”
Talking to Yourself:
“You had the conversation retrograded with yourself. You talk to yourself and not, and there’s a lot of people who talk to themselves and there’s usually a…the third house ruler is retrograde or Mercury is retrograde. Like you are your conversationalist, and you, in order to figure things out, you have to talk through it to yourself.”
________________


Strengths of Mercury Retrograde
Deep Analytical Ability:
“You’re able to work inward; you’re able to, to see the logic within the logic, you’re able to see the details that other people miss, so there is a blessing.”
Revolutionary Thinking:
“You have an ability to rework things in a way that no one else has thought of, and that can make you a revolutionary person.”
Document Expertise:
“You have a gift of reworking and rewording things with a Mercury retrograde or a third house retrograde when it comes to documents and making sure that those words are in your favor.”
________________


Challenges of Mercury Retrograde
Miscommunication:
“It creates miscommunication with other people constantly, because they don’t know where you’re coming from.”
Assumed Context:
“Sometimes that communication starts in your head and then…when you start talking to somebody, you forget that the whole conversation you’ve had in your head has not been said to them.”
“Communication with other people, not just writing, but any information that needs to be communicated, can suffer because you may assume too much about what people know.”
Decision Paralysis:
“With a Mercury retrograde, how many times are you going to think this thing through before you make a decision on something?..you think it and you rethink it and you think it over.”
Document Assumptions:
“Do not assume you know what’s in a document. Because that can be a challenge, I think I already know everything we’ve talked about…you’re not reading it.”
________________


Optimization Techniques
1. Explicit Communication:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Talk through things explicitly with others, not only to yourself
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Don’t assume others know what you’re thinking
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Verbalize the internal conversation
2. Solve Complex Problems:
“You can solve problems that other people can’t solve.”
3. Allow Decision-Making:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Recognize the tendency to over-analyze
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Set decision deadlines for yourself
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Allow yourself to make decisions rather than getting stuck in over-analysis
4. Leverage Document Skills:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Use your gift for reviewing and rewording
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Apply this to contracts, agreements, creative writing
5. Avoid Over-Explaining:
“You can over-explain everything for other people—and that becomes a problem. We’re good at it, but it’s not ours to do unless we’re asked.”
________________


House and Sign Considerations
Example: Mercury Retrograde in 1st House (Anita’s Chart):
“Anita’s chart, where’s your Mercury? Ah, in the first house. So you have a mercury that acts as an Aries, Taurus, and Libra because you have that conjunction here and Scorpio. So you have that mixture here, but it all spawns off of Scorpio and kind of feeds in…So it’s like I’m already diving deeper.”
Stellium Complexity:
“The Mercury retrograde itself, yours is combined into this, so yours is, we have to break down a little bit more. Mine, for instance, is sitting at six degrees all by herself, you know, just floating up there. But yours is sitting here at the tail end of a stellium.”
________________


Real-World Manifestations
Behaviors:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Internal conversations before speaking
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Talking to self to process information
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Repeating, revisiting, revising decisions
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Chronic indecision
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Miscommunication with others despite clear internal understanding
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Deep skepticism and fact-checking
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Unique problem-solving approaches
________________


2.2 VENUS RETROGRADE
Core Energy When Direct
Planetary Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Value and self-worth
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Love and relationships
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Money and resources
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Talents and artistic expression
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Beauty and aesthetics
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Creativity
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * What we attract and are attracted to
House Rulerships:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Taurus (2nd house naturally)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Libra (7th house naturally)
Verbatim:
“Venus pertains to money and as Venus pertains to relationships…”
“Venus is having both the second house and the seventh house retrograde… relationships, value, money, talents, artistic expression, self-worth, beauty.”
________________


How Retrograde Modifies Venus Energy
Dual House Impact:
“Venus retrograde is like having the seventh house and the second house retrograde. So, whenever you’re talking about Mercury, we talked about Virgo, and we talked about Gemini. So, having the sixth house and the third house retrograde, that’s what having a Mercury retrograde is. It’s having both of those. Venus is having both the second house and the seventh house retrograde.”
Value Confusion:
“So, when Venus is there, having money or understanding wealth, worth, and value can be very challenging for these people. In order to gain it, they have to go in and they have to go figure it out.”
Hidden Talents:
“A retrograde doesn’t mean that you’re not talented with Venus. It actually means you probably are very talented, but you don’t know what your talents are or how to use your talents, because a retrograde means you already had it. Now you’re figuring it out, you’re reworking it.”
________________


Instructor’s Venus Retrograde Experience
Verbatim:
“Guess what? Second house is naturally Taurus; its ruler in my chart is retrograde. Seventh house, Libra ruled by Venus; its ruler retrograde. So for me, as Venus pertains to money and as Venus pertains to relationships, I have both retrograde. So when I talk about, I was born in the ghetto, and money was difficult for me, and life was challenging, and relationships were tough. It’s not just this, but this was a contributing factor to it.”
“I didn’t understand money, or value, or self-worth, or anything like that growing up because again, my second house ruler, and it would be the same for Venus.”
________________


Relationship Patterns
Lack of Discernment:
“You just assume that everybody is someone they could have a relationship with. And that’s a challenge with Venus retrograde: you’re not discerning about who to be in a relationship with because you just assume everybody, anybody, and you’re supposed to rework what is, what is value to you?”
Revisiting Relationships:
“These are the type of people that will revisit relationships, even after the relationship has ended constantly. This was a bad relationship; it was toxic. I ended two months later, and I’m talking to them again. I want to give it another go.”
________________


Strengths of Venus Retrograde
Natural Talent:
“You can be naturally good at things and not know that you’re good at them because you haven’t figured that out yet.”
Unique Value System:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Develops deeply personal definition of worth
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Creates individualized relationship standards
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Discovers hidden creative abilities over time
________________


Challenges of Venus Retrograde
Early Life Struggles:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Difficulty understanding money or self-worth
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Confusion about what is valuable
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Relationship challenges due to lack of boundaries
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Not recognizing own talents
Talent Recognition:
“You can be as talented as hell, but you haven’t figured out how to use your talent in your own way, and that can be very challenging.”
________________


Optimization Techniques
1. Define Personal Value:
“You have to figure out what value is for you. What does money mean for you? What is your relationship with money?”
2. Individualized Approaches:
“Your diet has to be your diet. This is why you can’t just jump on a diet fad; you can’t just go to some nutritionist, and you can’t just go to some fitness influencer, especially if you have your second house or your Venus in retrograde.”
3. Use Your Talents:
“Should be using [your creative talents]. It doesn’t have to be the only thing, but you should be using it.”
4. Develop Relationship Discernment:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Learn to evaluate potential partners consciously
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Define what relationships mean to YOU
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Recognize patterns of revisiting toxic connections
5. Personalize Everything:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Money management strategies must be YOUR way
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Relationship dynamics must fit YOUR values
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Creative expression must be authentic to YOU
________________


Real-World Manifestations
Behaviors:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Repeatedly returning to past relationships
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Difficulty recognizing own talents until later in life
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Struggling with self-worth and money early on
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Creating highly personalized value systems
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Being naturally talented but not knowing how to monetize it
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Lack of relationship boundaries initially
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Eventually developing unique relationship style
________________


2.3 MARS RETROGRADE
Core Energy When Direct
Planetary Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Action and initiation
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Assertion and drive
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Ambition and goals
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Anger and aggression
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Starting new projects
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Leadership and courage
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Physical energy and athleticism
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Sexuality and passion
House Rulerships:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Aries (1st house naturally)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * (Traditionally also co-rules Scorpio/8th house)
Verbatim:
“Mars, the planet of action and everything that is thematic of that planet…”
________________


How Retrograde Modifies Mars Energy
The Inward Turn of Action:
“This is why people who have a Mars retrograde turn their energy inward, and they have a very difficult time asserting themselves. They have a very difficult time taking action, starting new projects because it already was started before they were born.”
The “Already Started” Paradox:
“When you have a retrograde in your chart and the action’s already been done for you, the universe, everybody else that came before you is already done, you’re in a position of reevaluating.”
Missing Starter Energy:
“You feel like there’s a missing starter. You feel like there’s something that’s stopping you from being able to make money doing these things or being able to have a relationship…”
________________


Rarity Note
Verbatim:
“Mars are very rare; Silas, Mars and Venus only happen every two years, so both of those are rare retrogrades.”
Mars retrograde in a natal chart is relatively uncommon, making those who have it particularly unique.
________________


Inward vs. Outward Assertion
Self-Directed Anger:
“Often, you’ll end up asserting yourself to yourself. So if there’s any anger with a partner, you could blame yourself, or you could just communicate with yourself, and it doesn’t actually fix any of the issues or any of the trauma.”
Action Within Action:
“But you can see action within action. You can do things within what you’re doing. So … because you see opportunity for doing things within something you’re already doing … Because the natural flow of a retrograde planet is to go inward, is to go backwards, is to revisit.”
________________


Strengths of Mars Retrograde
Reworking Existing Systems:
“You can take things that exist, things that have been done a certain way … you can turn that energy inward. And there’s blessings and challenges in there.”
Attraction Energy:
“Retrograde energy is an attraction energy, so you have a couple of things that are going on because it’s going back.”
Deep Focus:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Ability to rework, revise, perfect
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Seeing opportunities within existing frameworks
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Fitness, bodybuilding, writing, creative compilation work
________________


Challenges of Mars Retrograde
Difficulty Starting:
“In the first parts of your life, these are areas that don’t seem to work. Right, there are things that you feel like you’re missing or you’re lacking. And those are things that you have to go inward to find.”
Compounding Rework:
“You just want to be careful because retrogrades compound. So as you rework things, you can get so hung up on this snow pile of reworking and redoing that it stops you from moving forward.”
Assertion Problems:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Trouble asserting needs outwardly
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Self-directed anger rather than external expression
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Feeling stuck before action begins
________________


Optimization Techniques
1. Delegate Action:
“You have to work around it … you have to bring other people in to do the work for you. So it’s very much a delegating type of energy.”
2. Work Within What Exists:
“Work the energies within the retrograde, which means you have to realize that all that eighth house energy and Mars itself, you taking action on things is going to be through values through yourself. So when you start bringing intimacy into your own life, so you’re not asking for it; you’re not asserting it.”
3. Use Inward-Directed Activities:
“People with a Mars retrograde actually end up doing like bodybuilding or fitness, or in this case, it would be something that would be writing or a career that uses your talents, that it’s all you kind of reworking your own stuff and kind of compiling it.”
4. Recognize the Rework Pattern:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Accept that you need to revisit and revise
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Use this as a strength for perfectionism in appropriate contexts
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Set boundaries on how much reworking is enough
________________


House and Sign Considerations
Example: Mars Retrograde in 2nd House, Libra (Lisa’s Chart):
Verbatim:
“Mars is retrograde in your second house. Awesome … all that Scorpio energy … it’s going to be encapsulated as a house condition into … the second house of self-worth, value … making money, your partner’s money, and you know how value attributes to how you relate to other people and so on.”
“Yours is in Libra. So it’s a non-confrontational energy anyway, but it’s, you have to work with workarounds, and you have to bring other people in to do the work for you.”
Analysis:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Mars in Libra is already challenged (non-confrontational)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Retrograde compounds this
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Located in 2nd house affects money, self-worth, values
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Requires delegation and internal reworking before external action
________________


Aspect Considerations
Semi-Sextile Complications:
“You actually have to focus on this to resolve this issue so that this energy can feed into this one, because this can make it very difficult to put your energy into something that’s going to make money.”
Mars retrograde in aspect to other planets compounds the internal reworking quality and may create roadblocks that must be worked through in sequence.
________________


Real-World Manifestations
Behaviors:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Difficulty starting new projects
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Intense internal reworking before action
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Bodybuilding, fitness, or other self-directed physical activities
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Writing, compiling, revising work
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Self-blame when angry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Needing others to initiate or delegate tasks
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Struggling with outward assertion
________________


2.4 JUPITER RETROGRADE
Core Energy When Direct
Planetary Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Expansion and abundance
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Philosophy and belief systems
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Culture and ethnicity
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Higher education and teaching
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Wisdom and knowledge
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Travel and foreign experiences
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Optimism and luck
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Vision and meaning-making
House Rulerships:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Sagittarius (9th house naturally)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * (Traditionally also co-rules Pisces/12th house)
Verbatim:
“Jupiter is expansion and abundance and philosophy and culture, right?”
________________


How Retrograde Modifies Jupiter Energy
Absence of Expected Abundance:
“When you are looking at definitions and why I keep saying stop looking at definitions, Jupiter in the fourth house, Jupiter in … always says you had a big house. You had a big family, blah, blah, blah. I didn’t know that I had a family. … I did have a large family. I never knew them until I was 37 years old when I used astrology to go find them.”
Cultural Disconnection:
“When you are born with Jupiter retrograde … you don’t understand abundance; you don’t understand philosophy. There is culture doesn’t exist, or your relationship to culture isn’t there.”
Seeking What’s Missing:
“You’re looking for something more to learn. … You could have the whole dictionary and you’re like, it probably left out some words. Then you go to Urban Dictionary, and then you go to whatever, and you start learning all those words.”
________________


Instructor’s Jupiter Retrograde Experience
Verbatim:
“Jupiter retrograde, Jupiter is expansion and abundance and philosophy and culture, right? It’s all these things. Guess what I don’t have and didn’t have growing up? Any of those things, no abundance, not a big family.”
Cultural Substitution:
“But I’ll tell you what I did get is all of my friends. That I’ve had growing up through all of my recreation and activities and martial arts and all of that from my childhood. I went with their family, the ruler right there, boom with their family and their family and their culture. All of my friends were ethnic, every single one. …So, but that’s the retrograde, and I dove deep into it; I took all of their, their culture to me and said, why are you doing that?”
________________


Learning and Education
Skepticism of Traditional Education:
“It’s usually like, I already know this, or college is not going to teach me anything that I can’t learn myself. You’ll hear that all the time from somebody who has a ninth house retrograde or a Jupiter retrograde.”
Forever Student:
“For me, I’m a forever student…ninth house…the ninth house is about higher education, but it’s also about teaching; you can’t teach without higher education, without a higher knowledge. …So, you’re going to limit your teaching if you’re not continuously learning.”
________________


Strengths of Jupiter Retrograde
Seeing Hidden Opportunities:
“You see opportunity … within something that other people don’t see. And that’s what makes people with a ninth house retrograde.”
Deep Synthesis:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Absorbing diverse, broad, or unique perspectives
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Receiving and synthesizing multiple worldviews
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Direct experiential learning
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Multicultural integration
________________


Challenges of Jupiter Retrograde
Missing Cultural/Philosophical Foundation:
“No abundance, not a big family …”
“I don’t even know what culture I am, like white Caucasian, sure. But is it German or Irish or English or whatever?”
Disconnect from Expansion:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Feeling like abundance is absent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Difficulty with optimism early in life
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Skepticism toward traditional education
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Seeking endlessly for what feels missing
________________


Optimization Techniques
1. Find Your Own Way to Learn:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Value direct experience over formal education
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Synthesize multiple traditions or philosophies
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Create your own meaning-making systems
2. Explore Non-Traditional Paths:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Embrace multicultural experiences
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Dive into obscure or alternative philosophies
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Learn through travel, relationships, direct experience
3. Become a Lifelong Learner:
“Learning things you’ve already learned because you’re looking for something you’ve missed.”
4. Teach What You Learn:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Share your unique synthesis
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Don’t wait for traditional credentials
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Your perspective is valuable because it’s different
________________


House and Sign Considerations
Example: Jupiter Retrograde in 4th House, Scorpio:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Lack of family connection or cultural roots
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Deep dive into lineage later in life
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Using astrology or other tools to reconnect
________________


Real-World Manifestations
Behaviors:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Skepticism toward formal education
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Seeking multiple sources of learning
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Cultural exploration through friends or partners
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Feeling like abundance is always just out of reach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Specializing in arcane, obscure, or multicultural knowledge
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Constantly seeking “more” to learn
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Teaching without traditional credentials
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Using unconventional methods to find family/roots
Example: Anita’s Chart:
“Jupiter retrograde, challenge relating to family/culture/self-image, video gaming as channel for expansion.”
________________


2.5 SATURN RETROGRADE
Core Energy When Direct
Planetary Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Authority and structure
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Long-term goals and achievement
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Public life and career
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Management and responsibility
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Discipline and boundaries
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Time and tradition
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Maturity and wisdom
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Societal expectations
House Rulerships:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Capricorn (10th house naturally)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * (Traditionally also co-rules Aquarius/11th house)
Verbatim:
“Saturn itself has to do with any authority figures.”
________________


How Retrograde Modifies Saturn Energy
Authority Confusion:
“When it comes to authority, you think you have the authority more than other people. You don’t respect people just because they’re in a system or in a position of authority with a Saturn retrograde because you need to prove it.”
Non-Traditional Career Paths:
“Most people with a Saturn retrograde or a 10th house ruler that is retrograde are not meant to have careers in the standard traditional sense because that career has already been had. That level of achievement has already been had. … Like you don’t understand what an achievement is when you are successful at something; you are usually successful, but you don’t honor it because you don’t understand it.”
Success Blindness:
“You don’t know what success is; you don’t know what a career is; you don’t know what authority is. So you don’t like cops as much; you don’t like your boss as much.”
________________


Instructor’s Saturn Retrograde Experience
Verbatim:
“I also have a Saturn retrograde, so I don’t verbalize mine in the third house. I don’t talk about being successful. I don’t think I’m successful. Like I talk about it all the time. I’ve got my name up on a building, I got money, I got whatever. I’ve done a lot of really cool things, but in my mind, in my energy, in my brain, I don’t attribute that to being successful. I’m not successful yet. There’s always something else, and it’s because I haven’t really—I’m still 42 years old. I haven’t figured this out yet, what success means to me.”
Rejecting Management:
 Story shared about being offered a managerial promotion and declining it because it felt like a “downgrade” despite higher pay and status.
________________


Tradition and Structure
Creating Personal Traditions:
“You create all kinds of traditions for yourself. Everything’s a freaking tradition. I always do this; you’ll hear people with Saturn retrograde be like, I always do this. … That’s a tradition.”
Natural Success Without Recognition:
“You’re naturally successful. Most people with Saturn retrogrades are, and this is also why, partly why people with Saturn retrograde or the 10th house rule or retrograde have a tough time with management and have a tough time with anybody in a position of authority where they don’t necessarily want to be the manager. They already feel like that would be a downgrade for them because you are imprinted with the energy that you’ve already had it.”
________________


Strengths of Saturn Retrograde
Unique Structuring Ability:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Building alternative systems from scratch
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Innovation through rejection of tradition
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Personal authority development
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Self-directed achievement
Questioning Authority:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Not blindly following rules
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Demanding proof and authenticity
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Creating own measures of success
________________


Challenges of Saturn Retrograde
Lack of External Achievement Recognition:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Not understanding what success means
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Failing to celebrate accomplishments
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Always moving the goalposts
Authority Resistance:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Difficulty with bosses, police, traditional hierarchy
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Aversion to management roles
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Rejecting societal definitions of career
Structure Confusion:
“There’s an expectation of structure, but it’s not there for you. There’s no authority there for you. Authority you don’t make, it doesn’t make any sense, but at the same time you feel like you already have the authority.”
________________


Optimization Techniques
1. Define Personal Success:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Create YOUR definition of achievement
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Don’t compare to societal standards
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Recognize accomplishments in your own terms
2. Build Alternative Structures:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Develop your own organizational systems
