TRANSCRIPT 16: ACCEPTING CHIRON WEBINAR
Complete Knowledge Extraction for Alchemistic Astrology App Development
Class Date: January 26, 2025
Word Count: ~26,500 words
Critical Framework: “Accepting” vs. “Embracing” — acceptance is the core challenge with Chiron
________________


PART I: FOUNDATIONAL CONCEPTS & CLASS PURPOSE
1.1 Why “Accepting” (Not “Embracing”) Chiron
The Deliberate Choice of Language:
Verbatim:
“Welcome to the Accepting Chiron. … the purpose of why I called it, I keep saying embracing Chiron, because I did a Lilith one, which is embracing Lilith, and yes, embracing is extremely important. But with Chiron, I really chose the word accepting because that is the biggest difficulty; it’s the biggest strife that we have when it comes to this astrological body or astronomical body.”
Key Distinction:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Embracing (Lilith): Can be actively claimed, projected outward, owned as power
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Accepting (Chiron): Requires surrender to what cannot be “fixed,” normalized, or made to conform
The Core Challenge:
“And the fact that in this area of life, stuff just don’t go right and it’s not supposed to. And that’s the acceptance part, is that in this area of life, you are unique, you are different, you are special, and things are chaotic and just off axis, so to speak here.”
________________


1.2 How Chiron Fits Into Alchemistic Astrology
Central to Self-Acceptance Work:
Verbatim:
“And for those of you who are here learning alchemistic astrology, you know that for me, when I was putting all this together, when I was looking at everything, the astronomical doctrine of signatures is extremely important.”
“I use (Chiron) in almost every single astrology reading now in tandem with the Lilith placement to really help people accept who they are.”
Chiron as Authenticity Marker:
“Chiron is the key; Chiron’s the key to everything in your life. It is what makes you, you, because you’re in process of figuring out the better way to do it, but no one else is gonna be in the same place as you. So therefore, it’s the most authentic planet you have.”
________________


1.3 Debunking the “Wounded Healer” Myth
Pop Astrology’s Main Error:
Verbatim:
“So if I type in astrology, it’s always going to be, Chiron is the wounded healer. I’m going to tell you right now that that is not true. Chiron is not the wounded healer in the sense that in the mythology, Chiron was, you know, one of centaurs within this, this mini scourge in that, you know, wasn’t even a part of it, but ended up getting inadvertently shot in the leg with a poison arrow. Eventually, over time, couldn’t heal himself, but supposedly could heal everybody else. And then had to go to Zeus, gave up his immortality for, I think, Prometheus, and then ended up mortal and then died. Like that’s the story.”
The Truth:
“I don’t understand how people are trying to apply that to the real world, how they’re trying to apply that to life because literally nothing I just said has anything to do with your Chiron placement. The closest we get to wounded healer is that Chiron does represent what we perceive as weaknesses and wounds.”
Better Framework:
“The healer part, you know, is not based specifically on the wound itself as much as the fact of, of where the orbit path is… Jupiter’s not so much about healing as much as it is about wisdom. … So again, calling Chiron the wounded healer is, in terms of articulation, is just off. If we want to get to what’s valid about it, it is wounds that we are able to mentor, and it’s based off of our own perception of these things and our own beliefs around these things and what we’ve had to accept as our own truth, which is Saturn.”
________________


PART II: ASTRONOMICAL & MYTHOLOGICAL BACKGROUND
2.1 Chiron’s Astronomical Classification
Centaur Object:
Verbatim:
“I pulled up this image specifically because I wanted you to see a couple of things. This is a rendering; this is obviously not an actual photo. We don’t have a true photo yet of Chiron. It was discovered in 1977, so our information on this asteroid, on this centaur, is very limited. Now, centaurs in mythology, half person, half horse, whatever; and because it’s a centaur, all of the centaurs in astronomy were labeled after mythological centaurs.”
Hybrid Nature:
“Centaur … hybrid physiology, so to speak, of comets and asteroids, which means many of them actually have a, um, a cloud glow that they call a halo…Chiron’s halo. Pull it up real quick, coma. … Chiron, you don’t have a standardized coma because, although there is water and ice, they believe that it is actually carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide that is creating the coma there, but it still operates because it has an orbit as an asteroid, so it has that hybrid feature.”
________________


2.2 The Unstable Orbit & Its Meaning
Location Between Saturn and Uranus:
Verbatim:
“Anything that sits between Saturn and Uranus, there’s a very specific sector of the, uh, the universe. They call that the Centaur range and it’s highly unstable. … Saturn’s gravitational pull, Uranus, Uranus’ gravitational pull, and the mechanics of that area, is that it’s highly unstable. … the orbit changes. The orbit fluctuates; it has not been the same for the last million years, and over the next million years.”
Astrological Interpretation:
“For you to accept Chiron and bring that into your life, that it’s about malleability. It is about molding. It is about realizing that there is no concrete structure here.”
________________


2.3 Physical Properties & Their Symbolic Meaning
Unknown Axial Tilt:
Verbatim:
“We do not know its axial tilt because we have not gotten a clear image. We don’t actually understand its rotational period. We know its rotational period, but it’s off of light spectrum. …which means we don’t know what side is up and what side is down. …we haven’t determined its axial tilt because we haven’t determined its axis.”
Irregular Shape:
“It is just an irregular shape in general, … it’s not a perfect sphere or even a bulbous sphere. … 220 kilometers, 136 miles. So it’s one of the largest centaurs, which is why it impacts us. But when you compare it to a planet, it’s not even close.”
Chiron Has Rings:
“One thing that’s super interesting … is this: there are rings too; there are rings to Chyron. …Chyron acts like its own system. It acts like there are other space dust, debris, and rocks and things that are actually orbiting this comet asteroid.”
Astrological Significance:
“It doesn’t have its own place in the universe where it’s consistent. And this lends to exactly what Chyron is in your chart. … it is always changing. It is invariable, and it is its own presence. It is its own system, which lends to you needing to understand it and realize that it is a significant astronomical and astrological position in your chart.”
________________


2.4 Orbit Path: Between Structure (Saturn) and Revolution (Uranus)
Visual Description:
Verbatim:
“Orbit path of Chiron: So red is Jupiter, yellow is Saturn, and green is Uranus. Purple is Chiron. … it crosses Saturn and it goes all the way up, but it doesn’t quite reach Uranus.”
The Crucial Insight:
“Chiron’s orbit, along with everything about its physical properties, has to do with the fact that it crosses over Saturn. So, Saturn becomes a prominent theme, but it comes within Saturn, closer to Jupiter, which is going to bring in Jupiter themes. … it comes all the way out and we get almost to Uranus’s path, and this is important, the fact that it doesn’t actually reach Uranus because when you look at a natal chart, zodiac signs…”
Breaking Down But Not Reaching Revolution:
“When Chiron comes over to, but does not, oops, does not reach Uranus, that means Chiron in your chart is a place where structures have been broken down. Structures are not solid; they are on their path to be broken down until they would reach the Uranian point where there’s pride and a brand new perspective, where we’ve seen things differently We’ve taken the structure, we turned it on its head, and we said, no, this is better because Capricorn and Saturn’s energy is best; it is achievement, success. I’m the best at what I do. And Uranian energy comes along and says, I can do it better, and it breaks everything down. … Chiron’s energy doesn’t get there, so Chiron’s energy is in the process of breaking things down, and for several reasons, this is a weakness; so what ends up happening is you don’t feel strong in this area.”
________________


PART III: CORE CHIRON DEFINITION
3.1 What Chiron Represents
Primary Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         1. Area of Perceived Weakness:
“Chiron does represent what we perceive as weaknesses and wounds. And there is an element of true weakness here. And this is that we have to talk about here because you have to accept it, understand it, and do your best to support yourself around this, this placement and this configuration in your chart, because there is a weakness there; however, that weakness can be turned into strength.”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         2. Malleability & Lack of Structure:
“For you to accept Chiron and bring that into your life, that it’s about malleability. It is about molding. It is about realizing that there is no concrete structure here.”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         3. In-Between State:
“Chiron’s energy doesn’t get there, so Chiron’s energy is in the process of breaking things down… you don’t feel strong in this area.”
________________


3.2 The Lego Metaphor
Perfect Visualization:
Verbatim:
“It’s kind of like you built something with Legos; I like to go back to Legos all the time. You built something with Legos, and you start taking the pieces apart to create the next thing that you think would be better, but you haven’t built it yet. So, some of the pieces are missing, some of the pieces are sitting off to the side, and some of the pieces you put in this bucket over here, and you still have access to them, but they’re not part of the main structure anymore.”
The Vulnerability:
 Things can happen that make you “open to weakness” because the structure is dismantled, pieces scattered, new vision not yet realized.
________________


3.3 The “I Don’t Like” Framework
Universal Chiron Pattern:
Verbatim:
“So, when you look at Chiron in your chart, the first thing you say, I don’t like. I don’t like authority traditionally. I don’t like networking and friendships traditionally or social media traditionally. In third house, I don’t like communication or the expectations of communication traditionally. I don’t like facts, figures, numbers, or math traditionally. I don’t like early education traditionally, the way they teach traditionally. I don’t like money or value traditionally. I don’t like what I’m supposed to do traditionally. I don’t like my body. The way that it’s supposed to be traditionally.”
Core Principle:
 Wherever Chiron is, there is discomfort with expectations and traditional structures in that life area.
________________


3.4 The Authority Paradox
You Already HAVE the Authority:
Verbatim:
“You feel, with like Chiron and Gemini or Chiron and Aquarius, you feel that you’re not smart because you don’t have the structure of being smart. … But for you, it’s like I don’t do it like everybody else. …But in the perception of everybody else, you are smart, like you’re beyond smart. How did you figure that out? … And this is the part of Chiron that no one talks about, and I think is one of the most important things. You already have the authority. You already know how this works, but you’re breaking it down.”
The Insecurity:
“Now, because you’re breaking it down and you’re in the process of re-figuring it out, there is a weakness.”
________________


3.5 Comparison to Saturn (The Default Trap)
Why Chiron Hurts:
Verbatim:
“The acceptance part is that you don’t get to go back. Chiron’s orbit is sitting; most of it is sitting as a centaur out towards Uranus. You don’t get to choose to be structured in this area and be like everybody else, be traditional and all this attorney and properties; you don’t get to. You’ve moved beyond it. You’re beyond tradition; you’re beyond authority; you’re beyond structure, but you’re not rebellious. You don’t have the confidence, and this is where the insecurity is because you default back to the biggest planet there is, which is Saturn.”
The Comparison Cycle:
“So you compare yourself to other people; you compare yourself to people who have been successful; you compare yourself to what’s normal…You default to that because that’s what you naturally do when you’re insecure.”
“All of that is Saturnian. You default to that because that’s what you naturally do when you’re insecure. You overcompensate because the majority of people that you’re comparing to are Saturnian.”
________________


PART IV: THE ACCEPTANCE CHALLENGE
4.1 Why Chiron is SO Difficult to Accept
It Defies “Normal”:
Verbatim:
“With Chiron, I really chose the word accepting because that is the biggest difficulty; it’s the biggest strife that we have when it comes to this astrological body or astronomical body.”
“In this area of life, stuff just don’t go right and it’s not supposed to.”
The Expectation Problem:
“When you allow it to, through expectation, which is another Saturnian theme, when you have expectations here, there becomes a problem.”
________________


4.2 What Happens When Chiron Is NOT Accepted
Overcompensation:
Verbatim (from instructor’s experience):
“Sometimes I buy it just to prove I can buy it, which is the overcompensation because when I was young, I didn’t have any money, I didn’t have any authority, I didn’t have any respect, I didn’t have any parents, and this is how it played out at first.”
Loss of Authenticity:
“Chiron is just as delicate and difficult to deal with; the authority is already there. But when I try to be the authority, because I’m taking Chiron’s energy and pushing it back to Saturn’s level, I’m no longer, I’m no longer being authentic. And I’m not expressing that energy the way that it’s supposed to.”
Emotional Consequences:
“When I allow Chiron to get the better of me, it’s like this little rage that points up, like, fuck you. That’s literally how it comes out: get the fuck out of here.”
“It directly crushes my mood and it makes me angry.”
________________


4.3 The Path to Acceptance
Step-by-Step Process:
Verbatim:
“You have to accept that Chiron where it sits, the Chironics itself, and accept everything that is step one. Step two is the house. What area of life is this happening to you? Step three is the sign in the deck, and then step four is all the aspects. And then step five is where’s that ruler. What is it feeding itself into? And then you go from there until layering.”
What Acceptance Looks Like:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         1. Acknowledging the Difference:
“Accepting Chiron is to say that traditionally, like in the first house, traditionally speaking, my body and my motivations and my, even the way that I have sex and what, how my stuff works is going to be different.”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         2. Stopping Comparison:
“You have to accept that I know something that is revolutionary, that is going to change the structure of things… but I can’t force it.”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         3. Embracing Authentic Expression:
“When I allow myself to say, I already know how to do what I want to do. I already know what I want to do deep down, and I allow myself to do the things I want to do in the way that I want to do them.”
________________


PART V: CHIRON BY HOUSE (COMPLETE BREAKDOWN)
Interpretive Framework:
Verbatim:
“The houses are far more important than the signs; the signs flavor it. The house tells you exactly what it is on a personal level. The Zodiac signs are more like a lens to the universe.”
________________


5.1 CHIRON IN THE 1ST HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“Chiron in the First House is that you, it’s not that you don’t have the authority. Remember, Chiron says you do have the authority. You just feel like when you’ve exceeded beyond that point, you’re supposed to pull yourself back. So, you don’t like the expectations around maintaining the physical body. You wouldn’t like expectations around you’re supposed to do something.”
Early Life Experience:
“It’s likely when you were younger that you were always told to go do something, figure out your life, go whatever. And it created this wound because you didn’t know what you wanted to do, because you looked to everybody else and the expectations there. And maybe you’ve tried a bunch of things, and things just don’t seem to work out for you because you haven’t allowed yourself to say, I already know how to do what I want to do.”
The Pattern:
“People with Chiron in the first house have a very difficult time because they constantly feel like they have to prove themselves to everybody. I can do this; I hate it. Go cut your nails. You need a haircut. I’m like, no, I don’t; I’m fine.”
Acceptance Challenge:
 Must accept that their physical body, motivations, and self-direction are inherently non-traditional.
Path to Healing:
“Until you do that, it won’t happen.”
Allow authentic self-expression without proving anything to anyone.
________________


5.2 CHIRON IN THE 2ND HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“If Chiron’s in the Second House or in relation to Venus, they don’t like the expectations around money; they don’t like the systems around money. And there’s a different way that they see value in money that would be a bit more revolutionary, a bit more potentially even more humanitarian, but it would be a new way to use money, a new way to use resources. But they tend to have self-worth issues because there’s a certain level of expectation they feel like they’re supposed to have over themselves and their values, and their talents, and their art. And these people are usually highly artistic, but they don’t see it.”
Real-Life Manifestation:
“I buy games and never finish them. … sometimes I buy it just to prove I can buy it, which is the overcompensation because when I was young, I didn’t have any money, I didn’t have any authority, I didn’t have any respect, I didn’t have any parents, and this is how it played out at first.”
The Gift:
 Highly artistic, revolutionary approach to value and resources, but cannot recognize own talents.
Acceptance Challenge:
 Accept non-traditional relationship with money, value, and self-worth.
________________


5.3 CHIRON IN THE 3RD HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“In third house, I don’t like communication or the expectations of communication traditionally. I don’t like facts, figures, numbers, or math traditionally. I don’t like early education traditionally, the way they teach traditionally.”
Communication Style:
 Difficulty expressing thoughts in expected ways; may need unique methods of translation.
Example from Silas:
“When we would like read books in class, I can’t look at the book and listen to what the other people are saying at the same time…When I’m watching a movie, I can’t watch the movie without subtitles or else I don’t understand the concepts, what they’re saying.”
Acceptance Challenge:
 Accept unique learning and communication style; stop trying to fit traditional educational molds.
________________


5.4 CHIRON IN THE 4TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim (inferred from system):
“It’s not my authority and how I process and perceive emotion, or how I relate to emotion, or my mother, or my family. It is that, you know, that there’s an element of it being different there that does not conform to tradition or expectation. It’s already been broken down, and it’s perceived as a weakness because we don’t know what to do with it.”
Specific Example:
“Because yours goes back into cancer, mom specifically.”
Area Wounded: Family, emotional foundation, mother, home life.
Manifestation: Unconventional family structure or emotional processing; difficulty with maternal expectations.
________________


5.5 CHIRON IN THE 5TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“When it’s with the sun, Fifth House, Fifth House ruler, Leo Energies, it’s not that you don’t like yourself; it’s that the expectations that you feel like you’re supposed to be something. You already know who you are, but you don’t feel like you’re comfortable enough to express that in public with your individuality. So therefore, you tend to overcompensate by either overly expressing yourself or shutting yourself down, or you try to chameleon, almost like a Pisces. You try to chameleon to fit the expectations of others, and therefore you’re never truly yourself, and you end up usually unhappy, unfulfilled and have a difficult time through comparison with trying to figure out what you want to be.”
Area Wounded: Self-expression, creativity, joy, individuality, romance.
Pattern: Chameleoning to fit others’ expectations, over/under-performing, never feeling fully authentic.
Acceptance Challenge: Accept authentic creative expression without reference to others.
________________


5.6 CHIRON IN THE 6TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“If it’s in your sixth house, it’s like, I don’t like routine. My health is already good, but in some cases, it’s broken down. So there are certain things that are going to cause health issues for me that it’s like, I almost have an allergy to something because…mental health works a certain way.”
Area Wounded: Daily routine, health, work, service.
Manifestation: Aversion to routine, unpredictable health patterns, unique mental health needs.
Acceptance Challenge: Accept that rigid routines don’t work; create flexible, adaptive systems.
________________


5.7 CHIRON IN THE 7TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“When it’s in the seventh house, it’s how you relate to other people. I don’t, I already know how to connect to other people, but I don’t like the expectation that I have to reply to you. I don’t like the expectation that our relationship has to be traditional or contingent on certain parameters. And therefore, the way that I see relationships and connecting to other people is a bit more independent. I can be myself and I need that a little bit of that freedom, but not to the point where I’m like separate from you. But I also feel like I’m not supposed to have that, so I feel insecure. And when someone else has their independence, I’m like, I don’t know if you’re being independent of me in a way that is a bit too much and you’re not bringing me the reciprocation that I need.”
Aesthetic Overcompensation:
“Some people with Chiron Seventh go a little too far with makeup because they have already mastered being pretty, or being aesthetic, or being able to use aesthetics, but then they take it to that next level. And sometimes it’s a good thing and sometimes it’s not; it depends on how that person has accepted Chiron.”
Area Wounded: Relationships, partnership, social connection.
Challenge: Balancing independence and connection; rejecting traditional relationship structures.
________________


5.8 CHIRON IN THE 8TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“If Chiron is in your eighth house, well, there’s intimacy issues because there’s an expectation of that intimacy and diving deeper, and you don’t like it. I don’t like that. We have to dive deeper. If I dive deeper, it needs to be on my terms in a different way. But it can also around the reproductive system not work properly, so in order to have children, that could be the same thing with the fifth house in a different way. You might not be able to have children in a normal way, and sometimes it means, you know, IVF or, you know, someone else being involved.”
Physical Manifestation:
“It depends on how it sits in your chart Or sometimes it just means, in order for you to do that and find that intimacy, to be able to have fun in a romantic connection with somebody else. There are certain ways that you have to do it for other people. It’s like low motility. If it’s Uranian involved, it might require the science or it might require, you know, something else that is going to allow you to actually have children. So you’re seeing a physical manifestation of something that is energetic, that is sitting as a broken down post-Saturn type of influence.”
Area Wounded: Intimacy, sexuality, transformation, shared resources, reproduction.
Example Response: “Eighth house themes, holy crap, that’s accurate.”
________________


5.9 CHIRON IN THE 9TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme:
Verbatim:
“A lot of people who have Chiron in the ninth house, one of two things usually happens, or three, I guess. One is they don’t go to college. It depends on how it sits in your chart, but they don’t go to college because philosophy, higher education, expanding the mind, it’s like they’ve already kind of understood that. And what they will do, no one can teach them. So when it gets, like I said, you already have authority in this area. And this is the thing that nobody realizes. They just see Chiron, and they just say, oh, I’m broken. And there is an element of brokenness, but you already have authority, which is the challenge with Chiron. But because you’ve gone beyond that authority into something that’s a bit more revolutionary, without the confidence of being that, you default back to feeling like it’s wrong.”
Cultural Disconnection (Silas’s Chart):
“So, culturally speaking, you’re not traditional. Whatever you identify as culturally, whether that’s ethnically, or the area you live in, or whatever culture means for you, which can also include religion and just belief patterns in general of your vicinity, your family, because of cancer’s integration into the ninth house, that needs to apply into your identity in a way where you feel comfortable that you’ve revolutionized your own identity. You’re just not always going to be comfortable with it until you accept it, which means your way of thinking and your ideas are going to be different, especially than your families, because yours goes back into cancer, mom specifically.”
Area Wounded: Higher education, philosophy, belief systems, culture, travel.
Pattern: Rejecting formal education, feeling “unteachable,” seeking unique worldview.
________________


5.10 CHIRON IN THE 10TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme (Instructor’s Placement):
Verbatim:
“Chiron in Capricorn, right? It’s expressed through Taurus, but my Chiron is in Capricorn. So it is, Chiron itself is, I already have the authority, but I’m breaking down authority into something that is what I would perceive much more future-oriented; something that’s gonna be a bit more, you know, involves networking, involves people on a bit more of a friendly level, is going to allow for a new way of doing it, but it’s gonna pertain directly to authority and structures.”
The Completion Problem:
“So when it comes to systems, when it comes to authority, when it comes to getting things done and completing things, my weakness is that I don’t complete things because, if I don’t feel that I’m supposed to complete that thing, I won’t.”
Rejecting Authority Titles:
“Part of the reason why I feel like, why I haven’t finished this damn book, even though I wrote 80 to 85% of it a year and a half ago, is because of this. It’s because I don’t consider myself the authority over astrology. I’m just a guy who fiddled with astrology because I wanted to see if I could make it work. And I don’t like the fact that it’s even called a system because I’m not an astrologer; I don’t like titles.”
The Paradox:
“Other people can just walk up and be like, I am the authority of astrology. There are people out there who do that, and I can’t do it; it’ll never work. So I have to approach it as like, look, this is what I’ve created, it is different. And I, at the same time, have to accept the fact that I am never going to be able to say I’m the authority. I can’t; I don’t want to be either.”
Area Wounded: Authority, career, public achievement, power structures.
Justin Timberlake Example:
“If you’ve ever watched any of the behind-the-scenes…he was kind of the leader of the group, even if, you know, he himself said he wasn’t the best singer…He also couldn’t do the trills and stuff, which is that Virgo Deccan. So, he ended up, through his music coach, switching to falsetto.”
Creating own signature style (falsetto) when traditional method (belting high notes) didn’t work.
________________


5.11 CHIRON IN THE 11TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme (Ashley’s Example):
Verbatim:
“Ashley has her Chiron and Gemini in the 11th house; she actually has her Chiron in Aquarius. This has to do with the mechanics of things; this has to do with science and technology, and science has to be a certain way for her to care about it. She already gets that science is real. Like when she teaches alchemistic herbalism, science is a big part of it, but she’s like, the science isn’t enough. We need a revolution in science; that’s the same thing as saying Chiron in Aquarius. It’s like I already have the authority around rebellious things. She already knows she’s a rebel, but she’s not confident in being a normal rebel because a normal rebel just says I fixed it. I’ve done it. And she’s like I know that I’m rebellious. I already know that I look at the mechanics of things and the new way to see things, but there’s more. There’s something else. There’s more. I want to be revolutionary in being a rebel, so that’s what the 11th house creates that friction.”
Group Dynamics:
“So what ends up happening in groups and teams is that you don’t fit in with groups and teams because you’re better than them. You are better than the people who are better That’s not supposed to be cocky, but you don’t see it; you’re the friend who is the better friend.”
Area Wounded: Groups, friendships, social causes, networks, future vision.
Pattern: Not fitting into groups, being “the better friend,” needing revolution within rebellion itself.
________________


5.12 CHIRON IN THE 12TH HOUSE
Core Wound Theme (Instructor’s North Node/12th House Experience):
Verbatim:
“North node sitting in the 12th house and that Pisces energy with its ruler over here, squaring off, means I’m highly sensitive to, um, you know, to people who are. The fact that I’m rebellious kind of also creates a situation where I don’t feel like I have the authority over things. So it’s like I’ve been an isolated loner for most of my life because I feel like I see the world in a different way.”
Isolation & Spirituality:
“And especially here in California, where my entire chart shifts, and it really highlights that Piscean energy. It’s like, it’s just better when I kind of do things on my own. Most people in Hollywood didn’t even know I had a studio until they worked on a project or until I showed up on their thing, like, who’s this guy? Most people didn’t know who I was, but they knew I knew what I was doing.”
Area Wounded: Unconscious patterns, spirituality, isolation, hidden life, collective sensitivity.
Pattern: Loner tendencies, operating behind the scenes, unique spiritual path outside consensus reality.
________________


PART VI: CHIRON BY SIGN
General Framework:
Verbatim:
“Chiron by sign … The house tells you exactly what it is on a personal level. The Zodiac signs are more like a lens to the universe. So, when we are factoring this together, this is the part of acceptance that you have to understand: this area of life is not a problem. This area of life is under acceptance, an area of life that you are aware of the structure, and you have moved beyond it.”
________________


6.1 CHIRON IN CAPRICORN
Authority & Structure Wound:
Verbatim:
“Chiron in Capricorn, right? It’s expressed through Taurus, but my Chiron is in Capricorn. So it is, Chiron itself is, I already have the authority, but I’m breaking down authority into something that is what I would perceive much more future-oriented.”
“So when it comes to systems, when it comes to authority, when it comes to getting things done and completing things, my weakness is that I don’t complete things because, if I don’t feel that I’m supposed to complete that thing, I won’t.”
The Challenge: Already has authority but can’t claim it traditionally; must create new structures.
________________


6.2 CHIRON IN GEMINI
Thought & Communication Wound:
Verbatim:
“Chiron in Gemini has to do with your thought practices, your ideas, your identity. And then, depending on where it sits, this is the problem with the Chiron and Gemini thing: you’re not talking about the house, and the house is more important than the fact that it’s in Gemini. Gemini is just the way the brain’s working.”
Sharon’s Example:
“Chiron, Gemini, Mercury in the ninth can’t explain why I do and don’t like something; it just is. It’s because you have gone beyond the expectation, and you’re seeking something different, but it’s being broken down…”
The Challenge: Difficulty explaining thought processes; unique logic that doesn’t fit standard communication.
________________


6.3 CHIRON IN AQUARIUS
Revolutionary Rebel Wound:
Verbatim (Ashley):
“She actually has her Chiron in Aquarius. This has to do with the mechanics of things; this has to do with science and technology, and science has to be a certain way for her to care about it. She already gets that science is real. Like when she teaches alchemistic herbalism, science is a big part of it, but she’s like, the science isn’t enough. We need a revolution in science; that’s the same thing as saying Chiron in Aquarius.”
The Paradox:
“It’s like I already have the authority around rebellious things. She already knows she’s a rebel, but she’s not confident in being a normal rebel because a normal rebel just says I fixed it. I’ve done it. And she’s like I know that I’m rebellious. I already know that I look at the mechanics of things and the new way to see things, but there’s more. There’s something else. There’s more. I want to be revolutionary in being a rebel.”
The Challenge: Already rebellious, but seeking revolution WITHIN rebellion; never satisfied with standard innovation.
________________


PART VII: INSTRUCTOR’S PERSONAL CHIRON JOURNEY
7.1 Placement Details
Verbatim:
“Chiron placement at 24 degrees, 42 arc minutes is in a direct, it forms a yacht here, but it’s in a direct quincunx to Pluto and from Neptune. And then we also have a square from the moon to Chiron here, and then its ruler is forming a square to my ascendant.”
Summary: Chiron in 10th house, Capricorn, with major aspects to Pluto (quincunx), Neptune (quincunx), Moon (square), and ruler Venus square ASC.
________________


7.2 Personal Stories
Childhood Martial Arts Tournament:
Verbatim:
“My dad dropped me off, and I said, why aren’t you coming in? He said, I don’t need to see you win anymore. How many times do I have to see you win, which hurt me? It was a wound, which leads directly into this. … I ended up doing bo staff … I made the whole [routine] up as I was going. … I won first place. … And I, I had a trend that every tournament I may, I went to in forms being structure, right? … I always made up my own form, and then I would make up what it was called. … I do worse when I study for a test; I just go in and go, yeah, same thing: tests, exams. I’ve never studied for a test in my life.”
Gift-Giving Wound:
“It’s not that I feel bad if I can’t give one back; I mean, that’s not true. I do feel bad if I can’t give one back, but that’s probably because of the square from the moon coming off of my 12th house, because it squares off with this. But yeah, I don’t like the expectation of gift giving…”
Financial Overcompensation:
“I’ve had 300 games when I had my, my music studio. I bought over 300 games, and I’ve done this like four or five times in my life. I’ve got all these games, and they’re all still wrapped. I’ve never played any of them. I buy them, and this is the problem, is that for me, cause it’s tied into Venus. It’s like, sometimes I buy it just to prove I can buy it.”
________________


7.3 Path to Acceptance
Current Relationship:
Verbatim:
“I have to accept that I am never going to be able to say I’m the authority. I can’t; I don’t want to be either. So therefore, I don’t want people coming to me asking me every single question about authority. I want people to learn it, which is where the mentor part comes in.”
“It’s like, I know a lot of things, and then it’s like, well, am I the authority in any of them? No, but I don’t want to be. I don’t consider myself the authority, but other people see me as such, so you have to accept that Chiron where it sits, the Chironics itself, and accept everything that is step one.”
What Helped:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Allowing non-traditional expression
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Accepting others’ recognition without claiming title
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Focusing on mentorship rather than authority
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Recognizing wins when not trying to prove anything
________________


PART VIII: CHIRON ASPECTS & CHART INTEGRATION
8.1 How to Read Chiron with Aspects
General Principle:
Verbatim:
“Chiron with aspect, so for instance, again in my chart, you’re going to read Chiron with aspects the same way you’d read any planet with aspects. So you’re going to trace it around to see what else is there.”
Orb Note:
“Chiron’s orb is just a half degree to a degree; usually, Chiron’s affected by other planets more than it affects anything else.”
________________


8.2 Chiron-Pluto Aspects
Instructor’s Quincunx:
Verbatim:
“For instance, Chiron in the 10th house …is in a quincunx to Pluto; Pluto’s in retrograde. This is a lot to break down…And then, but it’s also the thing I’m supposed to identify with. So what ends up happening is that Chiron naturally feeds into, as it pertains to structure, finishing things, whatever. This is why, by the way, I don’t finish things unless I’m emotionally connected to them, is because Pluto rules my fourth house.”
Effect: Links authority wound to deep emotional/family identity; can’t complete things without emotional investment.
________________


8.3 Chiron-Moon Aspects
Square in Instructor’s Chart:
Verbatim:
“We also have a square from the moon to Chiron here… when you allow it to manifest in its normal way that it becomes a problem. …When I honor the 12th side, when I honor my more behind-the-scenes, when I honor my, you know, the tribe that I have, when I honor my personal spirituality and I feed that into my Chiron in a positive way, the way you use a square aspect, then Chiron is completely supported.”
Negative Expression:
“Chiron’s influence up here, feeling like I know what I’m doing, but I’m doing it my own way type of energy, and that I’m not necessarily feeling like I’m the best at it, fuels directly into my identity on a very personal level. And so, therefore, that anytime that I’m feeling insecure and not really accepting and honoring Chiron, it directly crushes my mood and it makes me angry.”
________________


8.4 Chiron Conjunct Lilith
Double Wounding:
Verbatim:
“If Chiron is conjunct to Lilith, there is a kind of a double whammy with this one because there are already insecurities that are now tied into guilt and shame. …with Chiron conjunct Lilith, it’s the same thing, but now you’re bringing in a level of insecurity to your own shame. So once you embrace and the order matters, is it Lilith and Chiron or Chiron then Lilith, we would have to dissect that…”
Key Point: Order matters—which planet comes first by degree determines primary expression.
________________


8.5 Chiron & House Rulers
Delegation Through Rulership:
Verbatim:
“Venus ruling gifts and gift giving, with Chiron there, and not just because Chiron’s there, but Chiron’s ruler is Venus. So remember, through delegates, this doesn’t just act like first, second; it acts like the whole damn thing.”
Critical Instruction:
“Step five is where’s that ruler. What is it feeding itself into? And then you go from there until layering.”
________________


PART IX: PARTICIPANT CHART EXAMPLES
9.1 Silas: Chiron in 9th House (Capricorn)
Complete Reading Process:
Verbatim (extensive exchange):
“So, Silas, when it is in Capricorn, you’re taking the themes of, I don’t like and I’ve moved beyond, and I’m still figuring it out, so I don’t have the confidence here; but things don’t work normal, and I don’t like mad facts; it’s actually a liar, liar. I don’t like this area of life as it’s expected of me.”
Sensory Processing Struggle:
“When we would like read books in class, I can’t look at the book and listen to what the other people are saying at the same time…When I’m watching a movie, I can’t watch the movie without subtitles or else I don’t understand the concepts, what they’re saying.”
Instructor’s Guidance:
“You have to allow yourself to say it the way that you feel it intuitively that leads into needing translation… So, taste a lollipop and then try to explain it to me in a way that is just natural for you to say it. Obviously, the first thing to be like, I didn’t like it. That’s fine because you haven’t found the words, but … what it reminds me of would be the best way for you to say it.”
Cultural Wound:
“So, culturally speaking, you’re not traditional. Whatever you identify as culturally, whether that’s ethnically, or the area you live in, or whatever culture means for you… your way of thinking and your ideas are going to be different, especially than your families, because yours goes back into cancer, mom specifically.”
________________


9.2 Sharon: Chiron in Gemini, Mercury in 9th
Brief Analysis:
Verbatim:
“Chiron, Gemini, Mercury in the ninth can’t explain why I do and don’t like something; it just is. It’s because you have gone beyond the expectation, and you’re seeking something different, but it’s being broken down…”
________________


9.3 Carly: Chiron in 8th House
Confirmation:
Verbatim:
“Eighth house themes, holy crap, that’s accurate. That’s the point, right, Carly?”
Issues with intimacy, transformation, depth—all confirmed.
________________


9.4 Ashley: Chiron in Aquarius/11th House
Revolutionary Science:
Verbatim:
“Ashley has her Chiron and Gemini in the 11th house; she actually has her Chiron in Aquarius. This has to do with the mechanics of things; this has to do with science and technology, and science has to be a certain way for her to care about it. She already gets that science is real. Like when she teaches alchemistic herbalism, science is a big part of it, but she’s like, the science isn’t enough. We need a revolution in science.”
Better Friend Pattern:
“You’re the friend who is the better friend.”
________________


PART X: STEPWISE INTERPRETATION METHOD
10.1 The Building Block Approach
Critical Framework:
Verbatim:
“You can’t make any inference of over what Chiron in the 10th means without factoring everything else in. So we have to use it as that building block. We start with, okay, Chiron, what does Chiron mean? And this is what a lot of people are skipping, right? And I see it all over social media, but even within alchemistic astrology, and you guys, I’ve seen it where it’s like we’ll take the moon in the seventh house, right? And you’ll just dive right in. Some of you guys are diving right into the house, which is great, but you’re forgetting to define the moon. So you’re jumping right into the second step, but you haven’t actually analyzed the first step yet.”
________________


10.2 The 5-Step Process
Step 1: Define CHIRON Itself
Verbatim:
“What does Chiron mean? It means that there’s gonna be an element of mentorship; there’s gonna be element of things going weird, different. There’s literally gonna be the theme of, I don’t like.”
Core Themes:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Malleability
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Broken-down structure
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * In-between Saturn and Uranus
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Already having authority but not confidence
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “I don’t like traditionally”
________________


Step 2: Identify the HOUSE
Verbatim:
“Step two is the house. What area of life is this happening to you?”
Key Point: House is MORE important than sign.
“The houses are far more important than the signs; the signs flavor it. The house tells you exactly what it is on a personal level.”
________________


Step 3: Consider the SIGN & Decan
Verbatim:
“Step three is the sign in the deck.”
Note: Signs provide the “lens” or flavor, but don’t override house meaning.
________________


Step 4: Analyze All ASPECTS
Verbatim:
“And then step four is all the aspects.”
Remember: Chiron is usually affected BY other planets more than it affects them.
“Chiron’s orb is just a half degree to a degree; usually, Chiron’s affected by other planets more than it affects anything else.”
________________


Step 5: Find the RULER & Energy Flow
Verbatim:
“And then step five is where’s that ruler. What is it feeding itself into? And then you go from there until layering.”
Key Principle: Through delegates, Chiron’s ruler connects the wound to other life areas.
________________


PART XI: CLIENT WORK & PRACTICAL APPLICATIONS
11.1 How to Introduce Chiron to Clients
Start with Acceptance, Not Healing:
Verbatim:
“Accepting Chiron is extremely important; it’s not about fixing Chiron. And this is why I hate the term, the wounded healer. You’re not wounded…Chiron is a gift in the fact that you are literally authentic in this area. So, when you do something, when it’s your talents, when it is your wherever Chiron is, people know it’s you.”
Use the “I Don’t Like” Framework:
“So, when you look at Chiron in your chart, the first thing you say, I don’t like. I don’t like authority traditionally…”
________________


11.2 Language That Helps vs. Harms
AVOID:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “Wounded healer”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “You’re broken”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “You need to heal this”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “You should be like everyone else”
USE:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “This is your authentic area”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “You’re in process of figuring out a better way”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “You already have authority here, but it looks different”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “This makes you unique”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * “Acceptance, not fixing”
________________


11.3 Common Client Struggles
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         1. Overcompensation:
“You overcompensate because the majority of people that you’re comparing to are Saturnian.”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         2. Comparison to Others:
“You default to that because that’s what you naturally do when you’re insecure.”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         3. Feeling Broken:
“They just see Chiron, and they just say, oh, I’m broken. And there is an element of brokenness, but you already have authority, which is the challenge with Chiron.”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         4. Expecting to Be “Normal”:
 Clients resist accepting their difference, trying to force traditional structures.
________________


11.4 Breakthrough Techniques
1. Real-Life Examples:
 Use relatable stories (Justin Timberlake’s falsetto) to show how accepting Chiron creates success.
2. Validate Unique Experience:
“Does Justin Timberlake stop singing because he can’t hit those high notes by belting, or does he sing in falsetto to hit those same notes? And therefore creates his own way, and therefore is known for it.”
3. Show the Gift:
“Chiron is a gift in the fact that you are literally authentic in this area.”
4. Stepwise Breakdown:
 Walk through the 5-step process to show exactHOW the wound operates and where acceptance is needed.
________________


11.5 Warning Signs Someone Isn’t Ready
Verbatim:
“Most people have not accepted Chiron.”
Signs:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * Still trying to “fix” the area
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * Heavy comparison to others
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * Overcompensating behaviors
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * Rejecting their uniqueness
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * Anger or defensiveness when Chiron is discussed
________________

We should probably pull up at some point as the electional chart of when Chiron was discovered and we’re coming up right on that.”
Note: Chiron’s orbital period is approximately 50 years. At age ~50, Chiron returns to its natal position, marking major acceptance milestone.

Key Point: Relocation can change Chiron’s house placement, altering how the wound manifests in daily life.
